We are committing to implement meaningful change within our culture by increasing awareness of and counteracting unconscious bias, eradicating systemic barriers, embracing diversity, and engaging all employees in the process.', 'You have experience in a multi-channel customer facing environment and you’re comfortable with inbound and outbound contact.', 'Answering incoming and outgoing sales calls, live chat and email communication within agreed service levels while always delivering exceptional customer service.', 'Assist other departments whenever necessary, may include administration duties and / or customer service duties (customers returning from their tours).', 'Responsible for supplier communication to ensure all services are provided as booked.', 'Exodus Travels, part of Travelopia, is the leading tour operator of small group adventure trips offering over 400 unique itineraries, including trekking to Machu Picchu in Peru, climbing Kilimanjaro, or cycling in Vietnam. Exodus Travels also runs a smaller, self-guided European specialist brand called Headwater who offer around 150 itineraries.', 'Salary is dependent on experience', 'Other insurance benefits', 'Participate in weekly customer experience meeting with improvement suggestions within your area of expertise.', 'You will be working with colleagues that share the same values and behaviours, growing the organisation together', 'Maintain ongoing relationships with customers after the point of sale to ensure customer retention, follow up calls on returning from tours etc.', 'Leveraging great relationship skills to form seamless working relationship with sales, product, marketing and commercial teams.', 'Must have the ability to manage priorities and work under pressure.', 'Ensuring services are booked within a reasonable timeframe and liaising with internal departments and local operators to facilitate a speedy confirmation from initial contact to completion.', "You're a star communicator with a keen eye for detail, who loves organisation and finds satisfaction in meeting deadlines and hitting targets."]

title: Customer Success Agent
description:
Looking for someone to join our fast growing and highly active customer success team. As a customer success associate, you will be expected to:

  • Communicate regularly with our customers, via email, phone, and occasionally in-person, based upon the customer’s needs
  • Work with users around the world to quickly and effectively resolve their issues, from answering simple questions to diagnosing bugs
  • Document and report software issues to the engineering team, while offering context and suggestions
  • Have a high degree of urgency with respect to customer success and resolving inquires
  • Handle multiple customer issues at the same time in a fast-paced / high-pressure environment
  • Work independently, and self manage
  • Work in an objective-based environment with minimal structure

Requirements we’re looking for:

  • Excellent communicator, articulate, thoughtful, and fluent in English
  • Be curious, listen, and contribute
  • Post-secondary education
  • You must be a team player
  • Base-level technical skills, including basic proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Windows, and iOS
  • An analytical mind, you’ll be problem solving, troubleshooting, and organizing customer requests/fixes
  • Some sales enablement, content marketing, and general business acumen will benefit you in this role

If you get hired, you can expect:

  • Flexible hours and work schedule
  • To be always learning
  • Casual days mixed in with stressful busy ones
  • To be listened to, and respected
  • To work hard and meet your goals

title: Property Agent Correction
description:
Bi-Weekly Hours: 75.0 hours bi-weekly (Commencing Immediately)This position is responsible for providing a comprehensive real estate service including negotiations, acquisitions, marketing, dispositions, appraisals, property leasing and property management of a broad range of real property.Duties will include: - Acquiring real estate for the province by purchase, gift, exchange, lease or expropriation;- Determining client needs and providing quality service, conducting property owner research, and completing market analysis/market value appraisals;- Disposing of real estate for the province by sale, sale by tender or exchange which involves preparing a detailed inventory of the property to be disposed of and providing innovation in marketing the properties to ensure that the highest return can be realized from the sale of the property;- Managing provincially owned real estate which includes negotiating leases, licenses and other real property interest on behalf of the province;- Providing information and technical advice regarding policies and procedures of the Properties Section;- Conducting research and preparing summary reports and/or drafting responses to claims, inquiries or requests related to provincial lands and public;- Providing technical advice and guidance to support staff;- Negotiating and monitoring contract work required to complete projects; other related duties as required.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications: - Must have a bachelor’s degree or diploma from a recognized post-secondary institution, be a member in good standing with either the International Right of Way Association (IRWA) or the Appraisal Institute of Canada (AIC), and hold the professional designation SR/WA from the IRWA or the professional designation Canadian Residential Appraiser (CRA) from the AIC and experience related to acquisition, disposal, lease, license or management of real property on behalf of an employer or client. - NOTE: Applicants who are members in good standing with either the Appraisal Institute of Canada (AIC) or the International Right of Way Association (IRWA) and have obtained their professional designation as granted by the either AIC or IRWA prior to the prerequisite of a degree, and have recent related experience OR applicants who are working toward, or willing to work toward, their professional designation from either the AIC or IRWA and have extensive related work experience may also be considered.- Demonstrated equivalencies will be considered.- Must have good problem-solving and people skills.- Must be able to work independently and maintain results in a heavy workload environment.- Must have access to reliable transportation.- Applicants must have a good previous work and attendance record. The successful applicant must provide a satisfactory Criminal Records Check prior to beginning employment.Other Qualifications: - A good working knowledge of applicable provincial Acts and Statutes, property law, title searching, and computer/typing skills would be considered assets.- Preference will be given to applicants with Appraisal experience.- Additional relevant education and experience will be considered an asset.Please Note: Preference will be given to Employees of the Unclassified Division as per the UPSE Civil Collective Agreement.Please ensure the application clearly demonstrates how you meet the noted qualifications as applicants will be screened based on the information provided. The successful candidate will be the only individual receiving written notification of competition results. The "Notification of Successful Candidates" list posted on the Employment Opportunity board will serve to inform all other applicants of competition results.

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR) - new graduate opport...
description:
Change the future with us.

Our Sales experts are the eyes and ears of our customers. They do not wait; they take the initiative. They transform “That sounds interesting!” into actual contracts, paving the way for new avenues of business. Join our team and we will give you the latest knowledge and independence for autonomous action and decision-making, helping you become a trusted partner in customer relationships.

Why you’ll love working for Siemens!

  • Freedom and a healthy work- life balance– Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
  • Solve the world’s most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
  • Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
  • Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
  • Competitive total rewards package.
  • Profit sharing available.
  • Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle.
  • Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
  • Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
  • Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
  • Employee perks and discounts.
  • Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2018, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2022 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2021.

Siemens Sales Development Representatives are responsible for “opening doors” for our outside sales team, connecting with new accounts or new departments at existing customers. You will work directly with lead management and sales teams to identify and develop new business opportunities. We will train you on the overall value proposition of the solutions you are selling to be able to quickly communicate the message to prospects.

What will you do?

  • Prepare and setup for outbound daily connections, and calls.
  • Research on assigned target accounts to gather intelligence
  • Conduct initial qualification through phone or any other digital channel (email, social media)
  • Development of pursuit strategies to help outside sales convert prospects
  • Make outbound calls to generate interest and develop leads for sales teams.
  • Systematically follow-up on all qualification activities to develop total qualified opportunities that produce an above average close rate
  • Build prospect interest in the products and services offered by Siemens DI through web, social media, e-mail and primarily phone interaction
  • Enrich and profile our databases (Eloqua and Salesforce) to identify new interest

What will you need to succeed?

  • Degree or diploma in business, marketing or sales or related experience
  • New graduate opportunity
  • Fearless and persistent in cold calling new account targets
  • Target driven, highly organized and can manage a large volume of prospects
  • Recognized for your analytical ability to think creatively, craft a business solution and execute a plan to increase organizational performance.
  • You are driven and solution oriented, striving to make a difference in the business and create a better customer experience for our people.
  • Recognized for your learning mindset and ability to understand the business and challenges, and implement new and innovative approaches that result in improvements in organizational performance
  • French bilingualism is a nice to have

About us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Active across Canada, the company focuses on intelligent infrastructure for buildings and distributed energy systems and on automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. Siemens brings together the digital and physical worlds to benefit customers and society. Through Mobility, a leading supplier of intelligent mobility solutions for rail and road transport, Siemens is helping to shape Canada’s passenger rail services. Via its majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, Siemens is also a leading supplier of medical technology and digital health services. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power.

Making a difference together we raised $757,000 towards charitable contributions, support over 23 non-profit organizations and planted 1,100 trees in our local communities. Siemens Canada has 2,500 employees from coast-to-coast and 24 office and production facilities across Canada. Join our team of approximately 293,000 talented professionals in more than 190 countries/regions and help us tackle the most exciting challenges to build a successful future together. So, what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.

To learn more about Siemens Canada, visit our website at www.siemens.ca

While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

title: newCancellations Processor
description:
Job Title: Cancellation Processor I

Location: US-GA-Atlanta, Canada GTA-Remote

Position Overview: Cancellation Processor I


This position provides support to dealerships and/or their representative. In executing the duties of the role, cancellation processors will ensure the dealerships or their representatives will be reimburse the unused portion of the contract cost. Cancellation processors will receive an average of 1500 calls a week, and is to provide great customer service and to ensure all callers are satisfied. To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required, but is not a complete list of all essential job functions.


Essential Functions:

  • Process a minimum of 75 cancellations daily
  • Ability to multitask while taking phone calls
  • Copy and mail cancellation checks to dealers/agents (in average 1000+ /week).
  • Ensure documents are linked to the correct contracts.
  • Return any documents that do not meet the cancellations requirements back to the dealership, agent, customer or finance company
  • Research all returned checks
  • Review all paperwork pertaining to the customer’s contract, including cancellation dates, repossession letters, payoff
  • Responding to emails on a daily basis
  • Ability to adapt & adjust to new and current Cancellation changes
  • Other duties as assigned by upper management

Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience required. College degree preferred.
  • Minimum of three years’ experience in customer service, insurance claims, call center environment. Experience within Automotive Industry preferred.
  • Must have strong computer skills and the ability to troubleshoot and service policy issues.
  • Must be proficient in Windows and MS-Office Products.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Superior verbal/written skills and communications skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills essential, Ability to handle complex situations. Exercises sound judgment when interacting with customers.
  • Must have knowledge of cancellation procedures and ability to process requests as required.
  • Ability to handle customer/client conflicts with professionalism & satisfactory results.
  • Must have the ability to work effectively within a team and independently to meet key Service Level standards.
  • Good punctuation, spelling, mathematical, grammar and attention to detail a must.
  • Strong knowledge & understanding of forms manager and ability to review terms & conditions on all contracts.
  • Ability to comprehend form verbiage in utilizing accurate completion of a cancellation.

Company Profile:

Founded in 1992 and based in Atlanta, Safe-Guard Products is driven by the steadfast commitment to provide unparalleled service and the highest quality vehicle protection products to the automotive, RV, marine, and motorcycle/powersports industries. In their twenty-five-year history, Safe-Guard has grown to over 500 employees across the U.S., with a client roster of over 35 leading brands, who serve over 10,000 dealers, and protect over 11 million consumers under Safe-Guard contracts.

Safe-Guard’s mission is to provide products and solutions to the motor vehicle industry that drive customer retention and protect consumers from the perils of ownership. Safe-Guard is experiencing dynamic growth and has earned a stellar reputation from customers, partners, and peers by providing: 1) the highest quality protection products in the industry, 2) a broad platform of value-added technology, marketing, and training solutions, and 3) unparalleled client and customer service.

Safe-Guard Products International is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, marital status, disability or protected veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Call Center Agent Remote (PEI Area)
description:
Equinox Marketing Services is an awards winning call center located on Côte-de-Liesse in Montréal (QC). With more than 25 years of experience, the company is an industry leader in sales, telecommunication, and customer service. We are currently seeking Remote Call Center Agents who are English speaking and full time available to work from home (in Prince Edward Island area). Only local candidates will be retained.

Responsibilities...

  • Offering information, insight and recommendations on promotions and products.
  • Assuring clients' satisfaction.
  • Understanding the products and maintaining a working knowledge of all products and services.
  • Utilizing available tools and resources as designed to enhance efficiency on the call.
  • Meeting specific performance standards, quality targets and sales goals.

Successful candidates are/have...

  • Ability to communicate in English.
  • Available to work full time during office hours, Mondays through Fridays.
  • Experience in call centers/telephone jobs and/or sales is an asset.
  • Stable, with at least 6 months of consecutive experience in any employment.
  • Enthusiasm, a positive attitude, high energy, strong work ethic and attention to detail.
  • Fast on the keyboard.
  • Ability to meet personal and team goals.

We offer you...

  • Permanent, full time employment.
  • Work a convenient schedule from the comfort your own home.
  • Fully paid training and $200 referral bonus per person referred.
  • Full collective insurance coverage upon seniority.
  • The possibility to grow within the business and get promoted.
  • An excellent support team always ready to help (coaches, managers, etc.)

title: Sales Support Specialist, New Graduate, 1 year contract
description:
Kick start your career journey!

Experience@Siemens is an exciting opportunity for new Graduates from college or university to transition from academic to the workplace. Siemens Canada will provide you with practical and meaningful work experience as you start your career journey and help you build business skills.

We are passionate about innovations that mean real progress. We are excited about technologies that still need to be developed. What about you? Do you want to use your curiosity, passion, and creativity to make the lives of millions of people easier and better? Join us as a recent graduate –by beginning your early career through Experience@Siemens New Graduate Program. Whichever path you take, we’re looking forward to seeing your perspective.

Recent graduates enrolled in this program will be partnered with a mentor and receive one on one coaching and guidance in support of their development and to help navigate their early career. In addition, this program will help students establish contacts and widen their network to excel in their career journey. Experience@Siemens offers experiential learning and flexibility, allowing you to balance your personal life and career goals.

Why you’ll love working for Siemens.

  • Freedom and a healthy work- life balance– Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
  • Solve the world’s most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
  • Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
  • Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
  • Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
  • Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
  • Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2018, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2022 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

  • Leveraging digital tools and assets to service the Digital Connectivity portfolio customers effectively and efficiently.
  • Working in parallel and collaboratively with our Territory Managers to unlock sales potential.
  • Handle Inbound calls from customers and colleagues looking for support on Siemens Digital Connectivity portfolio products, services, or solutions
  • Generation and follow up of quotes and proposals for our customers in alignment with Territory Managers
  • First contact for technical-commercial pre-sales questions for customers
  • Build rapport with customers through friendly, engaging communication
  • Develop understanding of customer’s needs and identifying sales opportunities
  • Researching and qualifying leads
  • Identifying suspects/prospects (building Outbound connection)
  • Executing Lead qualification (outbound connection)
  • Maintaining leads and opportunities through our CRM tool
  • Keeping abreast of product and service information and updates
  • Assist with development of in-person and digital marketing activities (working with professional Marketing team)
  • Work closely with or sales professionals and partners to ensure that our customer experience is the best possible

What will you need to succeed?

  • New graduate from a college or university program in a related discipline.
  • Industrial Automation background (Mechatronics, Electrical Engineering, or Industrial Networking) is an asset.
  • Graduated from post-secondary within the last 12 months.
  • Above average study performance (Accumulative average > 2.5 (B-)). Transcripts to be provided upon request.
  • Demonstrated leadership or initiative at school, work and/or community (extra curricular activities)
  • Interest in industrial digitalisation
  • Thrives in customer engagement and proactively pursues new clients
  • Growth mindset, with a passion for learning
  • Collaborative with an ability to cultivate relationships and networks
  • Agile, technically savvy, with a knack at creating solutions
  • Creative thinker with a unique ability for resourcefulness
  • Bilingualism (French, English) is an asset.

About us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Active across Canada, the company focuses on intelligent infrastructure for buildings and distributed energy systems and on automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. Siemens brings together the digital and physical worlds to benefit customers and society. Through Mobility, a leading supplier of intelligent mobility solutions for rail and road transport, Siemens is helping to shape Canada’s passenger rail services. Via its majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, Siemens is also a leading supplier of medical technology and digital health services. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power.

Making a difference together we raised $757,000 towards charitable contributions, support over 23 non-profit organizations and planted 1,100 trees in our local communities. Siemens Canada has 2,500 employees from coast-to-coast and 24 office and production facilities across Canada. Join our team of approximately 293,000 talented professionals in more than 190 countries/regions and help us tackle the most exciting challenges to build a successful future together.

To learn more about Siemens Canada, visit our website at www.siemens.ca

While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Hope you are doing well!!!

Iris's Fortune 500 direct client is looking for UX/UI Designer. Please find below Job description and share me your updated resume at Jatin.gupta@irissoftware.com

 Position: UX/UI Designer

Location: Mississauga, ON

Duration: long Term Contract

Skillset

  • Degree in Design, Fine Arts or related field.
  • Prior experience as a UI Designer as well as a strong portfolio of related projects.
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (specifically Illustrator, InDesign and Photoshop) as well as Sketch, Abstract and Invision
  • Strong attention to detail and have a keen eye for esthetics.
  • Excellent communication skills and can clearly articulate ideas, designs, and suggestions. 

Responsibilities

  • Take design briefs to understand requirements.
  • Translating requirements into style guides, design systems, design patterns and attractive user interfaces.
  • Creating a visualization of screens within a prototype framework.
  • Identifying design problems and devising elegant solutions.
  • Presenting ideas, concepts and design solutions to various stakeholders incorporating feedback into your designs.
  • Developing and maintaining documentation regarding style guidelines.

title: Senior Product Analyst REMOTE
description:
Are you a talented Product Analyst, keen to deliver solutions designed to improve customer value? Our Regina Saskatchewan client is seeking to hire a Product Analyst to join their team on a long-term contract with high potential for extension. Apply to this amazing Product Analyst opportunity today!

What’s in it for you!
As a Product Analyst with our Regina client, you’ll receive:
• Competitive market hourly rates.
• A 12-month contract with high potential for extension.
• Remote interview process.
• Opportunity to work from home during Covid-19.

What will you do?
As a Product Analyst with our Regina client, you will:
• Analyze business and data requirements, analyze and test large volumes of data, help build data models and data mapping, write complex SQL queries, and collaborate with development teams to facilitate application development and design
• Accountable for delivering solutions that enable organizational changes necessary to deliver value to employees and customers.
• Collaborates with the development team, product stakeholders, and end-users to understand, manage and document business requirements.
• Facilitates teamwork and seeks feedback from end-users and stakeholders.
• Involved in complex business and technical domains.
• Documents and executes user story acceptance tests.

How do you qualify?
To qualify for the Product Analyst role with our Regina client, you must have:
• 5+ years’ experience as a Senior Product Analyst/ Quality Analyst
• Experience with a variety of software solutions and technical applications.
• Strong technical quality assurance skills and experience
• General knowledge of systems analysis and design concepts.
• Experience working with data and data models
• Writing complex SQL

If the prospect of building a career in the technical and business domains by providing support while honing your product analysis skills intrigues you, then the Product Analyst role with our Regina Saskatchewan client could be the perfect opportunity for you!

title: UX Researcher
description:
UX Researcher

 

Contract Terms: 1 Year

Client Industry: Gaming

 

UX Researcher

As a UX Researcher, you will report to the Senior Manager of Research for IT, where you and the rest of your team will envision digital and live experiences for players and employees.

 

Responsibilities

  • Connect user research with products related to players, recruiting, employee, and game creation related products being an amplifier for relevant insights by working across the company.
  • Be an expert at matching research insights and its delivery mechanisms with the priorities and strategic goals product pillars.
  • Work with designers, creating user scenarios, concept sketches, experience storyboards, high fidelity designs, and rapid prototypes.
  • Work with product managers, designers, engineers, researchers, marketers, and external partners to establish cohesive language and a unified voice across products and platforms.

 

Requirements

  • Provide research that directly supports consumer marketing, social marketing and strategy, and audience illumination.
  • Skill at framing problems and scoping research approaches.
  • Questionnaire designer, survey programmer, data analyzer.
  • Translate complex questions into efficient and focused inquiries.
  • Analyze end-to-end product development from initial product strategy to post-launch iteration.
  • Familiarity with Agile Scrum, a variety of product design software, spreadsheets (can maintain complex spreadsheets) and customer research tools.
  • Diverse B2B/B2C portfolio (2+ years), spanning both web and mobile, that reflect design excellence

 

Constraints / Special Conditions

  • Note that this is not a game studio design role 

  • Only applications with a portfolio submission will be considered 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

EEO Employer

Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at

mailTo:employeeservices@apexsystemsinc.com

or 844-463-6178.

title: Business Development Executive
description:
Johnson Service Group (JSG) is recruiting for an experienced, Business Development Executive (BDE). JSG is a premier provider of IT & Technical staffing solutions with 30 years of experience and 32 offices across North America. We have been named by Staffing Industry Analysts (SIA) to three of its prominent 2021 lists: Largest U.S. Staffing Firms, Fastest-Growing U.S. Staffing Firms, and Largest U.S. Engineering Staffing Firms. We are experiencing tremendous growth across North America and now seeking to expand our Canadian Operations dedicated to Staffing Services and Solutions in the Canadian market.

As a Business Development Executive, you will be responsible for attracting and developing new clients across Canada. You will manage the growth and productivity of your clients by presenting contract, contract-to-hire, and permanent staffing solutions, as well as Solutions and formulating service level agreements. Our successful BDE's enjoy a base salary plus an extremely highly rewarding, uncapped compensation structure. We also provide ongoing professional development to enable top-performing team members career advancement opportunities into potential leadership roles.

 

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Attract new and maintain existing client relationships via phone, social media, face-to-face meetings, and email
  • Collaborate with current and potential clients to determine staffing needs and offer solutions
  • Negotiate contracts and pricing with clients
  • Schedule interviews between job candidates and hiring managers
  • Provide consistent follow up to both clients and recruiters in order to obtain feedback and move along the sales process
  • Work closely with our internal recruiters to fulfill client's staffing needs
  • Follow up on sales leads from internal recruiters, candidates, and contractors

 

Required Experience:

  • Outgoing personality with the ability to instantly connect with people
  • 2+ years of technical staffing or permanent placement experience preferred
  • Proven success in account development, establishing and maintaining customer relationships, and moving accounts through a sales funnel
  • Experience with Fortune 500 companies preferred
  • Self-discipline, confidence, and commitment toward following a business plan in a CRM tool
  • Previous experience with giving presentations and with the RFP process
  • Commitment to providing clear communication within the office and to clients
  • Computer literate with a high level of proficiency in all Microsoft Applications

 

All applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence.

Only those selected for interviews with experience in the industry will be contacted.


Job Type: Full-time Salary plus lucrative commissions

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Duration: 6-12 Months to start, renewals probable.

Must Have:

  • You take a user-centric design approach and apply design thinking and ideations across your work.
  • You have a portfolio demonstrating your experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments,
  • Building out user stories, journey maps, mockups, and prototypes.
  • Conducting user workshops and A/B testing.
  • Addressing heuristic analysis, usability, and accessibility concerns.
  • You have expertise in design software such as Sketch and Abstract, Adobe Creative Suite, Figma and Marvel.
  • You may have exposure to Balsamiq, Axure, InVision, and UXPin
  • The practical knowledge. You have experience in using UX best practices to design solutions, applying a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. You can rapidly iterate designs and solutions intelligently and clearly communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to internal and external teams.
The Role:

You will utilize quantitative and qualitative research to generate meaningful insights that will drive creative concepts. You will translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups, and rapid prototypes - optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces, leading to intuitive user experiences. You will apply your findings to create detailed UI designs for the product and development team.

Be a thought-leader. You will identify design problems and devise elegant solutions drawing on best practices and past experience to make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.

Collaborate and iterate. You will collaborate with Product and Development, working with internal and external clients to answer critical business questions. You will elicit needs and draw on user research and insights to create user journeys and user stories. You will workshop and test ideas with customers, iterating designs based on findings and feedback; relaying your commitment to a positive, engaging user experience.

title: Business Development Specialist
description:
DRS Technologies Canada Ltd. (DRS Canada), a subsidiary of Leonardo DRS, is a leading mid-tier Canadian defence electronics company specializing in military voice and data communications systems; electro‑optics (EO) and infrared search and tracking systems (IRST); command, control, communications, computers and intelligence (C4I) systems integration; deployable flight data recorders; and defence/space electronics manufacturing. 

What it is like working at DRS!

  • A motivating team-based environment where your achievements matter
  • A chance to work on industry leading edge technology with exceptional mentors
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Every second Friday off. We care about your work life balance!
  • Flexible hours. Work your hours around your schedule
  • Recipient of Carleton University’s Co-op Employer of the Year in 2018
  • Seasonal company-wide events: free BBQs, Christmas party, Dragon Boat team, Shinny hockey tournament, golf tournament, the Army Run, and more!

To learn more about Leonardo DRS, please visit our website at www.leonardodrs.com.

Purpose:

Working closely with the Business Development Team this position will perform a variety of key functions in support of business development initiatives and activities.

Major Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Participate in the development, implementation and tracking of strategic business development plans to ensure sustainable revenue growth;
  • Develop five (5) year bookings forecasts as part of the Company’s financial operating plan;
  • Assist in the forecasting of monthly, quarterly and yearly sales inventory and manage the Scorecard;
  • Research new business opportunities and prepare for evaluation at bid/no bid reviews;
  • Assist in the coordination of capture activities while monitoring the Bid & Proposal funding;
  • Promote communications and marketing material on both internal and external platforms;
  • Coordinate the participation of DRS TCL in both domestic and international tradeshows from planning through to onsite support at the event;
  • Develop positive working relationships with other functional areas within DRS TCL as well as with external customers serving as the key interface for business development activities; and
  • Support the VP, Business Development and Strategy with special projects and ad hoc assignments.

Core Competencies:

  • Possession of a Degree or Diploma in Business Administration or technical field combined with a minimum of five (5) years relevant experience ideally within the defence industry or equivalent years of experience;
  • Comfortable working with various social media platforms including presentation of materials in a manner that would be appealing to a wide audience;
  • Understanding of financial principals including compiling, reviewing and analyzing data;
  • Previous experience utilizing project management and planning skills in a business development environment;
  • Proficiency with computer software specifically with MS Office Suite;
  • Ability to pay attention to detail, manage own time effectively, produce work of the highest quality and meet deadlines consistently; and
  • Demonstrate strong communication, interpersonal, problem solving, and presentation skills.

All applicants must be eligible to meet requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Program and to obtain a Secret level security clearance.

Applicants requiring a disability related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process are to advise Human Resources. DRS Technologies Canada Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer.

Applicants may apply to this position online at www.leonardodrs.com careers.

title: Market Risk Analyst
description:
Client ID: 3825

Market Risk Analyst

On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Market Risk Analyst.

Market Risk Analyst – Job Description

  • The Model Control & Governance team within Market Risk & Model Development services the analytic and quantitative modeling needs of valuation and risk models for various stakeholders
  • Strong candidate to join the group to support model implementation testing for Murex system upgrade project
  • Work primarily with the team to perform model implementation review and testing, version control, as well as providing the analytic and quantitative modeling expertise to various internal partners
  • Perform model implementation testing and version control process for Foreign Exchange, Base Metal, and Precious Metal derivative models across PnL, Risk, VaR and CCR from bank's global trading businesses.
  • Design testing scenarios and conduct quantitative verification on model review and analysis as requested to ensure the timely delivery.
  • Review and provide effective challenge to model developer or model validation.
  • Create detailed model implementation testing documentation report.
  • Ensure to acquire an understanding of processes and methodologies followed by the business requirement.
  • Work on a project within securities
  • Communicating with different departments (deal with different people in different teams, some will not have a financial background so they will need to be able to take financial and/or technical terms and put it in layman’s terms)

Market Risk Analyst – Mandatory Skills

  • Solid quantitative finance knowledge associated with excellent understanding of derivative products, as well as the valuation and risk management methodologies
  • Solid understanding of pricing theory, stochastic calculus and numerical techniques used in derivative pricing (PDE/trees, Monte Carlo simulation, optimization)
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to translate complex technical issues for the benefit of others
  • Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematical/Computational Finance, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering

Market Risk Analyst – Nice to Have Skills

  • Previous working experience with Murex system on Foreign Exchange, Base Metal, and Precious Metal derivative models
  • Computational and programming knowledge (Python or VBA)
  • Experience in Model Development, Model Validation or related quantitative role – 3-5 years

Market Risk Analyst - Assignment Start Date

ASAP – 12 months to start

Market Risk Analyst - Assignment Location

Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

title: Communications Specialist
description:
Reference Code: IT044594

Details and Requirements:



Looking for Services of a Communications Specialist with the following (or similar) to assist in the delivery of professional communication services including the following:


• Create content (presentations, videos, articles, success stories, etc.) that develops awareness, knowledge, and understanding across the enterprise of high-level Digital initiatives.
• Develops and promotes communication channels to connect all Manitoba Hydro employees to Digital leaders to enable feedback, sharing, ideas, and dialogue.
• Consistently integrate Digital and Technology initiatives into channels and content.
• Collaborate with Corporate Communications for internal communications to ensure alignment with enterprise messaging, tone, and narrative.
• Arrange and coordinate key events (Brown Bag presentations, etc.).
• Collaborate/coordinate with Business Transformation Office communications and change activities,
• Lead the development of compelling messaging and execution of communication activities across all Digital transformation efforts.

• Provide expertise and support in writing, editing, and producing consistent and quality communications content.



Requirements:
A four-year degree in Communications, Public Relations, or Journalism from an institute of recognized standing and a minimum of five years of directly related experience in Communications, Public Relations and/or Creative Communications
OR
A two-year diploma in Creative Communications from an institute of recognized standing and a minimum of seven years of directly related experience in Communications, Public Relations and/or Creative Communications.
Excellent analytical, decision making, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information clearly and concisely both oral and written.
• Must demonstrate ability to work independently
• Are subject to a PRA (Personnel Risk Assessment)

title: Marketing Research Analyst -Qualtrics / Survey Monkey
description:
LOOKing for a Marketing Research Analyst with quantitative and qualitative skills to support the organization’s research and customer experience programs.  The service provider will support deliverables with the goal of further understanding our target market, audiences, customers, customer satisfaction and brand perception. 
Duration: 12 months
Security Clearance: Reliability
Location: Ottawa (not be expected to work in office locations at this time)
Required Skills:
  • Market research skills, including experience in analyzing quantitative data by coding open ends into themes, conducting frequencies and crosstabs.
  • Online survey programming skills using a research platform like Qualtrics or Survey Monkey
  • Ability to prepare & review insights summaries, reports or presentations
  • Experience using software such as Microsoft office, Excel, and SPSS, research platforms (like Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, etc.)
  • Possess a minimum of 2 years of experience in marketing research.
  • Demonstrated experience in statistical methodologies and proven knowledge of the tools and techniques to capture, analyze, and disseminate actionable customer insights.
  • Experience programming online surveys and manipulating data in a research platform
  • Experience conducting quantitative and qualitative data analysis including; coding open ends into themes, conducting frequencies and crosstabs
  • Good communication skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to collaborate with other researchers and marketing members
  • Familiarity with customer research platform such Qualtrics Experience Measurement Platform (Asset)
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Asset)
 
Tasks/ Responsibilities:
  • Review and perform quality assurance on research instruments (surveys & interview guides)
  • Prepare sample lists and upload them into customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Create and test survey distributions in customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Program surveys in customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Test programmed surveys in customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Code Open end responses: hundreds of verbatim, open-ended comments (non-structured data) from survey responses, code them into themes using Qualtrics and help generate insights
  • Load customer survey results manually into CRM
  • Create dashboards in customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Conduct some analysis in SPSS
  • Put together small reports from SPSS analysis into PowerPoint
  • Review and perform quality assurance on reports
  • Participate in meetings

title: UX/UI Designer, Remote Ontario
description:
We currently have exciting new opportunities for a UI/UX Designers to join our digital design team here at Our client Canada. You will be designing digital products that help our customers build financial resilience. Working with a diverse team of designers and developers with a wide range of experience.

This position reports to the UI/UX Manager.

If you feel this is a good fit for you please email me your word resume to aaron.lail@randstad.ca

Advantages
As a UI/UX designer you should have an eye for clean pixel perfect web experiences, be able to create sitemaps and process flows and interactions, and transform your wireframes into beautiful, intuitive and functional web applications. You will work closely with product owners, delivery managers, QA testers, business analysts and developers to help craft the look, feel and interaction of the web applications.

Responsibilities
Excellent knowledge working with Figma
• Ability to review, understand and make recommendations based on analytics.
• Worked at a digital organization (client or agency) designing web and app experiences
• Have a varied and exciting Digital Portfolio
• Experience of working on responsive web design across a range of devices
• Eye for typography, colour, layout, brand systems, and a pixel perfect attention to detail.
• Worked collaboratively with developers to make your design a reality in code
• Working knowledge of current user experience design principles, standards and trends.
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate your designs and ideas confidently and engagingly and the ability to present work and interface with all levels of management
• Strong experience working with interactive content and efficient at creating Pixel perfect production-ready artwork and assets
• Excellent knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, in particular Photoshop and Illustrator
• Working knowledge of current accessibility design standards.
• Experience designing single page applications
• Understanding of accessibility laws in Canada

Qualifications
Extensive experience in digital visual design (in-house or client-side) designing products and features for mobile or desktop, native or web.
• Have a portfolio that exhibits solid architectural and detailed design thinking, a solid grasp of information architecture, web or mobile technologies, and expert and inspiring visual design.
• Basic CSS and HTML skills

Summary
We are ideally looking for a UX/UI designer who is very strong with Figma and has a responsive portfolio to share.

In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer
description:
** If this posting is still published, it means we are still reading through every resume **

Location: USA and Canada. 100% remote.
Job type: Both full-time and contract - multiple roles open
Start date: Immediate


About the job:
Our client is hiring for a full-time Salesforce Marketing Cloud developer.

Responsibilities:

  • Architect the structure and setup new instances of the Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • Maintain and support exist instances of the Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • Work with a RESTful APIs to move data between custom databases, CRM platforms and the Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • Read and understand business requirement documents to facilitate the creation of an appropriate functionality requirements document
  • Ensure that solutions meet both business requirements and technical requirements, including performance, maintainability and stability
  • Design and build digital marketing Journeys
  • Use your SQL experience to build automations and manipulate data
  • Use SSJS to create Cloud Pages within the Salesforce Marketing Cloud that update the Salesforce Sales Cloud
  • Use AMPScript to create highly dynamic emails

Experience:

  • 2+ years of hands-on experience working with the Salesforce Marketing Cloud: Email studio, Content Builder, Contact Builder, Cloud Pages, Automation Studio, and Journey Builder
  • Experience with SSJS (Server-Side JavaScript), AMPScript, SQL, Journey Builder, Automation Studio, and Cloud Page
  • Experience with the design and development of relational databases
  • Experience working with web services and RESTful APIs

Nice to have:

  • Excellent understanding of the full software development life-cycle
  • Excellent communication and documentation skills
  • Self-motivated, good initiative and able to work independently to deliver a quality product while meeting tight deadlines
  • Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud Mobile Studio is considered an asset
  • Experience with Evergage (Interaction Studio) or Datorama is considered an asset
  • Certifications

title: Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications
description:
Client ID: 5486

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications

On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications.

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications – Job Description

  • UX designer (Interaction Designer) will work within an agile and cross-functional squad to work closely with Content Designers, Visual Designers, product and technology teams to produce flows from discovery to delivery phase
  • Looking for more of a “progressive” interaction designer in the sense that they exhibit more of a Product Designer mindset with regards to being comfortable with multiple skillsets (i.e., Interaction, Visual, Design Thinking)
  • Product Design focused (interaction, visual design, service design principles)
  • Highly skilled interaction designer with strong experience and understanding of component design
  • The ability to communicate rationale for design decisions as well as exhibit the flexibility to understand business and development constraints and how might that affect the design

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications – Mandatory Skills

  • BA/BS degree in Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science (CS), or a related field or equivalent practical experience
  • 2-3 years of experience in designing usable interfaces across multiple channels and platforms
  • Product Design focused (Interaction and Visual Design skillset)
  • Must have experience working on projects focused on Banking Product application
  • Strong understanding and experience with component design (Figma a requirement)
  • Has mobile-first design experience
  • Has worked in an Agile setting and a proven track record of working closely with product owners and developers
  • Has experience working with a Design System

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications – Nice to Have Skills

  • MA/MS degree or certification in Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science (CS), or a related field
  • Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase
  • Appreciation for the potential of 'design thinking'
  • Experience working within a large organization and within an agile environment

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications - Assignment Start Date

ASAP – 12 months to start

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications - Assignment Location

Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

title: Marketing Manager, Global ServiceNow Alliance, Deloitte Global Consulting
description:
Job Type: Permanent
Reference code: 105105
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality

Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting-edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with premier thought leaders in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?

What will your typical day look like?

  • Plan and deliver effective marketing measures and campaigns which build pipeline and eminence for our
  • ServiceNow Alliance and drive business growth through the alliance's go-to-market initiatives
  • Build internal and external awareness of ServiceNow solutions and coordinate alliance marketing programs globally
  • Develop marketing plans to meet business goals and work closely with leadership and cross-functional\ teams to execute plans and support tracking of marketing budgets aligned to alliance strategy
  • Maintain project timelines and deliverables to ensure successful execution of programs with reporting and tracking of leads; consult and collaborate with stakeholders to clearly define requirements and expected results
  • Create high quality marketing deliverables (online and offline), coordinating internal service providers and external vendors supporting projects as required
  • Contribute to the success of the Marketing team by sharing marketing best practices and identify opportunities to leverage content and messaging from related areas of the

About the team

Deloitte Globa l:

At Deloitte, we expect results. Incredible-tangible-results. And Deloitte Global professionals play a unique role in delivering those results. We reach across disciplines and borders to serve our global organization. We are the engine of Deloitte. We develop and lead global strategies and provide programs and services that unite our network. In Deloitte Global, everyone has an opportunity to lead. We see the importance of your perspective and your ability to create value. We want you to fit in-with an inclusive culture, focus on work-life fit and well-being, and a supportive, connected environment; but we also want you to stand out-with opportunities to have a strategic impact, innovate, and take the risks necessary to make your mark. Deloitte Global supports our talented professionals in answering the question: What impact will you make?

Global Consulting provides innovative solutions for cross-cultural, cross-border challenges our teams may encounter around the world. Using leading-edge tools, methods, and resources, we deliver top-notch service that is applied locally while staying true to our global brand and core values.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

You are someone with:

  • Bachelor's degree in marketing or related field
  • 5+ years of enterprise B2B marketing experience in professional services
  • Experience in creating demand generation programs and digital marketing strategies
  • Strong performance in developing, managing and executing multichannel marketing programs, with a collaborative mindset, to consistently deliver high quality results
  • Experience in developing digital advertising, branding and social media to support event marketing activations
  • Experience creating written messaging, thought leadership and B2B collateral as well as presenting concepts and ideas to colleagues, internal clients and alliance partners
  • High proficiency with MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Consulting, Developer, Equity, Marketing Consultant, Marketing, Technology, Finance

Apply now "

title: Business Development Manager Canada
description:
Summary:

Business Development Manager -Canada


At our Company, we grow People, Brands, and Businesses! We are seeking a dedicated Business Development Manager to manage sales programs and strategic planning initiatives within a specific department of the business to ensure sales targets are met.   This role may be dedicated to servicing one significant client or responsible for multiple clientâ€™s goals and encompassing customer relations and implementation.

 

Take this opportunity to join North Americaâ€™s leading business solutions provider and build your career working with amazing people in a growing industry! Apply today!

 

What we offer:

  • Full-Time Benefits (Health, Dental, Disability, Life, Lifeworks Program)
  • PerkSpot Discounts on Travel, Movies, Cell Phones and more
  • Training and Career Development
  • Generous Paid Time-Off

Responsibilities:

  • Achieve P&L targets; manage the business for each client(s) assigned.
  • Implement marketing strategies and analyze trends and results to achieve department/client income and expense budget goals.
  • Develop and launch strategies to pursue new opportunities.
  • Manage and maximize manufacturer marketing/promotional funds to achieve sales goals while staying within financial guidelines.
  • Organize a business unit team to retain and expand upon all client relationships.
  • Facilitate communication, opportunities, challenges, and workflow to other team members  and attend all Client meetings and reviews.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent job-related experience is required
  • 2-5 years of relative work experience in applicable field
  • Proven track record in sales
  • Working knowledge of syndicated data
  • Forecasts, set objectives, anticipates, structures tasks and establishes priorities
  • Strong sales presentation development skills; Outstanding written and oral communication skills.

The Company  is one of North Americaâ€™s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers, and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods.  The Company services a variety of trade channels including grocery, mass merchandise, specialty, convenience, drug, dollar, club, hardware, consumer electronics and home centers. We bridge the gap between manufacturers and retailers, providing consumers access to the best products available in the marketplace today.

The Company welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.   The Company will provide reasonable accommodations, accessible formats, and communication support upon request to persons with disabilities who take part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.   If you require accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact: Recruiter, Talent Acquisition, for external applicants, or, a Supervisor for internal applicants.

Responsibilities:

The Company  is one of North Americaâ€™s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods.  The Company  services a variety of trade channels including grocery, mass merchandise, specialty, convenience, drug, dollar, club, hardware, consumer electronics and home centers. We bridge the gap between manufacturers and retailers, providing consumers access to the best products available in the marketplace today.

 

Position Summary

 

The Business Development Manager manages sales programs and strategic planning initiatives within a specific department of the business to ensure sales targets are met.   This role may be dedicated to servicing one significant client or responsible for multiple clientâ€™s goals and encompassing customer relations and implementation.

 

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

 

Revenue Budget Achievement

  • Achieve P&L targets; manage business for each client(s) assigned
  • Implement marketing strategies and analyze trends and results to achieve department/client income and expense budget goals
  • Own and drive revenue growth; identify opportunities and align business unit resources to secure those opportunities  

Client Quota Achievement

  • Meet and/or exceed Clientâ€™s goals for sales, distribution, pricing, shelving and promotional volume
  • Identify and provide services to support the â€œCustomer as Clientsâ€
  • Develop and launch strategies to pursue new opportunities  

Client Key Performance Indicators Achievement

  • Manage and maximize manufacturer marketing/promotional funds to achieve sales goals while staying within financial guidelines
  • Identify opportunities and close white space within the market
  • Implement customer headquarter calls and penetrate key positions at retailer

Department Business Management

  • Organize business unit team to retain and expand upon all client relationships
  • Assist team to navigate in the larger  Company organization to align needed resources and support to ensure specific client and/or customer   initiative success
  • Facilitate communication, opportunities, challenges, and workflow to other team members   and attend all Client meetings and reviews

Supervisory Responsibilities

Direct Reports

This position does not have supervisory responsibilities for direct reports

 

Indirect Reports

Does not have direct reports, but may delegate work of others and provide guidance, direction and mentoring to indirect reports

 

Travel and/or Driving Requirements

Travel is an essential duty and function of this job. Driving is not an essential duty or function of this job.

Travel up to 40%

 

Minimum Qualifications

Education Level: (Required): Bachelor's Degree or  equivalent experience

                                                                               

2-5 years of relative work experience in applicable field

 

Skills, Knowledge and Abilities

  • Proven track record in sales
  • Strong sales presentation/development skills
  • Working knowledge of syndicated data

  • Forecasts, sets objectives, anticipates, structures tasks and establishes priorities

  • Accurately scopes out length and difficulty of tasks and projects

  • Strong sales presentation development skills
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills.
  • Demonstrates commitment to meeting or exceeding customer expectations, effectively solicits and responds to the needs of the customer both external and internal
  • Works cooperatively with others toward common group objectives, demonstrates respect for the ideas and contributions of other team members, cultivates positive relationships with other associates, and provides assistance and support to others
  • Intermediate Microsoft Office Suite skills

Environmental & Physical Requirements

 

Office / Sedentary Requirements

Incumbent must be able to perform the essential functions of the job.   Work is performed primarily in an office environment. Typically requires the ability to sit for extended periods of time (66%+ each day), ability to hear the telephone, ability to enter data on a computer and may also require the ability to lift up to 10 pounds.  

 

Additional Information Regarding  The Company  Job Duties and Job Descriptions

 

The Company  is committed to providing equal opportunity in all employment practices without regard to race, nation or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy and childbearing), sexual orientation, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability or pardoned criminal convictions, or any other category protected by law.

The above job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for the position. The Company reserves the right at any time with or without notice to alter or change job responsibilities, reassign or transfer job position or assign additional job responsibilities.  The Company shall provide reasonable accommodations of known disabilities to enable a qualified applicant or employee to apply for employment, perform the essential functions of the job, or enjoy the benefits and privileges of employment as required by the law.

Employee understands that neither the provision of the Job Description nor any representation in this document creates a guarantee or contract of employment for any specified period of time or changes the nature of Employeeâ€™s employment, which can only be modified in a writing signed by the CEO.

Important Information:

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of associates so classified.        

 

The Company is committed to providing equal opportunity in all employment practices without regard to age, race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, religion, physical or mental disability, or any other category protected by law.   As part of this commitment, the Company shall provide reasonable accommodations of known disabilities to enable an applicant or employee to apply for employment, perform the essential functions of the job, or enjoy the benefits and privileges of employment as required by the law.

 

The Company welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.   The Company will provide reasonable accommodations, accessible formats and communication supports upon request to persons with disabilities who take part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.   If you require accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact: Recruiter, Talent Acquisition, for external applicants, or, a Supervisor for internal applicants
