title: PPC Growth Strategist
description:
PPC Growth Strategist (Remote)  

Do you get excited by creating unstoppable B2B SaaS businesses with your mastery of nurturing trusted advisor relationships and strategic hands-on management of PPC campaigns in Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and LinkedIn Ads?

Does the idea of working in a company with a team of true believers, obsessively results-focused, open-minded action takers, and people who are always in it to win it, excite you?

You

  • Are fascinated and have shown demonstrated results with Google, Microsoft, LinkedIn and Facebook Ads (at scale) for B2B SaaS businesses.
  • Figure out how to fix the problem instead of who to blame.
  • Take 100% accountability for your wins and losses. You paid for your own stuff as a teenager.
  • Build rapport and command authority naturally with clients in marketing leadership positions, and have a track record of reducing pressure, noise, and overwhelm.
  • Say what you’re thinking and are objective with giving and receiving feedback.
  • Have a career history of success, working in the trenches, and delivering WOW results for your team and clients with consistent MRR growth and CAC reduction.
  • Have Experience managing large single-account monthly budgets of $50,000 and greater for B2B clients

We

  • We believe that the internet holds new possibilities for people and their companies.
  • Work to pioneer and uplift the standard of digital marketing and advertising we all experience.
  • Care more about your values and intelligence than your experience.
  • Are committed to creating a team dynamic that creates empowerment rather than entitlement.
  • Are one of the few independent digital strategy agencies globally with deep subject matter expertise in SaaS Marketing including being a Google Premier Partner, Facebook PRO Marketing Partner, Microsoft Ads Premier Partner, and Hubspot Gold Partner.
  • We really care about our team. We're rated 4.6/5 Glassdoor Rating with a 96% approval rating

Our Core Values

  1. Give a Sh!t
  2. Always Be in It To Win It
  3. Be Obsessed with Serving Others
  4. Practice a Growth Mindset
  5. When We Fail, We Don’t Lose the Lesson  

The Opportunity

The mission of the PPC Growth Strategist is to retain and grow a portfolio of B2B SaaS clients (4-5) through ongoing relationship nurturing and strategic hands-on management of PPC platforms (including but not limited to Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads).

The PPC Growth Strategist will support and protect the Director of Paid Media to achieve the company's long-term goals by consistently delivering WOW results for our clients.

This role demands an individual with exceptional communication, strategic, analysis, organizational, and interpersonal qualities. This means:

  • The ability to set, communicate, and regularly manage expectations with clients.
  • The ability to deliver impactful marketing results through smart decision-making and day-to-day campaign management while effectively communicating that value upward to the client.
  • The ability to plan, organize and execute multiple ongoing initiatives in a timely and transparent manner.

This individual is responsible for a portfolio of client accounts, including aspects of strategy, planning, client management, optimization, and reporting. 

Expected Outcomes

Reporting to the Director of Paid Media, you’ll:

  1. Be a strategic partner for our clients. Managing client relationships and performance for a portfolio of 4-5 B2B SaaS companies.
  2. Optimize Paid Media campaigns across all channels, writing and split testing ad copy, contributing to the landing page and website copy and recommending solutions to improve client’s inbound marketing funnel. 
  3. Consult on Demand Generation tactics for our B2B SaaS Clients including email campaign strategy, trial/demo acquisition funnel, and identifying content opportunities based on client’s personas. 

Some competencies you’ll need to have:

  • Critical Thinking: You are able to expertly craft actionable and impactful strategies for any role in the organization. Everything you do has a force-multiplier effect.
  • Project Management: Large and complex projects are kept organized, within scope, and on time. You are able to proactively resolve project risks and expertly handle objections.
  • Reporting & Analytics: You are able to create advanced custom reports and dashboards in Google Analytics and Google Data Studio.
  • Communication: You are able to communicate complex data in a simple manner and craft a story around it to lead to business insights. You have strong presentation skills and are comfortable speaking in front of small audiences.

 

Why You'll Want to Work Here

We earn our talent. This role will give you the opportunity to maximize:

  • Fit — We will over-communicate fit through feedback and alignment with where the company is going, and share exactly how you are helping improve the bottom line.
  • Family — We know family is important and will be flexible so you can be present and live a well-integrated life. 
  • Freedom — We will give you ample freedom to make decisions, and will not micromanage you.
  • Fortune — If you accomplish your objectives, you will grow in compensation and responsibility over the next five years.
  • Fun — We like to have a lot of fun around here. We think you will find this is a culture you will really enjoy.

We walk our talk.

We really care about our team.We’re rated 4.6/5 on Glassdoor with a 96% approval rating.

We don’t tolerate mediocrity. The only way we know is to always be in it to win it.

If you thrive in a “work hard, play hard” environment, then you’ll love working at Powered by Search.

Perks & Benefits

  • This role is Fully Remote (Requires 4 Overlap Hours with 9 am-5 pm EST)
  • 5 weeks paid time off (for everyone!)
  • We offer competitive compensation plus quarterly bonuses 
  • You do not need to become a manager in the company to move up in compensation and role/title.
  • Flexible Hours
  • Paid training (school, events, conferences)
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and eye care (For Full-Time Canadian Residents only

We're rated 4.6/5 Glassdoor Rating with a 96% approval rating", 'Comprehensive health, dental, and eye care (For Full-Time Canadian Residents only', 'Are fascinated and have shown demonstrated results with Google, Microsoft, LinkedIn and Facebook Ads (at scale) for B2B SaaS businesses.', 'Take 100% accountability for your wins and losses. You have strong presentation skills and are comfortable speaking in front of small audiences.', 'Practice a Growth Mindset', 'Care more about your values and intelligence than your experience.', 'Work to pioneer and uplift the standard of digital marketing and advertising we all experience.', 'Say what you’re thinking and are objective with giving and receiving feedback.', 'Have a career history of success, working in the trenches, and delivering WOW results for your team and clients with consistent MRR growth and CAC reduction.', 'Are committed to creating a team dynamic that creates empowerment rather than entitlement.', 'Have Experience managing large single-account monthly budgets of $50,000 and greater for B2B clients', 'Expected Outcomes', 'Paid training (school, events, conferences)', 'Reporting & Analytics: You are able to create advanced custom reports and dashboards in Google Analytics and Google Data Studio.']

title: Marketing/CRM Consultant
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:
•Act as a key contact person between various Marketing units and their managers to make recommendations using in-depth analysis of CRM campaigns.
•Make part in managing various marketing campaigns; provide leadership in following up on various stakeholders’ campaign processes and adherence to timelines in campaign delivery as well as in evaluating the industry KPI’s on the different business units.
•Act as a key contact on data insights and management between various marketing units and IT teams in order to provide necessary information and data analysis for customer and market knowledge.
•Analyze and interpret the information provided to partners and recommend other appropriate studies.
•Develop analytical files for marketing databases to support modeling/profiling and marketing activities; as well as develop analytical reporting for Marketing and Finance.
•Support Marketing Automation for campaigns, reports and database processes, and implement effective solutions using existing systems
•Maximize the use of current resources & tool and scale our next-generation campaign management platform
•Act a change agent to improve the campaign environment and campaign automation
•Liaising with critical partners such as IT, Channel, Technology providers, Customer Care, Commercial Strategy and Marketing to ensure customer engagement success
•Performs as subject matter advisor in direct marketing/ campaign management area and provide guidance and resolve problems highly complex in nature
•Leveraging analytics, insights and best practices to improve decision-making, processes and campaign development activities
•Interfacing within the internal and external stakeholders, particularly our Data Science, Data Products and Campaign Analytics and Reporting teams, to derive synergies and alignment on campaign efforts and priorities and how advanced analytics can drive campaign performance

WE NEED SOMEONE WHO CAN….
•Engage partners – understand the business and anticipate needs; collaborate well
•Lead by example – always teach, share, grow and develop, while driving results and making work fun
•Deliver quality – steer robust and meaningful outputs, with agility and attention to detail
•Interrogate the status quo – challenge old habits, ask why, and find a better way
•Influence and drive change – secure alignment across teams and leadership to ensure we are focusing on the right things, the right way
•Strong project management and change management skills
•“Connect the dots” – leverage foresights on opportunities, dependencies, risks, business and customer experience impact to drive better outcome
•Provided campaign portfolios to optimize, improve and create efficiencies

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE ROLE…
•Well-developed strategic-thinking skills, with the ability to excite and lead others, capitalizing on individual strengths to drive collaborative outcomes
•Ability to bring structure out of fluidity, shape a plan out of various discrete activities and rally a cross-functional team around a journey
•Capacity to thrive in an environment that is of constant change, unpredictability and ambiguity
•Ability to inspire and influence across organizations to gain alignment and support on recommendations
•Proven track record of taking a “client-first” approach, while setting and achieving aggressive objectives
•Simplicity and creative approaches that are solution/outcome-oriented, constantly looking for ways to do things smarter, better and more efficiently
•Natural or trained ability to grasp both business and technical aspects of the role
•Ability to quickly establish credibility with internal client-partners and to be the seen as a partner to the business with a deep expertise in campaign execution and delivering impactful results
•Must thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing work environment

MUST HAVE SKILLS:
•       5+ years of experience in Database Marketing / Campaign Management
•       5+ Years experience in using advanced CRM tools such as SAS Customer Intelligence Suite, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, SQL programming, UNICA, SAS Marketing Automation and leveraging digital capabilities such as Adobe Audience
•       Advanced experience in customer segmentation and data driven targeting strategies
•       In-depth knowledge of database marketing and data warehousing tools and software (MS SQL, ORACLE, …)
•       Experience in deploying large scale technology transformations including program management, funding and change management
•       Experience in working with financial/marketing information including business cases, KPIs, ROI, NPV

NICE TO HAVE SKILL:
•      Unica experience

ADDITIONAL SKILLS:
•       Knowledge of database architecture fundamentals and best practices
•       Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both written and oral) to interact effectively with senior leadership
•       University degree in business, marketing, finance, math, computer science or related field

title: Associate Principal, Marketing Transformation
description:
Overview:


Daggerwing Group is seeking an Associate Principal  for our North America office!  

About the Job:

Daggerwing Group â€“ Omnicomâ€™s global change management consulting firm, rated in the Top 10 in the world in its category â€“ is seeking an Associate Principal for Global and North American clients, with a base in North America. This role will be heavily focused in driving modern marketing and CX transformation for Fortune 500-level clients â€“ helping companies change the way that marketing organizations â€“ and marketers â€“ modernize to deliver greater value for customers, brands and their business.

 

As an Associate Principal (a VP level position), you will be focused on three areas:

  1. Driving end-to-end excellence in modern, data and insight-driven marketing processes/practices for clients â€“ working with CMOs and their leadership teams to prioritize and implement changes to marketing processes, structures, roles, capabilities, culture and talent/employee experience.
  2. Guiding, empowering and supporting Daggerwing employees so that they love the career-building benefits of working at our consultancy â€“ and feel supported within our inclusive culture.
  3. Helping to grow the business and the marketing transformation practice at Daggerwingâ€“ elevating our value with existing and new clients as well with agency partners across our parent company (Omnicom Group) network.

 

You will report to a member of Daggerwing Groupâ€™s Leadership Team in North America. You will also be part of a Global Leadership Team that you can tap into for ideas and support â€“ including leveraging consulting and creative resources from different Daggerwing Group offices around the world.

 

What will you be doing?

 

Managing delivery of marketing transformation consulting for clients

  • Applying your marketing knowledge to help clients pivot to more modern, data-driven marketing practices â€“ guiding clients to define their ideal â€˜future of marketingâ€™ state, assess their gaps and generate a roadmap for change that may range from shifting org structures across the marketing function and embracing more marketing technologies to creating more purposeful brands, redesigning E2E campaign processes and elevating capabilities in personalized engagement at every step of the customer journey.
  • Developing strategies/methods to help clients put customers at the center of marketing planning and decision-making â€“ helping clients to better understand and apply customer insights as part of culture, organization and process changes.
  • Leading, managing and/or overseeing consulting project management -- from concept to implementation, including leading team members in the development of SOWs, project plans and budgets for both new and current clients, taking into consideration client business needs and staffing/pricing approaches that ensure Daggerwing Group meets or exceeds revenue targets.
  • Building and strengthening relationships with stakeholders at Omnicom agencies, to encourage them to connect with Daggerwing Group when they have clients needing change management support.
  • Providing hands-on leadership to teams and oversight for client projects, to ensure they are on track, on time and on budget from both a client and Daggerwing Group business perspective â€“ with an emphasis on managing all projects to ensure Daggerwing meets monthly/quarterly finance projections.
  • Leading and/or facilitating the collaboration of multiple stakeholders (different departments in a client organization, agencies, other consulting firms) on large-scale client engagements, keeping all teams on track to meet client goals.

 

Strengthening the experience for our Employees

 

  • Providing hands-on coaching so that employees are always learning â€“ but at the same time ensuring that employees feel confident in trying new things, taking appropriate risks and learning new skills.
  • Working with employees to ensure that they have a learning and development plan that helps them grow and aligns with employeeâ€™s personal goals and the ambitions of Daggerwing Group.
  • Working with other Global Leadership Team members on initiatives to enhance our company culture and employee engagement.

 

 

Growing the business

 

  • Working with current clients to understand their business challenges - and then providing them with recommendations that address their challenges and opportunities.
  • Contributing to Daggerwing Groupâ€™s thought leadership platforms and contributing â€“ as a member of the Global Leadership Team â€“ ideas on ways to expand our expertise and solutions, stand out as competitors and grow our reputation.
Qualifications:

 

  • Recent experience on the client or agency side as a senior marketing leader
  • Experience as a participant/leader in any type of Marketing transformation effort (including building modern marketing capabilities, changing process and ways of working for planning and executing, adapting how companies work with agency partners in advertising, media, social, digital, experiential, etc.)
  • Strong understanding of modern marketing best practices and processes (purposeful brand building, omni channel orchestration, data-driven optimization, etc.)
  • Experience in designing or strengthening Marketing Process
  • Experience with Program/Project Management, managing large scale projects with multiple workstreams
  • Experience in advising for large clients and/or projects â€“ such as working with executive leadership teams, driving organization, marketing transformations, culture change, process change or internal communications for major new initiatives.
  • Proven experience in being a trusted advisor to a client or leader in your organisation â€“ with examples of where you were able to provide a strong point of view to address challenges
  • Ability to create and manage budgets
  • Recognised as a strong leader â€“ being a person team members want to work for because they feel that you are making their career aspirations and learning and development a priority
  • Comfortable with traveling internationally (when it safe) and has a valid passport

 

About You

Weâ€™re looking for leaders with:

 

  • A keen interest in being part of a company that is a â€˜challenger brandâ€™ â€“ working hard to bust the norms and stand out competitively against large, traditional consulting competitors
  • Curiosity and a growth mindset â€“ a positive attitude and a desire to constantly learn and grow
  • Thrive under pressure in collaborative and non-structured environments â€“ ability to be agile and flexible to continually changing priorities and ways of working
  • High degree of proactivity, a strong work ethic and self-motivated
  • Love to nurture the careers of others and is excited to play a role in team members growth and progress
  • Understand that consulting companies donâ€™t always work 9â€“5 and being part of a global company means sometimes there are calls with overseas team members at late and early hours

title: Campaign Specialist - Google Ads
description:
About Us:
Teleperformance is a worldwide leader in customer experience management and contact center business process outsourcing. Our company employs around 300.000 people working in over 265 dialects and languages, in 80 countries, operating across all business sectors and all continents on behalf of major international companies.

Teleperformance Canada, with more than 1200+ employees, part of the fortune 25 and certified with Great Place to Work, is looking for a group of highly-skilled professionals.

Our Work Culture:
At Teleperformance, we remain true to our core values of integrity, respect, professionalism, innovation and commitment.
  • Autonomous - We encourage and trust your decision-making skills.
  • Progressive work environment- If you have skills to prove we have all ladders for you to grow.
  • Flexible - We believe in results.
  • Innovative - All ideas matter.
  • Inclusive - Everyone is Included and everyone wins.
  • We work hard and party even harder.

Kickstart Connect Representative:
In this role, you will partner with an assigned portfolio of new clients in order to help them develop their first online advertising campaigns with the opportunity of having a significant impact on their business. It is a target-driven environment, where you will work towards individual targets as well as be part of a larger onboarding team.
  • Base Salary-$40,000 per year with the possibility of OTE of $54,000 per year.

Deliverable:
  • Pitch and impact assigned customers in accordance with training provided, standards and policies with a focus on deep level insights, customer success, upsell strategy, and strong relationship management.
  • Serve as a trusted consultant with customers to onboard, develop and optimize advertiser’s campaigns.
  • Interpret and develop business plans focused on driving customer goal achievement.
  • Hit productivity, upsell, and customer impact targets.
  • Handle a moderate volume of potential clients on a daily basis through outbound and inbound calls, aligning support with opportunities.
  • Manage day-to-day activities independently and proactively based on customer needs and incentives.

Minimum Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree, College degree or equivalent Degree.
  • 1-year minimum experience in consultative Selling: managing a portfolio of customers, identifying customers/partner's needs, focusing on customer goals, results and clients satisfaction.
  • Strong desire to meet or exceed productivity, readiness, sustainability, and task points, compliance and customer satisfaction targets.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills to pitch on the phone and compose compelling proposals.
  • Proven track record of target over achievement, strong sales attitude and desire to meet and overachieve multiple KPIs and Sales Quotas.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Knowledge of Google Ads or any Digital Marketing tool, understanding the synergy between different products, how to translate comprehensive marketing strategies into campaigns, and drive successful results.
  • Google Ads certification.
  • Knowledge of digital media and its competitive landscape.
  • Proven technical ability with CRMs (customer relationship management) programs.

Skills:
  • Understanding of sales cycles including prospecting, communicating, negotiating and the ability to sell based on value, not price.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills within required language(s).
  • Dependable, reliable with a strong work ethic.
  • Analytical and creative mindset, ability to solve problems.
  • Proactive, organized, responsible, and proven ability to work well with a team.

Benefits & Perks:
  • The flexible working model between remote and from the office Currently remote
  • Established career path supported by self-assessments, virtual training, and a guided curriculum that allow for vertical and horizontal growth through our multiple lines of business.
  • Robust career path with a full development plan Opportunity to grow in organisation.
  • Paid 4 weeks training, 2 weeks leave.
  • Continuous learning through progressive training that is specific to your tenure and skills.
  • Competitive salary with incentive programs.
  • Positive and supportive environment.
  • Weekly Friday Night Drinks / Social, Trivia Nights, Games evenings and Movie Outings.
  • Medical and Dental benefits, Employee Family Assistance Programs, Rewards & Recognition programs.

Schedule:
  • Fixed schedule Monday to Friday 9 am to 6 pm.

Location:
  • Candidates are advised to be within travel distance from our primary location Yonge & Eglinton.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $40,000.00 per year

title: Content Marketing Coordinator
description:
Swish Maintenance Limited is currently looking for a Content Marketing Coordinator to join our Marketing team! The Content Marketing Coordinator will provide support across multiple projects and functions throughout the business with an opportunity to grow and contribute along the way. This role can be located remotely, however reasonable proximity to a Swish branch and the ability to attend meetings at a Swish office location is required.
 AREAS OF FOCUS 
  • Drafting content for various marketing initiatives, must have the experience/ability in professional writing in a marketing/advertising capacity. 
  • Working under deadline pressure and manage projects across multiple lines of business
  • Collaborate with internal teams, external agencies and vendor partners
  • Identify market/industry trends & insights and optimize budget spend
  • Understand customer buying journey: sales process, buying cycle, website navigation
  • Willingness to learn about the business/industry and unique needs of business units
  • Research, develop and implement plans for increasing brand awareness and sales leads
  • Creative thinking in terms of content & asset development
  • Assessing past and existing campaigns/initiatives to make recommendations for future efforts
  • Responsible for producing content/copy that is in line with the voice & tone of the Swish brand and ensuring cohesive messaging across all platforms
  • Working with our Swish Clean-It® Centre retail outlets across Canada (retail marketing experience an asset)
  • Understanding and advocating for the "voice of customer" in GTM and communication strategy development
  • Other duties as assigned
WHAT WE OFFER
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • RRSP matching program
  • Performance bonuses
  • Equal opportunity, inclusive workplace
  • Positive, team-based environment
  • Starting salary $50,000 CAD
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Post secondary education - Bachelor's Degree or College Diploma in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration or related field
  • 2-4 years of relevant experience
  • Knowledge of brand management, project management and core marketing tactics
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills are a must
  • Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Design, etc.) an asset
  • Compelling portfolio of work over a wide range of creative projects
WORKING ARRANGEMENT 
  • Hybrid/Majority work-from-home opportunity (must have reasonable proximity to a Swish branch) 
  • Occasional travel within Ontario

title: Sr. Product Analyst
description:
AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

  • Support the product org with product metrics reporting
  • Support product org with insights and suggestions on feature usage
  • Support product managers with reporting requirements and performance measurement of new products & features
  • Define, track, and report on product success measurement criteria

 

KPIs FOR THIS ROLE

  • Create product usage reporting requirements
  • Document reporting gaps and work with necessary teams to find solutions
  • Maintain product & feature KPIs and Dashboards

 

PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide business requirements and collaborate with internal teams on data capture strategy that will support accurate reporting and insights on sales pattern and consumer behavior
  • Evaluating analytics processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
  • Perform ad-hoc and in-depth analyses
  • Drive initiatives to improve reporting capabilities
  • Explore new data sources to add signals to existing reporting
  • Create reports and self-service dashboards to provide ongoing insight to business stakeholders, support product leadership in making effective, analytically driven, and strategic decisions
  • Provide scientific driven insights to executive leadership through weekly and monthly reporting

 

TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES

  • Proficiency in SQL (e.g. Joins, sub-queries, window functions, CTE, LAG)
  • Experience in Python/R
  • Forecasting and Modeling: Sheets, Excel, etc.
  • Ability to design testable hypotheses
  • Working knowledge of analytical and data visualization tools (Python, R, and/or Tableau) if are using any BI tools

 

NON-TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to propose complex solutions and explanations in writing
  • Ability to break down business requirements into engineering and data requirements
  • Ability to transform complex reporting into concise digestible reports and insights
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Strong verbal and presentation/communication skills; be able to build a narrative around what you see in the data and translate to the non-technical stakeholders

 

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

  • Proficiency in querying and manipulating complex raw datasets for analysis. SQL skills required, experience with Python/R, ETL a bonus
  • 5+ years of advanced proficiency in Excel (including Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc)
  • Knowledge of Git version control (Github, Bitbucket)
  • Experience with designing scientifically accurate research and performing statistical analysis on large data sets
  • BS/MS Degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Finance and other quantitative areas
  • 5+ years’ experience in sales/business reporting/analytics
  • Effective at working independently and as a member of a cross functional team
  • Experience explaining technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to varied audiences and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses
 

About TapClicks

TapClicks, Inc is a Smart Marketing cloud solution and a leading marketing technology company for agencies, media companies, brands, and enterprises. Its integrated Marketing Operations Platform includes sales enablement, workflow, and order management, analytics, and automated reporting – all within a single intuitive user interface available on-demand in the cloud. TapClicks was founded in 2015, is headquartered in Silicon Valley, has development and sales offices in Boston, London, Hyderabad and Montreal. But enough about us!

title: National Marketing Specialist - Employer Brand
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 

The opportunity
 
Are you looking to grow and be part of something new and exciting? We’re looking for a brand builder who can amplify and tell our EY story through new and innovative strategies and tactics to join the Employer Brand group within our Brand, Marketing & Communications team at EY. Our team has an important responsibility to boost visibility and perceptions internally and externally by finding stories and showcasing the best of the firm, from our values, people and culture to key initiatives around diversity and inclusiveness, recruitment programs and people engagement priorities, while rallying our employees to participate as brand ambassadors.
 
This role is equal parts vision-building and execution, storytelling and engagement to connect with the hearts and minds of audiences. We're looking for a brand expert, enthusiast and trendsetter with a passion for people and culture, and deep end-to-end experience with omnichannel marketing campaigns from concept to delivery to showcase the best of EY and be a vocal champion of our employer brand programs. If you’re strategic, intrinsically driven by curiosity with big ideas and the know-how to put them into action with excellence, coupled with an exceptional talent for developing engaging copy, stories and creative that connects at a business to human level, please read on. 
 
Your key responsibilities:
  • Planning, managing and executing omnichannel employer brand campaigns to support talent and recruitment, culture, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion and other major initiatives
  • Building content strategies and copy from scratch and implementing them to maximize visibility and impact, while identifying clear objectives and measurable KPIs that support the overarching Employer Brand strategy
  • Managing agencies, developing and delivering creative briefs, and guiding the creative review and approval process to meet requirements with on-time, on-budget delivery and ongoing measurement 
  • Proactively liaising with Global and Americas teams to understand and identify Canadian-relevant employer brand programs and content that can be leveraged for the local market 
  • Collaborating with our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion and Talent stakeholders as part of campaign concept ideation, activation and approvals
  • Conducting regular content audits, proactively identifying gaps and priorities in content execution
  • Teaming with channel teams such as PR, Communications, Digital and Social Media teams to activate messages and campaigns, including implementing paid, organic and employee advocacy strategies to deliver best-in-class, relevant content to highly targeted audiences

Skills and attributes for success
  • A strategic and growth mindset focused on initiating new ideas to elevate the EY employer brand 
  • Ability to create, package and distribute thought leadership content in various formats across channels, using best practices, new strategies and actionable insights 
  • Strong teaming and collaboration with internal teams and firm leaders to activate content and campaigns, including follow-ups and results showcases
  • Superior writing and editing skills to support EY employer brand content and campaigns, including adhering to style guidelines and enabling a consistent brand voice, while bringing forward new and innovative ideas
  • Data-driven with a clear focus on impact, quality and engagement
  • Self-starter with strong problem-solving skills and a desire to navigate new uncharted territory
 
To qualify for the role, you must have
  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, digital marketing, communications or social media
  • 5-7 years of professional brand marketing and employer brand experience; agency or client side experience welcome – B2B experience preferred
  • Exceptional communications skills, including copy writing and editing
  • A passion for building from the ground-up, problem-solving, ideation and innovation
  • Organized and articulate, with impeccable attention to detail
  • Credible experience creating high-quality omnichannel campaigns and content, involving end-to-end development, including development and delivery of the creative briefs and managing the creative approval process
  • Strong experience implementing brand campaigns on digital and social channels, including good working knowledge of best practices, the latest tools and SEO principles 
  • A data-driven mindset and a strong focus on measurement, reporting and insights to identify whitespace and inform areas to improve and evolve the strategy and initiatives
  • Strong relationship-builder with a cross-functional teaming mindset and proactive stakeholder management across the team, firm and vendor base
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, complex, yet dynamic work environment and able to multitask and manage a variety of different projects with critical deadlines
  • Equal parts strategic and tactical with a challenger mindset and a passion for overcoming the status quo
 
What we offer

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:
  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
  • Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
 
Diversity and Inclusion at EY
 
Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.
 
EY Way of Work and your health and safety

EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely.  To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations.  A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.  

What we offer

 

If you join EY full-time after your internship, we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options.  Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances.  You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

 

  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

 

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

 

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

 

EY | Building a better working world

 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

 

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.

 

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during the interview process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at

ssc.customersupport@ey.com

.

title: Sales & Marketing Coordinator
description:
Are you the next Sales & Marketing Coordinator at Kinetic Commerce?

Do you love bringing to market real world innovative solutions that change the way people work and shop?  Have an insatiable appetite to learn sales and marketing processes that drive growth? Love to work with a world-class team engaged with some of the worldâ€™s largest and leading edge retailers? Then, you may be the right fit. Kinetic Commerce is a rapidly growing retail technology focused on enabling next-generation retail experiences.

We attract creative, independent thinkers who share a desire for excellence within an open culture. If you have a passion for marketing and sales enablement, we invite you to join our team!

Description:

Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer, and working closely with Business Development and  Kineticâ€™s Customer Success Teams, the Sales & Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for managing marketing and sales lead generation campaigns for the company.

Responsibilities:

  • Management and help create sales and marketing collateral.
  • Oversee the company lead generation campaigns including Linkedin Outreach, Webinars and Online content.
  • Manage Kineticâ€™s social media accounts for the company.
  • Assist in the management of the company's CRM (Hubspot) and other sales and marketing tools. 
  • Organize and help manage appointments for Account Executives with prospects and partners.
  • Communicate with new business leads to evaluate fit with Kinetic products and services.
  • Respond to or route inbound communications.
  • Coordinate and work with in-house teams as well as vendors, agencies and freelancers that support Kineticâ€™s sales and marketing activities.
  • Help edit and customize presentations and marketing materials.
  • Support in creating proposals, quotes, and statements of work.
  • Manage a list of events and trade shows for the Retail Industry.
  • Help prepare speaker proposals for industry events.
  • Develop and maintain media contacts.
  • Work with team members to identify and execute guest blog and podcast opportunities.
  • Provide feedback and insights from campaign results to help improve go-to-market strategies for Kinetic Commerce.

Experience:

  • 2 years of experience in a B2B sales and marketing role, particularly supporting digital or SaaS products.
  • Experience working with a company that provides solutions to the Retail Industry.

Skills & Knowledge:

  • Knowledge of the B2B sales and marketing process and campaign management.
  • Strong writing and verbal communication skills.
  • Command of business systems for marketing sales enablement, including Google Suite, Keynote, CRM (Hubspot), LinkedIn Sales Navigator, or similar tools.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage content marketing, and lead generation campaigns from ideation to execution.
  • Knowledge of B2B sales and marketing assets including, case studies, sales decks, marketing presentations, web pages, emails, blogs, video scripts, etc.
  • Organization and time-management skills.
  • Familiarity with marketing automation tools is an asset.

title: Content Marketing Coordinator
description:
Swish Maintenance Limited is currently looking for a Content Marketing Coordinator to join our Marketing team! The Content Marketing Coordinator will provide support across multiple projects and functions throughout the business with an opportunity to grow and contribute along the way. This role can be located remotely, however reasonable proximity to a Swish branch and the ability to attend meetings at a Swish office location is required. 
 
AREAS OF FOCUS 
  • Drafting content for various marketing initiatives, must have the experience/ability in professional writing in a marketing/advertising capacity. 
  • Working under deadline pressure and manage projects across multiple lines of business
  • Collaborate with internal teams, external agencies and vendor partners
  • Identify market/industry trends & insights and optimize budget spend
  • Understand customer buying journey: sales process, buying cycle, website navigation
  • Willingness to learn about the business/industry and unique needs of business units
  • Research, develop and implement plans for increasing brand awareness and sales leads
  • Creative thinking in terms of content & asset development
  • Assessing past and existing campaigns/initiatives to make recommendations for future efforts
  • Responsible for producing content/copy that is in line with the voice & tone of the Swish brand and ensuring cohesive messaging across all platforms
  • Working with our Swish Clean-It® Centre retail outlets across Canada (retail marketing experience an asset)
  • Understanding and advocating for the "voice of customer" in GTM and communication strategy development
  • Other duties as assigned
WHAT WE OFFER
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • RRSP matching program
  • Performance bonuses
  • Equal opportunity, inclusive workplace
  • Positive, team-based environment
  • Starting salary $50,000 CAD
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Post secondary education - Bachelor's Degree or College Diploma in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration or related field
  • 2-4 years of relevant experience
  • Knowledge of brand management, project management and core marketing tactics
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills are a must
  • Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Design, etc.) an asset
  • Compelling portfolio of work over a wide range of creative projects
WORKING ARRANGEMENT 
  • Hybrid/Majority work-from-home opportunity (must have reasonable proximity to a Swish branch) 
  • Occasional travel within Ontario

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Are you a motivated Marketing Manager in Residential High-Rise and Mid-Rise development? We are working with atruly outstanding residential Mid-Rise and High-Rise developerin the GTA that is looking for someone who is an expert at launching projects,reporting, and liaising with third-partysales and marketing agencies on the projects! Our client is looking for someone who loves Real Estate and Development and motivated by innovative ideas, awards, and recognition. If you are an inspirationalSales and/or Marketing Manager with experience working with a developerthat headsupSales Management,Marketing Project Launches for High-Rise and Mid-Rise developmentswith 5+ years of experience then APPLY NOW!

Responsibilities
In this role, you will be given the opportunity to be the liaison between the Developer, third-party Sales team, and Public Relations/Marketing firms. You will represent the face of the company, whilst portraying brand loyalty and innovation within the building industry. Our client is looking for a candidate with apassion for people, creative design ideas, current materials/finishes, technology, and high regard for green building/sustainable building practices. Ideally, they are looking for apositive, self-starter personalitywith a creative entrepreneurial twist.

What you will get out of it
Our client is an active residential developer with under 10 active projects underway within the GTA. Theyare looking to hire a motivated and self-sufficient Real Estate Sales and Marketing Manager with good tenure and loyalty to the firm and their business goals.They are looking to pay between $80-100K per year, plus a generous bonus, benefits, and vacation. They are a very friendly and nice group of people to work for and are centrally located.If this sounds right up your ally act fast as this type of role is rarely available. Apply today!

If you think this would be the perfect role for someone you may know, feel free to refer this to them ASAP.

We thank all applicants in advance, and only those who are qualified will be contacted.

title: Content Marketing Specialist (Remote Friendly)
description:
*This position is open for consideration of candidates in both Saskatoon, SK as well as remotely across Canada (dependent on experience).


At Vendasta, we believe in helping great local businesses survive and thrive in a world that’s more competitive than ever—and we’re growing our team! This is an opportunity to join one of the fastest growing tech companies in Canada and make a direct impact on local economies worldwide. In a world where local businesses all over the globe have had their livelihoods turned upside down, Vendasta continues to help them embrace digital solutions and flourish. 


Vendasta is a certified Great Place to Work and Best Workplace™ for Today’s Youth and Women. Keep reading if you’d like to join us on our mission to support small businesses all over the world.


About the Job

We are looking for an eager wordsmith and storyteller to join our content team. The ideal candidate is an outstanding writer, who is a quick learner with a deep interest in digital marketing, a keen eye for detail, and an ability to keep up with the changing landscape in content marketing. 


This is a great opportunity to join a dynamic marketing team, get involved behind-the-scenes in the tech and marketing industry, and explore and improve your creative abilities. There’s plenty of room for growth, and self-starters are sure to thrive.


The impact you’ll have

  • Write high-quality content for the website, blogs, long-form, social, email, and other collateral as required
  • Develop pieces as determined by the Director of Content Marketing, as well as contribute new ideas
  • Create long-form content like reports, case studies, and white papers
  • Read and absorb industry-leading content outside of Vendasta’s production
  • Produce lead-generation content that reflects Vendasta’s goals and helps our partners and prospects solve their business challenges
  • Construct email campaigns based on specific objectives and audiences
  • Create and publish paid and organic social media content on a range of topics
  • Keep a consistent social media posting calendar to engage audience on social platforms
  • Depending on skills & interests, help out with podcast production, video and audio production, ad campaign creation, web design, and other marketing projects


The value you’ll bring 

  • 2+ years of relevant experience
  • Strong writing and communication skills are essential
  • Experience in information technology and software-as-a-services is preferred
  • Exceptional organizational skills and keen attention to detail
  • Interest in digital marketing, content marketing, blogging and other content creation
  • Proficient knowledge of social media and best practices
  • Ability to work independently as well as collaborate within a team
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SEO best practices
  • The following are a strong plus: experience with graphic design software (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign or others), video and/or audio production and editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, After Effects, Audition or other), and Wordpress knowledge.


About Vendasta

So what do we actually do? We create an entire platform full of digital products & solutions that help small to medium sized businesses (SMBs) have a stronger presence online through digital advertising, online listings, reputation management, website creation, social media marketing … and much more! Our platform is used exclusively by channel partners, who sell products and services to SMBs, allowing them to leverage us to scale and grow their business. We’re trusted by 60,000+ channel partners, serving over 5.5 million small to medium businesses worldwide! 


Perks

  • Benefits  - health, dental, life, and disability insurance, an employee assistance program (EAP)*, and $500 annual Health Spending Account. Premiums for health & dental insurance will be covered by Vendasta!
  • Vacation - Minimum 3 weeks paid vacation per year; uncapped sick time policy.
  • Employee Options Program  - get in on Vendasta’s growth and success!
  • Sweet Eats - On site cafeteria with beverages & snacks all day and free catered lunch every Friday
  • Training & Career Development - Education reimbursement program, professional development plans, leadership workshops, mentorship program, and so much more! 
  • Culture - comprised of our core values: Drive, Innovation, Respect, and Agility
  • Social Events -  Ideas on Tap, ski trips, virtual talent shows, yoga classes, and more!
  • Giving Back -  endless opportunities to take part in programs and initiatives that give back to the community we work in, including paid volunteer time.
Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Sr Pricing Analyst
location: Area F (Mcconnell Creek/Hatzic Prairie), British Columbia
description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Affirm, Inc. proudly includes Affirm, PayBright, and Returnly. 

We are looking for intelligent, driven professionals to join the fast growing Merchant Pricing team! Merchant Pricing is responsible for enabling efficient value exchange between merchants and consumers through innovative and strategic pricing solutions.

In this role, you will help Affirm drive revenue growth and portfolio optimization and apply strategic pricing solutions to deepen merchant relationships. You will collaborate with Commercial, Marketing, Credit, Finance, Capital Markets, Product, Engineering, and Data Science teams. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem solving skills with solid knowledge of analytical tools, as well as interpersonal skills to work cross-functionally and drive forward recommendations.

What you'll do

  • Use data insights and work with various cross-functional teams to implement innovative pricing strategies for our top strategic partners and scaled programs
  • Structure new pricing strategies and solutions to go-to-market in a digestible and scalable framework to strengthen our positioning, deepen merchant relationships, and increase our competitive advantage
  • Develop analytical capabilities to enable pricing optimization at various levels of aggregation addressing needs for Affirm, our merchants, and strategic partners
  • Conduct analyses on sophisticated and open-ended questions at the intersection of profitability and risk; present findings in a clear and concise manner to influence partners across Commercial, Credit, Finance, Capital Markets, Product, etc.
  • Own end-to-end analytics workflow, including defining success, implementing data requirements, conducting analysis, generating insights and hypotheses, monitoring performance metrics, socializing them across the organization

What we look for

  • 3+ years of experience in an analytics role (consulting, finance, analytics, pricing, etc.). Experience in Financial Services and pricing analytics / deal desk is a plus
  • Masters Degree in Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, or Financial Engineering is a plus
  • Strong working knowledge of analytical tools, such as SQL and Python
  • Eager to seek out new opportunities, navigate ambiguity and develop creative solutions using data
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to develop strong relationships and work with cross-functional partners
  • Strong work ethic - able to take ownership beyond own responsibility and manage timelines/outputs effectively

Location - Remote Canada

#LI-Remote

Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles are remote and can be located anywhere in the U.S. and Canada (with the exception of the U.S. Territories, Quebec, Yukon, Nunavut, and the Northwest Territories) unless the job indicates a different global location. We are currently building operations in Spain, Poland, and Australia.  Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely or from an Affirm office in their country of hire, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our offices in Chicago, New York, Pittsburgh, Salt Lake City, San Francisco and Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.

All full-time jobs at Affirm (excluding interns and apprentices) are tied to a transparent grade-based pay range taking location into account. 

[Colorado Candidates] In accordance with Colorados Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the grade for this position in Colorado is listed above. You can find the Colorado base pay range and benefits here.

If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people who believe in Affirm's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of waysnot just candidates who check all the boxes.
 
Inclusivity:

At Affirm, People Come First is one of our core values, and thats why diversity and inclusion are vital to our priorities as an equal opportunity employer. You can read about our D&I program here and our progress thus far in our 2021 DEI Report.

We also believe Its On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.

By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy, or the Affirm Employment Privacy Notice (EU) for applicants applying from the European Union, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Senior Campaign Marketing Specialist
description:
SOTI is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world.

Job Title:

Senior Campaign Marketing Specialist

Location:

Mississauga (Hybrid)

Who We Are

At SOTI, we are committed to delivering best in class mobile and IoT device management solutions. We are looking for out of the box thinkers that appreciate the art of creating great software.

To us, being visionary is more important than doing things the way they’ve always been done. 

What We’re Looking For

SOTI is looking for its next Senior Campaign Marketing Specialist to join our rapidly growing team. The ideal candidate is responsible for managing the overall coordination of campaign material workflows to ensure the successful delivery of the individual and collective elements submitted by internal clients. Their impact includes executing on their own projects prioritizing and organizing the workflow of multi-channel components through multiple teams within the marketing team, led by their team manager. Their contribution plays a direct role in helping provide solid execution and completion of marketing projects and initiatives. The candidate will be working globally to ensure successful completion of all campaigns as assigned by their leader.

What’s in it for you?

The People - From our humble origins in our founder’s basement, to our industry leading position today, SOTI has worked hard to foster a company culture that we can all believe in. A culture that emphasizes personal growth, continuous innovation, and fun.

The Growth -Our environment fosters new ideas, fresh perspectives, and the ability to take them over the goal line. SOTI is a fast-paced environment with a global reach that encourages you to make your mark and be part of something big!

The Technology - You’ll get the chance to work with leading edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects, as part of highly collaborative and agile teams. You will work alongside SOTI’s partners which include leading tech giants that will keep you on the cusp of emerging technologies.

What You’ll Do

  • Responsible to coordinate projects across the global marketing team (global communications, product marketing, digital marketing and creative)
  • Meets with client(s) and project team members to ensure execution of global marketing campaigns with proper project plans in place
  • Independently review briefs and request forms and transform them into project plans and work back schedules for execution and delivery
  • Manage and drive new and complex projects in support of clients/business unit(s)
  • Develop project work back plans to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery of materials, provide time estimates for proposed projects independently or through collaboration with department team members, understand the process and the critical steps necessary to deliver a high-quality end product to clients
  • In a high-demand position with frequently changing priorities, you will help triage and mitigate client concerns and escalations
  • Use project planning tools (e.g., Asana) for proper projects, tasks and work back schedules
  • Highlight blockers/issues and mitigate risks for successful project completion
  • Ability to influence without authority, think proactively and function independently
  • Invests in own personal development to continuously improve themselves

Experience You’ll Bring:

  • Diploma/Degree in project management, marketing, or related fields
  • 5 years of related job experience
  • Ability to work well with a team and as an individual contributor with some guidance
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Exceptional communication and project management skills with ability to execute multiple congruent projects themselves and through others
  • Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail essential
  • High level of organization, research, analysis, problem solving, customer service and planning skills
  • Ability to work effectively in a changing and often high-pressure environment
  • Judgment on how to respond quickly, yet thoughtfully, to urgent matters
  • Technology industry knowledge is an asset

About SOTI

SOTI is a proven leader at creating innovative solutions that reduce the cost and complexity of business-critical mobility and the IoT. Thousands of companies around the world depend on us to secure, manage, and support their mobile operations. SOTI’s two decades of success has built strong partnerships with leading mobile platform providers and device manufacturers. These relationships give us unparalleled insight into new technology and industry trends before they happen. SOTI is a proven innovator — clear vision, laser focus and a commitment to R&D has made us the market leader at delivering exciting, new business mobility solutions. SOTI helps businesses take mobility to endless possibilities.

At SOTI, we celebrate the uniqueness of our global teams and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are curious problem solvers who are committed to bringing the best mobile and IoT management solutions to market. We offer careers with #EndlessPossibilities.

We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the requirements under the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify People & Culture at careers@soti.net.

#LI-RA1

If you want to bring your ideas to life, apply at SOTI today.

We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the requirements under the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify People & Culture at

careers@soti.net

.

Please note that SOTI does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Services Agreement with agency/recruiter, SOTI will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee.

title: Brand Marketing Assistant
description:
We are hiring for an entry-level full-time Brand Marketing Assistant position. We feel sales and marketing is a critical part of how to exist in the world.

 

This position is full time and involves responsibilities in:

  • Entry-level sales & marketing
  • Entry-level management training
  • Sales and marketing presentations
  • Face to face sales and marketing of new services for our clients
  • Sales and marketing techniques
  • Training sales and marketing representative

 

Our firm cross-trains all employees within leadership development which includes:

  • Interviewing
  • Sales and marketing training fundamentals
  • Team building and mentoring
  • Entry-level marketing and sales consulting

 

Benefits & Our Culture:

The management, sales & marketing team offers an environment where our employeeâ€™s ideas are not only heard but implemented. We offer a team-based and structured environment, however, employees are expected to be self-disciplined in managing their own time and work schedule. Other parts of our benefits and culture include:

  • Fun, team building environment
  • Travel Opportunities
  • Leadership workshops & development
  • Financial management, business management, time management
  • Philanthropy events â€“ a chance to give back to the community
  • Recognition for top performers

 

Qualified candidates:

  • Must possess excellent interpersonal communication skills
  • Maintain a high level of professionalism & integrity
  • Experience with public speaking for presenting to groups a plus
  • 4-year degree preferred, not required
  • 1-2 years of customer service
  • Demonstrated leadership ability. Sales and Marketing experience is not required
  • Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills

 

Employees who achieve promotions into management are:

  • Highly coachable team players
  • Willing to follow a proven training and support system designed to help employees achieve their goals
  • Team player
  • Amazing attitudes
  • Looking for an amazing future

 

Ideal candidates have an uncommon combination of attributes. They are self-motivated, entrepreneurial individuals who are ready to leave behind the constraints of the traditional corporate job model and build a secure future of their own.

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
We are a successful, dynamic organization in the marketing industry undergoing accelerated growth. We are seeking an ambitious and confident individual to join our team. Our Marketing Assistants continually develop new marketing strategies for our high profile clients within the telecommunications, clean energy, and home delivery industries. We support programs that drive team performance toward departmental and organizational growth. 

Our Marketing Assistants LOVE the thrill of a challenge and are excited to dive into new avenues. Just as we invest in our firm, we invest in our employeesâ€™ careers. We provide our Marketing Assistants with a collaborative and encouraging atmosphere within which to gain the knowledge, skills, and experience that drive a rewarding career. 

 

Our Marketing Assistants are Responsible for:

  • Promote products and services to an existing client audience and potential consumers to raise the clientâ€™s profile and increase their brand awareness  
  • Assisting the marketing team towards the achievement of strategic and operational goals
  • Executing innovative marketing and promotional campaigns directly to new and existing clients
  • Leading new product sales creation and delivery, communicating and coordinating with the marketing department to exceed client needs and ensure it has a best-in-class presence to consumers
  • Analyzing and reporting competitor activities and consumer trends to become an expert in the category and maintain a cutting edge
  • Developing consumer & brand connections to enhance customer loyalty and positive brand awareness
  • Collaborating and strategize with Marketing and Sales team members on any new campaigns in order to educate consumers on our clients

 

Our Marketing Assistants are Expected to Have: 

  • A degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, Business, or related fields 
  • A minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience is required (e.g. Marketing, client relations, sales, advertising, management)
  • Exceptional communication and persuading skills
  • Sound understanding of core marketing levers and customer insight development 
  • Superior prospecting, presentation, and networking abilities
  • The ability to work independently as well as in a collaborative team atmosphere
  • The ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, environment where you may have to wear multiple hats

title: Communications Consultant
description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

The role in a nutshell

The Communications Consultant is accountable for developing and delivering communications strategies and plans across many channels. Working with different business units, the successful candidate must be able to grow fruitful communications plans and strategies from a seed. Want to know more?

The role in detail:

  • Develop and deliver communication strategies that consider scope, content, tone, measurable objectives, target audiences and key messages required to achieve business and project goals.
  • Provide a plan and direction for internal partners including consideration for design, compliance, translation, and various cascading communication vehicles, while fostering positive relationships with all partners.
  • Write and edit clear, concise and consistent messages on topics ranging from regulatory initiatives, product enhancements, internal and event campaigns, and/or crisis directives, all aimed at helping advisors, clients and employees understand what’s changing in their day-to-day.
  • Collaborate with several lines of business with differing communication styles, including administrative communications for insurance and operations, and more creative communications supporting events and internal employee communications.
  • Adjust and amplify your content across multiple channels.
  • Ensure communications meet audience needs and are developed on time, brand, and approved for the relevant audience.
  • Manage competing priorities of multiple projects with varying complexities while meeting firm deadlines.
  • Collaborate to achieve consistency, alignment and continuous improvement in processes, work quality and effectiveness.
  • Manage risk through documented review and approval processes and due diligence.

You have these skills/qualifications:

  • A degree or diploma related to communications, marketing or journalism, and five years of relevant work experience.
  • Experience in financial services, life insurance, B2B, or an understanding of financial advisors and how they work.
  • Strong writing and editing skills with the ability to distill complex or detailed information into concise messages that resonate with the audience and inspire action.
  • Demonstrated digital marketing skills and experience with content management for online applications (websites, mobile apps).
  • Experience with email marketing programs, social media and event industry tools (i.e. Cvent, EventMobi) is an asset.
  • Comfortable with multiple distribution channels and accountability to multiple partners.
  • Organizational skills, attention to detail, ability to handle multiple tasks within a dynamic environment.
  • Strong information gathering and analytical skills with good follow-through.
  • Digital expertise including familiarity with mass email tools and the design and creative development process for email, online and print communications.
  • Ability to flex, reevaluate and pivot when project directions change.
  • Experience working with Office 365 and SharePoint is an asset.
  • Bilingualism (English/French) an asset.

Why come to Manulife?

You’ll be part of a creative organization dedicated to improving the health and wealth of Canadians, and you’ll enjoy:

  • An opportunity to take your career in communications to new levels
  • Professional growth, training and development (we have awesome resources)
  • An award-winning communications team that has your back

Interested?

Here’s what you need to do: As part of your resume PDF, please include a short cover letter and two of your own writing samples that represent your best work.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact

recruitment@manulife.com

.

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
Company:

Finning International Inc.

Number of Openings:

1

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

Pricing data, strategy and revenue analytics are increasingly impacting traditional businesses, and the heavy equipment business is no exception. Through system and quoting controls, improved administration, revenue analytics and strategic optimization, Finning is working to identify market willingness to pay and dynamic optimization opportunities.

This position is responsible for conducting pricing analytics, developing and implementing pricing strategies, and administering pricing changes based on analysis that will profitably grow the Finning business while enhancing customer loyalty.

Job Description:

Large opportunity and RFP support (30%)

  • Be agile in providing pricing scenarios for large opportunities or RFPs (requests for pricing) that come from our large mining customers.
  • Provide detailed analysis on impacts for various scenarios.

Provide fixed pricing scenarios to our large mining customers (40%)

  • Understand the scope of each pricing agreement as specified by the customers contract.
  • Calculate the pricing appropriate to each customer to be loaded into Finning's and the customer's ERP systems.
  • Own the pricing process for each customer end-to-end when working with other business units.

Give Sales Managers and Product Managers visibility to detailed revenue and pricing information via consistent reporting (30%)

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors’ degree in Business, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics.
  • Masters level (MBA) considered an asset.
  • 5 +years of experience in an analytical role with progressing levels of responsibility, with 2+ years in a Pricing, Economics, or Marketing analyst role
  • Completion of pricing specific training / professional development
  • Well versed in SQL and data analysis tools and techniques.
  • Proficient with MS Office applications and internal systems.

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.
