title: Marketer (Door to Door)
description:
SWP Burnaby is hiring door-to-door marketers for the Summer season (May to August) to work in the Burnaby area.

Ideal candidates are outgoing, positive, and independent. On the job training and marketing materials are provided and no experience is necessary. In this position, you will learn valuable customer service and marketing skills.

Position:

  • Marketing door-to-door independently or with a friend in the Burnaby area
  • Perfect for those who want to earn money with flexible part-time hours. Recommended that applicants apply with friends as it will create a more fun work environment!

Wage:

  • $19/hour

Hours:

  • Weekdays: 4:30pm-8pm
  • Weekends: 11am-6pm (Minimum 4 hours per week, not required to work all of the weekday and weekend hours)

Requirements to apply:

  • Strong conversation skills
  • Great attitude
  • Willing to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest

 

SWP West is a local painting company that has been operating in the lower mainland for the past 30 years. We offer Interior and Exterior, Residential, and Commercial painting services.

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Marketing & Promotions Associate
description:
We are the leader in marketing and promotional consulting services. Our expert team of Marketing and Promotions Associates are helping transform our clientsâ€™ business into leaders of their market. We are seeking an entrepreneurial mindset with strong relationship-building and customer-facing skills to join our team as a Marketing and Promotions Associate. 

 

Marketing and Promotions Associate Responsibilities:

This role is critical to the Marketing and Promotions team and serves as a key point of communication between their respective working marketing teams. They are involved in each project from start to finish, helping wherever possible to meet the needs of the team and the clients. It will be your responsibility to communicate our proven track record, leadership and innovation through a clear marketing and promotions strategy in this extraordinarily fast-growing, exciting industry segment. You will report directly to the CEO, as a key contributor to our continued success in our marketing and promotions consulting services. 

 

The daily responsibilities of our Marketing and Promotions Associates include: 

  • Determine appropriate marketing and promotions strategies for local territory
  • Build and monitor promotions in various territories using marketing systems and tools that are taught by top marketing and promotions team members
  • Be data-driven. Monitor marketing and consumer metrics; make recommendations for enhancing effectiveness, and report on all activity and results
  • Must have strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize in a changing environment 
  • Assist in relationship development with the consumers by thoroughly running through each marketing promotion our clients are offering and helping them select a package that suits their needs

 

Marketing and Promotions Associate Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree and/or experience in marketing, communications, or business development
  • Passion for analyzing products, customers and market dynamics; interest in industry trends and latest marketing techniques 
  • Understanding of marketing perspectives and strategies
  • The ability to think creatively and â€œoutside of the boxâ€ as it pertains to developing marketing ideas and campaigns for our business partners 
  • Must be timely and have a flexible work schedule in order to deal effectively with responsibilities throughout the year: weekends, nights and holidays as dictated by clients and their needs

title: Senior Marketing Automation Specialist (Marketo) - Remote
description:
Please note: We are open to hiring anywhere in Canada, as long as you can work in EST.


It's our time to scale. It's your time to be part of something big.


Tulip's mission is bold. We're a team of experts who have worked with and for retailers over the past 20 years. We are driven to disrupt an entire industry and enable one of the world's largest job markets.


Tulip has built a retail mobile software platform that empowers leading retailers such as Mulberry, Chanel, Saks Fifth Avenue, Kate Spade, Coach, and Michael Kors to give mobile devices to their store associates so they can elevate service, sell more and provide a personalized experience.


Tulip is a place you come to make an impact, working with like-minded people to build something meaningful using the best technology. We are growing, and while lean is great, we need more people, energy, innovation and talent.


Right now, we are adding a Marketing Automation Specialist to the team. As part of the Marketing team, you will help Tulip execute and optimize its marketing automations and operations programs. The Specialist will perform day-to-day system maintenance and configuration of Marketo aiming to drive improvements and employ best practices across the department. Working very closely with both the Sales and Marketing teams, they will contribute to process improvement projects to help drive team efficiencies.


What you will do:

  • Oversee and execute Marketo campaigns, nurture programs and emails
  • Implement and optimize nurture and drip campaigns 
  • Collaborate with Sales and Marketing team members to optimize lead scoring and ensure accuracy across all channels, programs, and initiatives
  • Ensure leads are properly tracked and attributed across complex sales cycles 
  • Create and manage forms and form architecture 
  • Use templates to create and update landing pages and thank you pages in WordPress (Marketo form embeds)
  • Support and enable multi-channel campaigns and conversions 
  • Manage dashboards and provide weekly metrics updates on full funnel lead progression 
  • Automate and improve data integrity and data management initiatives
  • Manage contact database, including segmentation and list management
  • Work closely with Revenue Operations to ensure Salesforce and Marketo work smoothly together 
  • Ability to set up, analyze and adjust email plans using A/B testing
  • Continually learn, research, recommend, and implement email and marketing automation best practices


What you bring:

  • University degree, preferably in marketing, business, or economics, or equivalent working experience
  • 2-3 years of experience with marketing automation systems
  • Solid understanding of the Marketo platform
  • Comfortable with Salesforce and Google Ads 
  • Experience with advanced automation and segmentation logic  
  • Experience with dashboarding and reporting 
  • Strong understanding of email nurture tactics and strategies 
  • Strong executor who likes to be hands on 
  • Ability to prioritize own workload and meet deadlines


Tech Stack: Marketo, Salesforce, WordPress, Google: Analytics, Optimize, Tag Manager, Clearbit, Unbounce, Zoom


Tulip has perks, career progress, and an intimate culture. We have:

  • Embraced remote culture! Work remotely, permanently, and full-time.
  • Ability for employees in many roles to choose to work a 4½ or 4-day week.
  • A “workcation” benefit that’ll let you work reduced hours in order to extend your vacations
  • An excellent healthcare plan with no wait time, paid parental leave, and corporate gym rates.
  • A culture of openness and idea generation. We have weekly all-hands and quarterly town halls. We pride ourselves on our transparency and keeping it real. From the most senior to the newest team member, we give you access to decision makers and career building work. 
  • The opportunity to grow and apply new skills be it hands-on or leadership. We prioritize diversity, inclusion, and building a community. We're a little weird but in a good way. 


Why we are awesome.

Tulip is hungry and humble. When you join Tulip, you'll be part of a strong, thriving, diverse group of people who come from different disciplines, countries, and experiences. We do what we love and it shows in our unrelenting pursuit of affecting real change. We believe in investing in our people, building positive relationships with our customers, and treating our work like our craft. 


Tulip is at the cutting edge of technology. We work with big-name retailers. It's a chance to step up to solving complex technical problems and develop a deeper understanding of the retail world while being part of a niche startup style company. We don't fear failure; we embrace challenges. We're excited about taking the lesser known paths, using the open source tools and keeping up with the pace of evolving tech solutions. It's fun, it's fast, and it's future-focused.


Tulip gives back. Inspired, passionate, and committed people helped make us the successful company we are today. We challenge norms and put people before profits. Our CEO, Ali Asaria, created The Tulip Foundation, a charity controlled by all of us, the employees. We believe we can build a great company that changes the technical space while simultaneously giving back to society and the community.


Join us.


Feel like you can't tick all the boxes? If you have some of the skills and experience that we're looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply.


Tulip Retail is strongly committed to equal opportunities in employment. We welcome applications from all minority group members, women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of Tulip Retail.


Tulip Retail welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Brand Retail Production Specialist
description:
Your Opportunity at ARC’TERYX:

As the Brand Retail Production Specialist, you are responsible for bringing brand experiences to life in a growing fleet of Arc’teryx brand stores. You will work closely with your team and partners in Brand and Retail on everything from global campaign production to new store openings. You are as comfortable taking initiative and working autonomously as you are asking for guidance. You manage multiple vendor relationships, projects, and budgets comfortably and have a strong understanding of production needs, timelines, and impacts. You are a valued contributor to a cross-functional team focused on creating elevated and innovative retail experiences. 

Meet Your Future Team:

You will work as part of the Brand Operations team – a collaborative group of Project Managers, Producers and Operators responsible for defining and evolving process and leading creative teams to the successful delivery of campaigns and projects.

Is this job open to relocation? No
Will there be Visa support? No
Can this job be hired remote? Yes

If you were the Brand Retail Production Specialist, now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:

  • Working with external partners to coordinate and deliver printed and fabricated materials to stores
  • Supporting Brand and Retail partners to plan timing, installation and removal of campaign, experience, and construction deliverables
  • Processing and tracking invoices for Brand related production projects
  • Maintaining and updating the Production Coordination dashboard to keep stakeholders informed of project status
  • Working with the Visual Merchandising and Retail Communications partners to provide consistent and current information and direction to stores
  • Supporting Stores with Branded material requests as needed
  • Working with Retail partners to ensure seasonal and campaign creative or templates and assets are available for in-market production when relevant 

Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:

  • Partnering with your Retail Excellence and Store Design partners on new store opening (NSO) production needs for both exterior and interior  
  • Working with your Brand Creative partners on creative file development and delivery for NSOs and campaign creative
  • Building and managing vendor relationships in Canada and US primarily
  • Supporting our EMEA partners with European store openings and campaign roll-outs  
  • You will help to evolve our processes and build strong communication between teams

Are you our next Brand Retail Production Specialist?

  • You have 3+ years’ experience with a retail organization
  • You have 2+ years’ experience working with production and fabrication vendors, from print to large-scale 
  • You are a strong communicator, both verbally and in writing 
  • You are comfortable managing multiple projects at one time. 
  • You have experience working with web-based project management tools (e.g. Monday.com, Smartsheet)
  • You have demonstrated success in a fast-paced, matrixed work environment
  • You are able to thrive in a dynamic, constantly evolving, and highly competitive industry 
  • You are a performance focused individual with experience working from concept to completion, dealing with ambiguity and working toward clarity, while maintaining high quality in outcomes and a strong sense of accountability 
  • You have strong Project Management expertise; strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to plan and prioritize 
  • You are able to create strong relationships, collaborate, and influence across all levels, functions, geographies - internal and external 
  • You have experience driving timelines and managing budgets 
  • You have a strong understanding of a multi-brand, cross-functional, vertically integrated organization 
  • You are a results driven, proactive self-starter, and are organized and focused 
  • You are able to travel 20% of the time 
  • You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity 
  • You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions 
  • You seek to execute the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment to do what is right 
  • You drive breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement 
  • Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it 
Equal Opportunity

Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 

Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  

All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

Design your Purpose. Live our Values. 
DISRUPTIVE EVOLUTION. Design your future through challenge, experimentation, and inspiration.
COMMIT. Set and deliver on bold objectives as we collectively raise the bar.
LIVE IT. Deepen your connection to nature and live your most purposeful life. 
LEAVE IT BETTER. Create a better world, together.

title: Marketing Specialist, Senior Associate (Remote)
description:
Line of Service

Internal Firm Services

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

IFS - Brand & Communications

Management Level

Senior Associate

Job Description & Summary

A career in Sales and Marketing, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to focus on positioning a distinctive PwC brand in the marketplace and driving long term revenue growth. Our Sales and Marketing Generalist - Practice Support team focuses on designing, developing, and implementing communication programmes and media events to promote and sell PwC’s brand and services as well as contribute to and evaluate our pricing strategies in the marketplace.

Important point to consider

  • Please note this is 15 month contract

  • COVID-19 Vaccination Policy: Putting the safety of our people and clients first as we look to a hybrid future: The health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, clients, and communities is our number one priority. Vaccinations have proven to reduce the risk of COVID-19. Effective Friday, October 1, 2021, PwC Canada requires all partners, staff, contractors and visitors to be fully-vaccinated when entering a PwC location, subject to applicable legal exemptions. At PwC, the future ways of work will be a hybrid of in-person and virtual, allowing choice and flexibility to explore new ways of working and collaborating. Read this press release for further details.

What you'll create and do

As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:

  • Key player in the execution of employer brand marketing plans

  • Understands and participates in project planning, administration and budgeting

  • Understands and supports the connection of marketing efforts (advertising, events, sponsorship, digital/content etc.) and the tracking of ROI across media

  • Reviews and edits marketing materials to ensure content produced is of high quality, with consistent use of PwC guidelines

  • Writes content for a variety of external communications: email, blogs, digital advertising including full ownership of the development of event invitations and select internal communications

  • Collaborates with the Design team to develop marketing collateral such as thought leadership, event invitations and promotional materials

  • Collaborates with the Digital marketing team to maintain and update the PwC Canada website

  • Manages the risk, independence and branding guidelines processes for various marketing initiatives

  • Process and track the payment of invoices to ensure vendor payments meet all deadlines

  • Contributes to the development and execution of social media campaigns using resources such as LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram etc. Provides recommendations as needed

  • Collects all metrics and reports on the performance of marketing campaigns and external events to the necessary stakeholders

  • Ability to conduct ongoing competitive intelligence and external market research

  • Responsible for the deployment of demand generation campaigns using the Firm’s campaign management tool

  • Collaborates with the campus talent acquisition stakeholders on business priorities and challenges and adjusts upcoming campaigns to address and meet those needs.

What you’ll bring to this role

  • An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work

  • A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives

  • Familiar with Google Suite, Salesforce and data analysis software like Power BI and Tableau

  • Progressive marketing experience in campaign planning and execution, client-facing events (in-person and virtual), internal and external communications, digital marketing and content development

  • Solid understanding of managing a budget in support of marketing and event plans

  • Experienced in the procurement and management of external suppliers of support services

  • Proven ability to manage multiple priorities to deadline

  • Self-starter who is detail-oriented and can work well within a local and national team

  • Demonstrated ability to excel in a fast-paced, corporate environment

Why you’ll love working for PwC 

At PwC, we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits. Discover a life that works for you with our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture. To learn how you can grow and shine in your career at PwC, please visit: https://www.pwc.com/ca/whypwc

See how you can create your future at PwC

www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/create-your-future.html

Get to know us

Check out our careers blog to hear what our people have to say and discover a place where you can bring your passions and whole self to work. https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/blog.html 

Applying at PwC

At PwC, we embrace new technology where you will learn to innovate and deliver differently. For Administrative, Specialist, Associate, Senior Associate, and Manager roles you may have the opportunity to participate in an on-demand video interview. To learn more about our innovative cloud-based online application interview process click here:  https://www.pwc.com/ca/applytopwc

We take your privacy seriously. To protect your personal information, please submit your application directly through PwC Canada Careers: https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers.html

PwC is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.

Every day we see how people make businesses great. But it's not only about skills. If your experience is close to what we're looking for, please consider applying. We recognize that experience comes in many forms, and passionate teams reimagine the possible. Create your future at PwC.

PwC s’engage à bâtir une équipe diversifiée et représentative des collectivités qu’il sert. Nous invitons toutes les personnes qualifiées, sans égard à leur appartenance ethnique, leur race, leur religion, leur sexe, leur orientation sexuelle, leur identité sexuelle, leur statut d’autochtone, leur âge, leur handicap ou leurs besoins en matière d’adaptation du milieu de travail, à présenter leur candidature, qu’il nous fera plaisir d’examiner.

Chaque jour, nous voyons des personnes participer à l'essor des entreprises. Ce n'est pas seulement une question de compétences. Si votre expérience se rapproche de ce que nous recherchons, n'hésitez pas à postuler. Nous sommes conscients que l'expérience peut prendre diverses formes et que des équipes de passionnés peuvent réinventer le possible. Créez votre avenir chez PwC.

title: Communications Specialist
description:
At Home and Community Care Support Services Toronto Central by providing an accessible workplace, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. That is why we are intentionally committed to diversity and inclusion by providing an accessible and inclusive work place for all persons. We are strongly committed to include Black, Indigenous, visible minorities, Francophone, 2SLGBTQ+ persons, neurodiversity, women, national origin, ancestry, disability status, age, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, all faiths, or any other aspect, which makes them unique, through recognizing each applicant through anti-racism and anti-oppressive practices to ensure equitable opportunity.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Communications Specialist is responsible for supporting the development and implementation of internal and external communications plans, organizational initiatives and other confidential matters, locally and provincially. Reporting to the Manager, Communications, the Communications Specialist develops key communications products, engages internal leaders and teams to provide communications support and advice, and establishes relationships with key stakeholders to educate, inform and advance Home and Community Care Support Services’ strategic priorities. A valued member of the Toronto Central team, this position also supports the provincial Communications team and provides services across geographies, as assigned.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Support initiatives in Toronto Central and as part of the provincial Communications team – operating as one team to support HCCSS-wide priorities and objectives – including materials for the CEO and Board, as well as projects that impact staff and stakeholders across the province
  • Engage and collaborate with Communications teams across the province to streamline efforts and maximize resources
  • Support the development of Communications & Engagement strategies aligned with the organization’s strategic priorities including public relations, stakeholder engagement, marketing, brand management, social media and issues management
  • Develop and implement communications plans and tactics to support corporate projects and initiatives, which at times may include confidential matters about the organization or operations
  • Provide Communications support/advice, including on confidential matters, to the Communications Manager and/or Director, provincial Communications team and other leaders
  • Advise and work collaboratively with human resources, including on confidential matters which may include information about employees or positions, to effectively engage and communicate with staff to raise awareness of HR initiatives, programs and policies
  • Create written and designed content (in collaboration with graphic designer) for newsletters, brochures, posters, videos, web, intranet, speeches, presentations and other communication materials aimed at diverse audiences
  • Oversee the production of patient-facing pamphlets, brochures and newsletters and coordinate the distribution of print/branded materials to staff, patients, caregivers, etc.
  • Oversee the translation of materials, including use of internal French translators and external translators for additional languages
  • Leverage digital technology solutions and incorporate digital, social and web strategies to support strategic communications plans, while taking a lead role with social media activities
  • Provide media relations support including creation of news releases, organization of media events, development of speaking points, triaging of media requests, development of media responses and building and maintaining strong media relationships
  • Provide support for internal and external stakeholder engagement activities, including community engagement and education opportunities, in-person and virtually
  • Provide issues management and risk management support
  • Provide support for Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act requirements (FIPPA), keeping confidentiality top of mind
  • Support crisis communications at the local level, and at the provincial level as assigned
  • Monitor, analyze and report communication metrics and results to determine effectiveness of communications initiatives
  • Uphold the organization’s reputation through relationship-building with stakeholders, public awareness activities and marketing in alignment with visual identity, brand guidelines, AODA compliance and French language requirements

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:

Education

  • Post-secondary degree/diploma in communications, journalism, marketing or a related academic field

Experience

  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in strategic communications, public affairs, marketing and health care communications
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative software and website content management systems; proficiency with graphic design software an asset
  • Communications experience in a multi-stakeholder environment. This includes knowledge and experience with best practices and planning methods
  • Strong organization skills
  • Ability to work independently and possess a strong sense of responsibility
  • Detail-orientated, able to multi-task effectively, take initiative and function well in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
  • Ability to analyze, digest and understand complex information
  • Understanding of the Ontario health care system, its stakeholders, programs and issues
  • Business professionalism
  • Strong relationship management and facilitation skills, including the ability to work collaboratively with all levels of staff, members of the public, health system partners, government and other diverse stakeholders
  • Developed negotiation and conflict resolution skills with the ability to provide advice on best practice guidelines
  • Strong leadership skills to participate on/or lead internal committees, councils, etc.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality, exercise good judgement and discretion when dealing with confidential information

JOB-SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES:

  • Business Acumen: Ability to apply business principles, including systems thinking, to the healthcare environment; basic business principles include financial management, human resource management, organizational dynamics and governance, strategic planning, risk management and quality improvement.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Develops networks and builds alliances. Engages in cross-functional activities; collaborates across boundaries, and finds common ground with a widening range of stakeholders.
  • Relationship Management: Builds multiple external collaborative relationships to support department performance. Identifies the key issues and accommodates the key players when dealing with external parties/units on joint projects.
  • Strategic Planning: Communicates corporate goals and objectives within the department. Aligns department tasks and objectives with corporate goals and objectives. Establishes clear targets and measures to track progress toward department objectives. Shares organizational performance measurement information and encourages dialogue and analysis.
  • Change Management: Actively embraces change efforts and initiatives to improve department performance. Develops and uses different methods to help employees to positively react to change.
  • Community Engagement: Mobilize connections, facilitate collaboration and cooperation to create trust with the community.
  • Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Makes clear and convincing oral and written presentations to individuals or groups; listens effectively and encourages open communication; facilitates an open exchange of ideas and fosters an atmosphere of open communication; considers and responds appropriately to the needs, feelings, and capabilities of others in different situations; is tactful, compassionate and sensitive, and treats others with respect.
  • Crisis Management: Deals effectively with pressure; maintains focus and intensity and remains optimistic and persistent, even under adversity. Recovers quickly from setbacks.

Home and Community Care Support Services Toronto Central is committed to accommodating people with disabilities as part of our hiring process. If you have special requirements, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment process

title: Product Analyst, Growth (Remote)
description:
BenchSci’s vision is to bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We’re achieving it by empowering scientists with the world’s most advanced biomedical artificial intelligence. Backed by F-Prime, Gradient Ventures (Google’s AI fund), and Inovia Capital, our platform accelerates science at 15 top-20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading research centers worldwide. We’re a remote-first company recognized for our impact and culture as a Deloitte Tech Fast 50TM, CIX Top 10 Growth, Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked organization on Glassdoor. Learn more at www.benchsci.com.

We are looking for a Product Analyst, Growth to join our team. Reporting to our Manager, BI & Analytics, you will uncover novel insights that answer critical business questions and guide strategic decisions by analyzing the full user journey. 

You will be a crucial member of our business intelligence and analytics team and a critical member of a cross-functional platform team comprised of scientists, engineers, product managers and designers. Working as an analytics subject matter expert, you will help grow our understanding of our end-users, measure product feature launches, and elevate our capabilities with new testing frameworks and methodologies. Ultimately, you will ensure BenchSci is empowered to answer critical business questions about our products and make continuous, data-driven improvements for BenchSci's end users. You will directly impact the success of new features that BenchSci ships and that excite you!

You Will:

  • Define, analyze, evaluate and re-define measures of success to evaluate product performance
  • Create measurement plans, set up tracking events and build reports to measure feature and product performance
  • Develop strategies and testing methodologies to unlock data-driven product improvements 
  • Partner with our Product Managers, UX and design experts to analyze and understand the intent of our end users
  • Collaborate with the entire business intelligence and analytics team to implement best practices for data capture, modelling and reporting
  • Formulate hypotheses to drive usage/conversion, deploy A/B experiments, analyze results, and draw conclusions
  • Identify usage patterns within the product that impact key performance metrics
  • Take ownership of ongoing metrics reporting, along with product and feature specific dashboard creation
  • Use strong communication skills to present, articulate, and explain insight findings and recommendations
  • Work autonomously to achieve our outcomes and manage your timelines, prioritizing between planned analytics projects and ad-hoc data requests
  • Elevate our product analysis outputs by actively contributing to the evolution of our methodologies, experimentation frameworks, tools, and knowledge

You Have:

  • 2+ years experience in product analytics
  • Expertise in measuring the success of product feature launches
  • Experience with running experiments, such as AB tests, to evaluate hypotheses and making data-driven optimization recommendations to drive conversions
  • Experience with product analytics tools (Heap, Full Story, Amplitude, Mixpanel, or similar)
  • Proficient in SQL
  • Familiar with business intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker or similar) 
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, comfortable explaining complex analysis to technical and non-technical audiences
Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture that hires the best talent from around the world
A competitive compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options 
Comprehensive health and dental benefits with an emphasis on mental health
An annual Executive Health Assessment at Medcan for proactive health awareness
Three weeks of vacation plus an additional day for every completed year
A $2000 Annual Learning & Development budget
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options
Additional time-off: 2 weeks for Winter Holiday, every other Friday in July and August, your birthday, and more!
A $1000 work from home allowance to make your home setup perfect for you
An Oculus Quest 2 to connect with your team members in Virtual Reality
An executive coach for managers to assist in leading high-performing teams
Complimentary Headspace account to support mental wellness and focus
Complimentary genome sequencing from 23andMe to better understand your health through your DNA

Our Culture:
We believe culture is critical to success and invest accordingly. We live and promote our FASTT values of focus, advancement with speed, tenacity, and transparency. We work hard to maintain an engaging, supportive environment where everyone can do their best work. To learn more, read our culture deck.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. To learn more, read about our DEI initiatives.

Accessibility Accommodations:
BenchSci provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

#LI-Remote

title: Senior Content Marketer
description:
Our Mission:

Our mission is to make high quality legal services accessible to everyone. 70% of people and businesses can’t afford access to legal services today. Our software automates and centralizes legal work so that it can get completed 90% more efficiently.

About Rally:

We’re enabling lawyers to work better, while dramatically improving the legal experience for end legal clients. No more paper & word docs everywhere, no more forgetting important legal dates & obligations - we want a world where legal data can be easily recalled, utilized, and manipulated from anywhere.

Our software will not only make legal experiences more enjoyable, but also make them affordable and accessible. Today our focus is on automating legal work for SMBs, but our ultimate goal is to expand our technology to many areas of law, making all types of legal services more accessible.

We are currently a team of 12 and have just closed a $2.8m round of seed funding. We are ready to grow quickly and this Product & Content Marketer position is critical to meeting our goals.

Responsibilities:

You will fill an evolving role:

* Produce & coordinate content creation: website copy, blog posts, e-books, product videos, webinars, social posts, press releases, and digital ads

* Develop Rally's brand voice & brand narrative

* Build a thorough understanding of Rally's product and feature-set

* Differentiate Rally from competition

* Understand Rally's customers

* Work with the team to develop a marketing strategy for the product and adapt it as the company evolves

* Conduct marketing experiments in multiple market segments as we solidify our product-market fit

* Develop sales collateral to support the sales team in selling the product as it evolves

* Help meet lead targets on a monthly and quarterly basis

* Provide analytics of key marketing work and tactics and report on best ROI activities

* Experiment, track, measure and log results

* Research competitor products and offerings

* Research keywords and topics for blog posts

About You:

* You're comfortable wearing multiple hats and juggling multiple projects at one time

* You appreciate a flexible work environment and are a self-starter

* You are a strong communicator and can function effectively within a distributed team

Requirements:

* Excellent writing ability
* 3+ years experience in a related role

* A track record of creating high-quality content (bonus: you can show the results)

* Ability to work remotely

* Experience with graphic or media design is an asset

Perks:

* Own a piece of the pie; as a crucial early hire you will be granted generous stock options

* Generous paid time off

* Autonomy and responsibility; we measure ourselves on results and let you determine how you get the job done

* Flexible work environment; join us in the heart of downtown Toronto at our Yonge & Dundas office, the award-winning Genesis Centre in St. John's, Newfoundland, or wherever you feel you get your best work done

* Endless career growth potential; Rally is an early-stage company which means you'll have influence and leadership opportunities from day one

* An incredibly deep & interesting problem space with an opportunity to make a massive impact (70% of people and businesses feel they cannot afford to access legal services today)

Rally is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Customer Advocacy Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
At Emburse our mission is to help make our users’ lives -- and their businesses – better. We are dramatically transforming how organizations manage corporate expenses and invoices. We humanize work by automating manual tasks and saving users’ time, so they can focus on what matters most -- their family, community, or more rewarding work. We help CFO's give their employees a simple and amazing experience while ensuring compliance and reducing costs. Our solutions are tailored for companies from start-ups to enterprises. We have more than 16,000 clients and 9 million users globally.

Emburse has offices across North America, including Los Angeles, Montreal, Portland (ME), San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto, as well as locations in the UK, Germany, Spain, Australia and the Netherlands.

Our core values - Sincerity, Empathy, Empowerment, Individuality, and Teamwork - reflect who we are as a company. They are central to the decisions we make and the interactions we have with our teams, customers, and partners. As a people-focused company, we are seeking candidates who align with our values.

Emburse is a proud recipient of a 2020 Tech Cares Award from TrustRadius and a 2020 IDC SaaS CSAT Award for Travel and Expense. These awards celebrate companies that have gone above and beyond to provide their communities, clients, and front-line workers with support during the COVID-19 pandemic. We are a people-first company, and this award is a testament to our mission to humanize work.

Follow us to stay updated on news and job openings!

We’re looking for a Customer Advocacy Marketing Specialist to help amplify advocacy programs across the Emburse customer base. This role requires 1-4 years of relevant experience in marketing and/or community management, and a creative mindset to proactively suggest campaign ideas and tactics to capture customer stories. This person will source customer advocates for various marketing opportunities, create inspiring content to showcase and celebrate our customers’ successes, manage our online customer community, and support other exciting marketing initiatives.

What you'll do:

  • Manage Emburse’s customer advocate community, including content creation, new member recruitment, rewards fulfillment and budget tracking, discussion moderation, member communications, and reporting. Measure engagement and recommend optimization tactics.
  • Maintain the community content calendar and collaborate with teams across the organization on various community activities.
  • Develop relationships with customers and work with cross-functional teams to source customer advocates and amplify their stories through testimonials, speaking engagements, videos, case studies, media, and more. Assist with drafting and editing content as needed.
  • Maintain an updated database of references and enable internal teams on customer advocacy programs and content.
  • Develop tactics to drive 5-star product reviews on public-facing reviews sites.
  • Assist with the Emburse customer referral program.
  • Support the Emburse customer awards program.
  • Assist with drafting customer communications to drive advocacy programs and support lifecycle marketing campaigns.
  • Assist with measuring performance across advocacy programs.
  • Support other marketing activities as directed.

  • #LI-LH1

What we're looking for:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
  • 1-4 years of experience in B2B Marketing
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Process-oriented and data-driven mindset
  • Creative problem-solving skills, and willingness to think outside the box
  • Strong organizational and project planning skills
  • Experience managing online communities
  • Experience with customer advocacy software, such as Influitive
  • Salesforce or other CRM experience preferred 
  • Marketing automation experience preferred
  • Google Docs / Microsoft Office Suite experience preferred
Emburse provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Emburse complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location where the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

title: Demand Generation Marketing Specialist - Remote Canada or US
description:
WorkJam’s mission? To provide the best Digital Workplace for frontline and hourly workers. Through our industry-leading Digital Frontline Workplace platform, we are positively impacting the lives of millions of frontline employees worldwide, enabling them to achieve breakthrough productivity levels at companies of all sizes. We’re proud of our dedicated teams who are driven to make a difference in the world. Join our team today and bring your innovative ideas, passion, and commitment to excellence to make an impact on our products and the new markets we create!

 

WorkJam is a high growth global organisation with operations in North America, Europe, and Australia with our head office based in Montreal. Learn more about WorkJam at WorkJam.com!


Your role as a B2B Demand Generation Marketing Specialist:

 

What you'll be doing: 

  • Under the supervision of the Director of Marketing, the B2B Demand Generation Marketing Specialist will play a strategic and tactical role in a fast-paced collaborative environment. 
  • Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to build and drive marketing strategy 
  • Assist in planning, conducting and executing campaigns to drive qualified leads for the sales and BD teams 
  • Create content and manage logistics of email campaigns 
  • Manage all tradeshow planning and logistics 
  • Plan and execute customer events including content and logistics 
  • Execute WorkJam Webinar series 
  • Lead tracking, qualifying and identify campaign ROI 
  • Manage Salesforce.Com and Pardot for purposes of driving, maintaining and analyzing lead activity 
  • Execute partner marketing activity 
  • Perform market research and identify new lead-generating opportunities 
  • Evaluate and nurture sales opportunities through marketing campaigns 
  • Work closely with the business development team to manage lead pipeline 
  • Strategically manage the budget to the marketing plan 
  • Interact directly with prospects and customers 
  • Build awareness for the WorkJam brand 
  • Occasional travel (Trade shows, on site workshops, etc.) 

 

What we're looking for:

  • BS/BA in marketing, communication or another related field 
  • Must have demonstrated experience setting up and managing Salesforce.com and Pardot campaigns  
  • Minimum 3 years experience as marketing specialist or similar role 
  • Excellent English presentation, written and oral communication skills, enjoys writing and the writing process. 
  • Energy and enthusiasm for bringing in leads and building market presence 
  • Working knowledge/understanding of B2B software marketing channels and techniques 
  • Proven experience with project management, especially relating to events 
  • Highly organization, attention to detail and critical thinking are all required 
  • Ability to work well in collaborative environments with attention to detail 
  • Demonstrate ability to work remotely with professionalism and efficiency 
  • Solid computer skills, including MS Office, marketing software (Adobe Creative Suite) 
  • Strong understand of the creation and management of Digital Assets 
  • Ability to influence and manage a social network 
  • Understanding of Workplace Communications and Collaboration 

 

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • 4 weeks’ vacation
  • Contribution to your retirement/pension plan
  • A flexible and remote/hybrid work environment
  • Work with the latest technology
  • A dynamic and inclusive culture
  • A supportive team that will encourage your professional growth and development
Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Business Development Specialist, New Accounts - (Virtual)
description:
Overview

Business Development Specialist (New Accounts)- Montreal - Virtual

 

Are you an ambitious and persistent sales professional with a proven track record of new business development? 

 

As a Business Development Specialist (New Accounts), you will be responsible for achieving sales revenue targets within assigned geographical territory. You will work in partnership with Account executives in presenting office equipment and software solutions. 

 

We are excited to offer a new and adaptive way of working that provides flexibility in the workforce while maintaining operational readiness! By blending remote and in-office work, we are able to take advantage of the independence and flexibility that comes with working from home, and the collaboration, teamwork and sense of belonging that comes from working together face-to-face. Our Workstyle Program offers the best of both situations: structure and sociability with independence and flexibility

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities

  • Prospect for new customers and maintain a sales funnel satisfactory to drive and exceed the monthly, quarterly, and annual sales quota
  • Assess and understand customer needs in order to provide individualized solutions 
  • Document all sales activities on a daily and weekly basis in Salesforce
  • Partner with Account executives in presenting office equipment and software solutions

Qualifications

To Succeed, You Will Need

  • High School Diploma or equivalent; Post-Secondary education is preferred
  • 2 years of sales experience is required
  • Exceptional time management skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent computer/technical skills –Proficiency in Microsoft Office with a focus on Excel and PowerPoint
  • Strong knowledge of Sales Force
  • Refined analytical skills
  • Good process management skills
  • Bilingual (French& English) 

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

 

COVID-19 SAFETY PRECAUTIONS

  • By monitoring public health conditions and following local COVID-19 guidelines, we are taking necessary precautions and putting the safety of our employees and candidates first
  • A critical component of our workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy.  Employees are required to be fully vaccinated and must provide Canon with proof of vaccination or undergo regular COVID-19 Rapid Antigen Screening in order to access the workplace. Canon will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.

REMOTE WORK

  • This position offers a Virtual work schedule. You will be 100% remote and not required to report to the office unless there is a specific business need (work schedules and office reporting requirements may change from time to time based on business needs)
  • When working from home, a reliable internet connection is required. Remote work is supported with cloud-based applications and collaboration tools

BENEFITS

  • Comprehensive health coverage plan that includes medical, dental and vision
  • Life insurance, disability and wellness programs
  • Vacation, Paid Personal Time and Sick days
  • Matching RRSP contribution & Profit Sharing Program
  • Tuition Assistance Program for professional continuing education
  • Discounts on Canon products, retailers, memberships and more!

EMPLOYEE PERKS

  • On-site cafeteria and outdoor patio
  • Employee gym and fitness centre
  • Employee referral program
  • Inspire Program, online peer-to-peer recognition for redeemable points on hundreds of products.
  • Community involvement

title: Ad Operations Specialist - Canada/USA (Remote)
description:
VerticalScope (TSE:FORA) is a publicly traded technology company that has built and operates a cloud-based digital community platform for online enthusiast communities. Our communities are roll-ups of high-consumer spending categories.


We leverage our deep in-house expertise in Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Internet marketing, and traffic acquisition to build highly targeted, successful online communities and websites. Our platform operates at the intersection of community, content, and commerce. We believe in the power of enthusiasts to inform and inspire.


Through targeted acquisitions and development, VerticalScope has built a portfolio of more than 1200+ websites with more than 1.7 Billion posts of content and more than 101 Million monthly active users - and growing.


As an employee you will receive a competitive salary and a full range of benefits, take advantage of learning programs and contribute to an international team whose passion is innovation driven by a collaborative merit-based culture.


Role Overview 


Reporting to the Ad Operations Manager, the Ad Operations Specialist will be responsible for trafficking campaigns across our large network of owned and operated communities. They will be responsible for testing and launching ad creatives, monitoring delivery to perform necessary optimizations and reporting as needed. Working closely with a team of Account Managers and Account Executives, the chosen candidate will ensure effective delivery of digital media campaigns and drive the day-to-day execution of digital ad delivery to meet client expectations for a broad spectrum of advertiser accounts.
 
Responsibilities:
 

  • Manage the day-to-day delivery of all direct sold campaigns, working directly with Account Managers to ensure campaigns deliver in full and exceed client KPIs.
  • Traffic and manage multiple advertising campaigns across various verticals.
  • Interact with internal as well as external clients daily, continuously building and strengthening positive working relationships.
  • Provide technical support to help troubleshoot any issues that arise at any point during the adverting life cycle and serve as the conduit to the technology team for escalations.
  • Ensure ad creative adhere to technical specifications and troubleshoot creative issues that affect delivery.
  • Maintain up-to-date understanding of site ad functionality, including knowledge of all ad products available; general availability; and performance of each unit.
  • Screen incoming creative tags to confirm correct specifications and parameters are met before implementation. Thereafter, implement tags with correct macros, pixels and trackers ensuring reliable output data for analysis.
  • Perform a thorough QA for all campaigns that go live.
  • Ensure custom placement creatives are properly built, internally as well as externally. If/when necessary, help build creatives and insert all necessary supplementary components for proper functionality of unit and on the site.
  • Monitoring delivery of campaigns from beginning to end. Develop optimization strategies on a campaign-by-campaign basis to maximize both delivery and advertiser performance to meet client’s expectations and KPIs.
  • Use best practices to pace budget and optimize for performance where necessary.
  • Facilitate re-expression and re-allocations as directed by the Sales and Account Management teams, ensuring information is accurate between first- and third-party systems.
  • Provide recommendations and solutions to quickly resolve technical issues. 
  • Identify opportunities to implement solutions that increase effectiveness and efficiencies.
  • Supply feedback to improve overall technical and inter-departmental workflow and participating in any tasks needed to test and implement new products/procedures.
  • Additional projects and tasks supporting the Ad Operations team where required as outlined by the Ad Operations Manager.


Qualifications:
 

  • Experience with Google Ad Manager (360 or Small Business), Campaign Manager 360, OpenX, Rubicon, Salesforce, and similar third-party ad servers.
  • Experience with verification/viewability vendors (IAS, Double Verify, MOAT, etc.)
  • Comfort with Microsoft Excel, and ability to consolidate information and work with multiple data points (comfortable with Pivot tables, VLOOKUP, Concatenate, etc.)
  • Agency trafficking experience is an asset
  • Capable of working well in a fast paced, deadline-oriented environment
  • Superior attention to detail, organizational aptitude, and time management skills
  • Proactive and highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Clear and effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • HTML/CSS, JavaScript working knowledge is preferred
  • Ability to work independently and in team settings
  • Ability to communicate technical/product information to both a technical and non-technical audience


NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as negotiated and ad hoc projects to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.


VerticalScope is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, colour, race, citizenship, ethnic origin, place of origin, creed, disability, family or marital status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation or any other protected ground or social area according to Human Rights laws.


If you require disability related accommodation during the application, recruitment and interview process, please let us know and we will work with you to make all possible adjustments to suit your needs.


Though we are only able to respond to applicants that are being considered for an actively open position, we sincerely thank all applicants who are interested in working with us and are glad to hear from you.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Senior Growth Marketer- Remote
description:
Overview

Walnut is a VC-funded fintech that is powering a new era of insurance — embedded. Walnut, https://www.gowalnut.com, provides life insurance as a premium membership. Simple plans, instant coverage and exciting member benefits from brands millennials know and love. Our goal is to provide life insurance coverage to a larger proportion of the population, to serve the underserved audience, and to acquire those consumers early in the life insurance journey. Our goal is to build trust and earn the right to serve them as our members progress through their stages in life. We make getting life insurance coverage as easy as picking a tier of Netflix. For businesses, we’ve partnered with top North American insurers and leading consumer brands to turn life insurance into a premium membership that businesses can seamlessly integrate as part of their product offerings or as addons in existing purchase flows. It’s Stripe for life insurance. Find out more at: https://www.gowalnut.com/businesses  Our team is looking for an experienced growth marketer with an entrepreneurial drive, a strong track record of driving results, and ability to unlock new distribution channels. You’ll be working with experienced growth-focused founders and partners with a passion for building some of Canada’s most notable startup brands.

What you'll be doing:

  • Work closely with the founding team to lead our growth marketing strategies and drive tangible business results
  • Run experiments across the funnel, improve conversion rates, and work across departments to collaborate on new initiatives
  • Create, manage, and experiment with new user and business acquisition channels (ie: social ads, SEO, search ads, PR, affiliate, etc.) and campaigns
  • Conceive and execute on content campaigns that drive, engagement, education, and retention
  • Help determine and define the execution of social media campaigns and content creation
  • Manage SEO efforts both on and off-site
  • Interview customers and prospective customers to understand needs and opportunities for improvement
  • Build dashboards, analyze data, and monitor performance to find areas of improvement
  • Determine the required resources and help recruit and source them
  • Plan experiments, then move with conviction and pace to execute at startup speed, measured in days and not quarters
  • Help us find new and innovative ways to increase revenue and meet company goals

Who we're looking for:

  • Ownership mentality is a must. You own your results. We’ll do whatever you need to help make you successful but we don’t read minds. Tell us what you need to succeed
  • 7+ years of hands-on marketing experience with ownership of a conversion funnel
  • Experience working with B2B SaaS marketing tools like: Hubspot, Slack, Customer.io, Intercom, Google Analytics, Google Optimize, MixPanel, GSuite, Mailchimp, Unbounce, Buffer, etc.
  • Design and implementation skills from Figma through to Webflow or similar tools would be a big plus
  • Knowledge of UI/UX design, HTML and CSS code, SEO factors all a big plus
  • Comfortable with change, uncertainty, and a fast paced environment
  • Startup experience is not required but entrepreneurial drive definitely is
  • Insurtech and Fintech experience is a big plus

Expectations:

  • Highly organized, high level of attention to detail with solid project management skills to collaborate with cross-functional team
  • Use data to drive decision making
  • Consistently strive to meet and exceed target KPIs
  • Keep close contact with the team to work through challenges together vs in a silo
  • Plan, prepare and actively participate in monthly, quarterly, and annual business reviews
  • Smart, risk-balanced decision making with exceptional ability to get things done
  • Perfection is not required. Honesty, integrity, and a positive, can-do attitude is required

Our values:

  • Mission-driven - you have the ability to empathize with our mission and utilize your skills and passion to help us pursue it together
  • Ship-in-progress - you have the ability to quickly share ideas, wins, and losses with the team in order to progress the business strategy
  • Compassionate - you are able to listen, understand, and provide support to those working alongside you
  • Integrity - you have the ability to treat co-workers, clients, and others stakeholders with respect and provide transparent solutions
  • Clear communication - you have the ability to clearly and effectively communicate with each part of the organization alongside external partners

About applying with us:

Compensation will be a combination of base and equity competitive with VC-backed early-stage companies. Successful candidates will be required to go through a background check.

title: Content Specialist, Marketing (Req #2022-246)
description:
Why Work at Ross Video? We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results. If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible. If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Senior Marketing Content Writer (remote)
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">We are looking for a Senior Marketing Content Writer to join our team. If you excel in creating high-quality and engaging content across digital platforms — think blogs, white papers, online articles, infographics, and other marketing materials – we want you!

The Senior Marketing Content Writer will be a key part of the Percona Marketing team, and will be responsible for creating, updating, and enhancing content aligned to Percona’s overall content strategy and editorial guidelines. The successful individual will help drive awareness, engagement, product education, and revenue through expert content creation across a variety of channels. The position reports to the Director of Content Marketing.

All applications must include a portfolio of 3-5 writing samples, inclusive of both short- and long-form published work. Submissions without portfolios will not be considered.

Percona is a respected thought leader in the open source community. We provide services and software for MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and MariaDB to open source users globally. 

Percona is remote-first and globally dispersed; we have 300 people in more than 40 countries. We offer a collaborative, highly engaged culture where your ideas are welcome, and your voice is heard. The growth and development of our staff is a top priority; we provide funding for training, certifications, conferences and more. 

Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, who also know how to have fun and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We offer flexible hours, the ability to work remotely and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.</section>

title: Senior Marketing Analyst
description:
Company Description

Assent is the supply chain sustainability management solution for the world’s most responsible, sustainability-focused complex manufacturers. The #1 business risk for complex manufacturers is hidden. Most supply chains were never built with sustainability in mind, and most manufacturers do not have deep visibility into their supply chain risks while outsourcing the majority of their production. Shaped by regulatory experts, customers and suppliers, Assent is the foundation manufacturers need for cross-enterprise sustainability. At Assent, your work will help bring transparency, sustainability, and fairness to the global community. 

We’re one of the fastest-growing technology companies - from $5 million to $50 million ARR in under five years! As the global leader in supply chain data management, we provide transparency into the supply chains of some of the world's largest and most successful companies, including 75 percent of Fortune 500 companies. In our most recent funding round, we raised $350 Million USD in funding led by Vista Equity Partners. This funding will allow us to continue to scale with purpose, and add exceptional talent to our already remarkable team. 


Job Description

Reporting to the Director of Marketing Operations, the Senior Marketing Analyst is responsible for supporting Senior Marketing Leadership by proactively generating actionable insights, diagnosing key issues pertaining to marketing processes/campaigns/initiatives and making data-driven recommendations to support business growth.

  • Identify and define requirements for reporting, analysis, and insight in collaboration with senior marketing leaders and business stakeholders across the marketing organization and beyond; including Revenue Operations, Customer Success and Product teams.
  • Lead the development of reporting and insights for marketing quarterly business reviews and sales/marketing leadership meetings (including Board of Director meetings).
  • Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to support strategic and tactical decision-making for key marketing initiatives, mapped to the buyer journey.
  • Review existing/ongoing marketing reporting (internal and external) ensuring consistent storytelling and proper campaign management; create, maintain marketing analytics reports/dashboards/datasets as needed, ensuring adoption across organization.
  • Effectively communicates complex ideas to internal and external clients, through compelling writing and verbal storytelling.
  • Partner with the Enterprise Data engineering and analytics team to build meaningful data products that support Marketing Business objectives.

Qualifications

 

  • Degree/Diploma in business, science, statistics, engineering or quantitative discipline.

  • At least  5+ years of experience in a Marketing Analyst or similar role in a B2B company

  • Extensive experience with Salesforce (dashboards, reports, etc)

  • Proficient using BI tools like Tableau, PowerBI, etc.

  • Experience in a SaaS based company a plus

 


Additional Information

At Assent, we are uniquely positioned to make meaningful, impactful changes in the world around us. If you believe in doing work that matters, we want you to join our team.

Life at Assent

  • Wellness: We believe that you and your family’s well being is important. As a result, we offer vacation time that increases with tenure, comprehensive benefits packages (details vary by country), life leave days and more.

  • Financial Benefits: It’s not all about the money – well, it’s a little about the money. We understand that financial health is important and we offer a competitive base salary, a corporate bonus program, retirement savings options and more.

  • Life at Assent: There is purpose beyond your work. We provide our team members with volunteer days, flexible work options and opportunities to get involved in corporate giving initiatives.

  • Lifelong Learning: At Assent, curiosity is not only valued but encouraged. You will receive professional development days that are available to you the day you start.

  • Work The Way That Works for You: Your work and life should be balanced in a way that is purposeful for you. We offer flexible working environments for our team. Choose a space that meets your unique needs.

Work the way that works for you. Your work and life should be balanced in a way that is purposeful for you. At Assent, we offer flexible working environments for our team. Choose a space that meets your unique needs. 

At Assent, we are committed to growing and sustaining an environment where our team members feel included, valued, and heard. Our diversity and equal opportunity practices are guided and championed by our Diversity and Inclusion Working Group and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs).

Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion includes recruiting and retaining team members from diverse backgrounds and experiences, and fostering a culture of belonging where all team members are included, treated with dignity and respect, promoted on their merits, and placed in positions to contribute to business success.

If you require assistance or accommodation throughout any part of the interview and selection process, please contact talent@assentcompliance.com and we will be happy to help.  

 


Videos To Watch

  • https://youtu.be/ueYa47qRqwQ

title: Marketing Designer, Employer Brand (Remote, Americas)
description:
Shopify is a leading global commerce company, providing trusted tools to start, grow, market, and manage a retail business of any size. Shopify makes commerce better for everyone with a platform and services that are engineered for reliability, while delivering a better shopping experience for consumers everywhere. Shopify powers millions of businesses in more than 175 countries and is trusted by brands such as Allbirds, Gymshark, PepsiCo, Staples, and many more.

About the team: 

Shopify’s Employer Brand team aims to accelerate an innovative, global growth marketing engine to identify, attract, and convert the right talent to Shopify. The team is looking for a Marketing Designer to help us develop our employer branding and build engaging digital experiences for potential employees of Shopify. This person will use their expertise in design and UX practices to play a key part in amplifying our culture and helping people understand what it means to work at Shopify.

We’re searching for someone who is collaborative and cares deeply about branding design and UX, with empathy for the user and internal stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a particular strength in brand, social, and web design, and will approach their work with a systems mindset.

In this role you will:

  • Design beautiful ads, brands, and digital properties while thinking of design from a systems perspective

  • Collaborate with developers, content strategists, and marketers to bring new marketing experiences to life (and improve existing ones) 

  • Take ownership of your craft and its development by experimenting and considering multiple solutions to design challenges

  • Stay up to date on design trends and competitive research in order to drive the design process, while also collaborating with and advising stakeholders

  • Hold yourself to the highest standards by shipping beautiful, deeply considered design solutions, and being the individual that collaborators rely on

Requirements:

  • An empathetic and holistic mindset, and a collaborative, inclusive approach to work

  • Experience working on end-to-end, iterative projects, with awareness of common practices such as user research techniques, job stories, journey mapping, content modeling, wireframing and prototyping, and user testing

  • Proficiency with industry standard design tools, including Figma and Adobe

  • Experience leading large scale branding projects

  • Experience working with other designers, developers, content strategists, and other cross-functional collaborators

  • Appetite for experimentation and rapid-prototyping with proven success in a fast-paced environment

Bonus experience:

  • Knowledge of Talent Attraction and/or experience supporting an employer brand team

  • Experience working within and contributing to a design system

title: Product Marketer
description:
Bridgit is workforce intelligence for the construction industry. Our mission is simple – to help the trillion dollar construction industry maximize profits and reduce risk by taking a people-first approach. We are, and always have been, driven by the want to disrupt and transform construction.

Bridgit is a Series B company, having raised over $43.5 million CAD in funding, from investors like Camber Creek, Export Development Canada, Salesforce Ventures, Storm Ventures, and more.

We offer a remote-first environment with flexible working hours as well as options for working locations. Make an impression, make an impact.


What you will do

As Product Marketer, you will support logo acquisition and customer expansion by communicating the value of Bridgit Bench to the GC Market. Your primary mandate is to drive positioning, go-to-market, and competitive intelligence. As a member of the Product Marketing team, you will work cross functionally with the product, revenue, customer, and growth teams to assist in our goal of disrupting the construction industry. We’re growing quickly, which means you’ll have the opportunity to be a driving force behind Bridgit’s product positioning and GTM strategies.

You can expect to:

  • Develop and define product positioning, messaging, ICPs, personas,
  • Conduct market intelligence, competitive intelligence, industry trend, and pricing research
  • Build and launch GTM plans in partnership with the product and revenue teams
  • Create and deliver sales enablement materials and trainings
  • Construct and launch, in partnership with the customer team, product-focused content like monthly customer newsletters and product release announcements

Requirements

Are You a Good Fit for Product Marketer at Bridgit?

Let’s start with our core values:

  • Deliver results, fast
  • Fixate on the customer
  • Be open, be honest
  • Win or lose together
  • Never stop learning

Does that sound like you? Great! Keep reading.

  • You are customer obsessed
  • You have a strategic mindset and an eye for detail, meticulous and a big picture thinker at the same time
  • Your written and oral communication skills are impeccable
  • 3+ years of experience in product marketing, from strategy to execution
  • You have stories to share about launching GTM plans for product or feature releases, building out positioning and messaging, increasing user education, and leading sales enablement
  • You would describe yourself as scrappy and growth oriented
  • You have the ability to build strong relationships with multiple teams, potential clients, and existing clients
  • You are committed to diving deep into industry trends, competitive analysis, and client data (Salesforce, Mixpanel, Appcues, MailChimp)

We recognize many of the skills we’ve developed over our careers are often transferable. We believe that creativity, enthusiasm, and drive are the keys to success. If you’re not sure you meet every qualification but feel you have other experience relevant to the role, we encourage you to apply.

As we move into a remote-first future, the health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, customers, and communities remain our number one priority. While vaccination is not a condition of employment, Bridgit does require all team members to be fully-vaccinated against COVID-19, as defined by the Government of Ontario, when entering our offices and attending in-person events, subject to applicable legal exemptions.

Benefits

  • An autonomous environment with the opportunity to make an impact quickly
  • A culture that encourages innovation and professional growth, among other things
  • Competitive salary and options
  • Perks and benefits including unlimited vacation, 4-hour Fridays and extended long weekends

Bridgit values diversity and believes that our strength comes from including the perspectives of all kinds of contributors. We encourage people from underrepresented communities to apply, including racial minorities, LGBTQIA+, and those with disabilities. Accommodations are available during all stages of the recruitment process, please advise us of any needs as required.


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.
