title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Company Overview

POOLCORP is the leading business-to-business wholesale distributor of swimming pool and landscape supplies, equipment, and related outdoor living products.  Through our subsidiaries, SCP Distributors LLC, Superior Pool Products LLC, and Horizon Distributors Inc., we operate in more than 390 Sales Centers worldwide, with nearly 5,000 employees proudly serving the needs of customers. Each Sales Center operates as its own business; driving an extraordinary culture that involves a high work ethic, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a community presence all within a family-oriented work atmosphere.

Why POOLCORP? 

Because it’s a place where you can make an impact and grow!  At POOLCORP you’ll find a wealth of management opportunities that support your individual and long-term career goals.  Our stable work environment is further enhanced by our generous compensation and benefits package.  Publicly traded since 1995, POOLCORP is a global organization with a long history of continuous success - clearly making it an industry leader – in so many ways!

So, end your job search here – at POOLCORP – Where Outdoor Living Comes to Life!

Location: SCP Distributors Canada - Vaughan, ON 390; 282 N. Rivermede Rd, Concord, ON L4K 3N6

Job Summary:

The Marketing Coordinator is a junior associate level position. Responsible for building, organizing, standardizing, and executing marketing strategy and media in keeping with company objectives, vision, and image across multiple platforms.

Responsibilities:

  • Collects, standardizes, and maintains the company’s digital data/assets for use on multiple company platforms (web/PIM/general marketing use) in a group and/or individual setting.

  • Assists with the creation of media assets through research and other means, image manipulation to standardize digital assets using photoshop and other design software.

  • Assists with periodically updating content for the marketing team (digital campaigns/programs/company initiatives) in a proactive, methodical, self-motivated approach with minimal supervision.

  • Works with the Product and Program Management team, Design teams and Vendors for the creation/maintenance of digital programs/projects and other assets.

  • Analyzes data for accuracy/consistency – adherence to procedures and company guidelines for integrity.

  • Generates, edits, publishes, and shares marketing/media content (original text, images, video or HTML) that builds meaningful connections and encourages community members and customers to take action.

  • Creates calendars and syndication schedules where applicable, tracks marketing expenditures.

  • Coordinates all aspects of events – in person or virtual – Sales Events, Trade Shows, Conferences/Meetings.

  • Identifies areas of improvement regarding in-house system processes for potential development. 

  • Additional marketing tasks as assigned.

The Ideal Candidate Will Possess:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing/communications/technology or related field.

  • 2+ years marketing experience preferred.

  • Ability to create original content, consistently maintaining a high design standard.

  • Intermediate to expert level of current Adobe Creative Suite: InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, and Adobe Acrobat. Microsoft Office:  Word, Outlook, Excel, OneNote, Power Point. Graphic design experience an asset.

  • Capabilities to work well in a fast-paced/deadline-driven/multitask environment and approaches work with a positive attitude while being able to take direction. Skilled at performing in a team environment as well as being a strong individual contributor.

  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills – meticulous attention to detail and well-organized.

  • Ability to be proactive and seek out relevant information, take initiative to reach out to team members, vendors and departments within the organization.

  • Swimming pool and outdoor living industry knowledge preferred.

  • Fluency in French – written and oral an asset.

POOLCORP is a drug-free company and an EOE, M/F/V/D. POOLCORP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Spécialiste de contenu marketing
description:
Spécialiste de contenu marketingFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Rejoignez la division ABB Produits d'installation, fabricant numéro un de produits d'électrification en Amérique du Nord comptant 125 ans d'expérience en innovation et en solutions axées sur les clients afin de connecter et protéger les systèmes électriques, ainsi qu'une offre unique démarquée de moyenne tension. Nos produits sont utilisés tout autour de vous, chaque jour - en orbite autour de la Terre, en travaillant sur Mars, dans les trains les plus rapides que nous empruntons, dans les voitures les plus rapides du monde, en traversant les océans, dans les usines produisant votre nourriture, dans les immeubles les plus hauts du monde, dans les hôtels les plus modernes et même dans les murs de votre maison. Avec une gamme de produits comportant plus de 200 000 articles sous plus de 38 marques de commerce de première qualité, les offres de la division ABB Produits d'installation sont disponibles partout où l'on utilise de l'électricité. Nos équipes de marketing jouent un rôle clé dans la manière dont les technologies d'ABB contribuent à un avenir plus productif et plus durable dans nos sociétés. Aider les clients du monde entier à améliorer leur efficacité, à économiser des ressources et à réduire les émissions donne à notre travail un grand sentiment d'engagement et d'appartenance.Nous recherchons un esprit créatif qui pourra rédiger et coordonner la création de contenu marketing engageant. La personne idéale est dynamique, a de fortes habiletés linguistiques autant en anglais qu'en français et est dédiée au succès de l'équipe - quelqu'un qui a beaucoup de talent et un petit égo. Elle fera partie d'une équipe d'experts en marketing produit qui assure la création, la gestion, la production et le déploiement de campagnes et d'initiatives marketing. Nous collaborons avec d'autres ressources, internes et externes, afin concrétiser les projets et produire des résultats concrets. Notre spécialiste sera amené(e) à trouver des idées, créer des concepts, élaborer des messages pour divers éléments et gérer des projets.
Vos responsabilités

  • Interpréter l'information transmise par différents experts, développer et présenter des idées et des options de concepts captivants.
  • Produire du contenu de qualité pour le marketing traditionnel et numérique, incluant des publicités, scripts de vidéos, affichages pour événements, communications aux ventes, contenu web, publications pour médias sociaux, brochures, présentations PPT, etc.
  • Rechercher et comprendre les besoins de nos audiences cibles, leurs préférences, les différents tons et styles à utiliser et les tendances du marché et partager les meilleures pratiques avec l'équipe tout en respectant le ton adopté par ABB et les standards de son image de marque.
  • Prendre en charge la réalisation de projets marketing variés en mobilisant les forces des membres de l'équipe.
  • Réviser les textes et traductions de collègues ou ressources externes avec une approche constructive et assurer l'assurance qualité de base en faisant les corrections nécessaires.
  • Participer à l'optimisation des processus de production afin de favoriser l'efficacité des projets.
  • Exceller dans un milieu au rythme soutenu, en collaborant à plusieurs projets en même temps et en soutenant l'équipe de marketing dans les différentes phases de projet, exigeant souvent des délais d'exécution courts.
  • Se retrousser les manches pour effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes nécessaires.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Excellentes compétences linguistiques : rédaction, révision et correction d'épreuves, avec un sens aiguisé du détail, du vocabulaire, de la fluidité et de la grammaire.
  • Solides habiletés créatives et capacité à développer des concepts marketing liant divers éléments de contenu.
  • 5 à 10 ans d'expérience professionnelle en rédaction ou développement de contenu
  • Personne fonceuse capable d'élaborer des initiatives et de diriger des projets.
  • Excellent sens de l'organisation et capacité à travailler de manière indépendante et en équipe pour respecter les délais.
  • Atouts : connaissances des pratiques de SEO, des médias sociaux et facilité à s'adapter à différents outils numériques.

Benefits
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Plan retraite
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur ABB, consultez notre site web www.abb.com.Pour la quatrième année consécutive, ABB Canada a été reconnue comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada par le magazine Forbes et s'est classée au premier rang dans la catégorie de l'industrie. Également nommée parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada, les meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, les meilleurs employeurs pour les jeunes au Canada et le prix de la meilleure expérience du candidat (CandE Award), la culture et l'engagement d'ABB consistent à offrir un milieu de travail bienveillant où chacun collabore, se sent valorisé, respecté, inclus et soutenu. Nous nous engageons également à veiller à ce que toutes les politiques et pratiques respectent le Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, nous visons à ce que notre main-d'œuvre soit réellement représentative des quatre groupes désignés : les femmes, les autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB fournira des accommodements adéquats aux candidats handicapés et les encouragera à s'identifier dans le processus de candidature.#LI-Hybrid
skills: ["Personne fonceuse capable d'élaborer des initiatives et de diriger des projets.", "Excellent sens de l'organisation et capacité à travailler de manière indépendante et en équipe pour respecter les délais."]

title: Business Developer
description:
Accountabilities

Job Type: Permanent FTE 37.5

Job Code: BD

Job Level: L1 / L2

Location: Hybrid Remote - Mount Pleasant, Vancouver

Min expectation of 1 day per week in office or in-person meetings (Expected travel ~25%)


About MistyWest

MistyWest is a hardware engineering consultancy that exists to create novel technologies that enable a healthier planet and bring prosperity to all humankind, with a focus primarily on hardware projects that advance the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

About the Role

You are an energized, enthusiastic technical sales professional looking for your next opportunity in the IoT and smart connected devices space. You engage deeply with our world-conscious mission to bring prosperity to all, via impactful technology and innovative solutions.

You place a high value on organization, self-discipline, and results - all while employing a thoughtful, client-focused approach to delivering the solution that best fits the client’s need. You thrive on identifying, pursuing, and closing partnership deals and can tailor your communication to a diverse audience with varying levels of technical knowledge.

You look forward to working with an inspired team of collaborators - from engineering physicists to industrial designers and everything in between. You will work most closely with our cross-functional sales and business development teams to attract new partners into our funnel, steward them through our proposal process, build long term relationships and ideally - sign multiple expanding scopes of work.


Accountabilities
  • Take accountability for your client's success and satisfaction via owning project KPIs like Client Satisfaction, NPS, net margin, revenue targets and other metrics
  • Support the MistyWest Engineering and Design team in order to achieve high client satisfaction with project outcomes
  • Turn leads generated from marketing and outreach activities into opportunities with clear client pain points to be solved
  • Drive revenue by converting opportunities into closed projects
  • Nurture client relationships to turn projects into recurring revenue
  • Develop strong relationships based on mutual trust and respect with the engineers and project managers at MistyWest to deliver client success
  • Develop succinct knowledge of product development in our core technology offerings to provide a reasonable rough order of magnitude estimate for new projects.
  • Relentlessly expand your personal network in the hardware ecosystem and constantly work to provide value and build MistyWest’s reputation.
  • Maintain client satisfaction, and provide an escalation path to Directors when issues arise
  • Maintain excellent record keeping and leverage our CRM (Salesforce) to accelerate the sales cycle.
  • Process key legal documents including NDAs, Master Services Agreements, and Work Orders
  • Improve internal processes and playbooks by contributing and capturing key learnings during your tenure
  • Others, as required.

Candidates matching most of the following skills are encouraged to apply. If you are missing some requirements, you may still be considered. Please highlight any missing requirements in your cover letter and explain how you would address or overcome that challenge.

  • 3-6 years of experience in a hardware or engineering sales environment
  • Proven results in customer-facing sales and/or account management roles
  • Understanding of current trends in industrial and commercial IoT, preferrably computer vision, remote sensors, wearables, and other embedded systems
  • Takes accountability for client outcomes and works relentlessly to achieve success
  • Coachability: proactively seeks opportunities to learn from teammates
  • Adept at learning new concepts and employing that learning in realtime
  • Excellent verbal, written and digital communication skills; can distill complex or difficult concepts to First Principles
  • Skilled collaborator: employs a “Pull Together” mindset to achieve collective results, prioritizes team effort over individual wins
  • Bias to action: continually pushes through barriers to achieve results in ambiguous or unclear situations
  • Legal ability to travel within continental North America (Travel time: ~ 25%)
  • Awesomeness


Preferred Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Industrial Design or STEM field, or equivalent diplomas & experience
  • Direct experience in IoT and Computer Vision hardware engineering environments
  • Technical sales leadership experience is highly valued

Compensation for this role will scale with experience and the degree to which the candidate fulfills the various requirements of the role.

The base salary band for this role is $69,800 to $90,000 based on a 40-hour workweek. Additional compensation based on commission or bonus-sharing schemes TBA.

In addition to our competitive base salaries, MistyWest offers a dynamic salary based on profit sharing, equity, banked time and benefits, which is a bit different from conventional compensation programs. We also work a 37.5 hour work week, to encourage healthy work-life integration (something to keep in mind if comparing to 40-hour, non-banked time salaried gigs).


Benefits include the following (we’re always adding more):

  • 37.5 hour workweek and flexible weekly allocation
  • Banked time: MistyWest compensates for all hours worked above salaried amounts
  • 4 weeks paid vacation, 5 sick days and 3 Pro D days annually plus 10 paid statutory holidays & holiday office closures (44 PTO days annually)
  • Additional two weeks of paid Support Leave for parents, caretakers & bereavement
  • Flexible work schedule & opportunity to telecommute when not needed at HQ
  • Generous parental leave top-up (18 weeks at full pay)
  • Supplemental Unemployment Benefit for medical and extended leaves
  • Comprehensive medical, dental & vision plan from Sun Life (including psychology and clinical counseling benefits)
  • Flexible Health Spending account starting at $250, with $100 added every year after one continuous year of employment
  • $1000 discretionary Professional Development budget per annum
  • Access to full laboratory and workshop for personal projects
  • Well-stocked corporate library & access to complimentary online learning subscriptions on demand
  • Opportunities to travel to professional conferences like CES, SXSW, SIGGRAPH, and more
  • Complimentary staff events like ski trips, parties, shared meals, and community events
  • Working in an attractive, bright, open-plan, dog-friendly office in Mount Pleasant, with complimentary snacks and espresso!

You engage deeply with our world-conscious mission to bring prosperity to all, via impactful technology and innovative solutions.', 'Maintain excellent record keeping and leverage our CRM (Salesforce) to accelerate the sales cycle.']

title: Sr. Principal Strategist, Inspire Value
description:
Company Description

At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you. 

With more than 7,400 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2021 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies®. 

Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.

Job Description

The Strategic Go-to-Market organization is a newly created function combining our Value Management, Inspire, Industry Solutions, Industry Go-to-Market and Top Accounts teams under a single umbrella. Our organization provides outstanding services to our quota-carrying field sales organization and to our end customers and prospects. We understand industries, our customer's strategy and desired outcomes and provide industry relevant solutions that achieve demonstrative customer value.

We help bring a creative customer engagement experience through our Now Value framework, at-scale using best practices and expertise culled from our experts and from system data from thousands of customers who use the Now Platform for digital transformation.

The Go to Market (GTM) Top Accounts Team provides programmatic support to our accounts, providing a geographically aligned engagement with account teams to ensure the success of our largest clients. As part of the GTM team of Industry and Value, the team provides a connective tissue to the field and extended teams. We are looking for a strategic driver to expand on sales strategy and be the connective tissue across the field and extended partners. You will support four areas including:

  • Deploy "Dream Big Engagements" to bring systematic, front-to-back approach for creating large strategic opportunities and building long-term customer relevance
  • Run "NowValue Business Reviews' as quarterly account reviews with c-suite to showcase value realized, highlight value optimization opportunities and discuss future growth
  • Lead Industry Advisory Boards at twice annual industry forums for customers to network, gain access to executives and experts, and influence product strategy
  • The leader will use management skills to overachieve in a sales environment. They will be strategic and know how to use data to make decisions and build stretching growth plans.

What you get to do in this role:

  • Provide strategic services to sales and customers to increase annual contract value and expand ongoing pipeline
  • Develop, communicate and build a multi-year plan to grow business
  • Work with industry, value and advisory matrix teams to develop industry specific GTM strategies
  • Collaborate on go-to-market strategy: GTM, Solution Sales, Solutions Consulting, Field Marketing, Customer Success, Professional Services and Alliance and Channels
  • Be a trusted advisor who sets a high-bar, leading from the front
  • Demonstrate expertise to promote new customer engagement
  • Work with senior sales leadership, including Global EVPs, Geo leads and P4
  • Help improve Strategy Decks/Account Plans and JPPs
Qualifications

To be successful in this role you have:

  • 15= years of experience in field sales/sales management or consulting in a matrixed and complex sales environment with a focus on aligning to company plans
  • Strategic consultative mindset, understand business and people change, can engage with depth at C-Level
  • C-Suite Consultative approach
  • Experience building multi-tiered customer relationships and C-Suite influencers
  • Experience growing talent
  • Knowledge and demonstrated skills in sales techniques, customer interaction, customers relations
  • An ability to respond to large amounts of complex data


FD21



Additional Information

ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.

All new employees hired in the United States are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to such exceptions as required by law. If hired, you will be required to submit proof of full vaccination or have an approved accommodation, by your start date. Visit our Candidate FAQ page to learn more.

If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at

talent.acquisition@servicenow.com

 for assistance.

For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.

Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.

Work personas

Work personas are categories that are assigned to employees depending on the nature of their work. Employees will fall into one of three categories: Remote, Flexible or Required in Office. 

Required in Office

A required in office work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office. This persona is required to work from their assigned workplace location 100% of the work week based on the business needs of their role.

Flexible 

A flexible work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office and will work from their assigned workplace location roughly 3 days/week or less (generally around 40-60% of the work week). Flexible employees may choose to work the remaining working time from their workplace location or home. Flexible employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment.

Remote

A remote work persona is defined as an employee who performs their responsibilities exclusively outside of a ServiceNow workplace and is not contracted or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office, including those whose place of work (pursuant to their terms and conditions of employment) is their home. Remote employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment.

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
Our Surrey Promotional Event Company is now hiring a Marketing Associate. Our clients are industry leaders, Fortune 500 companies who are looking for help promoting their brands, services, and products. This is where we come in; our event based marketing approach allows us to connect with customers and clients at the foundation. We excel in building relationships with customers, while communicating our clients' brand in order to increase awareness and profitability. Applicants must be comfortable engaging with the public and have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.

To meet the increasing marketing and advertising needs of our clients, we have multiple openings available and are in need of training the right individuals in all divisions of our firm:
  • Junior Marketing
  • Campaign Development
  • Event Coordination
  • Public Relations
  • Sales Associates
  • Customer Service

We are looking for talented and hardworking individuals who are looking to start their career with a fast-paced company. Our ideal employee will be a self-starter with strong organizational and leadership qualities. Please only apply you have the following:
  • Outstanding communication skills both verbal & written - fluency in English is essential
  • Must be able to travel to our office in Surrey on a daily basis
  • Candidates must have a valid driver's licence and reliable transportation
  • Must be looking for full time (40 hours a week)
  • Able to prioritize and work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Able to work effectively in a team environment
  • Detail-oriented and the ability to follow up on tasks.
  • Work effectively under pressure and maintain a positive attitude
  • Capable of multi-tasking, prioritizing, and managing time efficiently




    About NuVision Promotions.:

    NuVision Promotions is a promotional event marketing firm dedicated to transforming our clients' brands through effective marketing campaigns. We’re enthusiastic about building interactive campaigns that intrigue and attract potential customers. Our client centred approach, as well as our top-notch services, has allowed us to understand our clients’ goals and accordingly formulate a strategy that will help them to gain additional customers. At NuVision, we work with well-known firms. With our unique approach to sales and marketing, we have met every project’s unique business needs. When a client approaches us, before proposing a marketing strategy, we prefer to understand their requirements and create a plan to help them promote their services in the most effective manner.

title: Market Data Analyst
description:
Summary:

**PLEASE NOTE - This is NOT a technical role for a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or someone with an IT background. Candidates MUST have experience in the Market Data realm and be able to administer Market Data contracts. Please read the description before you apply**

The Market Data Analyst at S4 Market Data will oversee client projects and be responsible for the overall service delivery of our managed services with respective clients. This position will manage market data service inquiries and projects from clients as well as manage a market data administrator within the projects to ensure administrative tasks are being completed in an accurate and timely manner. The ideal candidate will have market data vendor management and administrative experience; sourcing and negotiating contracts, managing procurement/sourcing requests throughout the spend life cycle, speaking with internal business units and stakeholders (legal, finance, IT, etc.) to procure goods/services for our clients.  The candidate needs to be located in the US, this is a fully remote position.

Responsibilities:

  • Handle day-to-day demand management or vendor management and administrative inquiries from internal business units, including but not limited to; data/sourcing requests, contract negotiation, entitlement administration, exchange reporting, moves/adds/changes requests, inventory management, procurement/legal approval, expense allocation, invoices reconciliation, and spend reporting.
  • Interact with the clientâ€™s various internal stakeholders and business units; technology, legal, accounting/finance, human resources, and investment managers.
  • Oversee the inventory management process of leavers/joiners, ensure current inventory is accurate and up-to-date. Oversee the reconciliation invoices and validation of monthly allocations/expenses.
  • Conduct monthly/quarterly exchange reporting and ensure exchange policies and data compliance across the clientâ€™s end-users and applications.  Administer their datafeeds (EMRS, DACS, Etc.)
  • Review spend and enact cost savings and avoidance initiatives. Provide respective business units with an overview for their costs; understand their products/services and respond to any inquires as needed. Maintain reports on costs and identify ways to consolidate spend.
  • Conducts regular internal team meetings to report on client SLAâ€™s and to ensure all client service deliverables are being met and completed.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in MIS, Business, or related degree and 3-5 years of relevant experience in financial services or market data. Relevant work experience in consulting is preferred.
  • Experience working with Market Data vendors such as Bloomberg, FactSet, Exchanges (NYSE, ICE, etc.).
  • Knowledge of FITS and MDSL inventory systems is preferred.
  • Excellent communication and project management skills and experience in working closely with internal client business units and senior stakeholders.
  • An entrepreneurial and self-regulating mind-set. Display a high level of time management skills to manage multiple and elaborate requests simultaneously.
  • Have high energy and be a self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

title: Marketing Coordinator - Quebec
description:
Company Overview

Affinity Group Canada is a well established successful and growing company that prides itself on being one of the premier food brokers in Canada.  Since 1989, our success has been driven by the number of industry leading food manufacturers that we represent.  We pride ourselves on having a dedicated sales team, strong customer service orientation, extensive product knowledge and a professional, challenging and rewarding work environment.

Job Summary

The Affinity Group Marketing Coordinator is to work with the Marketing team to manage and create POS, manage product specs, French translations, and assist with food show management.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Create and Prepare e-campaigns and communications
  • POS creation and Management
  • Direct the content, preparation, and timely circulation of internal communications
  • Assist with Food show Management
  • Educate customers and sales team about terminology, features, and benefits of products to improve product related sales and operator satisfaction
  • Maintaining product specifications sheets for client portfolios
  • Assisting in developing marketing and sales presentations for internal and external audiences
  • Prepare and manage all corporate translations which include trade notifications and POS.
  • Ensure consistency across Affinity and client assets and tools.
  • Special projects as required

Qualifications and Skills

  • Demonstrated experience providing administrative and project management within a team environment. Marketing experience considered an asset.
  • Strong organization and multi-tasking skills with the ability to make critical decisions.
  • Ability to prioritize and work independently
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, including Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Advanced skills in Adobe/Illustrator/Canva
  • Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills with the ability to build productive partnerships with management, staff, and external partners.
  • Critical thinker and ability to escalate when support is needed in a timely manner.
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Fully Fluent in French and English
  • Pleasant telephone manner
  • Professional image at all times
  • Outgoing and mature
  • A team player
  • Must be passionate about food

We offer a competitive wage, and group benefit package.  Interested candidates should email resumes.  Only successful candidates that meet our requirements will be contacted.  Resumes to be submitted in English.

The Affinity Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Content Marketing Specialist
description:
StickerYou is a leading global e-commerce company for custom die-cut products such as stickers, labels, decals, temporary tattoos, and more. Our proprietary platform infuses automation technology and creativity to empower anyone to make the best custom products in any size, shape, and quantity. Business and consumers can make their marketing, packaging, dÃ©cor, or personal expression professional grade. We believe in the enormous power of customization. We are a smart, creative, and passionate group dedicated to growing the most talented and engaging people in Toronto, Canada. We are a global company utilizing software and advanced digital manufacturing. We proudly make custom products locally. We make what matters stick!

The Role:

Weâ€™re looking for a performance-oriented Content Marketing Specialist that is passionate about conversion, copy and crafting messaging for different stages of the marketing funnel. Reporting to the Senior Director of Marketing, this person will be responsible for developing marketing campaign content focused on increasing StickerYouâ€™s visibility and engagement with various marketing channels with the goal of both converting new customers and growing existing ones.

This person will champion and create conversion focused content to support our growth across 3 core revenue channels (direct, promo, and e-commerce). They will play a key role in crafting digital ads, emails, blogs, social content and landing pages for these targeted audiences. Prioritizing impact over perfection, they will demonstrate the ability to seamlessly cater content to different audiences, personas, funnel-stages and mediums. The responsibilities of the role include leveraging our marketing automation platforms (email, sms), building customer journeys, writing customer stories and creating communications that motivate audiences to act. A key to success in this role will be to continuously audit and self correct campaigns to ensure they deliver optimal performance.

We're looking for someone who brings a level of excellence that will be a catalyst for StickerYouâ€™s growth at an important time in our company's evolution.  The person we're looking for will be able to move seamlessly between the creative and the analytical. As a true direct marketer they'll be able to create inspiring content without losing site of the metrics that drive success. The kind of person we're looking for follows the latest marketing trends and understands their value (or lack of), knows the ins and outs of Tik Tok and Instagram (and beyond) and may even be a creator themselves.

If this sounds like you, read on....

Core Responsibilities:

    • Create content plans and engagement initiatives for our core buyer segments (i.e. reseller, direct, and e-commerce).
    • Determine the appropriate channels to communicate to your segment and balance a mix of product, thought leadership, and event content (i.e. right place, time, message).
    • Represent content across our key marketing channels (e.g. ads, emails, webinars) to ensure optimal performance, and share learning with members of the leadership team.
    • Write and edit conversion copy, including but not limited to ads, email, social posts, landing page, webinar and event invites, and follow-ups.
    • Work with our marketing, product, and design teams to develop demand generation strategies based on search volume data, competitiveness, and relevance to StickerYou's brand and business goals.
    • Identify new trends and opportunities for outreach and engagement.
    • Report on the performance of your content/campaigns 

What Success Looks Like:

    • You demonstrate how the introduction, distribution  and optimization of your content initiatives result in converting more prospects to first-time customers, first-time customers into returning customers, and returning-customers into loyal ones.
    • You develop ongoing thought-leadership content that positions StickerYou as an authority in the business branding space.
    • You are performance-driven and increase revenue from triggered communications (email, sms) by 20% or more over previous year results.
    • You demonstrate innovative thinking, taking StickerYou into new communications channels that can ultimately deliver value for the business.

Requirements:

    •  A degree in Communications, Marketing, Business, or the Arts.
    • 3-5 years of experience writing, editing and optimizing conversion-focused marketing content in a B2B business (SaaS, agency, etc).
    • Experience with Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Marketing Automation Software (Klaviyo).
    •  Analytical skills to dig into website data and track content performance using the latest digital marketing tools (ie. Marketo, Hubspot, etc).
    •  Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills, especially when it comes to short, conversion-ready copy.
    • Experience editing freelance writers work and writing detailed content briefs based on product marketing fact sheets.
    • Authorized to live and work in Canada.

Key Competencies: 

    • A drive to create and workshop ideas into truly eye-grabbing copy.
    • Ability to quickly get up to speed on the ins and outs of niche industries (print, reseller).
    • Ability to work independently.
    • Proactive, organized, and collaborative.

    Covid Protocol

    StickerYou is committed to the health and safety of all our employees, visitors and community members. All employees, contractors and visitors who work on-site in StickerYou oï¬ƒces, retail and production locations will be required to show proof of vaccination status from a Health Canada approved COVID-19 Vaccination. Accommodations may be provided for those with valid medical exemptions and will be asked for valid proof of exemption status.

    Diversity and Inclusion

    StickerYou is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employeesâ€™ unique contributions to our companyâ€™s success. If you require accommodation for the recruitment or interview process,  please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs

    As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

title: Marketing and Promotions Specialist
description:
Your Connection to Wildlife

As one of Canadaâ€™s largest not for profit leaders in wildlife conservation, research, and advocacy, we are seeking to fill the following positionâ€¦

 

Marketing and Promotions Specialist

 

Position Overview:

The Marketing and Promotions Specialist is responsible for aiding the Canadian Wildlife Federationâ€™s (CWF) Senior Conservation Biologist in the development and implementation of marketing, event and digital strategies related to the CWF marine conservation program. This will include the promotion of gear trial and lending programs, sharing of knowledge and scientific results, improving public awareness on a variety of marine conservation topics, and strengthening a community of stakeholders engaged in CWF marine conservation programs. In addition, this position will work with the Senior Conservation Biologist to refine and then implement an existing targeted communication program. They will be responsible for helping to ensure consistent and cohesive messaging.  The ideal candidate should have event coordination experience, digital marketing and social media experience, strong attention to detail and excellent administrative and marketing/communication skills.  This position will also support the overall work of CWF and contributes to the productivity of this not-for-profit organization. Other duties shall be assigned as necessary.

Job Duties

  • Maintain websites related to fishing gear trialing and lending programs and Marine Team social media accounts.
  • Update The Watch and Ropeless Fishing Facebook groups
  • Write blogs and other outreach articles.
  • Work with the marine team to develop and implement a communication plan, for several programs, particularly the fishing gear lending program.
  • Create promotional products from materials produced by the gear trials program.
  • Assist with coordinating and engaging at boat shows/conference events.
  • Other related duties as assigned.

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of work experience in Marketing and Communications and/or Event Services;
  • Bilingual En/Fr is a strong asset.
  • Possess an undergraduate degree in Marketing, Communications, English or another related field; or relevant work experience
  • Experience overseeing multiple projects with aggressive timelines;
  • Web savvy
  • Possess exceptional writing and communication skills, with an eye for good content (both written and design);
  • Must be highly organized
  • Detail-oriented and highly meticulous, even when faced with competing priorities in a fast-paced work environment;
  • Display good judgment, with an ability to identify risks and manage expectations;
  • Exceptional communication skills with an ability to articulate creative concepts and rationale with every level of the organization;
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suites, as well as Google Analytics.

_____________________________________________________________________

Work Conditions

  • Location: Ideally Halifax, NS. Candidates outside of Halifax will be accepted.
  • Term length: 1 year fixed-term
  • Manual dexterity required to operate computer and peripherals.
  • Interacts with employees, various management levels and the public at large.
  • Repetitive work.
  • Overtime may be required

 

APPLICATION DEADLINE:  This positions will remain posted until filled. 

HOW TO APPLY:   Cover letter and resume should be submitted online. Only the candidates who meet the qualifications and experience for the position will be contacted for an interview. We thank you for your interest in the Canadian Wildlife Federation.

 

 

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________

The Canadian Wildlife Federation embraces diversity and equal opportunity and we welcome applications from qualified candidates from all diverse communities. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds and perspectives. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, religion or any other status or classification protected by law.

Accommodation may be available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process. If you would like to request a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please advise the Human Resources Department when you are selected to participate in the recruitment process.

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
Overview:

Visier is the global leader in People Analytics and Workforce Intelligence trusted by over 8000 customers and a third of the Fortune 500. Our solutions give customers valuable insight into  their people, because people are a business' most important asset. Every day Visier employees work to help create more efficient, fair, and successful businesses through leveraging data.  Recently closing a successful Series E funding round, and a landmark $1B valuation, Visier is embarking on an incredible phase of its 11-year growth journey.

 

Reporting to the Manager, Marketing Operations, you will work hand-in-hand with our Marketing Operations Specialist in developing operational excellence around our use of Marketo, our marketing automation platform. You will own the production of programs (including QA), optimization of templates, and process improvement within the platform. Being the in-house expert on marketing automation, you will be the go-to MOPs team member for the wider Marketing team on best practices and continuous improvement.

What You'll be Doing...:
  • Manage the production of marketing programs within Marketo including design, build and testing, always looking for opportunities to increase efficiency
  • Measure, analyze and report on program metrics
  • Identify testing opportunities for emails and landing pages, execute and optimize against results
  • Support operational tasks including list preparation, list uploads and campaign management in our CRM (SFDC)
  • Manage the QA process of Marketo projects with a high attention to detail
  • Ensure compliance (GDPR & CASL) and best practices in every program launched, acting as a data steward
The impact you'll have...:
  • 3+ years marketing experience, in a B2B technology/software company preferred
  • 2+ years Marketo experience
  • Experienced using advanced features, eg. program tokens, engagement programs, dynamic snippets and segmentation â€“ bonus if you are Marketo certified
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, SEO/SEM and Google Analytics considered an asset
  • Experience with other technologies such as SFDC, Bizible, Demandbase, Pathfactory, Sendoso, Reachdesk, Allocadia considered an asset

title: Marketing Coordinator (Go Insurance)
description:
Job Description:

The Marketing Coordinator role is the perfect opportunity for an ambitious individual looking to kickstart a prosperous marketing career!    

 

Weâ€™re hiring a Marketing Coordinator who will work with our VP of Go Insurance to execute weekly and monthly marketing campaigns and various other tasks. We need someone whoâ€™s organized with a knack for detail. If you have some design chops, thatâ€™s a bonus.  

 

Youâ€™ll be put in a position to grow, succeed, and help thousands of customers make better insurance choices every year, and youâ€™ll have a great time doing it! We were recently awarded for having one of Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies.  

 

About you:

  • You are highly organized, have an eye for detail and data, and can juggle multiple projects at one time.
  • Youâ€™re a versatile and multi-faceted individual who is willing to learn new skills in a fast-paced environment.
  • You understand the aspects and needs of different media: email marketing, digital marketing, and social media.
  • You have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Your time management skills are on point, and youâ€™re not flustered by quick, hard deadlines.
  • You bring your â€œAâ€ game to every task and operate with a sense of urgency.
  • Youâ€™re excited to measure the performance of our marketing campaigns, report on any insights youâ€™ve gained, and make proactive suggestions for improvement.
  • Youâ€™re a team player and are willing to jump in and work on whatever is thrown your way.
  • You can take direction from multiple people at the same time and work independently in a large office environment, with minimal supervision.

Required Skills and Abilities

  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly Word & Excel.
  • Must be fluent in spoken and written English.
  • Copywriting experience is an asset but not required.
  • 1-2 yearsâ€™ experience as a Marketing Coordinator or post secondary education in marketing
  • Ability to do some graphic design work

 The Perks:

  • Extra Vacation: 3 weeks after your first year, then an additional week after 5 and 10 years with Go Auto
  • Health Benefits: Health care and dental (80% - 100%), plus a health and lifestyle spending account

This job is based in Edmonton, Alberta.

title: Bilingual Pricing Analyst
description:
Cardinal Health, with over 1300 employees in Canada, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.

We are currently seeking a Bilingual Pricing Analyst to add to our team in our office in Vaughan Ontario or Dorval, Quebec. The incumbent will be responsible for planning, coordination and execution of all pricing changes in the ERP system for Cardinal Health Canada. The Pricing Analyst will be accountable for the setup, maintenance and regular updates to all pricing agreements, vendor contracts and customer contracts for assigned accounts. Additionally, this individual will manage customer relationships within the pricing and contract implementation process.

The primary goal of the Pricing Analyst role is to maintain the integrity of pricing data in the ERP system for Cardinal Health Canada and to ensure both internal and external customers always have accurate and current pricing at their fingertips.

For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings

Your Contributions to the Organization will be:  

  • Accountability of the integrity of pricing data in the ERP system

  • Planning, coordination and execution of pricing updates in the ERP system related to Pricing Agreements, Vendor Contracts and Customer Contracts for assigned accounts

  • Execution of tasks linked to the customer rebate program

  • Ensuring that Customer Service, Sales, Finance, Vendors or Customers are handled and resolved in an accurate and timely fashion

  • Managing relationships with internal & external customers

  • Supporting EDI related projects and activities

  • Creating, analyzing and distribution of selected reports for customer accounts

  • Serving as a liaison between the customer and the business on major projects assigned

  • Ensuring all pricing issues escalated by

This Job might be for you if:

  • You are fully bilingual in French and English

  • You possess JDE ERP experience - an asset

  • You have strong analytical abilities and excel experience

  • You showcase strong written and verbal communication skills

  • You are self-motivated and able to work independently to meet demanding deadlines

  • You are results oriented with strong problem solving capabilities

  • You possess Strong organization skills with an attention to detail

  • You work well in a fast paced and ever changing environment

  • Cardinal Health Canada is dedicated to the health and safety of its employees, customers and communities. Pursuant to this, we have implemented several COVID-19 safety measures, including a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that requires all employees to be fully vaccinated. This is subject to reasonable accommodation for grounds protected under human rights legislation

Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities.

Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

""

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Market Data Analyst/Specialist
description:
As a leading global technology solutions provider to the investment management industry, Confluence helps clients solve complex investment data challenges across the front, middle and back office. From innovative portfolio analytics to regulatory and financial reporting solutions, Confluence invests in the latest technology and data and in its team of industry experts to meet the evolving needs of asset managers and service providers. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA, Confluence services over 400 clients in 40 countries, with locations across Europe, North America, South Africa, Australia and Asia.

 

 

The Montreal office is the market data hub for the global company. The Equity, Index & Operations team is responsible for the quality and daily assessments of equity type securities, mutual funds, exchange rates, indices as well as the customer service for our North American client base.

We are currently recruiting for a Market Data Specialist to join our Equity and Data Operations team in Montreal. This is an exciting new role with many opportunities to work with financial market data and grow within our team.

 

Responsibilities

  • Validating price returns, corporate events and historical performance to match client expectation as well as benchmarks.
  • Ensuring data quality and identifying outliers (Equities, FX rates, Corporate Actions, some Fixed income evaluation data).
  • Constantly seeking process automation, methodology updates, workflows improvements and documentation.
  • Analyzing issues at any point in the workflow from vendor, to internal system, to client delivery.
  • Providing support to external clients, internal client services and development teams.

Essential Qualifications

  • Very comfortable with financial market data and how stocks, bonds, indices, etc. are used.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Solid knowledge of Excel and SQL.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment with production deadlines.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, working knowledge of French.
  • Flexible with occasionally working a non-standard shift as required:
    • 8:00am to 4:00pm
    • 2:00pm to 10:00pm (~ once a week)

Ideal Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business/Finance, mathematics, statistics, economics, or related fields.
  • 1 to 2 years in similar role.
  • Experience with financial instrument data, bond terms and conditions, equities and derivatives.
  • Knowledge of asset and portfolio analytics.
  • Ability to write simple code in VBA or other (an asset).
  • Experience with JIRA/Confluence ticketing system.

Personality:

  • Very high attention to detail.
  • Constantly challenging the status quo.
  • Team player.
  • Willingness to take responsibility and be autonomous.
  • Eager to learn.
  • Resourcefulness to collect information from a broad range of sources to support analysis.
  • Ability to plan/organize workload.
  • Eager to innovate.

 

 

We are committed to providing equal opportunities regardless of age, gender, religion or ethnic origin and we give full and fair consideration to the employment and career development of disabled persons, commensurate with their aptitudes and abilities.

Confluence Privacy Statement

title: 5987 - Category Advisor – IT
description:
Our client, the third largest producer of Canadian oil and natural gas and the second largest refiner and upgrader with extensive midstream and downstream infrastructure, has an immediate need for a Category Advisor – IT. This is a contract position for six (6) months located in Calgary, Alberta.

 Description

The Category Advisor, IT will support the Supply Chain Management team Category Management team and will be responsible for supporting the portfolios of IT Hardware and Telecommunications.

 Accountabilities

  • Responsible for end-to-end Category Management of the IT Hardware and Telecommunications portfolios.
  • Execute on annual and long-term strategic planning and budgeting to secure supply of goods and services and manage the associated price and supply risks.
  • Review, interpret, and analyze legal and commercial contract terms and conditions in legal documents including master agreements, schedules, statements of work, pricing, confidentiality agreements or other documentation as required. These agreements will include but not be limited to software, hardware, services, hosted/cloud solutions, subscriptions and professional services.
  • Lead strategic sourcing initiatives including RFx activities, development of negotiation strategies and recommendations to award.
  • Ensure is conducting business with financially viable, technically qualified suppliers, who operate within their expertise, and have a proven safety record.
  • Lead commercial negotiations with vendors ensuring goods and services are contracted in an efficient, effective manner bringing maximum value to the organization.
  • Interface with IT leadership team, subject matter experts and external vendors on contract management related tasks.
  • Ensure compliance to Supply Chain Business Rules, approved SCM channels, the Code of Business Conduct & Ethics, company policies, standards, processes and regulatory requirements.
  • Provide administrative tasks required to manage contracts in the portfolio.
  • Conduct other related duties as required.

 Required

  • 5-7 years’ experience, ideally in an IT portfolio
  • Post-secondary Business, Supply Chain or related degree
  • Experience leading and managing RFx activities
  • Experience with IT Hardware and Telecommunications portfolios software, hardware, services, hosted/cloud solutions, subscriptions, and professional services.
  • Experience with reviewing, interpret, and analyzing legal and commercial contract terms and conditions in legal documents including master agreements, schedules, statements of work, pricing, confidentiality agreements
  • Strong negotiation skills required
  • Must be proficient in Microsoft Office application suite
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills to effectively share ideas and issues with all levels of the organization
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail required
  • Oil & Gas experience is not required but will be considered an asset

 Additional Information

  • Client requires proof of Covid-19 vaccination to access job site. Providing proof of vaccination is a condition of employment with Ian Martin” for this opportunity.
  • The candidate will be working in the downtown office three days per week and remotely two days per week.

If you're a technical professional, you know that it can be difficult to find fulfilling work that advances your career. At the Ian Martin Group, we exist to connect professionals like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at

http://recruit@ianmartin.com/

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

#WES

#MON

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
Marketing Administrator


The Marketing Administrator will be responsible for executing a strategic marketing plan by clarifying our key differentiators, our target clients, and the most effective communication channels, and then creating the messaging for these channels, and execution of it. This person will track results to push for continual improvement in finding clients that are a great fit for our products and services, as well as cohesive branding in our target markets.


For more information please visit: https://terzettohomes.com/


Essential Duties and Responsibilities


  • Manage the content that the business posts on social media
  • Conduct social media audits to ensure best practices are being used
  • Develop strategies that drive customers to the website, Improve SEO; SEM
  • Improve the design, UX, traffic, and content of the website
  • Analyze digital data to draw key recommendations around website optimization
  • Create paid campaigns on social media platforms
  • Maintain consistent brand messaging throughout all platforms
  • Create email blast campaigns to target key customers
  • Use advanced metrics to measure the success of a marketing campaign
  • Keep up to date on the latest social media trends


Help our company dominate digital marketing in the Construction marketplace! Manage the company website development projects, email marketing campaigns and social media. Manage the back end of our new website including adding new products and other regular maintenance. Oversee our paid search and SEO efforts.


Job Type: Part-time

Salary: Commensurate with Experience

Experience:

  • Google Analytics: 1-2 years (Preferred)
  • Digital Marketing: 1-3 years (Preferred)
  • Marketing: 2-3 years (Preferred)

title: Influencer Marketing Specialist
description:
We're the banking app that believes in small businesses. 

Our company is looking for high performing builders to join our growing team as we enter our next phase of expansion . We are a San Francisco, New York, Portland, Toronto and remote-friendly based, venture-backed startup at the heart of the FinTech movement that is shaping the way financial services are delivered. We are backed by some of the best VCs in the world (Battery Ventures, Redpoint Ventures and more) and are growing fast.

Our mission 

We eliminate the pain that small business owners face through financial management and banking. Poor financial literacy has an outsized impact on the costs and failure rates amongst small businesses, and we are on a mission to solve these problems. We've created a mobile, tech-powered account built specifically for startups, freelancers, and small/medium-sized businesses (SMBs) that acts as a world-class Finance Department that most small businesses could never afford. Small businesses are the bedrock of every community and the economy, and you'll be their champion. Ready to start?

Our team

We ❤ Marketing. As an Influencer Marketing Specialist, you'll be the first of its kind at NorthOne and take charge of scaling the influencer channel. Reporting to our Performance Marketing Lead, who has tested over 15 user acquisition channels including out of home, direct mail, tv, podcasts, and radio, you'll also benefit from our incredible advisors and experienced management team, who have helped create and scale companies like Square, McKinsey, Google, Frank and Oak, Strava, Instacart, Prodigy, Oportun, eBay and more.

We're building a product that solves real pain for our community of customers. Small businesses are the bedrock of every community and of the American economy, and you'll be their champion. Ready to start?

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

  • Growing the influencer channel to be one of the largest in our marketing mix.
  • Continuous outreach and relationship management of 150 influencers at any given time and at scale.
  • Collaborating with our paid and brand marketing teams to develop creative that is on brand and drives results against our core KPIs. 

REQUIREMENTS

Today you might be a Communications Specialist, Community Manager, Influencer Marketing Coordinator, Growth Marketing Specialist or the equivalent in your company...or something that we haven't heard of yet - we keep an open mind. The most important characteristic of our Influencer Marketing Specialist is your attitude. We want you to join because you don't see roadblocks, you see opportunities to be at your best. You know that with a growth mindset and great teamwork, you can figure anything out.

The skills required for this role - 

  • You have experience managing end-to-end influencer campaigns, whether that be at an agency or fast-paced consumer brand.
  • You have a deep understanding of the influencer space on channels such as TikTok, Instagram, YouTube and more. 
  • You love analytics and are comfortable reviewing and analyzing business performance metrics and using the data to pivot when it tells you.
  • You have your finger on the pulse of pop & internet culture, and love to quickly identify trends and act on them.
  • You embody high ownership - you own your work, you know what it means to be fully done, and you always get it done. 

Bonus points - 

  • You have existing relationships with a roster of top US influencers.
  • You geek out over technology and/or FinTech.
  • You've worked in a fast-scaling early stage startup.

BENEFITS

Our mission is big and audacious, but we're assembling a team to take the challenge head on.

As an Influencer Marketing Specialist, you'll be joining a team that prioritizes:

  • People: Our company is more than just a business. We're a tight-knit team supporting each other on our mission to rebuild business banking. We're really serious about mission, fit, and the people we work with. You'll be part of a rapidly scaling team that reflects these values and keeps this place special.
  • Diversity: You'll find yourself in an environment that values diversity and inclusivity. We believe that a broad array of lived experiences and backgrounds are essential for creating the best possible product and company culture.
  • Leadership: You're right in the thick of it, making critical decisions that will clear our path forward.

You'll receive: 

  • Top-tier health/dental benefits: We care about the people we work with and put their health first. NorthOne is proud to offer inclusive health and dental coverage.
  • Flexible working hours: We don't clock in and out at set times. You know when you do your best work. We celebrate accomplishments, not how many hours are spent at the office.
  • Unlimited paid time off: We hire talented people and know that they need time off to be at their best. Take as much time off as you need to recharge and make sure you're working sustainably.
  • The latest computer equipment: We make sure you have the best equipment so you can produce great work.
  • Professional development budget: We support lifelong learners by covering the cost of classes, workshops and conferences. You'll also get access to our ever-growing library of industry-related books.
  • Remote and in person get-togethers: Bond with your teammates over shared interests at regular get-togethers. Find like-minded people who are passionate about everything from sport and music to gaming and cooking.
  • Remote-friendly environment: Flexibility to work from home, office, or both! We support our teammates wherever they prefer to work. 
  • One hell of an adventure!

Few people have been trained for this sort of role and research shows that women and people from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply if they haven't satisfied every requirement. If you are this close to what we've described, but aren't sure, apply. Let's figure out together if this is where you could shine.

NorthOne is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and celebrates diversity. We welcome all applicants regardless of race, colour, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, disability status or national origin.

title: Mobile App Marketing Specialist
description:
Company Description

Position:                   Mobile App Marketing Specialist

Term:                        1 year contract

Location:                  Toronto/Remote

Industry:                   eCommerce

 

We are seeking for an experienced Mobil App Marketing Specialist for our client, a leading global eCommerce platform.  This is a 1-year contract role.

 

The company offers a casual working start-up environment and a group of friendly and talented individuals. Our employees rank us highly in terms of commitment to work/life balance. We realize that for our people to be innovative, creative and passionate they need to feel valued and supported. We believe in rewarding all our employees with competitive salaries, performance based annual bonuses, stock options and training opportunities.

 

    Job Description

    The Role:

     

    Looking for a highly creative and performance-oriented Mobile App Marketing Specialist [1-Year Contract] to join our Digital Marketing Team. Growth marketing efforts advance at an incredible pace and we pride ourselves on using the latest digital strategies to deliver ongoing value for the organization. Our team’s core objectives are to drive customer acquisition and sales through the website and apps.

     

    Reporting to the Director, Digital Marketing, the Mobile App Marketing Specialist plays a vital role in driving growth by managing paid digital marketing programs for a rapidly.

     

    The successful candidate in this role must have mobile app marketing experience along with B2C paid advertising knowledge. A strong background in working with an MMP and Google Analytics is key. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to create and execute effective acquisition strategies, launch new marketing campaigns, build relationships with networks and publishers, and optimize activities for return on investment and cost efficiency.

    They will be responsible for launching, optimizing, and expanding mobile ad campaigns, reporting on performance and communicating results to internal/external partners, assisting in developing an ASO roadmap, working alongside the Digital Marketing team to invest budget efficiently across all channels, and leading testing strategies to constantly move the needle across targets.

    Qualifications

    The Person:

     

    You’re the first to know what’s going on in the worlds of digital and mobile app marketing. You speak a language of acronyms, like CPA, CPI, ASO, ROAS, DSP and SDK. You have broad skills and experience across PPC digital marketing channels, especially for eComm and Apps. You’re motivated to take ownership and grow by expanding new and existing strategies. You’re a true team player with a positive, collaborative attitude. You’re known for your ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies, and clearly explain them to others. You’re an entrepreneurial spirit who knows how to get things done in a fast-paced environment. You love a challenge and being challenged. You excel having your hands in many things at once.

     

    You will be responsible for:

    ·       Establishing, executing, and measuring our mobile app paid advertising initiatives to drive conversion and sales across products and services.

    ·       Demonstrating your ability to work at the planning level by generating bold and innovative ideas for growth and at the tactical level by managing advertising campaign execution, creating and optimizing campaigns, analyzing traffic data and solving problems.

    ·       Overseeing and consistently improving tracking, attribution, and analysis of key metrics including CPA, CPS, CPI, CVR, CPC, quality of the traffic by source, and return on investment.

    ·       Building, developing, and managing relationships with top mobile ad networks and publishers.

    ·       Providing complete performance reporting and analysis on all mobile app marketing campaigns and taking relevant actions on insights gained.

    ·       Working with our in-house Product team to collaborate on ASO by assisting, developing, and supporting on the execution of a dedicated roadmap.

    ·       Collaborating closely with technical, business, and support teams to manage timely projects.

    ·       Managing global budgets across multiple countries, campaigns and targets to accurately invest in KPI growth.

    ·       Proactively sourcing new opportunities for expansions across digital media channels to drive customer acquisition.

    ·       Working with our in-house creative team to write insight-driven creative briefs and develop all marketing campaigns and materials.

     

    The Skillset:

     

    Required:

    ·       2 years in digital marketing with a focus on paid mobile app marketing tied to growth success, specifically using metrics such as CPI, CPA, CPC, CR (preferably eCommerce).

    ·       Deep understanding of digital marketing strategy across PPC channels (including DSP, SSP, DMP and the programmatic ecosystem); with proven track record of optimizing campaigns to improve performance and CPA results along with audience segmentation, targeting, APIs, custom audiences.

    ·       Proficiency in working with mobile app marketing strategies, attribution and MMPs, such as Tune, Branch, Appfigures, AppAnnie & Google Analytics.

    ·       Proven track record of delivering customer acquisition growth, sales, and optimization across key metrics.

    ·       Strong time management skills: ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously.

    ·       Strong analytical and decision-making skills based on data; the ability to leverage data sources for reporting to provide meaningful insights back to business stakeholders.

    ·       A good understanding of ASO tactics with proof points and apps.

    ·       Intermediate or higher Excel proficiency.

    Nice to Haves:

    ·       Experience working with creative teams to guide and create visual and copy assets.

    ·       Familiarity with SQL, HTML, XML, and general office software. Adobe Creative Suite is desired but not essential.

    ·       Comfortable working with Javascript tags, APIs and mobile SDKs.

    ·       Knowledge of app store optimization (ASO).

    ·       Foreign language skills (French, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, etc.) or localization experience an asset.

    ·       International marketing efforts are an asset.
