title: Pricing Analyst / Analyste de prix
description:
*English will follow

L’équipe d’achats chez Altitude Sports est à la recherche d’un(e) analyste de prix qui aura comme objectif de maximiser les ventes en optimisant la stratégie de prix et d’escomptes sur Altitude-sports.com et LaDernièreChasse.com. Nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne avec un fort esprit analytique et un intérêt marqué pour le ecommerce.

Ce que tu feras:
  • Analyser les données de produits de façon à positionner nos stock afin de maximiser les marges et ventes
  • Faire des recommandations descomptes pour optimiser les marges et les ventes
  • Monter les listes de promotion et gérer lintégration des escomptes sur les plateformes
  • Sassurer que les politiques descomptes soient respectées sur nos plateformes lors dévénements promotionnels
  • Coordonner les transferts dinventaire et valider lintégration sur nos sites de ventes
  • Avoir une compréhension et connaissance des politiques et structure de prix de nos fournisseurs (MAPs)
  • Connaître les particularités de chacune des politique de prix, fenêtres de promotions, fins de saisons, etc.
  • Maintenir une communication claire et ouverte avec toutes les personnes impliquées dans la gestion des MAPs
  • Créer et analyser des rapports
  • Lister et comparer les fenêtres promotionnelles des fournisseurs et identifier les changements en ce qui concerne les politiques
Ce que tu as besoin davoir:
  • 2 à 3 années d’expérience dans un rôle analytique
  • Avoir un intérêt pour le e-commerce
  • Un diplôme universitaire en finances, administration, gestion de projets, économie, Paralegal, logistiques ou expériences équivalentes pertinentes
  • Avoir une expérience de gestion de projets multi-départemental
  • Connaissances avancées de Microsoft Office Excel, Google Sheets et une facilité générale avec l’informatique
  • Minutie, rigueur et excellente gestion des priorités
  • Être orienté sur les solutions et voir les opportunités daméliorations continues
  • Bilinguisme en français et anglais, tant à l’oral que par écrit
  • Connaissance des outils Googles (un atout)
  • Avoir de l’expérience dans le commerce au détail, industrie sports/plein air (un atout)
Ce que tu y gagneras:
  • Gros rabais sur des marques de plein air et de mode pour toi et ta famille
  • Ensemble complet davantages médicaux et dentaires
  • Accès complet aux services de télémédecine via lapplication Dialogue
  • Budget dapprentissage et de développement
  • Options de travail flexibles
  • Un espace de travail moderne au cœur de la Petite Italie à Montréal
  • Possibilité de faire partie d’équipes sportives, de participer à des sorties de groupe et des concours, grâce à notre incroyable comité social
  • Faire partie dune organisation qui sefforce davoir un impact positif sur notre environnement grâce à des normes et des initiatives en matière d’écoresponsabilité.

Altitude Sports est le leader de la vente en ligne au Canada, et se spécialise dans la rencontre de la mode avec le plein air. Fondée en 1984, l’entreprise offre des conseils de premier plan en matière d’équipement et de vêtements techniques haut de gamme, en plus d’un programme d’avantages destinés à ses membres et d’une multitude de produits soigneusement sélectionnés pour les aventures urbaines et en plein air.



The Altitude Sports buying team is looking for a Pricing Analyst whose role will be to maximize sales by optimizing the pricing and discounting strategy on Altitude-sports.com and TheLastHunt.com. We are looking for someone with a strong analytical mind and a keen interest in ecommerce.

What you will do:
  • Analyze product data in order to position our inventory in such a way to maximize margins and sales
  • Make discounting recommendations to maximize margins and sales
  • Build promotional lists and manage the integration of discounts on the platforms
  • Ensure that discount policies are respected on our platforms during promotional events
  • Coordinate inventory transfers and validate the integration on our sales sites
  • Have an understanding and knowledge of our suppliers policies and pricing structure (MAPs)
  • Know the specifics of each pricing policy, promotional windows, end of seasons, etc.
  • Maintain clear and open communication with all individuals involved in the management of MAPs
  • Create and analyze reports
  • List and compare supplier promotional windows and identify policy changes
What you need to have:
  • 2-3 years of experience in an analytical role
  • Have an interest in e-commerce
  • A university degree in finance, administration, project management, economics, paralegal, logistics or equivalent relevant experience
  • Experience managing multi-departmental projects
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel, Google Sheets and a general facility with computers
  • Thoroughness, rigor and excellent priority management
  • Solution oriented and see opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Bilingual in French and English, both written and spoken
  • Knowledge of Google tools (an asset)
  • Experience in a retail position or in the sports/outdoor industry (an asset)
Whats in it for you?
  • Discounts on outdoor and fashion brands for you and your family
  • Comprehensive health and dental benefits package
  • Full access to Telemedicine services through the Dialogue app
  • Learning and Development Budget
  • Flexible working options
  • A modern workspace in the heart of Montreal’s Little Italy
  • Opportunity to participate in sport teams, group outings and contests, courtesy of our incredible social committee
  • Working for an organization focused on making a positive impact on our environment with sustainability standards + initiatives

Altitude Sports is Canadas e-commerce leader, working and playing at the intersection of fashion and the outdoors. Founded in 1984, the company offers best-in-class advice on premium gear and technical apparel, a members-only benefits program and a curated selection of products for outdoor adventures and urban pursuits retailer.

#AltitudeSports2


Altitude Sports

title: Senior Sales Analyst
description:
At Mazda, we love sharing the beautiful machines we craft with the world. But even more, we love building relationships with the people who help make it all possible. It’s why we have created the Clubhouse of Driving Passion. We are a team of passionate car fanatics with an incurable love affair with the road. We continually strive to challenge the status quo and make it our mission to put people, quality, and experiences before transactions. Ground-breaking technologies and our latest 7th generation products are just the tip of the iceberg. If you possess an unwavering commitment to delivering service excellence and a strong desire to shatter industry stereotypes, Mazda Canada is looking for you.

The Senior Sales Analyst is a key team member of the Sales Operations department who is responsible for supporting national sales objectives and planning through providing analysis, insights, and recommendations to achieve MCI’s critical key performance indicators (KPI’s) for sales operations. This role is responsible for all national sales reporting and analytics, supporting MCI’s national production, inventory, and volume plan (GVS) for retail, fleet, and wholesale, while consistently identifying trends and utilizing a PDCA (Plan Do Check Act) approach to improve sales & profitability for MCI and our Retail partners.

Essential Duties include (but are not limited to):

National Sales Reporting
  • Develop and analyze sales reporting utilizing internal and external data to accurately report and forecast national sales results.
  • Provide insights for management to help establish and recognize trends and patterns and provide recommendations on future sales and production planning.
  • Track, analyze and evaluate critical sales KPI’s and provide proactive core business insights and strategic action plan recommendations to management.

Mazda Corporate Analysis and Studies
  • Provide analysis and insights for MC requests regarding market share, sales opportunities and risks, inventory management, market research, sales trends, and forward planning recommendations.
  • Collaborate with other internal departments and external vendors to gather the necessary information/data to provide MC with an understanding of MCI’s business strategy.

MCI Internal Meetings Support
  • Prepare high-quality status updates and insights that recognize and anticipate trends and patterns, while providing forward planning recommendations for management and senior executives.
  • Manage month-end update reporting to monitor and track performance to objectives for retail, dealer fleet, and national fleet by region and carline.
  • Support the sales operations team in the preparation and submission of our volume plan and production forecast to Mazda Corporate.

Inventory Analysis and Reporting
  • Develop and maintain monthly and ad-hoc inventory health analytics and reporting to ensure proper inventory and sales mix balance, dealer days supply, and MCI days supply.
  • Work with other Sales Operations personnel to understand production restrictions and forecast their potential impact on future sales.

MCI Internal, Regional, Retailer, and Third-party Support
  • Work in collaboration with internal departments, regional operations, Retail partners, and third-party vendors to achieve and improve MCI’s national sales and profitability objectives, while delivering exceptional customer service to all parties that are in-line with our common purpose and behavioural guidelines.

Qualifications (Experience, Knowledge & Skills Required):
  • Post-secondary degree in business analytics, data analytics, business administration, economics, statistics, data science, or business management.
  • 3 years’ relevant work experience in analytics, sales planning, business development, or an automotive sales operations environment would be considered an asset.
  • Ability to analyze, interpret, and communicate meaningful insights in data and provide recommendations to management that will impact decision making and future planning.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
  • Very detail-oriented to ensure accuracy in all aspects of the position.
  • Customer service focused for internal stakeholders and Retail partners.
  • High degree of self-initiative.
  • Ability to effectively cope with change and ambiguity, shifting gears comfortably.
  • Comfortable presenting to Senior Management and internal stakeholders
  • Bilingual (English/French) verbal and written communication skills is considered an asset.
  • Knowledge of MCI and our Dealer network is an asset.

Mazda Canada Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer andupon request by the applicant, accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process.

Mazda Canada Inc. is an Employer Partner of the Canadian Center for Diversity and Inclusion.

Mazda Canada Inc. is a proud recipient of the Top 100 Greater Toronto Employers for seven years consecutively.

title: Leasing and Marketing Coordinator (12 Month Contract)
description:
About GWL Realty Advisors

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients. 
 

This is a perfect opportunity to join a well-established real estate company. As a Leasing Representative you will be an ambassador for the organization, so we are looking for someone who is a strong fit with our values and a positive reflection of our brand!

Responsibilities:
 
  • Maintain/establish strong relationships and ongoing contact with brokers, tenants and prospective tenants through meetings, luncheons, presentations, etc.
  • Negotiating financial and legal terms of leasing Proposals, Offers and Leases to achieve maximum value for our stakeholders.
  • Conduct property tours with prospects and develop in-depth knowledge of the portfolio.
  • Manage all marketing material to the brokerage community.
  • Coordinate communication between departments, i.e., asset management, construction, development, property management and accounting.
  • Strategically plan broker functions for the purpose of marketing space and maintaining business relationships.
  • Prepare and manage annual leasing budgets and other reporting as required.
  • Represent GWL Realty Advisors by maintaining the highest standards of professional ethics and integrity.
  • Attend industry related conferences and events.
  • Provide leasing/deal making support to the leasing department’s senior managers as required.

Qualifications:
 
  • Prior commercial leasing or brokerage experience (2-3 years)
  • Real estate license required
  • Strong working knowledge of offers, leases and the overall leasing process
  • Outgoing, articulate and well spoken with strong customer service skills
  • High attention to detail with strong abilities to multitask in an ever-changing environment
  • Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills and excellent presentation skills
  • Desktop publishing skills and working knowledge of Adobe InDesign
  • Post secondary degree or diploma in Business, Commerce or Real Estate Marketing while not required, is preferred.

What we Offer
  • 3 Weeks of Vacation per year
  • 3 Paid Personal Days per year
  • Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
  • Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
  • Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness

Our Business
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

title: Marketing Operations Specialist
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Nulogy is a technology company driving toward more agility within the supply chain. Nulogy's software platform enables Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies and their contracted (external) network of manufacturers and packagers to reduce waste, reduce costs, and better serve their customers. Nulogy's software is currently being leveraged within the world's leading CPG organizations (including brands like Colgate-Palmolive, L'Oréal, and P&G) and has become synonymous with best of breed supply chain solutions. As Nulogy has grown rapidly over the last decade, the company is proud to be recognized with a variety of awards including; Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers, and Food Logistics Top 100 Software Provider and Canada's Most Admired Corporate Culture. Nulogy has also received multiple awards for company culture including most recently Canada's Great Places to Work award 2021-2022 and 2021 Best Workplace™ for Mental Wellness!

By joining Nulogy, not only will you be joining a fantastic culture of capable and motivated individuals, you'll also be joining a team that is solving challenging problems everyday with the potential to make a global impact.

 

YOUR MISSION

The Marketing Operations Specialist plays a critical role in the cross functional coordination of marketing initiatives and owning the cutting-edge applications and tools used by Nulogy's marketing team. This role is ideal for someone who has experience working with sales and in marketing roles, and is excited to join a high-growth software company.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Serve as Marketing's "owner" of Nulogy's leading-edge marketing technology stack, including Salesforce, Pardot, Bombora, LeanData, and more, assuring these systems are functional, integrated, updated, and delivering the data and reports that the marketing team requires.
  • Lead the marketing team in best practices for report/dashboard generation, lead input, database/lead management, campaign list development and management.
  • Plan and coordinate cross-functional marketing tech initiatives to achieve the goals and objectives within the required timeframe, working closely with the RevOps team.
  • Maintain the synchronization between marketing activities and technology to optimize marketing initiatives.
  • Coordinate and deliver training to marketing and sales on application updates used by the team.

EXPERIENCE & SKILL REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, communications, technology or a similar area
  • Experience in B2B technology (e.g. SaaS) marketing is required; manufacturing or supply chain experience is highly desirable.
  • 3-5 years of proven marketing operations experience, utilizing the following tools:
    - CRM (preferable Salesforce)
    - Marketing Automation (preferably Pardot)
    - Additional marketing systems, such as intent data system (preferably Bombora), Account Based Marketing tool, lead analysis and attribution tools, and more.
  • A team player with strong leadership and collaboration skills
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Dynamic, articulate, well-spoken, with strong written communication skills
  • Proactive, organized and able to handle work in stressful and uncertain environments
  • Excellent time management skills (planning & organizing) to set priorities and meet goals

WHY NULOGY

  • Nulogy was founded by 4 friends who wanted to work at a place they loved. We imbed this notion into the culture through a highly supportive benefits plan, regularly inviting family to company events, and having lots of fun as a team. Our motto is "It's Not Just Business, It's Personal". 

  • We're solving problems that no one has been able to solve before. This is an opportunity to join a team that is transforming the way that supply chains are structured.

  • Competitive benefits package: Group benefit plan including health, dental, and vision that start on day one; Parental leave: 100% top-up for 15 weeks for any parent or biological or adopted children; Unlimited paid vacation policy; RRSP Matching Program; $3k annual education budget

OUR RESPONSE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC

The well-being of our employees is our top priority. In March 2020, we made the decision to ask all employees to work from home until further notice. Everyone is set up with the tools and resources required to stay connected and help employees do their best work. We continue to follow provincial and public health agency guidelines as well as consider the safety, health and interests of our employees, as we make decisions about reopening our office.

Nulogy embraces diversity, and we recognize the need for teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We encourage everyone to apply.

title: Reality Capture Specialist
description:
Company Description

Bantrel is proud to be a leading provider of Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) services in Canada.

Since our inception in 1983, we have delivered end-to-end solutions for some of Canada’s most challenging and complex energy, mining and infrastructure projects, with an unrelenting focus on safety, while delivering to the highest degree of quality. Bantrel performs design and procurement services from our Calgary, Edmonton and Toronto offices and delivers construction management and self perform construction services at various Client sites across Canada.

Our global reach and local touch is demonstrated by our affiliation with our parent company, Bechtel Corporation, one of the largest EPC companies in the world, and with McCaig Investments, a Canadian owned private company with longstanding ties to the local business community.

www.bantrel.com

Bantrel Co.: My Company | LinkedIn

Job Description

Hatch and Bantrel have formed the Hatch Bantrel Joint Venture (HBJV) to execute engineering and construction on the BHP Jansen Potash Mine Project in Saskatchewan. After successfully completing the Definition Phase Study for the project, the HBJV is currently carrying out the Detailed Engineering Phase for the Processing, Non-Process Infrastructure (NPI) and Mining Areas of the 4.5 Mtpa Stage 1 Potash Mine. With a published TIC of US $5.3-5.7 Billion this will represent one of the largest projects and private investments in Canada. The HBJV will use a hybrid of best-in-class new developing technologies and systems as well as the proven HBJV suite of tools to execute this exciting project.

The Reality Capture Specialist will be responsible for executing the reality capture program for the Jansen Project. This includes carrying out the following activities in accordance with project standards and requirements: performing and managing 360 image capture; drone orthomosaic photogrammetry; and mobile and terrestrial laser scanning. 

* Please note this position is not eligible for a relocation subsidy or living out allowance. This will be a camp position on a rotation.

In this full-time permanent role, you will be a champion of diversity & inclusion.

Duties & Responsibilities

Role responsibilities include:

  • This role will work closely with the Jansen project’s field engineering and construction supervision teams who require digital footage as well as the project’s quality assurance site survey contractor.
  • The role is responsible to manage, plan and implement the Jansen project’s potash ‘remotely piloted aircraft system’ (RPAS) program
  • The role is responsible to conduct regular and frequent:
    • Sitewide drone orthomosaic photogrammetry flights utilizing the ‘Drone Deploy’ software.  Note that all drone flights follow the Visual Flight Rule (VFR) minimums for controlled and uncontrolled airspace, as per Canadian Aviation Regulations (CARs), Part VI General Operating and Flight Rules, Division VI – Visual Flight Rules
    • Sitewide laser scanning constructed installations using the Veerum software
    • Sitewide 360 image capture utilizing the ‘Openspace’ software
  • Maintaining positive relationships and open communication with internal and external stakeholders, maintaining professionalism in all company related activities and upholding the company values
  • Attending and actively participating in meetings
  • Excellent presentation, written and oral communication skills, listening & interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills
  • Pro-active, highly motivated and a strong team player with a positive attitude
  • Strong ownership and responsibility for a project or task of high importance to see it through to completion
  • Ability to effectively prioritize, execute and deliver tasks in a high-pressure/stress environment under tight deadlines.
  • Strong attention to detail

Following may be required:

  • Travel to module assembly yards and vendor package units
  • Conducting oral presentations to varying audiences 
Qualifications

Suitable qualifications for this role include but are not limited to:

  • A recognized degree in an engineering or scientific discipline
  • Certified/diploma engineering technologist/technician
  • Specialized courses in engineering, surveying or other relevant specialized disciplines
  • Appropriate recognized trade qualifications and experience
  • Current Canadian drivers license issued from candidates point of origin

Essential capabilities:

  • Proficiency in the use of desktop PC with Microsoft and other various software
  • Proficiency with cutting edge hardware technologies and associated software/applications including mobile devices (e.g. tablet, phone) etc.

Preferences, but not pre-requisites are:

  • Field experience
  • Practical work experience in fields of design engineering, environmental, construction, operations, commissioning etc.
  • Technical knowledge and experience in the application of engineering, environmental and construction practices sufficient to comprehend specified engineering, environmental and construction requirements
  • Proficiency and experience with laser scanning LIDAR (light detection and ranging) and photogrammetry devices, laser scanning devices, drones, and 2D & 3D camera (still and video) devices
  • For this role, a ‘remotely piloted aircraft system’ (RPAS) license is required, but is not pre-requisite.  The project will provide the training and support to obtain the necessary licence(s) required as per the Transport Canada drone operating categories (i.e. basic operations, advanced operations and possibly special flight operations)
  • There is a preference for local candidates to apply who can work 5 days on (Monday to Friday) and two days (weekend) off each week


Additional Information

Please note there is a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy in place. Prospective employees will not be asked to disclose their vaccination status and only successful candidates will be asked to provide proof of vaccination and/or to seek accommodation pursuant to the mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy prior to starting work.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for further review will be contacted. All other resumes will be retained for future consideration.

title: Category Specialist
description:
Description


Hey, we’re Article. We’re a digital-first furniture brand that’s engineering remarkably better furniture experiences. We don’t have brick-and-mortar stores, so we’re able to deliver better value on beautiful, modern furniture. Recently named one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies, we’re on the hunt for talented, enthusiastic team members to join us at our headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia.

We’re looking for a Category Specialist that will drive the Article portfolio of products for a designated room, supporting and enabling the Category Manager in striving to increase the profitability of existing products, while expanding the catalog offering and driving the launch of new product lines.

With a deep understanding of the Article brand, the North American Furniture market, and specific product knowledge, the Category Specialist will help build product lines that deliver catalog growth, while growing market share and driving portfolio profitability.

In addition, the Category Specialist will carry out product performance analysis and define strategies to optimize Article’s product collections, ensuring that product features and the Design vision is communicated accurately across all departments and facilitating product feedback loops.

The Category Specialist will also be responsible to ensure the effective translation and execution of the Product vision in go-live and campaign product launches.


What You'll Do


The Category Specialist is an essential contribution to the Article team. Responsibilities and daily tasks include:

Analysis
  • Participate in the product performance review process, suggesting product development initiatives to improve catalog performance.
  • Perform analysis of competitor collections and evaluate new opportunities.
  • Perform market pricing analysis documents for new product development.
  • Participate in and monitor Sale pricing. Communicate ‘Sold Out’ information to the Company.
  • Participate in First Order evaluation and placement.
Product Launch
  • Communicate product go-live timelines to the Marketing team and ensuring that they have all product data and information around product vision needed for campaign planning.
  • Understand the big picture view around new products, timelines, changes in plans, marketing campaigns and communicate changes timely and effectively to all cross-functional partners.
  • Suggest marketing story ideas for product plan.
  • Partner with Supply chain and Creative teams to ensure samples are on track to meet campaign shoot timelines.
  • Ensure all product attributes are updated and accurate and clearly communicated to the photography team.
  • Oversee the SKU set up process to ensure product pages contain accurate information and reflect Product team vision.
  • Partner with the copy team on validating new product and fabric names.
  • Suggest ‘goes well with’ products that compliment new products for go-live.
  •  Suggest improvements for website and marketing teams to optimize sales.
  • Participate in the SKU and trend planning process with the Product Creation Team.

Communication
  • Ensure effective communication to cross-functional partners of new product features via Product Design Guides.
  • Support the Customer-facing team with training pre-Launch of new products and continue the support post-launch as inquiries come up.
  •  Ensure feedback from Customer Care and Website reviews are shared with the Product Development Team.
  • Provide feedback on the product page, assembly instructions, hang tag, and cut sheet creation to ensure accurate product descriptions, feature lists, and care instructions that anticipate customer needs. 
  • Maintain database information to reflect price changes, promotions, and phaseouts.

Skills Knowledge and Expertise


  • 2+ years of experience in merchandising or related positions.
  • Strong analysis skills.
  • An ability to organize, plan and think strategically as well as keeping projects moving at a fast pace
  • Familiarity with project management software is an asset.
  • An ability to understand Article’s aesthetic and recognize products that fit our brand. A deep interest in modern furniture, décor, and interior design.
  • An ability to work independently and within a team
  • Strong communication skills in English
  • A professional and positive attitude
  • A passion to continuously improving and a strong work ethic

Benefits



At Article, we believe in an “Ownership Mindset” where you’ll be given autonomy and the ability to own your work. Beyond a competitive salary:
  • We reward that ownership mindset, so we offer stock options after one year of employment
  • With our fast growth, we have a culture of curiosity, where learning happens on the fly — and while having a lot of fun
  • Access to dental and health benefits package plus a health/lifestyle spending account for your total physical and mental well-being
  • 45% discount on our products so you can experience first-hand why our customers love Article 
  • Your choice of state-of-the-art laptops with the tech and tools to easily collaborate 
Most HQ employees are working from home due to COVID-19. When it’s safe to return to the office, we have flexible solutions if you want to be in the office a lot, sometimes, or not at all. 

  • When our office is safe to reopen, you’ll love that:
    • The Article HQ is a converted warehouse with in-house photo studios, an airy open layout, an open kitchen filled with snacks, premium coffees and teas (and ALL the milks).
    • A dog-friendly office. We love our dog friends here at Article. If you have a well-behaved, well-socialized pup, we’d love to have them in the office too.
    • Onsite fitness equipment, change rooms (including towel service!) and bike storage
    • Regular extra-curricular activities, such as socials, open-mics, picnics... even cross-country skiing! For now, we've replaced them with creative virtual events for the time being — like virtual trivia night or a cooking class through Zoom!
Ready to become a Particle? Apply today. We're excited to meet you.


#INDARTICLE
#ZR1
#LI-VJ11

title: Senior Retention Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
Description


Riipen is looking for a Senior Retention Marketing Specialist to join our Marketing team!

As a Senior Retention Marketing Specialist, you’ll be owning end-to-end campaign management of various retention marketing programs from pre-production, to development, execution, and reporting. Reporting to our Senior Manager, Growth Marketing, you’ll be collaborating with the marketing team and cross-functionally to drive retention on the platform.

Riipen is a mission-driven company and we look for team members who are passionate about what we’re working toward. Our company isn’t just about education, it’s built around education. We want you to enjoy what you do and who you do it with, and to grow and learn right alongside the business itself. We champion curiosity, creativity, and collaboration; and we continuously strive to create an inclusive and supportive environment where all of our team members feel they can bring their whole selves to work. 

Key Responsibilities


  • Lead the execution of retention marketing programs; 
  • Partner cross-functionally to execute on programs that drive customer engagement and repeat conversion;
  • Develop and execute A/B testing strategies to strengthen customer retention;
  • Effectively utilize marketing automation tools to support retention campaigns; 
  • Conduct research to build a better understanding of the customer journey and pain points to be addressed;
  • Identify and propose new opportunities to optimize customer retention and loyalty programs;
  • Monitor, measure, and report on campaign key performance metrics using tools such as Hubspot and Google Sheets/Excel; and
  • Determine recommendations for optimizing results to deliver on overall company goals.
  • Participate in one-on-one and team training as offered. 

Skills Knowledge and Expertise



Great Candidates Will...

  • 3+ years of experience in retention marketing, ideally for a B2B SaaS, digital marketplace, or an EdTech company (preferred but not required);
  • Strong knowledge and experience with analytics, reporting, and tracking tools like Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Tableau;
  • Experience with data management, analysis, presentation, reporting, and tracking tools with the ability to not only report but also provide recommendations for future improvements;
  • Efficient and highly detail-oriented with strong quantitative and communication skills;
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with external and internal stakeholders at various levels of the organization;
  • Be process and detail-oriented, creative, and strong analytical skills; 
  • Have the ability to consistently deliver exceptional results on demanding timelines;
  • Possess an entrepreneurial spirit with a desire to work in a fast-paced startup environment; and
  • Have a hunger and willingness to learn - we don’t expect you to tick all the boxes. However, you should be curious and ready to take on anything thrown your way. 
Bonus Points:
  • Experience and success working with remote teams; and
  • Experience using Hubspot
We ask that if you feel like you don’t check all the boxes but have the potential to learn what you don’t know, that you still apply! We believe that diverse teams are high performing teams and we strive to employ individuals with a diversity of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. 

We would love to learn more about you! How have you championed life-long learning? What draws you to contributing to our work on eliminating barriers for emerging talent? What unique experiences would you love to bring to the work we do? 

If this role excites you, we look forward to receiving your application!


What We Offer


  • Remote/travel working opportunities (when appropriate)
  • 4-weeks of annual vacation 
  • Extended Health and Dental benefits from your first day for the duration of your contract 
We appreciate your interest and application. Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. 

Riipen is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, colour, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. 

Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

However, you should be curious and ready to take on anything thrown your way.', 'Lead the execution of retention marketing programs;', 'Identify and propose new opportunities to optimize customer retention and loyalty programs;', 'Determine recommendations for optimizing results to deliver on overall company goals.', '3+ years of experience in retention marketing, ideally for a B2B SaaS, digital marketplace, or an EdTech company (preferred but not required);', 'Experience with data management, analysis, presentation, reporting, and tracking tools with the ability to not only report but also provide recommendations for future improvements;', 'Experience and success working with remote teams; and', 'Possess an entrepreneurial spirit with a desire to work in a fast-paced startup environment; and', 'Develop and execute A/B testing strategies to strengthen customer retention;', 'Strong knowledge and experience with analytics, reporting, and tracking tools like Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Tableau;', 'Have the ability to consistently deliver exceptional results on demanding timelines;', 'Participate in one-on-one and team training as offered.']

title: Marketer
description:
Job Summary: SWP West is looking to hire a marketer. We are looking for outgoing, positive and money driven marketers that can work part time throughout the next 6 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

Our hours will consist of Monday to Thursday 5:00pm to 8:00pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm, with your choice of a minimum of 4 hours per week. You can design your schedule to work around your own personal life- whether that be schooling, another job or any other commitments you may have. This job is located in the T2J postal code in Calgary AB (SE).

All training will be provided to you!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:
  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others
Pay Structure:
Every crew member can expect to make a minimum of minimum wage and our last years highest earning employees were averaging $25/hr. Specific pay structure will be discussed during our first phone call.

Bonuses:

  • Lead Count
  • Lawn Sign Count

Requirements to apply:

  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work
  • Communication

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
AMA:

YOUâ€™RE A self-motivated,

INNOVATIVE thinker.

 

Posted: 2022-04-29
Closing: When Filled
Location: Edmonton South

 

 Please note: this is a temporary placement.

 

Are you passionate about online marketing and have a keen interest in executing marketing tactics? Is it impossible for you to look at a piece of direct mail without pointing out to the person next to you all the things you would have done if you were in charge of that account? Do you like to cross the tâ€™s and dot the iâ€™s? Are you all about the details? If so, you are just the person we have been waiting for.

Hereâ€™s what we need. We need a Coordinator who thrives on a challenge, believes in the power of human connections both online and offline. We are looking for a new team member to work on marketing tactics: someone motivated and energetic; someone who will not only tell our brand story but drive our tactical advertising to generate strong sales. We need someone who can only market stuff they truly believe in. Our attitude is young, vibrant, energetic and change-oriented. Shaking things up is the name of the game. In this dynamic, competitive world, staying relevant is the name of the game and getting noticed is how you play. If this kind of challenge excites you, then you might like doing this;

 

 

WHAT MOVES YOU

  • You are a diplomatic and collaborative negotiator with good group facilitation skills.
  • You have strong interpersonal skills with a clear, positive people focus.
  • You have a demonstrated ability in planning, scheduling and executing.
  • You have the ability to think consumer first and to put yourself in their shoes.
  • You are able to identify and evaluate a problem/opportunity in context of the overall strategy.
  • You are a team player willing to take the lead when needed.
  • You have strong verbal and written communication.
  • You are a visionary and creative thinker.
  • You have a solid business acumen, organizational assessment and analytical skills.
  • You have a proven integrity and work ethic.
  • You demonstrate an ability to produce quality results within timelines.
  • You are all about the details and keeping work organized.
  • You can mine data in your sleep.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Report to the Marketing Team Lead, you will manage the scheduling, deployment and reporting of all online and offline marketing campaigns for the Association.
  • Liaise with printers, publishers, designers, suppliers and other vendors on production and delivery of marketing materials.
  • Track ongoing expenditures against budget for promotional materials, printing, media buying, tradeshows, and sponsorships.
  • Execute marketing campaigns including copywriting, A/B testing, email deployment, reporting and optimization.
  • Stay up to date with email Marketing.
  • Help meet marketing objectives and come up with creative campaigns, ideas and concepts.
  • Work all marketing departments and web related groups to deliver effective online marketing solutions to deliver on the member value proposition.
  • Build strong relationships with our external suppliers and internal departments.
  • Stay on top of administrative and advertising workflow and provide administrative and operational support.
  • Ensure critical marketing-related deadlines are met.

 

WHAT YOU'VE DONE

  • You have a post-secondary degree or diploma in marketing, communications or public relations, but weâ€™ll also consider equivalencies.
  • You have at least 2 years of marketing experience under your belt and youâ€™re ready for your next big challenge.
  • You will get bonus points for having experience with Social, SEO, PPC, email marketing, copywriting, radio, print media and advertising.
  • You are pretty tech savvy -   you know your computer systems and software, and youâ€™re always open to learning new ones.

 

WHAT YOU'LL GET

  • Competitive salary.
  • Temorary role, with possibiltyof extension.  
  • Benefits if you choose to receive them (With payroll deductions).
  • Vacation pay is added to each paycheque.
  • Great AMA discounts.
  • Unlimited learning opportunities.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Advertising Operations Specialist
description:
Advertising Operations Specialist

About Foxquilt 


Foxquilt is a leading North American Insurance technology company focused on providing small businesses insurance. Foxquilt develops, underwrites and distributes a complete line of its own commercial insurance products in the United States and Canada. The company uses a combination of data analytics and artificial intelligence to recommend the best insurance coverage and price to meet the individual needs of its small business customers. 


About You
Do you want to make a big impact and grow with one of North America’s leading Insurtech organizations?

We are looking for an Advertising Operations Specialist with 2+ Years of experience in an advertising or marketing agency. You have a thorough working knowledge with Hubspot Sales/Marketing and experience managing Google Adwords or Bing Ads.
You should be a technical thinker with an A/B test mentality who is ready to further the growth of one of Canada's leading insurtech companies.



About The Role

Foxquilt is a leading Insurance technology company focused on empowering small businesses and B2B networks to save on small business insurance. We’re introducing new products to the market that finally provide businesses with greater value and buying power. As an Advertising Operations Specialist, you will directly contribute to Foxquilt’s day-to-day paid media execution in a customer-centric way. 

Location: Toronto, (hybrid work environment)

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Implement new expansion and segmentation focused advertising, including campaign hierarchies and best fit paid media solutions across Canadian and US Markets
  • Ensure comprehensive conversion tracking, working with various platforms like Facebook, Linkedin, Google Adwords, Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager, and maintain the data integrity of all website statistics 
  • Monitor website channel performance daily, providing recommendations and implementing them to increase conversion rates
  • Leveraging data, consistently evaluate the user experience both online and offline, identifying and solving for pain points in a lead’s onboarding journey, with a particular emphasis on optimizing for segments 
  • Perform A/B testing with the intent of improving impression share, quality score and CPL
  • Monitor and assess competitor activity and keyword ranking performance
  • Work cross-functionally with Sales, Product and Tech teams for opportunities for enhancement

Education & Experience

  • 2+ Years of experience managing Google Adwords or Bing Ads with niche keyword portfolios. Candidates will need a deep understanding of search bidding strategies including tCPA & tROAS.
  • 2+ Years of experience in an advertising or marketing agency
  • Ability to use wireframes to establish the structure of end to end buying journeys
  • Thorough working knowledge with Hubspot Sales/Marketing, Call Tracking Metrics, Slack and G-Suite for Business
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

Additional Qualities:

  • Passion and/or demonstrated experience in Financial / Insurance services industries
  • Ability to leverage large datasets to extract meaningful insights and communicate performance recommendations to the broader team.
  • Experience with customer journey mapping, with proven examples of reducing friction by improving user experience 
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, with the ability to influence key stakeholders
  • Exceptional organizational and project management skills with the ability to handle multiple competing initiatives
  • The ability to build relationships and collaborate with stakeholders, product development, technology and marketing team members

What do we offer?

  • Competitive compensation
  • Equity in Foxquilt (Employee Stock Options)
  • Excellent extended health and dental benefits
  • An extra day off on your birthday!
  • Casual dress-code
  • Opportunity to work with a talented, supportive, & extremely diverse team
  • Office in Downtown Toronto (at 1 Yonge Street) with a great view of the water!
  • Social events, regular celebrations of milestones, and birthdays!
  • Flexible work environment, with opportunities to work from home
  • Fun, friendly, diverse, social, and collaborative environment
  • A place to grow and advance in your career


How do you apply for this position?

Please apply directly here with your resume. 


Foxquilt Insurance Services Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages applications from qualified candidates of all abilities who bring diverse backgrounds, skills, experiences, and ideas. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process upon request. If you require accommodation, please contact Anjan Ravi, People Operations & Culture Lead.

title: Channel Marketing Specialist
description:
Fortinet () is a global leader in cybersecurity, delivering a broad, integrated and automated security fabric to enable customers to accelerate their digital journey. Fortinet secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network—today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud, or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide, and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. Fortinet is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California, with a large Canadian presence, including our Canada HQ in Ontario and product development and FortiGuard cybersecurity teams in Burnaby. We employ over 8,000 professionals globally.

Description:

We are seeking a Channel Marketing Specialist, as a key player in driving partner marketing initiatives and programs for Western Canada. This position works collaboratively across the marketing organization and closely with sales, engineering, and corporate teams to understand revenue goals and objectives and translates those goals into measurable marketing KPIs. This person will be responsible for regional activities from start to finish, measuring the effectiveness of all marketing programs, and generating sales opportunities for their designated region.

What you’ll do:

  • Work with the Channel Marketing lead to Identify, execute and manage strategic and integrated marketing programs for Fortinet’s focus partners, in collaboration with key individuals in the Canadian sales organization
  • Understand marketing data to drive lead generation and pipeline acceleration
  • Translate strategy to growth throughout the marketing funnel > convert leads to closed sales, and achieve quarterly revenue targets (MGO)
  • Complete understanding and demonstrated track record across all marketing tactics within the channel – including digital marketing, communication strategies, social media, events and high-touch activities.
  • Quarterly planning activities that optimize Canadian partner MDF funds.
  • Foster Sales-Marketing interlock and build key relationships with the partners
  • Manage channel partner events and tradeshows, and other regional events.
  • Collaborate with the Field Marketing team to develop and execute on other marketing campaigns as required
  • Identify opportunities to improve process efficiencies and work with Fortinet tools including SharePoint and our event management platform
  • Establish, manage and analyze program metrics to ensure efficiency and goal attainment.
  • Create and deliver regular reports to leadership on campaign plans and results.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 5 years of marketing management experience at a tier 1 technology vendor preferred. 
  • Must have experience in marketing management, events, digital promotion, advertising and other tactics.
  • Requires a professional attitude and ability to manage strategic and tactical tasks.
  • Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal, and communication skills.  Experience working with channel partners, media, and industry analysts.
  • Proven ability to engage and involve sales and other executives.
  • Required a deep understanding of marketing and knowledge of marketing and sales through an indirect business model.
  • Experience developing lead generation strategies and measuring lead generation campaigns.
  • Knowledge of CRM, marketing automation systems, marketing/sales funnel, and how to maximize them for efficient lead distribution and reporting.
  • Event management experience would be an asset. 
  • Travel required throughout the region and nationally primarily to support programs.
  • Some regional travel within Canada may be required.
  • Other duties as required.
  • Preferred location is Vancouver

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Marketing or related degree.

#GD

#LI-JN1

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
Our company is looking to hire a Marketing Assistant who will be working closely with our marketing team to develop and implement marketing plans and strategies for our brands. As a successful hire, you will be tasked with helping identify marketing trends and opportunities for growth, as well as creating marketing materials such as white papers and case studies.


You will be giving presentations about our ongoing campaigns and provide administrative support to our marketing and sales teams.


To be chosen for this role, you must have a Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field. Prior work experience in administration, sales, or marketing is a plus. Effective written and verbal communication skills and a high level of attention to detail are both important keys to success in this role.


Responsibilities


  • Collaborating with the marketing manager, internal teams, clients and partners on marketing strategy.
  • Helping identify marketing trends and key opportunities for innovation.
  • Learning and working with various types of software for digital marketing.
  • Working closely with the sales and marketing department.
  • Creating marketing materials such as white papers, case studies, and presentations.
  • Giving presentations.
  • Maintaining a marketing database.
  • Providing administrative support to the marketing and sales team.
  • Preparing, formatting and editing a range of documents.
  • Understanding company product and brand.
  • General office duties.
  • Creating and interpreting a variety of reports.
  • Organizing market research.
  • Analyzing questionnaires and other forms of feedback.
  • Updating social media accounts.


Requirements


  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business or related field.
  • Administration or sales and marketing assistant experience.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.
  • A high level of attention to detail.
  • Ability to work effectively within a team and independently.
  • Experience using computers for a variety of tasks.
  • Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
  • Good organization skills.
  • Related job and internship experience.
  • Digital marketing experience.

title: Stagiaire en marketing
description:
Tannous Solutions RH, cabinet - conseil en recrutement et ressources
humaines 2.0 est à la recherche d’un super stagiaire en marketing –
création de contenus réseaux sociaux pour un contrat de stage de 6 mois.

Nous offrons aux étudiants une possibilité de se démarquer par la créativité
et l’innovation. Tu as envie de créer, d’innover et d’avoir du fun? Alors
rejoins – nous. Viens faire la différence!

Ce que tu devras faire ?
 Du webmarketing
 De la création de contenus (dont vidéo)
 De l’animation des réseaux sociaux
 De la rédaction d’articles pour notre super blog RH 2.0

Ce que tu dois avoir ?

 Une personnalité créative et engagée
 Tu suis actuellement une formation autour de la
communication digitale
 Tu es passionnée de webmarketing et de réseaux sociaux
 Tu as une connaissance professionnelle des réseaux sociaux
Facebook – Instagram – LinkedIn – Tiktok
 Tu as une connaissance approfondie de l’anglais et du français
 Tu as une connaissance approfondie des outils de web
marketing
 Tu as une bonne connaissance de Canva et de la suite Adobe
 Tu sais travailler de façon méthodique et proactive
 Tu es créatif, innovant et force de proposition
 Tu as une connaissance de Windows, MS office
 Tu as envie d’intégrer une entreprise à taille humaine et de
grandir avec cette dernière

Si tu es intéressé à nous rejoindre, merci d’envoyer ton CV a
elsatannous@elsacrecrutement.ca

title: Spécialiste Marketing
description:
Chez Annexair, notre objectif quotidien est de combiner les efforts de nos 280 employés talentueux pour atteindre un seul but : dépasser les attentes de nos clients pour nos produits.

Nos esprits brillants, qui suivent les nouvelles tendances technologiques et poussent la créativité de chacun à se dépasser, créent un environnement unique et dynamique. Êtes-vous la perle rare qui incorpore l'énergie liée aux nouvelles tendances technologiques et qui cherche à relever des défis nouveaux et passionnants ? Vous êtes la personne que nous recherchons !

Sommaire

Tout en respectant la stratégie globale de croissance de l’entreprise, le Spécialiste Marketing est responsable de la réalisation et de la gestion de tous les dossiers de l’entreprise concernant le volet communication et marketing tout en proposant un calendrier incluant des objectifs précis et bien définis. Votre étroite collaboration avec le comité de direction, les ventes, le département de développement produit et le président de l’entreprise vous placera au centre des stratégies de croissance et d’image de l’organisation. Ce poste fera de vous un partenaire multifonctionnel clé, qui devra répondre aux différentes demandes des multiples départements de l’entreprise.

De plus, dans le cadre de vos fonctions, vous devrez mettre en pratique vos connaissances au niveau des affaires entre le manufacturier(vous), le distributeur (Rep), le client(end-user) et d’autres intervenants tel qu’architectes ou ingénieurs-conseils. Votre compréhension de ce type de mise en marché vous permettra de maîtriser l’interaction de ces différents groupes qui exige une écoute et un livrable distinct.

 

Principales Responsabilités

  • Agir comme principal contact marketing et communications pour tout le réseau des représentants de nos client dans un environnement B2B composé uniquement d’ingénieurs et d’experts techniques;
  • Avec le support de l’équipe des ventes, concevoir et rédiger la documentation technique relatifs à nos produits et innovations destiné à notre clientèle et nos distributeurs;
  • Développer divers documents de marketing, brochures corporatives, vidéo et autres à des fins de marketing RH et de communication avec une population d’expert technique;
  • Créer et administrer des campagnes de marketing dans les différents médias sociaux (Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.);
  • Développer et implanter une forte image ainsi qu’un rayonnement de notre marque dans la région de Drummondville et des environs à travers différents programmes RH et à travers notre participation à la vie culturelle de la région;
  • Responsable de la gestion et de la mise à jour du ‘’Customer Relationship Management’’ (CRM);
  • Responsable de la mise en place et de la gestion de notre site web qui est en cours de révision présentement;
  • Coordonner l’équipe du centre de formation technique pour nos clients ‘’Annexair Academy’’;
  • Concevoir le matériel corporatif tel que cartes d’affaires, lettres types et autres standardisations de l’image de marque;
  • Veillez à ce que les normes graphiques et l’image globale de l’entreprise soient respectées;
  • Responsable de la gestion du volet des produits promotionnels tel que : cadeaux-clients, certificats, promotions, etc;
  • Planifier et coordonner la logistique lors des visites de nos clients durant tout leur séjour (hôtel, restaurant, transport, activités, tournée d’usine, etc.);
  • Organiser et coordonner les évènements lors des foires commerciales, dont un évènement d’envergure annuel, ainsi que certains petits évènements régionaux, majoritairement aux États-Unis (booking, préparation, matériel, budget, etc.) ;

Expérience et Formation

  • Détenir un BAC en marketing et posséder un minimum de 5 ans d’expériences dans des responsabilités similaires.
  • Maîtrise de Microsoft office, Adobe InDesign, Illustrator et Photoshop;
  • Connaissance de CRM, WEB, Google Analytic, Adwords.
  • Capacité à travailler dans un environnement technique composé d’expert et d’ingénieurs;
  • Démontrer un bon sens des priorités, d’ouverture et de créativité;
  • Habilité à travailler sur plusieurs projets de front avec différents échéanciers;
  • Consciencieux des petits détails et priorise le travail bien fait du premier coup;
  • Habileté à juger quand et à qui déléguer des tâches afin de rencontrer les échéanciers sans risquer la qualité du travail à produire;
  • Habileté à initier et à maintenir des contacts professionnels externes, organisations, compagnies et associations;
  • Bilinguisme Anglais & Français essentiel.
  • Connaissance technique HVAC (Un atout)

Vous êtes la personne que nous recherchons !"]

title: Coordinator, Influencer Marketing
description:
ROLE: COORDINATOR, INFLUENCER MARKETING 

TEAM: CONNECTIONS

Salt XC is an agency driven by the philosophy of Experiential CommerceTM. Our unique framework for designing better consumer experiences that earn attention and drive action. We take an integrated approach that connects your consumerâ€™s online and offline experiences through data, media and the memorable moments that drive brand transactions.  

OVERVIEW  

The Coordinator of Influencer Marketing is a collaborative, highly organized, and results-driven people-person, interested in executing world-class influencer programs for Salt and its clients. The best candidate for this role would be a digital native with a passion for social media marketing, user-generated content, trend analysis and influencer culture. They are interested in functioning as part of a high-performance influencer marketing team, collaborating with content creators to tell brand stories, drive awareness, and spur conversion using innovative tactics and tools.  

Reporting to the Associate Director of Influencer Marketing, the Coordinator of Influencer Marketing will serve as the main point of contact between Saltâ€™s clients and contracted content creators, building authentic two-way relationships with influencers of every size and scale. This role will require the candidate to quickly learn, adopt and deploy the Salt technology stack, and make recommendations as required for enhanced tools and processes that will better serve the companyâ€™s needs. From influencer selection to onboarding, campaign management, tracking, amplification, and reporting, this role will be essential to ensure client influencer programs are successful and optimized from end-to-end. 

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES  

  • Influencer Management 

    • Establish and execute key processes for the successful management of scaled influencer programs 

    • Source and identify the best partners for each program  

    • Establish, maintain, and nurture long-term relationships with influencer partners 

    • Negotiate contracts and manage influencer payments 

    • Review influencer assets and ensure they reflect client needs 

    • In collaboration with clients, draft and communicate campaign briefs to influencer partners. 

  • Research & Reporting 

    • Deliver regular reports on campaign KPIs, highlights, learnings, and opportunities 

    • Make recommendations to internal and external teams about content amplification and usage across marketing channels, where relevant 

    • Assist in the development of influencer plans, strategies, and campaigns 

    • Execute influencer gifting campaigns, providing recommendations on how to personalize and continually improve gifting programs. 

  • Business Operations 

    • Dive into campaign data to seek out trends in influencer activations and results 

    • Research emerging influencer, social media, and affiliate trends, ensuring Salt is providing best-in-class recommendations to clients across industries 

    • Remain up-to-date on relevant laws and best practices regarding influencer advertising and disclosure requirements 

    • Various administrative tasks, such as maintaining a library of influencer content, follow-ups on outstanding content, influencer program tracking, ad-hoc reporting, and other needs as required 

EXPERIENCE & SKILLS  

  • Minimum 1-2 years working at an Influencer agency, media vendor, talent firm or equivalent  

  • Bachelor's degree or Diploma in Marketing, Communication or Advertising required 

  • Retail and CPG experience preferred but not required  

  • Strong presentation, communication, and relationship management skills 

  • Prior experience with influencer discovery, management and boosting tools preferred 

  • High attention to detail 

  • Prior hands-on experience with Facebook business manager, GAM, TikTok for Advertisers, Snap, and other platform self-serve media tools  

  • Google Certifications is a huge plus 

  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed and sometimes involved instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form 

  • Experienced in some facets of the digital marketing space: CRM, SEO, SEM, programmatic, social, mobile, video 

  • Experience with e-commerce platforms such as Shopify, Magento, Big Commerce is an asset 

  • Working knowledge of basic HTML, CMS Platforms such as WordPress are an asset 

  • Creative, hard-working, and motivated to take smart risks  

SALTâ€™S OFFERS 

  • A competitive company benefits package. 

  • Business casual working environment. 

  • Flat corporate structure. Youâ€™ll be collaborating with both your peers as well as senior executives on the regular. 

  • An agile, fun, and innovative start-up culture. 

SALTâ€™S VALUES 

  • Salt of the Earth:â€¯We aspire to be good people. People who are humble, hardworking, honest, and kind to one another. People who are fun to work with, who trust and are respectful of each other.â€¯â€¯â€¯ 

  • Do What's Right: We donâ€™t believe in taking shortcuts. We believe in doing what is right, not what isâ€¯easy or expected.â€¯â€¯â€¯ 

  • Earn It:â€¯We believe in rolling up our sleeves and not being afraid of hard work. We want toâ€¯earn the respect of others, the results we deliver and the praise we receive.â€¯â€¯â€¯ 

  • Make things Better:â€¯We aspire to leave things better than we found them and are always looking for a better way. Great ideas come from anywhere, they come from being curious, passionate, solutions-oriented people who care deeply about what we doâ€¯â€¯â€¯ 

  • Seek Different Perspectives:â€¯We believe in embracing difference; the perspective it brings, how it challenges us, how it spurs creativity, and its ability to make us better.â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯

title: Brand Marketing Specialist
description:
At New/Mode, we are a hard-working team dedicated to building a fairer and more sustainable world. We founded one of the worldâ€™s largest and most successful online campaigning organizations, OpenMedia, and led campaigns for progressive advocacy organizations and politicians. Our founders saw the power of people-driven campaigns first-hand. Now, weâ€™re putting the powerful tools used by the worldâ€™s leading campaigns into more campaignersâ€™ pockets. New/Mode was born to help progressive organizations activate grassroots power and win their campaigns.

Position Summary

You will be supporting the execution of the Marketing Roadmap as created in collaboration with the Director of Sales and Marketing. You are keen to stay informed about the market, industry trends, and the competitive landscape, while helping strategize and implement marketing, branding, and advertising plans. Day to day, you could be creating marketing and sales collateral, joining planning sessions, and coming up with creative and new ideas for New/Modeâ€™s brand to stay relevant and fresh. You would also be thinking of new content and social media ideas to engage our core audience of progressive campaigners that are looking to reach decision makers and win campaigns. 

Your Essential Functions and Responsibilities

  • Experience with graphic design and engaging cross-functional teams to understand our organisationâ€™s Brand Identity 
  • Website development and design
  • Support Marketing Team with creating collateral for our Marketing Campaigns to ensure design and execution are consistent
  • Product art direction
  • Project management
  • Maintain brand integrity across all company marketing initiatives and communications
  • Analysing brand positioning and consumer insights
  • Translate brand elements into plans and go-to-market strategies
  • Monitor market trends, research consumer markets and competitorsâ€™ activities
  • Content management and delivery 
  • Manage and optimise social media channels 
  • Create and manage online events that are relevant to our target audience 
  • Oversee the tools and technology needed to operate a successful inbound/outbound marketing program (ie. Hubspot, SEM Rush, ZoomInfo, etc.).
  • Ensure the New/Mode website is compelling, fresh and optimised 
  • Track marketing metrics and provide timely and accurate reports as requested by the department director, CEO & COO.
  • Contribute to and support sales and marketing strategies and campaigns.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of New/Modeâ€™s products, services and features, along with leading trends and best practices for digital advocacy and engagement.

Your Special Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities 

  • 2  years of experience in a digital marketing, marketing operations, CRM administration, paid advertising, or a similarly aligned role 
  • Familiarity with inbound marketing best practices, systems, processes, and automations
  • SEO and content marketing 
  • Google analytics 
  • Email marketing
  • Graphic design - Familiarity with Photoshop, Canva,InDesign
  • Experience administering a paid ad budget, creating campaigns, deploying ads, and monitoring the results
  • Strong willingness to share knowledge and support the development and growth of others
  • Exceptionally organised
  • Strong growth mindset with willingness to learn and try new approaches and encourage your team to do the same 
  • Excellent time management skills and the ability to work remotely
  • Superior knowledge of Hubspot 

Total Rewards 

  • 60-65k CAD Base Salary
  • Generous paid time off, personal days and sick leave
  • Health Spending Account
  • Company stock options

Flexible Work Options

This opportunity might accommodate a custom work schedule and/or reduced hours to suit your unique life circumstances including but not limited to your desire/need to:

  • Care for an elderly family member 
  • Pick up kids early in the afternoon
  • Train for the world chess championship, esports competitions, crickets games, meditation retreat, or Paralympics medal 
  • Invest time volunteering and giving back to the community
  • Develop a passion project, prepare for the shark tank pitch, or got talent singing competition

Please bring up your preferred schedule/hours at the first stages of the interview process so the hiring team can share what might align with the requirements of the position, team, and organization.

Work Locations

This position is ideally suited for someone comfortable with remote work. Our ideal candidate is based where we have existing teams: Toronto, Vancouver, or Montreal. However, exceptional candidates will be considered anywhere in Canada.

About New/Mode

New/Mode is a purpose-driven enterprise, providing sophisticated civic engagement tools to the worldâ€™s most important causes. At New/Mode, you have the opportunity to embrace open-source software and be part of an organization supported and owned by a network of non-profit and social impact investors.
You believe in a new mode of operation based on the following core values, and partner with people and organizations who share them, there might be alignment.

  • Empowerment. Empower people to speak in their own voice and take action.
  • Collaboration. Aim to help build a society that embraces new tools and processes for sharing and cooperation.
  • Empathy. Celebrate and engage with diversity, uncover othersÃ¨ needs, and find common ground and shared wins. 
  • Participation. Believe decision-making should be open, transparent, collaborative and focused on those who will be most impacted in their daily lives. 
  • Sustainability. Help create more sustainable, vibrant, and resilient communities.
  • Fairness. Work towards a fairer economy and society. 

New/Mode is an equity-seeking organization. People who identify as being from marginalized communities, including women, Indigenous peoples, visible minorities, people with disabilities, people identifying as LGBTQ2, and people from low-income backgrounds are especially encouraged to apply.

title: Communications Specialist
description:
Who we are

Tribe Property Technologies is a prop-tech company simplifying residential community living (think: condo living) through the modernization of the property management industry. Our Vision is to change the way people view community living, connect with their neighbors and interact with their homes, while our Mission is to provide the most comprehensive suite of products andâ€¨services for building and managing residential communities.

Our name Tribe comes from our experiences with community and community living. We define it as A group of people having a common character, occupation, or interest, with a sense of connection, kinship, and community. If you have a minute, you can read more about our name from our CEO, Joseph Nakhla.   

We believe in a holistic vision of community living, supported by education, connection, and communication. We work together with owners, residents, councils/boards, real estate developers, and vendors to understand the complete community from pre-construction to post-occupancy, making the community our business.

Tribe is the sixth-largest strata/condo and rental management company in Canada with offices in downtown Vancouver, Delta, Victoria, Kelowna, Kamloops, Calgary, and Cambridge. We develop our platforms in-house and we are pretty proud of our Tribe Home community platform. Tribe is a publicly-traded company on the Toronto Venture Exchange under TRBE.

Our Culture

We are a closely-knit team of 200 talented individuals working in a variety of environments depending on the role, team, and personal needs of our employees. We have monthly Town Halls, fun team-building events, and opportunities to connect whether we are in-person or virtual.

Work Perks

In addition to vacation allotment, Tribe closes for the week in between Christmas and New Yearâ€™s providing additional days off, and beginning at year one, you get to celebrate your annual workaversary with the day off! Through our company partnerships program, you have access to discounts for food delivery, home internet and cable packages, fitness equipment, and more. And of course, we offer the usual health, vision & dental coverage.

Role Overview

The Communications Specialist is responsible for working across corporate communications, internal and external, and public relations to support Tribeâ€™s narrative of simplifying residential (multi-family) living, and doing so with heart.

Weâ€™re looking for a natural-born communicator with an emphasis on writing expertise, who gets that communication is the cornerstone of every lasting relationship â€“ be it with colleagues or clients. This role reports directly to the VP, of Marketing and Communications and will work closely alongside our marketing team to support all departments within our company. You are tech-savvy and people-focused. You get that You can provide communication that supports our pillars of Informed, Educated, and Connected. You are bold, straightforward, and genuine, with a dash of humor. Above all, you value collaboration and being a part of a team.

Responsibilities

  • Support an internal communication strategy that connects, informs, and engages more than 200 people across seven offices across Canada
  • Write, edit and craft internal employee communications ensuring consistency and adherence to the corporate style guide
  • Oversee Tribeâ€™s editorial calendar and management of content for internal and external audiences, ensuring alignment to priorities and consistency in messaging
  • Manage, prepare, edit and distribute communications materials including newsletters, daily news stories, leadership messages and emails, website content, speaking/interview notes, and executive briefing documents across our business
  • Liaise with the brand, digital and social experts, demand generation teams, graphic designers, translators, and other internal stakeholders to develop, finalize and distribute communications
  • Proactively and consistently contribute ideas and creativity to brainstorming and planning discussions, as well as team meetings, with accountability to deliver against quarterly plans
  • Create visually appealing materials and presentations for internal use, with the support of a team graphic designer
  • Measure and report on communications results to stakeholders and the wider team
  • Support additional communication requirements as needed, including press releases
  • Assist with other communications projects as required

Qualifications

  • College Diploma/University Degree or equivalent in Communications, Journalism, English, Marketing, or a related field A minimum of 3 years of proven experience in a communication and engagement role
  • Experience in, building relationships with internal and external stakeholders of all levels
  • Ability to manage large, complex integrated communications programs and projects
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Strong planning, project management, and organizational skills
  • Experience using CRMs such as HubSpot, SalesForce, and other tech tools
  • Experience working with MS Teams and SharePoint

Core Competencies

  • Strategic and growth mindset
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
  • Ability to think outside the box and develop engaging and innovative communications messages and stories
  • Firm understanding of reputation management
  • Excellent problem-solving ability
  • Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to work in a team and independently as well as with minimal supervision 
  • Proactive, highly motivated and results-driven
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to influence and manage a wide range of stakeholders 
  • Demonstrated ability to function efficiently under pressure with constantly changing priorities and deadlines
  • Tech-savvy 

Compensation and Benefits

  • This is a full-time position with a competitive salary and benefits
