title: BILINGUAL MARKETING SPECIALIST
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Marketing Specialist reports to the Manager of Media Relations and Public Affairs and works with internal stakeholders to develop marketing campaigns to support products, programs and services. This Specialist also leads campaign execution and analyzes performance reporting on results. The CBA provides a variety of benefits including a 33.75 hour work week, summer hours, and holiday closure in December.

LOCATION

66 Slater Street, Suite 1200 Ottawa, ON

ANNUAL SALARY

$49,999.95

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Works with internal stakeholders to develop marketing campaigns
  • Writes and implements campaign briefs including:
    1. Identifying marketing objectives
    2. Writing key messages for various audiences and marketing channels
    3. Identifying audience segments and appropriate marketing channels
    4. Budgeting for digital advertising campaigns
    5. Developing timelines for related communications activities
    6. Define targets to measure success
  • Writes and edits creative and engaging marketing copy and social media posts
  • Defines, tracks and reports on KPIs to measure success and updates messaging and collateral to maximize campaign success
  • Proactively identifies enhancements and improvements to existing member communications
  • Stays up to date with digital and traditional communication and marketing trends.
  • Ensures the branding standards are met in all publications, distributed materials and office communications
  • Other related duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Education

A college diploma or university degree in marketing or a related discipline such as multi-media is required. Equivalencies will be considered.

Experience

A minimum 3 years of experience in a marketing role within a non-profit and/or member-based association. Equivalencies from the private sector will be considered.

Skills and Abilities

  • Demonstrable work experience with marketing campaigns and web technologies, such as online tools and social media
  • In-depth knowledge of:
    1. Social media platforms
      • LinkedIn
      • Facebook
      • Twitter
      • Instagram
      • YouTube
    2. Adobe CC products
    3. Microsoft Office
    4. Email, web and social media analytical tools
    5. Digital advertising tools
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, written and verbal and detail-oriented
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Excellent organizational skills and adherence to strict deadlines
  • Excellent client service approach through interaction with staff members, directors, executive directors
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively, under pressure, and as a part of a team
  • Knowledge of the Canadian legal system is preferred
  • Bilingualism is required (English and French)

This Job Description is not meant to be all-inclusive, rather an overall representation of the main responsibilities, tasks and qualifications.

Interested applicants must submit a cover letter and resumé.

We sincerely thank all applicants for their interest; however, we will only contact those under consideration. All applicants are encouraged to join the CBA Talent Community which establishes a list that may be considered for similar positions of various tenures.

The CBA is committed to the principles of equity, diversity, and inclusion in its learning, work environments and in its operations. We encourage applications from traditionally marginalized groups. We believe in and promote the rights of all persons with disabilities as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA 2005) and its related Accessibility Standards Regulations. To meet this obligation, the CBA will make appropriate accommodations available upon request. Please inform the CBA, in advance, of the need for accommodation(s) during the recruitment and selection process to ensure your equal participation.



RÉSUMÉ DU POSTE

La ou le spécialiste en marketing relève du ou de la gestionnaire bilingue des relations avec les médias et des relations publiques, et travaille avec les intervenants internes à l'élaboration de campagnes de marketing visant la promotion des produits, des programmes et des services. En outre, ce ou cette spécialiste supervise l'exécution des campagnes et analyse les rapports sur le rendement d'après les résultats. L'ABC propose divers avantages, notamment une semaine de travail de 33,75 heures, des heures d'été et la fermeture des bureaux pour les vacances en décembre.

ENDROIT

66, rue Slater, bureau 1200, Ottawa (Ontario)

SALAIRE ANNUEL

$49,999.95

RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Travailler avec les intervenants internes à l'élaboration de campagnes de marketing
  • Préciser les objectifs de marketing.
  • Déterminer les segments de marché à cibler pour les publics internes et externes
  • Définir et rédiger les messages clés.
  • Tenir compte des contenus créatifs collatéraux nécessaires au soutien des diverses campagnes.
  • Rédiger le matériel de marketing.
  • Rédiger et réviser des contenus originaux et attrayants pour la publicité, et les publications sur les médias sociaux. Déterminer les médias de communications appropriés. Définir les indicateurs de rendement clés (IRC), en faire le suivi et en faire le rapport pour évaluer le degré de réussite, et revoir les messages et les contenus collatéraux d'après les résultats.
  • Gérer les partenariats avec les fournisseurs de médias, s'il y a lieu.
  • Établir les budgets de la publicité en ligne.
  • Préparer le calendrier des activités de communication pour toute la campagne.
  • En faisant preuve d'initiative, repérer les possibilités d'amélioration des communications pour les membres.
  • Rester au fait des tendances des communications et du marketing traditionnels et électroniques.
  • Élaborer et gérer un programme de marketing d'influence.
  • S'assurer que l'ensemble des publications, du matériel diffusé et des communications organisationnelles répondent aux normes de la marque.
  • Effectuer des tâches connexes, au besoin.

QUALITÉS

Éducation

Un diplôme décerné par un collège ou une université dans le domaine du marketing ou dans une discipline connexe telle que les multimédias, est exigé. Les équivalences seront examinées.

Expérience

Minimum de 3 ans d'expérience de travail en marketing dans une association de membres ou sans but lucratif. Les équivalences seront examinées.

Compétences et aptitudes

  • Expérience de travail attestée dans des campagnes de marketing et avec les technologies Web, notamment les outils en ligne et les médias sociaux.
  • Connaissance approfondie des éléments suivants :
    1. Produits Adobe CC
    2. Dreamweaver et Photoshop
    3. Microsoft Office
    4. Outils analytiques des courriels, du Web et des médias sociaux
    5. Outils de publicité sur le Web et dans les médias sociaux
  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication et de présentation, à l'oral comme à l'écrit, et souci du détail.
  • Excellentes aptitudes d'analyse.
  • Excellentes aptitudes organisationnelles, et capacité de respecter des échéances serrées.
  • Excellente approche du service à la clientèle fondée sur l'interaction avec les employés, les administrateurs et l'équipe de direction.
  • Capacité de travailler efficacement sous pression au sein d'une équipe.
  • Connaissance du système juridique canadien, idéalement.
  • Bilinguisme (anglais et français)

La présente description de poste ne se veut pas exhaustive, mais une représentation générale des responsabilités, tâches et qualités rattachées au poste.

Veuillez soumettre une lettre de présentation et un résumé.

Nous remercions sincèrement tous les candidats et candidates de leur intérêt; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu'avec ceux et celles dont la candidature est retenue. Tous les candidats sont encouragés à se joindre à la Communauté de talents de l'ABC qui établit une liste pouvant être considérée pour des postes similaires de diverses durées.

L'ABC s'engage à respecter les principes d'équité, de diversité et d'inclusion dans ses formations, dans ses milieux de travail et dans ses activités. Nous encourageons les candidatures de groupes traditionnellement marginalisés. Nous croyons aux droits de toutes les personnes handicapées et en faisons la promotion, comme le stipulent le Code des droits de la personne de l'Ontario, la Loi de 2005 sur l'accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l'Ontario (LAPHO) et les règlements connexes sur les normes d'accessibilité. Afin de respecter ces obligations, l'ABC met en place des mesures d'adaptation appropriées sur demande. Veuillez informer l'ABC, à l'avance, de vos besoins en matière de mesures d'adaptation pendant le processus de recrutement et de sélection afin de garantir votre participation égale.

title: Marketing Specialist - 1 Year Contract (Vancouver, British Columbia, C)
description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract 
Reference code: 103110   
Primary Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada 
All Available Locations: Vancouver 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.
Have many careers in one Firm.
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness. 

Do you want to serve as a trusted advisor and work with the Marketplace leaders to plan and execute a full complement of marketing initiatives to drive growth and enhance market positioning? Read more below!

What will your typical day look like?

As a Marketing Specialist, you will be part of an overall internal marketing agency, responsible for end-to-end support of marketing and communications campaigns. You will have oversight for implementing marketing tactics such as thoughtware development, event planning, online activities, sponsorships, speaker and eminence programs. In this fast-paced role, you will deliver marketing campaigns on time, on schedule and on budget; all while delivering ROI. You will be working in close collaboration with our studio agency teams to deliver world-class campaigns to the client/business.

About the team

Deloitte’s in-house marketing agency is seeking a Marketing Specialist to join the team.  
As an integral member of a high performing team, you will be responsible for working collaboratively with other team members and leading the execution of marketing programs, events and initiatives.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone who has:

  • Minimum 3-5 years of marketing experience
  • Completed undergraduate degree
  • Demonstrated experience in event coordination and collateral development
  • Experience working with senior professionals in a fast paced environment often with tight deadlines
  • Strong project management and event planning skills
  • Lead the implementation of marketing and communications campaigns or campaign initiatives as identified in the marketing plan. This may include, but is not limited to tactics such as: 
    • collateral and thought ware development
    • event planning including virtual
    • digital and social media coordination
    • sponsorships
  • Have a high standard of quality and provide quality assurance review on all projects
  • Bilingualism is an asset

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You?
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Spécialiste CRM
description:
SPÉCIALISTE CRM

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un spécialiste CRM afin de joindre l’équipe d’acquisition/intégration sous le portefeuille de Natasha Villeneuve. Si vous aimez travailler pour Harris, que vous avez un intérêt quelconque pour un nouveau défi, que le mot « CRM » vous parle ou que vous souhaiteriez prendre en charge certaines tâches/responsabilités qu’apporte la gestion/administration de CRM ou encore, que vous convoitez un rôle de spécialiste du CRM, ce poste est pour vous !

Le spécialiste CRM est un joueur important dans une équipe multidisciplinaire et travaille en collaboration avec les champions CRM des différentes BUs et leur direction. Son rôle principal est de comprendre et d’analyser les besoins des BUs en lien avec leurs processus d’affaires et ainsi, proposer des solutions simples et efficaces qui seront intégrées dans leur CRM et ce, tout en maintenant son évolution. Le candidat doit avoir le souci du détail, être persévérant, autonome et en mesure de répondre aux exigences d’un environnement qui évalue rapidement, tout en conservant une attitude positive.   

Ce que vous allez faire :

  • Assumer un rôle-conseil auprès des champions CRM des unités d’affaires;
  • Analyser, développer, tester et déployer des personnalisations et des fonctionnalités du CRM et assurer, la formation et le support auprès des champions;
  • Assurer l’administration et la gestion de CRM au quotidien.

Ce qu’il vous faut :

  • Bac en informatique ou administration ou expérience équivalente;
  • Capacité d’analyse des besoins et faire preuve d’adaptabilité lors de situations d’imprévues et de changements;
  • Connaissance d’Adxstudio (Portail Client);
  • Expérience en configuration Dynamics CRM et en gestion de projet;
  • Bonne connaissance des outils Visual Studio, Xpertdoc Smart Flows, XRM Toolbox, Ribbon Workbench, Plugin Registration Tool,Ultimate Workflow Tookit, Dynamics 365 Workflow Tools, Workflow Scheduler, CRM Xpress Drag-n-Drop Utilities, CRM String Workflow Utilities, CRM Note Workflow Utilities, CRM DateTime Workflow Utilities, Dynamics 365 PowerPane, LevelUp for Dynamics 365, Cobalt Snapshot.
  • Connaissances des meilleures pratiques pour déployer les personnalisations et expérience en migration/importation de données;
  • Avoir une très bonne connaissance de CRM Dynamics, de ses fonctionnalités d’intégration, ses limitations et des bonnes pratiques de son utilisation en entreprise;
  • Bilinguisme

Points bonis si :
       Connaissances de :

  • JavaScript et CSS;
  • HTML / ASPX;
  • C#;
  • CRM Outlook Client;
  • Intégration SharePoint.

Nous vous offrons :

  • Le télétravail et les horaires flexibles;
  • Possibilité de réaliser vos objectifs professionnels;
  • Tous les autres avantages Harris que vous connaissez déjà !

Si vous êtes convaincus que vous êtes le collaborateur que l’on recherche et que vous souhaitez vous joindre à nous, il ne vous reste plus qu’à poser votre candidature pour qu’on puisse communiquer avec vous !

title: Research Associate
description:
Reference # :22-23440Title :Research Associate
Location :Edmonton, AB
Position Type :Contract
Experience Level :Start Date / End Date :05/02/2022 / 11/01/2023 
Description
Our client has pursued and achieved breakthroughs in medicine for more than three decades, with the goal of creating a better, healthier world for all people. They have commercialized more than 25 innovative medicines, helping to transform treatment for people living with HIV, viral hepatitis, cancer and other life-threatening diseases. Through their ongoing bold and transformative science, they’re driving innovations that have the potential to become the next generation of life-changing medicines.

We are currently seeking a "Research Associate" for a contract role in Edmonton, AB. Please apply if you would be interested and available for it.

Duration: 6 Months

Requirement:
  • Independently plans and executes experiments that support development activities and project goals.
  • Demonstrates and applies advanced level of understanding project goals and methods.
  • Selects appropriate methods and techniques in performing methods development.
  • Recommends alternatives, researches new methods and techniques and proactively seek out senior personnel to discuss potential solutions to problems.
  • Participates in group meetings.
  • Presents results of work, interprets data, and draws conclusions regarding presented material and nature of work.
  • Works with minimal supervision on projects of moderate to complex scope.
  • Uses good verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills to provide insight into the processes used to achieve results of assigned tasks.
  • Prepares validation protocols and reports or analytical development reports.
Regards,
Ankush Jha
Cell: 289-236-0817
Email: ankush.jha@artech.com

title: Ad Operations Coordinator - Toronto
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Acast was founded in 2014 and is the world’s largest independent podcast company.
A pioneer in the open podcast ecosystem, Acast’s powerful podcast monetization marketplace delivers for
creators and advertisers alike. Advertisers can efficiently target an engaged audience of listeners through
dynamic ad insertion, while podcasters are given access to a range of monetization opportunities — including
paid subscriptions through Acast+ — and the necessary tools to expand their listener base.
If you listen to a podcast hosted with Acast and hear an ad, it’s Acast delivering that audio behind the scenes
— and sharing revenue with the podcaster.

The company has a global footprint across 12 countries and, during 2021, had 3.75 billion listens on Acast-
connected podcasts. Today, Acast hosts 40,000 shows. Acast’s headquarters are located in Stockholm,

Sweden and the Company has nine local subsidiaries in the UK, US, Australia, Norway, France, Germany,
Ireland, Mexico and Canada.

About the role

Reporting to the Global Head of Ad Operations, you will be responsible for delivering successful campaigns for our advertisers in Canada and a US Group Business team. The role will focus on excellence in the delivery of our commercial campaigns. The Ad Operations Coordinator will ensure campaigns are set-up on time and correctly, manage campaign optimizations, and generate campaign reports. You will help manage our ad inventory and provide campaign forecasts to our Ad Sales team. You will provide insights and recommendations for future campaigns.

Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.

Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We’re global and have remote teams, so it’s even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome.We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.

We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!</section>

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Global University Systems (GUS) is focused on becoming one of the world’s most dynamic, inclusive, and diverse education organisations. GUS is an international network of higher education institutions, brought together by a shared passion for accessible, industry-relevant qualifications. GUS delivers a wide variety of programmes, including bachelor’s degree programmes, master’s degree programmes, professional training, English Language training, and corporate & executive education. When someone chooses to study at one of our institutions– whether on campus in Europe, North America, or even in their own home – they’re joining a network of 80,000 students worldwide.


This position will report directly to Marketing Manager and Head of Marketing & Communications. The successful candidate for this role will be responsible for executing social media strategies and campaigns, communicating with students, creating content for social media, organizing events and producing video and photo content. Marketing Coordinator will also collaborate with key players on the Marketing & Communications team and other departments to assist with various projects and campaigns as needed.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Support the marketing department by creating and scheduling social media content. Maintaining and updating social media calendar
  • Conduct research to analyze market trends, customer behavior, and competitive landscape, and prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data
  • Plan and manage various online and on-campus events
  • Create photo and video content as needed
  • Manage and oversea media release forms
  • Manage and coordinate filming schedules. Work with 3rd party videographers and photographers.
  • Discover any current marketing and social media trends that may be applicable. Ensure maximum effectiveness by staying up-to-date with any changes on all social platforms.
  • Execute social media strategy on all platforms
  • Create engaging content in text, image, and video format. Collaborate with designers and copywriters on creating informative, attractive content
  • Measure all social media traffic. Define social media KPIs
  • Collaborate with other teams and stakeholders
  • Facilitate conversations online with students, respond to comments daily, build and maintain an online community
  • Report on online feedback and reviews from students
  • Create an optimal schedule for posting, considering both customer engagement metrics as well as web traffic
  • Oversee the layout of all social media accounts
  • Suggest ways to optimize content and attract prospective students
  • Measure campaign success
  • Use social media marketing tools to improve efficiency and manage all accounts effectively
  • Work closely with current students and alumni on content creation

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, or similar
  • Past work experience as a marketing coordinator or similar role
  • Knowledge of traditional and digital marketing, content marketing, and social media marketing
  • Excellent English writing and communication skills
  • Proficiency in full Microsoft Office suite
  • Must be an organized multitasker able to handle many diverse projects at once and meet tight deadlines
  • Working knowledge of design and email software
  • Knowledge and expertise with multiple social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, TikTok and YouTube
  • Ability to deliver creative text, image, and video content
  • Familiar with marketing channels and online marketing strategies
  • Ability to grasp future digital technology trends and act on them proactively
  • Strong attention to detail

We acknowledge receipt of your resume for a position at Global University Systems and sincerely appreciate your interest in our company.

We will screen all applicants and select candidates whose qualifications meet our requirements. We will carefully consider your application during the initial screening and will contact you if you are selected to continue for the next stage of the recruitment process. We wish you every success.

GUS is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, or religion or belief.

title: Coordinator, Loyalty Marketing
description:
Job Description

The Coordinator, Loyalty Marketing, will be responsible for the day-to-day management of the email marketing calendar including scheduling, targeting & deployment activities. They will work closely with the Marketing and Loyalty Analytics teams to provide suggestions & reporting that will inform content and business decisions. They will be required to report on campaign performance and routinely interpret email communication and campaign results data

What The Role Is:

 

  • End-to-end ownership of our B2B Marketing email calendar and management of cross-functional email requests to support deployment of key customer touchpoints
  • Work in partnership with the Marketing, Data and Technologies, Analytics, Film & Store Teams as well as External Agency Partner in the development of best-in-class email journeys
  • Leverage test and learn methodologies to continuously drive toward increased relevancy with weekly emails & marketing campaigns
  • Work with Scene and Guest Services Partners on collision mitigation across calendars
  • Report on effectiveness of our communication channels in driving engagement as well as email engagement performance
  • Provide support to the Loyalty Marketing team
Qualifications

What You Offer:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business related degree or equivalent experience preferred
  • 1-2 years experience working with CRM technology platforms (Salesforce, Oracle etc)
  • 1-2 years' experience of loyalty and campaigns experience in a fast paced, omni channel environment
  • 1-2 Email Marketing Experience

What Sets You Apart From The Crowd:

  • Highly organized
  • Ability to think big picture
  • Collaborative
  • Detail Oriented
  • Calm under pressure
  • Agile
  • Team Player


Additional Information

Inclusion & Diversity:

Cineplex is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable. 

Interested applicants, please apply today.

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment’s standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.

 

Life at Cineplex:

Cineplex is synonymous with entertainment. Known as Canada’s largest and most innovative film exhibitor, we’re so much more than movies - operating The Rec Room, Canada’s favourite destination for ‘Eats & Entertainment’ and Playdium, specially designed for teens and families.

At Cineplex, change and disruption are nothing new. Infusing innovation into everything we do has fueled our evolution as a fully-integrated, diversified and growing organization with exciting career opportunities in our locations and corporate functions. Grow with us, and explore roles in operations, food services, hospitality, digital commerce (CineplexStore.com), digital (Cineplex Digital Media) and cinema media (Cineplex Media), consumer loyalty (SCENE), finance, human resources, technology, amusement solutions (Player One Amusement Group), and more.

Proudly recognized as having one of the country’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, we rally behind our values of Teamwork, Innovation and Excellence. 

We are creative, curious and love thinking big. The next evolution of Cineplex starts here, with you. 

Learn more about our businesses through the links below. 

Cineplex | Cineplex Digital Media |  | Cineplex Media | Cineplex Store | Player One Amusement Group | Playdium | The Rec Room | SCENE 

No Agency Calls Please

#CB, #LI-SB1

title: Market Specialist, Vancouver
description:
Overview

MAKE UP FOR EVER is looking for a Market Specialist. Based in Vancouver reporting to the Regional Manager, West, this person is responsible for driving sales through education and support of the Sephora Stores in their territory, as well as fostering beauty advisor’s Love of MAKE UP FOR EVER and positive brand perception.

 

ABOUT US: 

 

MAKE UP FOR EVER honored to be a part of the LVMH group, the largest luxury conglomerate in the world. Louis Vuitton Moet-Hennessy is home to 75 distinguished houses rooted in six different sectors.  

 

MAKE UP FOR EVER is a professional cosmetics brand founded in 1984 by artist, Dany Sanz. Originally a painter and sculptor working in Parisian cabarets and theaters in the late 1980s, Sanz discovered that art of body painting, what she coined as her “paintings in motion”. After harnessing her body painting craft, she went on to teach make-up artists her body painting techniques, slowly building following in the make-up community and a revolution in the world of make-up.  

 

Today, MAKE UP FOR EVER is a leader in the professional beauty market, providing high quality products in a wide range of colors and textures for MUAs and everyday consumers alike. Our products have been featured in hit shows like Riverdale and Euphoria, major publications like Allure and Glamour, and runways around the world.  

 

We would like to welcome you to our collective of PROFESSIONAL, EDUCATIONAL, ARTISTIC, and EXUBERANT talent! 

Responsibilities

SALES

  • Achieve retail sales objectives through the education of Sephora beauty advisers.
  • Exhibit strong selling and communication skills
  • Build and maintain store relationships through consistent follow up communication with the Store Leadership and beauty advisors.
  • Plan and manage time effectively when working in store to maximize efficiency and effectiveness in driving revenue.
  • Participate in and ensure execution of store events & initiatives to achieve sales goals, while staying within budget.
  • Review and analyze daily & weekly sales achievement by door and where applicable by Selling Specialist. Reinforce achievement by door compared to sales, last year and comp goals. Partner with RM to establish a plan by door to achieve or exceed sales plan.
  • Partner with Regional Manager to create regional initiatives & sales contest to leverage education to see positive ROI.
  • Understand business to partner and plan store visits which best impact the business Plan in-store coverage during key store hours.
  • Properly manage calendar & schedule to support top doors in region.
  • Understand and respect the Sephora beauty advisors, assistant-Managers, Managers and Store Director Roles, and communicate with appropriate person to affect change. When Sephora procedures do not resolve concern, address the topic with your Regional Manager.
  • Gondola Management:  Observe, investigate, facilitate and follow up on all aspects of Gondola, including Visual Merchandising and Inventory weekly.
  • Attend Business Brand Reviews with Regional Manager.
  • Meet Sephora Brand Partner Expectations to result in above 90% love scores.

 EDUCATION AND ARTISTRY

  • Be an outstanding role model for education and artistry skill and lead by example.
  • Execute training objectives set by National Sales & Education director.
  • Educate Sephora beauty advisors based on curriculum set by Sales & Education Department.
  • Exhibit consistent, appropriate, and effective training and artistry skills
  • Be a passionate, professional, positive brand representative to internal and external clients.
  • Partner with Sephora Leadership team in identifying and addressing areas for development: in artistry, business, or other areas of opportunity.
  • Support Brand and Sephora events and trainings. Master class, Brand Trainings, NSO and/or new additional programs as requested.

 

 ADMINISTRATIVE

  • Two office days per month to manage reporting of sales, training trackers and other reports as needed
  • Strategically build quarterly calendars with RM in Outlook
  • Timely completion of monthly expense reports (if applicable)
  • Clear and effective email communication in a timely manner
  • Manage distribution of beauty advisors' gratis

Qualifications

  • College degree preferred
  • Must have two or more years of experience in field sales experience within the retail cosmetics field. Experience within Sephora is preferred.
  • Mandarin and/or Hindi speaking a plus
  • Must be able to exhibit basic beauty make up skills.
  • Must have basic computer knowledge.
  • Must be able to travel 25% of the year
  • Must have their own vehichle and maintain valid driver’s license, with proof of insurance.
  • Must be physically able to carry boxes of a reasonable weight and work in a fragrance filled cosmetic environment.
  • Must be available to work on a Tuesday to Saturday schedule.
  • Must exhibit a high level of professional personal appearance and hygiene.
  • Must be eligible to obtain a corporate credit card.

title: Marketing Specialist, Partner Marketing
description:
Req ID-23-135 (2)

Come Join Our Passionate Team!  At Barracuda, we make the world a safer place. We believe every business deserves access to cloud-enabled, enterprise-grade security solutions that are easy to buy, deploy, and use. We protect email, networks, data and applications with innovative solutions that grow and adapt with our customers’ journey. More than 200,000 organizations worldwide trust Barracuda to protect them — in ways they may not even know they are at risk — so they can focus on taking their business to the next level.

We are committed to a candidate selection process and work environment that is inclusive and barrier free. To ensure candidates are assessed in a fair and equitable manner, accommodations will be provided to prospective employees in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code.  

Envision yourself at Barracuda

The Marketing Specialist, Partner Marketing will play a key role in driving growth of Barracuda MSP’s existing partner (customer) relationships via a combination of campaigns, engagement activities, and sales and marketing enablement. 

This is a great opportunity for an individual looking to work in a high-growth industry, propelled by the ever-evolving cyber security landscape. As a member of the Barracuda MSP team, this individual will play a role in protecting thousands of small-medium sized businesses by bringing leading IT security solutions to managed service providers. 

The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, and be able to both strategize and execute effective marketing programs. This individual will lead partner enablement and communications efforts, as well as support demand generation activities.   

What you’ll be working on

  • Collaborate with Partner Marketing teammates to:
    • Welcome and on-board new partners highlighting where marketing is here to assist them with growing their business by highlighting partner portals, toolkits, Marketing Development Fund options, etc.
    • Collaborate with partners for co-branded webinars for their customers to learn more about the offerings the partner that protects them via a multi-layer cybersecurity portfolio.
    • Manage and run webinars that multiple partners co-brand and use as a lead generation for business growth
    • Assist with executing marketing development fund activities
  • Maintain and leverage advocate marketing platform and advocate relationships to amplify marketing messaging and generate engagement among Partners
  • Coordinate with Events team to confirm sponsorship is fully executed; and assist with getting partner voices where needed.
  • Liaise cross functionally with other teams to create value-added marketing opportunities

 

What you bring to the role

  • 2-4 years’ experience as part of a high growth marketing team
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while adhering to deadlines
  • Must work independently, have strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate in a clear, concise, and compelling manner, verbally and in writing
  • Strong collaborator, able to effectively liaise with cross-functional colleagues and executives
  • Proven demand generation experience
  • Channel marketing experience is a plus
  • Technology or security marketing is a plus
  • Experience with Salesforce CRM and/or Marketo is a plus

 

What you’ll get from us

A team where you can voice your opinion, make an impact, and where you and your experience are valued. Internal mobility – there are opportunities for cross training and the ability to attain your next career step within Barracuda.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM RECYCLING?

Take recycling to a global scale.

Join us in our mission to recycle more than 3,000,000 tons of metal every year across the globe. At AIM Recycling, we recycle metals to the maximum of their capacity. For more than 80 years, we have been uniting our strengths to make a positive difference. Join our team to contribute to our company’s growth and to support our recycling activities in North America.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

Job Description

Reporting to the Director of Marketing - Ontario, the Marketing Coordinator role at AIM provides media coordination, public relations, event coordination, digital coordination, creative projects, and budgets and planning. 

Media Coordination

  • Assist with Creative Briefs, as required, for both internal & external resources
  • Implement all marketing initiatives and their placement as per approved media plans (Print media, collateral, digital media, signage, sales centre)
  • Municipal Signage bylaw knowledge, permit application tracking & process management

Public Relations

  • Participate in the design of the company’s PR strategy including sourcing new approaches and developing new strategies
  • Serve as a point person on all proactive and reactive media matters related to regional and national public relations campaigns in English
  • Manage donation communications, coordinating with internal departments, Digital Marketing Specialist, and media partners
  • Monitor all AIM Recycling and competitor information (i.e. pricing, events, industry news, etc.)

​​​​​​​Event Coordination

  • Collaborate and manage collateral items required for events, site openings and sponsorships (ie. Tent, heaters, food drink, DJ, parking etc).
  • Assist in development of sponsorship strategy to drive brand awareness
  • Attend sites openings, trade shows and events

Digital Coordination

  • Assist Digital Marketing Specialist in monitoring email inquiries and social media outlets
  • Collaborate to develop social content, write and execute for all applicable outlets
  • Assist with development and maintenance of social media calendar

Creative

  • Assist Director of Marketing with execution of creative output across all applications
  • Ensure accuracy of all creative before approval and execution
  • Ensure that Head Office has all necessary brochures and collateral on hand at all times
  • Support internal departments with creative tasks/executions as needed

Budget and Planning

  • Work with Director of Marketing to develop budgets and media plans
  • Prepare RFQ submissions to vendors/suppliers (signage, media planning, etc…)
  • Other duties as required; The Marketing Coordinator will experience intermittent peak periods (tied to site openings, events, trade shows, etc.) that will occasionally call for longer hours, including some evenings and weekends.

Skills

  • Dedicated/hardworking
  • Customer service oriented
  • Organized
  • Autonomous
  • Trustworthy
  • Professional/Discreet
  • Flexible
Qualifications

  • Post secondary education in marketing, advertising, or communications is beneficial
  • Minimum of two to three years of relevant experience in a similar role
  • Professional level communication skills
  • PR knowledge and experience advertising corporate programs, sponsorship & community involvement an asset
  • Excellent computer skills with an in-depth knowledge of all Microsoft 365 programs (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)


Additional Information

All information received will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants for their interest but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Market Planner - Acura
description:
Job Description:

The Market Planner is responsible for supporting National and Zone activities for assigned Acura models and sales activities. This includes new model sales planning, retail sales and support activities, motivational programs, event planning, reporting, analysis and providing recommendations to management towards the achievement of sales and division business plan objectives.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

  • Develop a strong understanding of the automotive sales landscape, analyze multiple sources of data, pointing out areas of concern to management and make recommendations accordingly
  • Develop new model sales plans for assigned models with key stakeholders (SP Flow) including the development of product launch guides
  • Process Dealer Exception Request/Dealer payments via Manual AJs. Collaborate with Sales & Production Planning for product ordering and allocation to dealer network
  • Prepare sales incentive program recommendations to achieve sales and market share objectives
  • Prepare monthly model CAP-DO gap analysis to identify opportunities and develop countermeasure proposals
  • Organize sales-related events (ie Dealer Meetings, Field Staff Meetings, Training activities) by liaising with external vendors, national staff, zones and dealers and executives)
  • Prepare and co-coordinate assigned sales department motivational, recognition and incentive activities as required
  • Prepare for monthly program meetings by comparing and analyzing sales and inventory documents using market demand information, historical trends and zone forecasts for assigned models
  • Draft and coordinate the release of sales and program bulletin for the dealer network as required
  • Prepare, maintain, and distribute sales performance reports as required
  • Other duties as necessary

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Post-secondary degree required
  • 1-2 years of automotive experience is preferred
  • Demonstrated planning and organizational skills
  • Flexible and adaptable to working in a fast-paced team environment with multiple priorities
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to build collaborative working relationships; strong results-orientation
  • Advanced level Excel knowledge is required (vlookups, pivot tables etc)
  • Advanced PC Skills (Microsoft Office)

Honda Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodation in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, upon request.   The accommodation will take into account the applicant's accessibility needs.

 

If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email Human Resources at accessibility@honda.ca   or call (905)888-4331.

#LI-Hybrid

title: Insights Analyst (Channel Operations)
description:
If you are looking to join one of Canada’s fastest growing companies, goeasy Ltd. is the place for you! Certified as a Great Place to Work®, recognized as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, GTA's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada’s Top 50 Fintech’s, and winners of the 2021 TSX30, we want the best and brightest to join our team.

We are a publicly-traded company on the TSX with over 4000% shareholder return since 2001. Accredited by the Better Business Bureau, goeasy Ltd is a Canadian company that provides non-prime leasing and lending services through easyhome, easyfinancial and LendCare. We offer a wide variety of financial products and services including lease-to-own merchandise, unsecured and secured installment loans, direct-to-consumer auto loans, and point-of-sale financing to over 4,000 merchants in the powersports, automotive, retail, home improvement, and health sectors. With over 30 years of experience, our 2200 employees work with our customers to help them get access to the money they need today, while they rebuild their credit and graduate to prime rates. Our omni-channel model includes over 400 retail locations and digital/mobile platforms that enable our customers to transact with us through their channel of choice.

goeasy is seeking a highly motivated and energetic individual to join our Channel Enablement team. Your responsibilities will be to engage Channels leadership in the development and implementation of net new initiatives, and to provide reporting, analytics, and insights on the performance of the various Channels.  This role is vital in the efficient operation of our retail businesses. As a result, it carries exposure to many senior executives and would be a great launch pad to leadership opportunities within goeasy.

Responsibilities:

  • Gather and maintain a wide array of data-related business processes and reporting. This involves both entering information into existing databases and creating new processes to accurately input and store critical data
  • Review, validate and reconcile the performance measurement data in an efficient and timely manner to identify and resolve any issues that may arise or escalate as required
  • Learn all operational aspects of the Channels to allow for the implementation of how to operationalize items such as P&L reviews; reporting, etc.
  • Manage the development and implementation of standard operating programs such as target setting, proactive goal setting for Incentive implementation, bonus, and other variable compensation
  • Operate as the point person for current and future reporting needed for the Channels. This would include gathering data; maintaining; determining frequency of reporting where necessary; determining when automation would serve the business to maintain efficiencies
  • Ensure all performance related metrics (STIP, BSC, KPIs etc.) are calculated and compiled correctly by ensuring that analytical reviews, reasonability checks and established processes are completed and followed in accordance with annual functional Policies, Guidelines, and Procedures.
  • Conduct thorough analysis on performance results, explain performance results, investigate discrepancies through to issue resolution
  • Investigate and respond to various inquiries
  • Develop and foster effective working relationships with other departments across goeasy
  • Other duties, consistent with skills and experience, as directed by the reporting manager
  • Identify anomalies in various data sources

Qualifications:

  • Strong attention to detail
  • Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel  
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Powerpoint and Outlook 
  • Familiarity with SQL queries would be considered an asset
  • Ability to prioritize tasks, multi-task, and meet deadlines
  • Ability to work under pressure and react quickly
  • Analytical skills, ability to identify problem areas and identify solutions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Windows and ability to manage multiple applications
  • 1-2 years in a similar role
    • Experience with sales and collections practices would be an asset
  • Post-secondary education (business/IT) or equivalent job experience

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

goeasy is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, goeasy is committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:

All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of their work experience to qualify for hire.  We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

To learn more about our great company please click the links below:

http://goeasy.com/careers/

 PAID1234

title: Senior Product Analyst
description:
WHO WE ARE

Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Burger King, Delivery Hero, HBO Max, Mercari, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale – each month, hundreds of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 3 billion active users through Braze.

Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Forrester Wave™: Cross-Channel Campaign Management (Independent Platforms), Q3 2021, and was named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list for the fourth consecutive year. The company has also been selected as one of Fortune’s Best Workplace for Millennials in 2021, and was ranked #20 on Fortune’s Best Medium Sized Workplaces in 2021. Braze is certified as a Great Place to Work in the UK and the U.S. and is recognized as one of the UK's Best Workplaces for Women.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

You love everything about data.  You have no problem diving into data; cleaning it, transforming it, analyzing it, visualizing it, and using it to tell stories.  You want to develop your passion into a career at a rapidly growing company with tons of data about mobile and digital interactions.  You want to contribute to the business as well as grow the business.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Identify reports, dashboards, and analysis needed by the business
  • Design and implement said reports, dashboards, and analysis
  • Analyze billions mobile and digital messaging data points
  • Be in the weeds pulling, cleaning, analyzing, and transforming raw data into insightful findings

WHO YOU ARE

  • 5-7 years of experience in BI, Data Analysis, and Data Modelling
  • 5-7 years of SQL experience 
  • Experience with Programming and/or Scripting Languages (Python, R, Java, VBA, C#, C++, etc.)
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, MicroStrategy, DataBricks)
  • BA/BS in Statistics, Math, Economics, Computer Science or similar technical discipline
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical analysis techniques
  • Fast learner, self-starter, go-getter, and intellectually curious

IDEALLY, WHAT YOU'LL HAVE

  • Experience working within an Agile team
  • Project Management Experience 
  • Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis)
  • Experience working on cross-department teams

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Competitive compensation that includes equity
  • Generous time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave
  • Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
  • Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture

If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.

If you are located in the EU or UK visit our privacy policy to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.

title: Field Marketing Specialist - Vancouver, Canada
description:
PURPOSE OF THIS JOB

Manage Marketing efforts in Vancouver by driving trial in the field and building grassroots consumer buzz and excitement for the Guayaki brand with a great product/brand experience and Community Network support.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

· Support local key events, scenes and marketing opportunities in line with Guayaki brand values that are relevant to the local communities, consumers and media landscape, with a focus on participation.

· Always have the "community / consumer" and "brand" eye in every single initiative and ensure we talk to the consumer in the most effective and efficient way

· Own relationships with the key influencers of the region (local authorities, local opinion leaders that relevant to our target, entrepreneurial and regenerative communities) in aligment with the FMM or Partnership team when applicable.

· Identify opportunities to improve consumer experience both in store and in market based on understanding of the market.

· Act as an ambassador for the brand by sampling product at key events and on premise opportunities.

· Introduce the product in unique ways in key lifestyle/on premise accounts in alignment with Sales and Brand teams.

· Act as the lead in the field - being sure to be onsite for all major events

· Ensure that every consumer experience with the brand is a positive one thanks to love for the detail and premium execution at events and all other field marketing activities.

· Act as a role model to your team and display the Guayaki values with a consistent tone of voice that is motivating and inspiring.

· Negotiate mutually beneficial partnership agreements to build long-term relationships in aligment with FMM and Partnership team

· Execute on National Community strategy in the field with a focus on connecting trial to sales in associated account pockets

· Work closely with National Community team and Special Operations to build our local event opportunities for fan club members consistent with Brand voice where applicable.

· Support and/or lead in triking activations in line with Community strategy in on site Field Markets.



MINIMUM EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS

· Experience as a participant within the Guayaki Community Network and / or as a Part-Time Community Cebador preferred

· BA Degree in Business, Marketing or related field required

· Minimum 2-3 years of relevant work experience in field marketing and implementing integrated campaigns across multiple locations.

· Ability to multi-task and work effectively with a variety of tasks and business partners (both internal and external partners); must be able to work cross-functionally with internal sales and operations teams to effectively generate, execute and report on marketing programs.

· Expert knowledge of marketing planning tools and strategies

· Professional team-player, collaborative, and open to feedback

· Strategic, self-motivated, intellectually curious, innovative and resourceful

· Dynamic communicator with great oral and written skills.

· Detail-oriented, organized and proactive

· Approaches new and different ideas with curiosity and open-mindedness


TRAVEL / PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Travel

Travels 50% in your allocated Region

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

· Employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear.

· Employee frequently is required to walk and sit.

· Employee is occasionally required to stand and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

· Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus

title: Home Care Business Development Liaison
description:
Are you a driven sales professional with a passion for seniors who is looking for a passionate, rewarding career in the home care industry? Our Toronto, ON office is looking for an experienced Home Care Liaison to join our stellar team. We are actively interviewing, apply today!

 

 Requirements of this role:

 

  • 2+ years of business development experience in home care, senior living, or senior health care space
  • Experience in generating new business from hospitals, skilled nursing facilities, senior living communities and geriatric care managers, etc. 
  • A proven track record of selling senior care services 
  • Have passion, be driven, entrepreneurial and creative
  • Thrive in an independent, self-motivated environment with little direct supervision
  • Maximize the resources at their disposal to build and maintain relationships
  • Have strong written and oral communication skills
  • Be team oriented and comfortable collaborating with other staff

 

Primary responsibilities include: 

 

  • Developing new referral accounts in the local healthcare and senior care community with elder care industry professionals, organizations, and establishments
  • Taking healthcare, financial, and or legal professionals through the sales process
  • Coordinating post discharge home care with hospital and skilled nursing facility discharge planners, RNs, social workers and physicians to provide a seamless transition and effective rehabilitation at home for our clients
  • Representing our services in a professional and creative manner
  • Answering and actively making calls to prospective clients in need of services
  • Organizing Lunch and Learn programs for professionals involved with the senior community
  • Representing the company at fundraising and community support events
  • Working closely with the client service team to ensure client satisfaction and excellence of care
  • Maintaining accurate records on all prospective and active referral sources

 

Perks in this sales role:

 

  • Unlimited growth and advancement potential with an expanding sales team
  • Strong senior leadership support and strategic guidance
  • Established and seasoned operations team supporting client care and staffing
  • Company sponsored cell phone and lap top
  • Robust salary plus uncapped commission
  • Health benefits: medical, dental, vision, life insurance
  • PTO

 

Home Care Assistance is the largest and fastest-growing private pay solution for seniors who wish to age well in their home. We offer concierge-level care management and dependable in-home assistance to seniors across our 150+ locations throughout North America. A mission driven organization, we proudly assist thousands of clients in optimizing their quality of life as they “age in place” in the comfort of their home. Our holistic approach to care is based on the lifestyles of the longest-living people in the world and promotes a healthy mind, body, and spirit.


Home Care Assistance began in 2002 when the founders noticed a lack of high-touch, premium care management and caregiving assistance when seeking to help their own loved one age successfully at home. While developing a thoughtful, comprehensive service offering they would expect for their own parents, they found that the home care market was fragmented, slow moving and ripe for improvement.


Today, Home Care Assistance has become an industry leader in the $100+ Billion industry through a focus on excellent customer service, great people and innovation.


We are unique in that we are the only at-scale, national provider of private pay, non-medical care with a company-owned location strategy. With plans to aggressively expand our footprint, there is tremendous opportunity to build a lasting and valuable company – we’re just getting started.


If this sounds like a great match, apply today!  We'd love to hear from you!


HCA requires all internal employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of vaccination will be required as a condition of employment subject to applicable law concerning exemptions/accommodations.

 

HCA is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability or any other protected status.

title: Senior Analyst, Demand Planning
description:
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact. 

What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.



SR. ANALYST, DEMAND PLANNING

POSITION PURPOSE
The purpose of this role is to optimize the supply chain network by effectively balancing inventory across different regions. The Senior Demand Planning Analyst will own the inventory flow planning and execution to ensure supply and demand are well balanced in the network. 


MAJOR / KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
• Own mid-term and long-term planning in line with S&OP forecast, balancing of inventory moves between plants to deliver lowest supply chain cost while meeting our customer service expectation
• Set caps to customer demand to ensure balance between demand and returns 
• Manage and own standing orders and ensure they meet the forecasted demand
• Work as a liaison between the forecasting team and Operations to balance inventory
• Monitor production allocation by plant and highlight gaps
• Proactively monitor key inventory health indicators and adjust plan accordingly
• Manage holiday schedule for all Canada plants and communicate to all stakeholders
• Monitor and balance returns from different retailers and regions to match production needs
• Own optimization of the returns network to meet Transportation KPI goals
• Use and create data/reporting to facilitate mid-term planning
• Lead the inventory calls giving guidance to the next week on production, returns, and issues by site
• Own and manage new cost reduction initiatives


MEASURES
• Pallet Moves per Issue 
• Stock Days of Coverage
• Transportation Cost per Issue/return/relocation
• Order Lead Time
• Repair/Inspection targets 
• Standings to Production Ratio


KEY CONTACTS
• Logistics Execution
• Transportation
• Customer Care
• Retail
• Customer Service
• Operations
• S&OP/Demand Planning
• Sales 

External:
• Manufacturers 
• Retailers
• 3PL Plants


QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent 

Desirable:
• Master’s degree in Engineering, Supply Chain, or Business Analytics
• Six Sigma Green or Black Belt certification 
• SCMA Designation
• CSCP Designation


EXPERIENCE
• 3-5 years related experience in supply chain industry
• Experience sensing and responding using data in an ambiguous environment
• Experience leading without authority, driving transportation partners and operational partners to achieve results
• Experience using data and analytics to drive decision making
• Experienced in presenting analytical results to cross-functional partners


SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
• Detail Oriented – ability to build, maintain, validate, and analyse, large amounts of data
• Ability to analyse given parameters and adjust action plan accordingly 
• Advanced expertise MS Suite
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
• Ability to make sound decisions in ambiguous situations 
• Sense of urgency and a strong drive for results and execution
• Ability to prioritize and balance large amount of inputs and priorities

Preferred:
• Six Sigma/Lean methodology


LANGUAGES
English
Desirable:  French



CHEP Canada invites applications from all qualified individuals. CHEP is committed to fostering workplace diversity, and, provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process. If you require this information in alternate format; require communication supports; an accommodation in applying for a posting and/or if you are selected for an interview, please contact our Recruiting Department and a recruiter assigned to the posting will work with you to meet your needs.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to developing a diverse workforce in which everyone is treated fairly, with respect, and has the opportunity to contribute to business success while realizing his or her potential. This means harnessing the unique skills and experience that each individual brings and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

Individuals fraudulently misrepresenting themselves as Brambles or BXB Digital representatives have scheduled interviews and offered fraudulent employment opportunities with the intent to commit identity theft or solicit money. Brambles and BXB Digital never conduct interviews via online chat or request money as a term of employment. If you have a question as to the legitimacy of an interview or job offer, please contact us at recruitment@brambles.com.

title: Senior Marketing Coordinator
description:
ZGF is seeking a Senior Marketing Coordinator to join our team in our Vancouver, BC office. We are looking for a driven individual who is looking for an opportunity to grow their professional marketing career in a creative, high energy, collaborative, and fun loving team-oriented environment. Our ideal candidate will come from an architecture, engineering, or construction background and be comfortable with technical language from these environments.

This is a hybrid position. Must be able to travel to other ZGF offices and/or client project locations as needed.

As a Senior Marketing Coordinator, you will...

  • Work closely with a diverse creative marketing team to develop and produce high-quality qualification packages, proposals, presentations, and other written materials.
  • Be a talented writer and storyteller with the ability to gather complex or technical information from various sources, to synthesize it, and to use it as the basis to craft cohesive and compelling narratives.
  • Possess excellent attention to detail and strong proofreading skills.
  • Be a standout marketer with a drive to go above and beyond and an appetite to consistently help us raise the bar.
  • Demonstrate a strong interest in architectural design and a willingness to immerse yourself in the building industry.
  • Share a love for content marketing and a passion for developing fresh and creative approaches to conveying information.
  • Work with clients, photographers, and architectural colleagues to schedule and coordinate photoshoots.

Qualifications:

  • Professional degree in Marketing, Journalism, Communications or a related field is required; or a combination of related skills and experience in Marketing.
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of relevant professional experience.
  • Experience in Architecture, Engineering, Construction, or professional services marketing is highly desired.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft, Adobe InDesign and PowerPoint.
  • Knowledge of Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop and database programs (Deltek Vision and Axomic Open Asset) is preferable, but not required.
  • Strong, demonstrated organizational skills and an ability to prioritize and complete simultaneous projects with minimal supervision; meeting deadlines and working well under pressure, while maintaining a high level of accuracy.
  • Demonstrated written and oral communication skills; editing and proofreading skills; strong graphic design sensibilities.
  • Technologically savvy and resourceful with experience generating content for digital platforms, including web and social media.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to work with both peers and firm management.
  • A collaborative and team-oriented disposition; a sense of humor and grace under pressure; persistent, tactful, and enthusiastic.
  • Sound, professional judgment, strong work ethic, positive, and client-focused attitude.

Apply With: 

  • Cover letter
  • Resume
  • Writing Samples

Applications without a cover letter, resume and writing samples will not be reviewed. Writing samples should be a link to URL or one PDF attachment.

title: Marketing Technology Sales Specialist - Canada
description:
:

A fantastic opportunity for a proven sales professional to drive our cloud-native, next-generation Marketing Technology value propositions in the Canadian market. Youâ€™ll be expected to leverage existing relationships, as well as develop new ones, to help deliver continued growth.

 

We are looking for an experienced Sales professionals who have sold marketing technologies in Canada.

 

What we do:  

 

Weâ€™re one of the leading solution providers in multi-channel Marketing Technology with capabilities extending across Customer Data Platforms, Customer Analytics, Personalization and Real-time Interaction Management. We are also the undisputed leader in analytics and have been for decades. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into actionable intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.â€¯  

â€¯  

What youâ€™ll do:  

 

In the role of Sales Specialist â€“ Marketing Technology and Personalization Solutions, you will help customers and prospects evaluate their Customer Experience strategy, determine approaches to application and data modernization, and recommend solutions that meet their technical and business requirements. You will be working with our most important customers within the industry. Within your customers, you will lead a virtual team of sales, technical and consulting resources to help customers realize the digital transformation in marketing.    

â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯  

You will:  

 

Provide in-depth industry, business function and Marketing Technology and Personalization Solutions related expertise to facilitate closing deals within the assigned territory.    

 

Integrate strategy into account plans. Initiate and support lead generation activities. Qualify leads by analyzing business drivers and technical fit.  

 

Partner with field Account Executives to sell Marketing Technology and Personalization solutions and services to prospective and current customers.    

 

Work with partners and other stakeholders at SAS, as well as use our targeted account lists to identify and engage prioritized customers/prospects  

 

Spend time with our prospects for Marketing Technology and Personalization Solutions, identifying pathways to modernize their customer experience strategy  

 

Develop opportunities by managing and influencing requirements to gain competitive edge.    

 

Build and maintain relationships with prospects and customers, influence long-term strategic direction, and act as a trusted advisor driving engagement at the CxO level with business and technology decision markers.  

 

Coach the Customer Advisory team to ensure that demonstrations of our Marketing Technology and Personalization Solutions address customersâ€™ business and technical objectives.  

 

Create and present proposals to successfully communicate the value of SASâ€™ products and services.    

 

Leverage Customer Advisory, Value Engineering and pre-sales engineering resources as appropriate.  

 

Communicate with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for services.  

 

Facilitates closure of complex sales. Assists with pricing negotiations and licensing questions.  

 

Post-close, knowledge transfer to Professional Services or Partners for design/deployment.    

 

Work closely with Customer Advisory and Value Engineering to ensure that the outcomes and value we promise gets delivered as quickly and efficiently as possible.  

 

Engage with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities.  

 

Influence the go-to-market strategies for our Marketing Technology and Personalization Solutions.

 

Provide feedback to sales, marketing and product management on current and future product requirements and sales challenges.

 

â€¯  

What weâ€™re looking for:

 

In-depth experience selling MarTech solutions in Canada.

 

Solid experience with consultative, outcome-driven selling in one or more of these areas: Digital Marketing, Customer Experience Management, Content Marketing, SO-ME Marketing.  

 

  • Great value based, consultative selling skills:
  • Understand customerâ€™s strategic intent and articulate desired business outcomes.
  • Identify and articulate outcome-driven use cases and value drivers that support the desired business outcomes.
  • Lead the value case creation, and present to marketing executives and ELT team with confidence.    
  • Trust builder
  • Establish and grow executive relationships by being a scholar of their industry and by inspiring customers how to tackle business critical problems.
  • Establish and grow director level relationships trust by being able to engage in meaningful business conversations about outcomes and value.      
  • Hunter & Farmer
  • Passionately scouting for Marketing Technology and Personalization Opportunities within territory.
  • Passionately ensuring that we deliver what we have promised to our customers.
  • Attention to detail, while seeing the big picture
  • Own the capability and transition vision (to future state) by understanding how SAS capabilities aligns to customer desired outcomes and rallying all relevant stakeholders (customers, SAS, partners) around it.
  • Ability to think ahead, anticipate potential roadblocks and plan to mitigate risks.
  • Passionate, motivating team player  
  • Passionate about Marketing Technology and Personalization Solutions and the value it brings to customers.  
  • Drive and Self-motivation. Focus on continuous self-improvement
  • Works productively with multiple stakeholders, both internally and with partners.
  • All the basics:
  • Knowledge of basic sales techniques
  • Knowledge of software acquisition cycles and buying influences
  • Experience in analyzing and evaluating territory dynamics and developing sales plans
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to travel as required

 

Additional information:

   

SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more:Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law. Also view the supplementEEO is the Law, and the  Pay Transparency  notice.  

 

Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education,  skills  and experience.â€¯Resumes may be considered in the order they are received.â€¯SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.  

 

In order to  work at SAS, you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If there is a medical or religious reason preventing you from receiving an available COVID-19 vaccination, and you are selected as a candidate for consideration, we have an accommodations process in place  to evaluate those  requests.

 

All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at  www.sas.com. SAS only sends emails from verified â€œsas.comâ€ email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at  

Recruitingsupport@sas.com

 before taking any further action.
