title: Research Associate
description:
Our client has pursued and achieved breakthroughs in medicine for more than three decades, with the goal of creating a better, healthier world for all people. They have commercialized more than 25 innovative medicines, helping to transform treatment for people living with HIV, viral hepatitis, cancer and other life-threatening diseases. Through their ongoing bold and transformative science, they’re driving innovations that have the potential to become the next generation of life-changing medicines.

We are currently seeking a "Research Associate" for a contract role in Edmonton, AB. Please apply if you would be interested and available for it.

Duration: 6 Months

Requirement:
  • Independently plans and executes experiments that support development activities and project goals.
  • Demonstrates and applies advanced level of understanding project goals and methods.
  • Selects appropriate methods and techniques in performing methods development.
  • Recommends alternatives, researches new methods and techniques and proactively seek out senior personnel to discuss potential solutions to problems.
  • Participates in group meetings.
  • Presents results of work, interprets data, and draws conclusions regarding presented material and nature of work.
  • Works with minimal supervision on projects of moderate to complex scope.
  • Uses good verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills to provide insight into the processes used to achieve results of assigned tasks.
  • Prepares validation protocols and reports or analytical development reports.
Regards,
Ankush Jha
Cell: 289-236-0817
Email: ankush.jha@artech.com

title: Marketing and Business Development Coordinator
description:
Marketing and Business Development Coordinator

Are you a recent graduate in Business or Administration? Are you seeking a collaborative work environment where you can learn, grow, and develop your career? Do you strive to provide value driven services and enjoy working on daily challenges? If this sounds like you, TWD may have the position youâ€™ve been looking for!

About TWD Technologies Ltd.:

First established in 1999, TWD has grown into a leading multi-discipline engineering, procurement and construction management company providing project development, execution and engineering services. Our expertise includes oil and gas, pipelines, terminalling and blending, renewables, power, infrastructure, chemical processing, and food and beverage.

Working as a tightly-knit team, TWD is committed to making a big impact in our industry. We aim high and weâ€™re proud of the fact that we push the limits of whatâ€™s possible on a daily basis. Weâ€™ve created a dynamic work environment that emphasizes the importance of creativity and fosters a strong sense of community.

At TWD Technologies, we are seeking a highly motivated Marketing and Business Development Coordinator to join our Team in Burnaby, BC! The successful candidate will provide general administrative support to the Business Development team including but not limited to proposal preparation and research, support sales activities, and assist in promotional materials.

What Youâ€™ll be Doing:

As a Marketing and Business Development Coordinator youâ€™ll work as part of the Business Development team to provide deliverables to a variety of stakeholders. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

General

  • Support and assist TWD Business Development team in meeting and exceeding sales targets.
  • Contribute to company business development activities.
  • Provide administrative support for Business Development team.
  • Assist in preparing and distributing reports that support the sales team.
  • Provide support for internal meetings.
  • Take on special projects, initiatives and other duties as assigned.

Proposal Preparation

  • Support incoming inquiries and support proposal preparation.
  • Assist in proposal preparation including generation, writing and research
  • Ensure inquiry and proposal process is conducted in a timely manner that meets internal procedures and customer satisfaction.

Promotions and Promotional Material

  • Assist in TWD promotional items program.
  • Assist in updating TWD Website and social media feeds.
  • Support in developing new TWD Project Profiles.
  • Ensure consistency of all internal and external documentation and communications.
  • Prepare brochures for prospective clients.
  • Supporting the re-branding of resumes

What You Bring:

  • College/University Diploma or Degree in Business or Administration
  • 2 years of experience in sales or equivalent
  • Proficient in MS Office Applications
  • Experience in Adobe Illustrator and Adobe InDesign is an asset
  • Excellent communication skills with strong initiative
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills
  • Experience with creating effective marketing and promotional materials an asset
  • Detail oriented professional
  • Ability to conduct themselves in a professional and discreet manner.

 

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation Package
  • Company Paid Group Benefits Plan
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • RRSP Matching Program 
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Wellness Subsidy Program 
  • Service Recognition Program
  • Work Perks Program
  • Employee Referral Bonus Program

We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all qualified applicants. If you require accommodation at any time throughout the recruitment process, please contact our Human Resources Team.

title: Data Analyst, Marketing
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Assist Manager, Performance Data Analytics, with Marketing and Market Insights and Pricing data analysis in identifying trends in its revenue and marketing data
  • Act as a primary source of expertise in the data structure and workflow of SAP and supporting systems
  • Assist in creating insights on marketing data analytics with use of reports and dashboards
  • Analyze the marketing data in support of the revenue and marketing teams
  • Analyze problems and errors produced by business applications
  • Evaluate query design, data structure, and data quality to provide recommendations for improvement as needed
  • Research and review large sets of data, using peer analysis with benchmarking and competitor analysis
  • Assist in developing metrics, KPI’s and business cases
  • Work with teams to provide input into the test strategy, test scenarios, test data requirements, and supporting user validation
  • Support data validation and analysis with other performance analytics projects
  • Conduct insightful, ad hoc analysis to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues
  • Conduct analysis to validate system issues and work with IT to resolve those issues
  • Provide training and support cross functional teams
  • Develop documentation of key processes, and build data dictionary
  • Complete all other duties as assigned

 

Qualifications:

  • A bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field
  • 1-3 years experience in a similar role preferred
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (Functions, formulas, charts, tables, and power query)
  • Experience in BI tools a plus (Microsoft PowerBI preferred)
  • Experience in Marketing, Sales or Business Analytics considered an asset
  • Actively demonstrates confidentiality, tact and discretion in preparing, disclosing and handling information of a confidential and/or sensitive nature
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and as a member of a team
  • Strong problem-solving skills, mathematical and data literacy
  • Must possess a detail oriented, and analytical mindset
  • Excellent communication, organizational, and time management skills

title: Shopper Marketing Coordinator
description:
Not just a job…
a community
a partnership
a team
 
You’ll experience them all at London Drugs.  As one of Canada’s  most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team! 
 
Our Marketing Department located at our head office in Richmond, BC currently has an opportunity for:
 
Shopper Marketing Coordinator

This position is responsible for supporting the strategy, planning and execution of brand and category advertising and promotions.

Roles and Responsibilities: 
  • Work with shopper marketing team leads to execute strategic advertising and marketing plans to drive business results 
  • Manage multiple projects as assigned by the Shopper Marketing Manager based on seasonality and customer relevance.
  • Manage communication and marketing services as support between business team and Marketing.
  • Work with internal and external stakeholders to implement marketing plan across various categories and services.
  • Work with data and insights team to inform decision making and make recommendations to the business.
  • Facilitate consistent execution of plans across all customer touch points including Website, in-store, print and social media.
  • Ensure strong and clear brand communication with our customers, while balancing business priorities
  • Support creative and communication development with production and content teams. 
  • Project manage key initiatives with cross functional players.
The successful candidate should possess the following:
  • Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills and the ability to deal with senior levels of the organization.
  • Ability to negotiate and sell a concept.
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strong administrative skills. 
  • Highly organized and able to multitask effectively and work under changing priorities. 
  • Initiative to isolate and solve problems.
EDUCATION & KNOWLEDGE: 
  • Minimum 3 years of increasing responsibility in a marketing role.
  • Retail Marketing experience an asset.
  • A marketing degree or equivalent work experience an asset.

London Drugs offers advancement opportunities through our promote-from-within policies, salaries commensurate with experience, as well as a comprehensive benefits program including: 

  • Comprehensive medical, dental, prescription drug and vision coverage for you and your family (Ensuring you and your family are taken care of)
  • Employee Discount Program (Sharing our success) 
  • Employee Recognition Program (Tangible rewards for great work!) 
  • Company matched RRSPs (Helping you plan for your future) 
  • Ongoing In-House Training & Education Courses (Lifelong learning) 
  • Employee Family Assistance Program (Free confidential counseling) 
  • Community Involvement (Giving back to our communities) 
If you are a well-organized, self-motivated, individual who has a positive attitude and a commitment to achieving Company objectives, then we have the opportunity for you to excel! 
 
Apply Now!
 
We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.
  
London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.
  
To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Insight Analyst
description:
You have a proven track record of delivering insightful analysis and value to clients in a fast-paced environment? You are excited to work directly with our clients and to help market leaders deliver and optimize their digital solutions? Emplifi is a global leader in Customer Experience solutions, guiding the world's customer-centric brands to the insights they need to improve the customer experience.

We are looking for an Insight Analyst to join the Analytical Services group at our Montreal (remote option available for the right candidate in Canada) or Columbus (Ohio) office reporting to the Insight Manager. You will work directly with one of our Fortune 10 clients leveraging strong analytical and presentation skills to create compelling insights to one of our key partners in the health care industry. Our partner is a drug-free
workplace and our future colleague is required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Apply today and join our dynamic company!

 

 

What You'll Do Here

  • Conducting analyses of our client's website performance (integrating multiple data sources including quantitative results, trend information, competitive insights and behavioral/Adobe Analytics data) and assist in preparing easy to interpret presentations that deliver insightful, strategic, and actionable insights;
  • Understand our client's business objectives and develop and execute research plans that effectively address needs of digital teams across their Enterprise;
  • Respond to requests for ad hoc analysis within short timeframes and an emphasis on exceptional quality and accuracy;
  • Contribute to the success of a strong strategic insights group as a collaborative team member;
  • Work in conjunction with client-side and Emplifi-side teams to build dialogue and cross-team liaisons. 
  • Supporting Project Managers in order to generate account satisfaction and growth;
  • Supporting ongoing development of Emplifi's solutions within research design, statistics, semantics, and predictive sciences.

What You'll Bring to Us

  • 1 to 2 years of work experience in consumer research, digital or web analytics, usability research, or experience management;
  • Experience with an Analytics tool (i.e.: Python, R, SQL, Q-research, PowerBI) and the MS Office suite;
  • Understanding of digital business strategies;
  • Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a relevant program including: Marketing Science; Business Management / eCommerce; Psychology / Social Sciences;
  • Very strong professional communication skills in English (French an asset).

What We Offer

  • International, fast paced and rapidly growing environment
  • Chance to work with the world's biggest brands at the CX tech leader
  • Agile and open-minded culture with a high level of flexibility
  • Opportunity for professional growth and development
  • 3 weeks of PTO (current PTO accrued by 6% from each paycheck)
  • Flexible working hours
  • A corporate group insurance coverage
  • Personal days (5 days per year) (prorated)
  • Sick days (unlimited)
  • Community days (2 days per year)
  • Access to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • There's more as well! Speak with us to find out all details!

description:

We are looking for outgoing, positive and money-driven marketers that can work part-time throughout the next 3-6 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn-first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

Hours are flexible, however, teams will generally work from Monday to Thursday 4:00/5:00 pm to 7:00/8:00 pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00 pm to 4:00 pm, with your choice of a minimum of 4 hours per week. You can design your schedule to work around your busy schedule.

title: Content Marketing Specialist
description:
Job Summary:

Do you love writing? Are you a compelling storyteller? Do you have a passion for creating marketing content that connects with your audience and strengthens relationships with customers? Do you want to make a difference in public transportation and help connect people to jobs, opportunities, and communities?

We are looking for a Content Specialist with the ability to write and edit content for a wide range of marketing communications. The successful candidate will be an extremely talented, passionate, and detailed writer who will aid in the planning, development, generation and implementation of our content marketing strategy. The Content Specialist is responsible for the timely delivery and quality of marketing content that is tailored to our target audience, in close collaboration with internal subject matter experts and teams. He or she understands how to create the right type of content for the different stages of the buyer's journey.

The ideal person is someone who can dive in and easily get a feel for our brand and voice, quickly be immersed in the diverse transit technologies we write about and create targeted content that generates engagement amongst our target audience, moves leads through our funnel, and ultimately influences sales opportunities.

This is an opportunity to work with a passionate, driven team in an exciting industry, and gain a wealth of experience in content marketing to further your own marketing career.

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

  • Write and edit a wide variety of content, including product overviews and descriptions, case studies, whitepapers, e-books, email, blog, landing pages, press releases, videos, events, social and presentation decks
  • Work closely with the Content Marketing Manager to develop concepts into specific content that will feed into strategic marketing campaigns spanning across multiple touch points (website, print, email, content hubs etc.)
  • Work with internal subject matter experts, external production specialists and undertake research to develop content that achieves response from our target markets.
  • Strategize with the marketing team on the appropriate targets for campaigns (target buyer persona, best content type and channel to reach that persona, metrics etc.)
  • Utilize industry and organizational knowledge to develop ideas and content
  • Draft and edit assigned content for multiple channels at once
  • Measure and report to showcase how content is performing against business objectives and targets.

Qualifications

  • 5 years' experience in producing high quality marketing content.
  • Passionate and enthusiastic for content creation
  • With an excellent attention to detail (you catch grammar and spelling mistakes easily)
  • A strategic thinker who can approach content creation from a strategic lens, asking the value of the content we’re creating, what we’re trying to achieve, and optimize content if metrics aren’t being met
  • Strong writing skills
  • Hands-on and eager to roll up sleeves to get things done in an agile, collaborative environment
  • Great interpersonal skills, able to work with key stakeholders internally and externally to the business
  • Excellent project management skills, able to work independently on multiple projects at once
  • Post-secondary education in Marketing, Media, Journalism or Communications.
  • A portfolio of work showcasing your content writing skills, preferably in a B2B marketing environment.

Worker Type:

Regular

Number of Openings Available:

1

title: Hybrid Product Development Specialist
description:
Staples Promotional Products- Product Development Specialist


Staples is business to business.You’re what binds us together.


Staples Promotional Products is the world's most trusted source for branded merchandise. As an unprecedented 11-time winner of the Distributor of the Year Award and the highest-ranking Canadian distributor on the North American Top 40 list, we are committed to providing outstanding service and exceptional value. That's why companies large and small, all over the world, turn to us for the resources they need to increase brand reach and visibility.


Here’s a peek into what we do!https://www.youtube.com/watch?reload=9&v=KK5lM-0wTvQ


What you’ll be doing:


+ Collaborate with Strategic Account Manager to develop the merchandising strategy for customer programs.

+ Monitors consumer retail trends across channels (print/social) to develop customer branded merchandise that will support the customer’s brand objectives.

+ Remain current on preferred and industry supplier products and services.

+ Be our customers’ brand advocate – responsible for ensuring products meet customer brand and compliance guidelines.

+ Attends off-site client meetings, makes presentations to customers and when necessary, unpacks/packs boxes or packages to show merchandise or catalogues at client or vendor events

+ Conduct product movement and category analysis and utilizes this data along with demographic information and retail trends to drive merchandising recommendations.

+ Adhere to and develop expertise on product safety & compliance guidelines and processes.

+ Control and maintain margins within set guidelines by program.

+ Ensure smooth working and customer satisfaction by working with members of the sales team, account services, and sales support teams across the business

+ Some travel is required; generally restricted to local office metropolitan area, and with 4-6 cross-border (USA) trips annually.

+ Work overtime as required to meet deadlines and provide team coverage upon request.


What you bring to the table


+ Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills with a flair for presenting

+ An innate love for product and sourcing with an agile understanding to adapt products and solutions to relevant trends.

+ Awareness on relevant issues and ability to use them to provide purposeful and intentional products and solutions.

+ Inclusive and team spirited working with an ability to build collaborative relationships and trust through open communication

+ Accountable, Positive Attitude and Takes Initiative to Learn, Share and Grow.

+ Strong organizational skills and the ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks/projects simultaneously in a fast-paced and changing work environment and under tight deadlines

+ Strong problem solving and analytical skill set with Strong negotiation skills

+ Self-motivated with high energy and enthusiasm


Qualifications :


What’s needed- Basic Qualifications


+ Purchasing / buying / merchandising experience preferably from the fashion and/or retail consumer goods industry

+ 2-3 Years relevant work experience in product marketing, merchandising or related field Experience in the retail / agency (fashion or consumer goods) industry preferred.

+ Proficient use of Microsoft programs (Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint)

+ High School Diploma required

+ University or college diploma in fashion, sales or business or equivalent working experience within a B2B sales environment is preferred


We Offer:


+ Competitive salary.

+ Inclusive culture with associate-led Business Resource Groups and resources such as the Social Justice Resource Centre.

+ Flexible PTO and Holiday Schedule (10 observed paid holidays), Online and Retail Discounts, Company Match RRSP, Benefits and Physical and Mental Health Wellness programs.

+ Growth & development opportunities.


_Interested in joining the team? Check out our_ _perks and benefits_ _!_


_Staples Professional is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and we encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including those with disabilities._

title: Cyber Insurance Marketing Manager
description:
"At Cowbell, our mission is to protect small to medium-sized enterprises by making cyber insurance accessible to all. Join our fast-growing team of diverse and passionate individuals on this mission to reinvent how businesses manage cyber risk and buy cyber insurance.

Cowbell is a fast-growing, next-generation cyber insurance provider, built on cutting-edge technology by a team of seasoned professionals united in their mission to achieve our ambitious goals. We believe in a people-first culture and know that great work isnt done without a phenomenal team, so we make sure to reflect that in our core values, benefits & wellness program. 

In support of increasing demand, we are actively looking for ambitious people, who are not afraid of hard-work, ambiguity and a dash of chaos, to join our team and be part of a growing institution where they can hone their skills and develop new ones in a fun, challenging and dynamic environment.

If that sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Cowbell Cyber is hiring an CyberInsurance Marketing Manager  to join our Marketing Department team. 

The Insurance Marketing Manager should have a strong background in commercial lines, preferably cyber insurance because this role is tasked with supporting and managing the relationship with our top broker partners with marketing support such as content writing and co-branded marketing materials, CE course instruction, and ongoing cyber insurance product training.

What you will do:

  • Produce and Develop Cyber insurance focused co-branded content:broker marketing kits, case studies, etc.
  • Lead CE Courses and Webinars for Cowbells partner agencies 
  • Be the Cowbell Champion at Industry Conferences with the sales team and drive market awareness
  • Present at client partner office visits representing the marketing team
  • Cross-collaborate with internal departments: sales, underwriting, claims, and marketing teams
  • Manage the ongoing Cowbell Cyber broker relationship at the marketing level
  • Have ability to engage with senior level stakeholders
  • Providing data analytics, research, and pushing forward marketing initiatives in the market for brokers and agents
  • Provide ongoing training support for broker agencies
  • Be passionate about cyber insurance or insurance in general
  • Build broker presentation decks
  • Marketing Administrative Duties where needed

What Cowbell needs from you:

  • 5 years Insurance Experience Required; Cyber Insurance preferred
  • Bachelors Degree preferred
  • Advanced Technical writing experience
  • Advanced skills in Powerpoint, Google Slides, & Canva
  • Strong people management skills 
  • Must present well both verbally and in writing
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment, thats constantly changing
  • Should be a self-starter and strategic thinker
  • Excellent Project Management Skills 
  • Possess initiative, creativity, and thinks outside of the box
  • High energy level with a strong service oriented attitude
  • Great time management skills and be highly organized

What Cowbell brings to the table:

  • We are certified as a Great Place to Work. 
  • Nationwide medical, dental and vision coverage plus life insurance, long term disability and flexible spending accounts.
  • 401K matching. 
  • Employee equity plan for all and wealth enablement plan for select customer facing roles.
  • Comprehensive wellness program including unlimited PTO, monthly wellness day off, subscription to meditation app, lunch and learns, book club, weekly lunch stipends, happy hours and much more.
  • Professional development and the opportunity to learn the ins and outs of cyber insurance, cyber security as well as continuing to build your professional skills in a team environment.

By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Marketer
description:
Job Summary: SWP West is looking to hire a marketer. We are looking for outgoing, positive and money driven marketers that can work part time throughout the next 6 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

Hours: Monday - Thursday 5:00pm to 8:00pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm with a minimum of 4 hours per week. You can design your schedule!

All training will be provided!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:
  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others
Requirements to apply:
  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work

Notre Histoire

Notre modÃ¨le de gestion distinctif, selon lequel nos associÃ©s dirigent notre firme, nous place dans la position enviable de pouvoir offrir Ã  chaque employÃ© la possibilitÃ© de dÃ©tenir une part de notre entreprise. Cela signifie que nous sommes en mesure d'attirer, d'engager et de fidÃ©liser les meilleurs talents.

 

______________

 

Our small Canadian-born business was founded in 1978 and has become a global organisation that now spans 120 locations across 20 countries. Our expansion has been rapid, but what matters most is the common belief that drives all 5,000 of our people to be a different type of real estate organisation. We believe that the places in which we live, work and play have the power to make us happier and healthier, and we are united by a shared sense of purpose, to have a positive impact on peopleâ€™s lives. In short, we are a global commercial real estate advisory firm with a simple aim: for real estate to play a leading role in creating vibrant buildings, cities and places that deliver long-lasting social value and economic impact.  

 

Why Work for Us:

 

We believe that our industry is changing, and we want our business to be a melting pot of curious minds, passionate hearts and strategic intelligence. Your gender, religion and race are all highly respected, but are less important to us than your ability to step up and change the game. We provide you with a place where you can do just that, with like-minded people. Collaboration is embedded in the way we work â€“ our people have the autonomy to collaborate on client relationships, engage teams across the business, lead operations, work collectively on projects, participate in strategy and are ultimately responsible for our growth. Our distinctive Principal-led, privately-owned model puts us in the enviable position of being able to offer every employee the opportunity to own a share of our business, and inspires and allows anyone to become a Principal. This role carries voting rights so our people have a very real say in the future direction and operation of our business. This means that we are able to attract, engage and retain the best talent from the industry.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Overview:

This  is an  exciting  opportunity for an experienced Marketing Coordinator to join a small Events team within our Marketing department, who are responsible for executing the largest gathering of data professionals focused on the data  platform. This is a demand generation and marketing communications role and requires the successful candidate to drive registrations and build excitement for this yearâ€™s hybrid conference taking place in Seattle this November.

Youâ€™ll be comfortable creating campaigns across a variety of marketing channels including, email, social media, paid-media, web content, video, and more.  Successful collaboration with our in-house brand team and other marketing teams will be essential to fulfil our communication plans and registration targets.      

Apply online today!

Key responsibilities  (Not in order of importance)  

  • Coordinate and support event marketing in the run up to and during PASS Data Community Summit.
  • Create on-brand assets for a variety of uses which include but are not limited to websites, email templates, social media graphics, event displays, print collateral, and videos to support the content for integrated demand generation campaigns.
  • Develop messaging, content and email campaigns designed to resonate with certain personas, segments and verticals.
  • Pre, during and post-event communications using event management software, including but not limited to RainFocus and Marketo.
  • Support with creating, uploading and scheduling social media campaigns as required
  • Oversee various social media channels and coordinate internal and external correspondence in a friendly manner (consistent with the Redgate brand).
  • Build and develop relationships with internal team members based across various time-zones to enable them to fulfil requirements and meet deadlines.
  • Use your event and community insight to offer suggestions and ideas where appropriate.

What makes you  a Marketing  Coordinator?  

  • Demonstrable experience of working in an events marketing role, supporting multiple event projects concurrently as part of a team, as well as independently.
  • Graphic or digital designing experience with Figma or Sketch or InVision, and Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Able to work well under pressure with excellent attention to detail, time management and organizational skills, with a keen interest in prioritising workload and taking your own initiative.
  • Able to hit the ground running and get up to speed quickly to take ownership of the marketing coordination of an international hybrid conference.
  • Socially competent, a proactive team player, self-motivated, and enthusiastic.
  • Ability to work across teams, functions and time zones to get the right stuff done first time.
  • A problem-solver with the ability to think creatively and on your feet, react rapidly to situations, prioritise your workload and implement measures to improve procedures and workflow.
  • Excellent communication skills including the ability to develop, and repurpose, written marketing copy across a wide range of channels.
  • Experience of using RainFocus or an online events platform, Marketo and Hootsuite would be an advantage.

 

Whatâ€™s the package?  

  • Competitive salary based on experience, and  a great benefits package to include:
    • 20 days holiday + statutory holidays
    • Medical, dental, vision & travel insurance
    • Life insurance, long term disability insurance
    • Company annual profit share/equity award
  • Award winning culture  

Achieving work life balance has never been more important and so Redgate has adopted a flexible-hybrid model. This means that people will work flexibly with a blend of remote (home) and co-located (office) work, with teams having the flexibility to decide which location best suits the outcomes they need to deliver.

Where you work and how frequently you attend the office will depend on the nature of your role, make-up of the team and the type of work that you need to do. A weekly visit to the office is likely for most people to support our collaborative culture and enable our teams to deliver great work, though less frequent visits may also work well. So, if you are able to travel to & from the office safely in a day, that works well for us.  With that, we are currently seeking candidates who are within a commutable distance of  Vancouver and reside within the province.  

You must have the right to live and work in British Columbia, Canada to apply for this role.  

Redgate Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Marketer
description:
MARKETING OPPORTUNITY TO STUDENTS

- Looking to hire individuals to work part-time over the winter semester (Jan-May)
- No experience required, just a positive attitude and desire to learn!
- Part-time work, upwards of $25/hr

Job Description
We are a home maintenance company that provides interior and exterior painting and staining services to households and commercial buildings. We are currently hiring field marketers to generate leads and schedule estimates to help us reach our 2022 goal of $400,000. We are a company that values and provides a great team environment, professional training, and advancement opportunities. 

About the Job
·     You will be canvassing door to door offering homeowners free estimates for painting and deck/fence staining
·     You will receive training on how to pitch, objection handle, and book estimates with potential clients!



Job Responsibilities
·     Engage in conversations that educate and inform people about our services
·     Increase brand awareness
·     Generate leads (lead = name, phone number, email, and address) and converting these leads into estimates
·     Work in a team environment, working with friends is encouraged
·     Build rapport with customers
·     Potential for future promotions within the company
·     Work locally and flexible schedule

Job Requirements and Benefits
·     Outgoing, energetic, and motivated
·     Goal/result oriented
·     Previous infield marketing, customer service, and sales experience is an asset but not a necessity
·     Must be willing to work outdoors
·     Reliable transportation
·     10-20hrs a week (flexible schedule), 3-4hr shifts
·     Position runs January-May or January-July
·     Commission-Based Pay

· GREAT business and marketing experience and resume builder 
 
If you are interested, please send your resume with all relevant information to 

jmorris@studentworkspainting.com

, send me a message or call/text (226) 376 0207

Expected start date: 2022-01-03
Job Type: Part time, permanent
Wage: Upwards of $25 per hour

title: Shopper Marketing Coordinator
description:
Spinrite is the largest craft yarn and sewing thread company in North America. As an industry leader focused on driving growth and execution excellence, we are looking for a Shopper Marketing Coordinator to join our growing Marketing team.

Reporting to the Shopper Marketing Manager, the Shopper Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for optimizing the shopper experience at the store level through customized marketing and retailer support programs. This position forms a critical role between the sales and marketing teams. The Shopper Marketing Coordinator will ensure the strategic execution of category-leading consumer programs. This means supporting the team in managing what happens from idea to shelf and beyond.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively with both the Spinrite and customer marketing team on marketing plans i.e. promotions, newsletters, virtual classes, social, etc.
  • Execute semi-annual merchandising solutions, ensuring that retailers and the sales team have the appropriate merchandising tools at shelf level to provide the optimum shopper experience
  • Manage project workflows and assignments within Airtable and Sharepoint
  • Track and manage budget expenses related to their customer accounts
  • Liaise with retailer counterparts in the execution of marketing campaigns
  • Manage the launch package process and provide support to Sales in building customer presentations and managing marketing materials for customer meetings
  • Support the Brand team on all marketing functions for the product line, pricing, promotions, and events
  • Support Shopper Marketing on all customer-specific initiatives and other shopper marketing functions
  • Assist in the product development (PD) process including packaging, launch packages, and other PD materials.
  • Create brand and account-specific presentation materials
  • Partner with the Graphics team to create marketing materials e.g. packaging, ads, planograms, inspiration sheets, promotional proposals.
  • Manage brand material creation e.g. tear offs, swatches, launch packages, and other branded materials.
  • Partner with the Design Team on pattern support for brand and account-specific initiatives.
  • Conduct marketing research to determine marketplace and competitive opportunities (SWOT).
  • Conduct consumer insight research to support the development of meaningful product and promotions.
  • Manage brand material creation e.g. tear offs, swatches, launch packages, ECNs, FGs, product costing and pricing approvals
  • Handle day-to-day sales, customer, and account-support activities
  • Provide marketing support to other internal and external partners i.e. sales, operations, product development, customers, consumers, and others as required
  • Works in a safe manner and meets company safety requirements.
  • Draw insights and make recommendations to leverage competitive, retailer, and shopper intelligence
  • Create and deliver analytical reports of sales and marketplace data as requested by the marketing team
  • Create reports, draft presentations, formulate internal/external communication (written and verbal), and other marketing support duties
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • Strong computer skills in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel
  • 2-3 years’ experience in marketing or trade marketing related role
  • College or university education, in Business or Marketing
  • Travel is required, must have a valid passport and driver’s license
  • Independent, entrepreneurial thinker, and adaptable to change
  • Solid communication skills, able to work with all levels within the organization
  • Highly organized and proactive with ability to work within a fast-paced environment
  • Creative and strategic thinker, great at problem solving
  • Strong customer focus


Spinrite is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and all applicants for employment without regard to any status protected by the Ontario Human Rights Code, US Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, and applicable state law. If you need assistance or accommodations during any part of the application or interview process, please contact us at 519-291-3780 and ask to transferred to HR.

This position forms a critical role between the sales and marketing teams. The Shopper Marketing Coordinator will ensure the strategic execution of category-leading consumer programs. description:
Good Markets Products experience in large Financial Services firms
Exceptional Data Analysis skills
Knowledge of SQL against large data sets
Business analysis & Presentation skills would be helpful
Technology background in File based or Messaging systems-based architecture would be an additional plus

title: Senior Lifecycle Marketing Specialist
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Do you love working with different departments to create interesting and innovative online campaigns? Are you a big-picture thinker where you see how your efforts fit into achieving key business goals? If so, our Senior Lifecycle Marketing Specialist position might just be the right position for you!

We form long-term connections as we respect the time and money of our regular players and customers. And we want you to be part of our Lifecycle Marketing team that strives to connect with our customers and help build games that connect them with other players. You are a mold-breaker who loves to learn and test new things. More than this, you can quickly pick up new tools and processes while always looking for ways to improve and build upon past successes.

This role can be based remotely anywhere in Canada

Excited by this opportunity? We invite you to apply now and start the conversation with us. Together, we can create and support some of the best games ever made and entertain the world!

About Kabam
Kabam is a world leader of developing entertaining, immersive, and highly social multiplayer games for mobile devices. They merge consumer behaviour with the art of game design to create experiences that are enjoyed by millions of players across the globe. Each game has raised the benchmark in mobile gaming, bringing high-quality graphics, next-generation technology and revolutionary gameplay to the console in every player’s pocket.
Kabam has partnered with leading entertainment brands like Disney, Hasbro and Universal to create mobile games based on some of the world’s most iconic franchises.

Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads including Fast & Furious 6: The Game, Fast & Furious: Legacy,Marvel Contest of Champions,Transformers: Forged to Fight,Shop TitansandMini Guns.These games have also received multiple awards such as Apple’s Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year.

Founded in 2006, Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, Montreal, Charlottetown, Los Angeles, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.

Kabam is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and equitable workplace, and inclusive environment for all existing and potential employees. Employment decisions are based on candidate qualifications and business need, not race, color, ancestry, place of origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, political belief, religion, creed, marital or family status, medical condition, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, prior criminal conviction or any other protected class in accordance with federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</section>

title: B2B Marketing Coordinator
description:
The Role

Our Marketing team is growing and requires a B2B Marketing Coordinator to support our growing B2B Marketing initiatives. We are looking for a highly curious and driven individual who is eager to learn. This opportunity does not require a specific set of prior work experience but rather a set of fundamental characteristics - curiosity, resourcefulness and hustle.

 

Responsibilities

  • Coordination of content as designated by the Senior Marketing Coordinator including: blog, email, social, web, print and more as needs arise
  • Webinar support, including coordination of speakers, sending of invites & follow-up communication with attendees
  • Coordination and quality assurance of weekly emails
  • Researching competitor content to help inform marketing strategies
  • Ensuring all creative assets are consistent with our brand style guide
  • Reporting, or coordinating the reporting, of key performance indicators for B2B marketing initiatives

     

     

    Education and Experience

  • Undergraduate or master’s university degree in marketing, communications, or related field.
  • Knowledge of B2B marketing an asset
  • Some CMS (Salesforce) experience an asset
  • Experience with Hubspot, Salesforce, CallRail, Google Data Studio is an asset

  •  

    Skills and Abilities

  • Requires a high degree of initiative, dependability, and ability to work with little supervision
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

title: Home Care Business Development Liaison
description:
Are you a driven sales professional with a passion for seniors who is looking for a passionate, rewarding career in the home care industry? Our Winnipeg, MB office is looking for an experienced Home Care Liaison to join our stellar team. We are actively interviewing, apply today!

 

 Requirements of this role:

  • 2 years of business development experience in home care, senior living, or senior health care space
  • Experience in generating new business from hospitals, skilled nursing facilities, senior living communities and geriatric care managers, etc. 
  • A proven track record of selling senior care services 
  • Have passion, be driven, entrepreneurial and creative
  • Thrive in an independent, self-motivated environment with little direct supervision
  • Maximize the resources at their disposal to build and maintain relationships
  • Have strong written and oral communication skills
  • Be team oriented and comfortable collaborating with other staff

Primary responsibilities include: 

  • Developing new referral accounts in the local healthcare and senior care community with elder care industry professionals, organizations, and establishments
  • Taking healthcare, financial, and or legal professionals through the sales process
  • Coordinating post discharge home care with hospital and skilled nursing facility discharge planners, RNs, social workers and physicians to provide a seamless transition and effective rehabilitation at home for our clients
  • Representing our services in a professional and creative manner
  • Answering and actively making calls to prospective clients in need of services
  • Organizing Lunch and Learn programs for professionals involved with the senior community
  • Representing the company at fundraising and community support events
  • Working closely with the client service team to ensure client satisfaction and excellence of care
  • Maintaining accurate records on all prospective and active referral sources

 

Perks in this sales role:

  • Unlimited growth and advancement potential with an expanding sales team
  • Strong senior leadership support and strategic guidance
  • Established and seasoned operations team supporting client care and staffing
  • Company sponsored cell phone and lap top
  • Robust salary plus uncapped commission
  • Health benefits: medical, dental, vision, life insurance
  • PTO

 

Home Care Assistance is the largest and fastest-growing private pay solution for seniors who wish to age well in their home. We offer concierge-level care management and dependable in-home assistance to seniors across our 150 locations throughout North America. A mission driven organization, we proudly assist thousands of clients in optimizing their quality of life as they â€œage in placeâ€ in the comfort of their home. Our holistic approach to care is based on the lifestyles of the longest-living people in the world and promotes a healthy mind, body, and spirit.

 

Home Care Assistance began in 2002 when the founders noticed a lack of high-touch, premium care management and caregiving assistance when seeking to help their own loved one age successfully at home. While developing a thoughtful, comprehensive service offering they would expect for their own parents, they found that the home care market was fragmented, slow moving and ripe for improvement.

 

Today, Home Care Assistance has become an industry leader in the $100 Billion industry through a focus on excellent customer service, great people and innovation.

 

We are unique in that we are the only at-scale, national provider of private pay, non-medical care with a company-owned location strategy. With plans to aggressively expand our footprint, there is tremendous opportunity to build a lasting and valuable company â€“ weâ€™re just getting started.

 

If this sounds like a great match, apply today!  We'd love to hear from you!

 

HCA requires all internal employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of vaccination will be required as a condition of employment subject to applicable law concerning exemptions/accommodations.

 

HCA is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability or any other protected status.

title: Marketer
description:
Job Summary: SWP West is looking to hire a marketer. We are looking for outgoing, positive and money driven marketers that can work part time throughout the next 6 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

Our hours will consist of Monday to Thursday 5:00pm to 8:00pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm, with your choice of a minimum of 4 hours per week. You can design your schedule to work around your busy schedule.

All training will be provided!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:
  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others
Pay Structure:
Every crew member can expect to make a minimum of minimum wage and our last years highest earning employees were averaging $25/hr. Specific pay structure will be discussed during our first phone call.

Bonuses:

  • Per Lead
  • Per Estimate
  • Per Lawn Sign

Requirements to apply:

  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work
  • Communication
  • Reliable transportation

What is expected of you: 

  • A positive and persistent attitude. 
  • Hours are flexible and based on your schedule, but plan to work 6-20 hours per week (6 hours minimum)
  • Reliable transportation (door-to-door routes will vary within the V7G and V7H postal codes) 
  • Referring our exceptional service to friends and family

As mentioned earlier, we can work in pairs and encourage a fun work environment, so feel free to apply with a friend!

The Part-Time Marketer position could lead to full-time employment as a Painter should you be interested. If you feel like you would be a good fit for the job, don't hesitate to reach out and get in contact with us!

You can design your schedule to work around your busy schedule.', 'Motivated to Work', 'Reliable transportation', 'Honest']

title: Business Development Coordinator
description:
About Hive:

Hive Media Group connects various audiences with satisfying, fun, and thought-provoking pieces of digital content. We’re driven by our desire to entertain and educate audiences interested in entertainment, parenting, pets, sports, finance, history, and everything in-between.

Job Description:

We are seeking a motivated Business Development Coordinator to assist our Vice President of Audience Development in driving lead generation and expanding the business. You will be working on a cross functional team to coordinate partnerships with content creators on Instagram, Tik Tok, SnapChat, Facebook and Youtube. You will conduct market analysis, maintain the CRM system, initiate contact with prospects, generate leads, maintain relationships, organize media, and complete a range of administrative duties to improve processes.  

To excel in this role you; enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, have excellent people skills, are proficient in analyzing and managing large amounts of data, are resourceful and a problem solver. You will need to be organized and detailed oriented, not let “No” slow you down and lastly, must be willing to develop a strong understanding of the media landscape. 

*****This is a full-time, in-house position in London, Ontario (During COVID-19 we will be WFH indefinitely, with plans to reopen the office in 2022) **Applicants must submit a cover letter/resume with your application to be considered**

Responsibilities:

  • Conducting market research to identify new business development opportunities
  • Maintaining a CRM of prospective candidate company and contact information
  • Providing regular pipeline updates
  • Coordinating outreach and conversations to arrange prospect meetings
  • Assisting with preparation of presentation materials for prospective candidates
  • Maintaining relationships and conversations with prospects
  • Coordinating agreements and organizing media for team use
  • Improving and adjusting business development processes
The Ideal Candidate:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, Media or related field
  • 1-3 years of professional experience
  • A strong understanding of Tik Tok, Instagram and SnapChat platforms 
  • Ability to prioritize and manage workload
  • Ability to work independently and part of a team
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • A collaborative, make-it-work attitude
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment
  • Experience with SalesForce or PipeDrive is a plus
  • Experience working with content creators is a plus 
  • Previous sales experience is a plus
 Why Work for Hive Media?
  • Competitive wages
  • Employer contribution towards Medical, Dental, and Vision premiums for all regular full-time employees and their dependents.
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • 401(k) profit-sharing plan for Americans or  Registered Retirement Saving Plan (RRSP)  with company match for Canadians
  • Paid Time Off
  • We care about your career and foster a culture of learning. We provide dedicated time to improve your skills, lunch and learns, online courses, knowledge sharing between team members, and many more opportunities
  • A management team focused on performance, growth, engagement and connection
  • Company-sponsored events and fully hosted summer and winter parties.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
We are looking for an energetic, self-motivated Marketing Coordinator to join our growing team. The candidate will be working directly with the management team to ensure the overall marketing strategy is aligned with the needs of our supply channel and direct retail customers.

The candidate will be responsible for assisting in creating marketing plan, coordinating all the marketing activities and initiatives, conducting market research, carrying out promotional campaigns, identifying target audiences and evaluating current trends.

â€œExpect betterâ€ are the words we live by and is reflected consistently through our everyday actions to create a better tomorrow.
 

In this job you will be expected to:

 

- Assist management team with developing strategic marketing initiatives and activities.

- Implement marketing plans that include digital, print, broadcast and online content.

- Create branded advertising campaigns, and support the design activities by coordinating and collating content. - Setup tracking systems for marketing campaigns and online activities.

- Conduct market research to identify marketing opportunities and negotiate media coverage.

- Traffic all advertising efforts to appropriate channels.

- Create, maintain and strengthen the organizationâ€™s overall brand through all media avenues.

- Contact and manage relations with social media sponsors and brand ambassadors - Create and coordinate digital marketing plan (Ie, including online ads for search, social platforms, newsletter, etc.)

- Manage social media pages across multiple brands; Respond to customer posts on social media posts - Organize and streamline service offerings into user-friendly concepts.

- Manage print contractors and other promotional vendors. - Simplify complex data into a user-friendly format such as graphs, charts and other visual aids for clients and management.

title: Designer, Marketing
company: DUCA Financial Services Credit Union Ltd.
description:
Designer, Marketing

DUCA is looking for a Designer to join our Marketing team!

Job Purpose & Summary

The Designer supports DUCA’s marketing initiatives and campaigns through design for digital and print including our public website, email communications, internal communications, and in-branch marketing collateral. This position is highly skilled in production and has a strong sense of design.  

Key Accountabilities & Duties

  • Support cross-functional design requirements (marketing, internal communications, corporate, brand awareness projects, etc.)
  • Collaborate to produce designs that support DUCA’s goals and vision while considering the end-user.
  • Follow and suggest improvements to the DUCA Brand Guidelines as well as the processes and protocols developed for the design unit and Marketing Department, such as file naming system and rate updates.
  • Create high-fidelity, accurate design deliverables in a timely manner.
  • Support ongoing updates and maintenance of DUCA’s digital channels (DUCA website, social media, in-branch digital signage, etc.).
  • Build and refine layouts for marketing emails, eNews and eVites, and update templates.
  • Create and update existing print and digital marketing materials and corporate communications, such as social media images, online and print ads, employee communications, event materials, PowerPoint templates, rate sheets, and election materials.
  • Communicate the intended user-experience with research, design, and mockups.
  • Provide support in coordinating print production and distribution of marketing materials, especially for campaigns and branch events when needed

Occupational Experience & Education Requirements

  • Degree or Diploma in Graphic Design or a related field
  • Preferred 2 years' experience in design and production, preferably in a financial services environment
  • Demonstrated experience in producing usable digital designs
  • Proficient in InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator and Acrobat
  • Well-versed in Microsoft Office, especially PowerPoint and Word
  • Skilled in:
    • Email Marketing Application, ClickDimensions is an asset
    • Content Management System (CMS), OpenText TeamSite is an asset
  • Knowledge of HTML and CSS
  • Experience in animation and/or motion design considered an asset
  • Knowledge of file preparation for printing considered an asset

Knowledge, Skills & Attributes 

  • Highly organized with excellent production skills
  • Great attention to detail, and commitment to quality
  • Demonstrated visual design sensibilities as they relate to applying a brand to digital and analog experiences
  • Strong prioritization, and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple deliverables at one time
  • Self-starter, and team player who is comfortable in a changing environment
  • Eager to learn and develop new skills

Working Conditions

  • This position works in a normal, fast-paced office environment. Standard work week of 38 hours with additional time may be required to meet deadlines and project deliverables

Department: Marketing

Primary Location: 5255 Yonge Street, North York ON

Employment Status: Full-time

Hours per Week: 38

Job Grade Level: 3

About DUCA

DUCA exists to help people do more, be more and achieve more with their money and their lives. We’re driven by a co-operative philosophy that puts our Members (and Owners) at the centre of every decision we make, gives them a voice in how we’re run, and rewards them for their loyalty by sharing our profits.

At DUCA, we’re dedicated to creating a positive environment where our employees have growth and development opportunities, a healthy work/life balance, opportunities to give back to the community, and a focus on doing what is right for our Members. DUCA offers a competitive total compensation package including base salary, a short-term incentive (bonus) program, a comprehensive benefits program, pension plan, and employee banking benefits.

DUCA is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Recruitment related accommodations will be provided upon request.

Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their application. Applications must include both a resume and cover letter.

We thank all applicants but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

title: Product Analyst / Analyste de produits (Réf : 5-24E)
description:
Par où commencer ? Cette compagnie est tout simplement incroyable! Leurs produits, leurs équipes, leur localisation, l’ambiance de travail, les avantages, etc. tout est « numéro 1 »!

Il s’agit d’une PME a forte croissance qui est déjà en affaire aux 4 coins du monde auprès de clients prestigieux.

Ils ne recrutent pas une liste de compétences mais des personnes avant tout. Bien sûr il vaut mieux avoir le savoir faire, mais ce qui compte c’est surtout qui vous êtes.

Fondée en 2003, l’entreprise est située à Montréal, avec des bureaux localisés à Chicago, Chennai, Melbourne, Amman et Londres. Ils collaborent avec 35 % du Fortune 100 et 25 % des meilleurs établissements de l’enseignement supérieur, ce qui inclut 8 des 10 meilleures écoles de commerce au monde. L’entreprise compte des clients dans plus de 40 pays. Depuis 2014, notre client fait continuellement partie des Meilleurs lieux de travail de l’institut Great Place to Work® et s’est classée au premier rang des « Meilleurs lieux de travail au Canada » en 2021.

Ce que vous ferez en tant qu’Analyse de produits :

  • Concevoir des conditions/spécifications détaillées pour l’équipe de développement.
  • Créer des documents reliés aux sorties des produits.
  • Participer aux activités reliées aux conditions, en s’assurant de mettre à jour régulièrement la documentation.
  • Garder une communication rapide et claire avec les membres de l’équipe.

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour exceller dans ce rôle :

  • Une expérience :
    • D’au moins 3 ans en analyse de produits.
    • En rédaction de documents techniques et non-techniques (ex. conditions, matériel de formation, etc.).
  • D’excellentes compétences verbales et écrites afin de bien collaborer avec les parties prenantes.
  • Une capacité :
    • À bien présenter l’élément à l’équipe.
    • À bien comprendre les concepts techniques.
    • À compatir avec le client et à vouloir offrir une expérience agréable pour l’utilisateur.
  • Une passion pour nos produits.
  • Une bonne connaissance de : Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Confluence, JIRA.
  • De bonnes compétences d’organisation : le sens des priorités, de l’organisation des documents, de la gestion du temps, du multitâche et de l’autonomie.
  • Un souci du détail et un bon œil pour trouver les défauts d’une solution.
  • Un poste situé à Montréal, Québec.

Atouts :

  • Une expérience avec la méthodologie Agile.
  • Une capacité à apprendre rapidement.
    • De sortir des sentiers battus.
  • Une connaissance du français et d’une autre langue.

Avantages :

  • Des congés/vacances illimités.
  • Un environnement de travail flexible et hybride.
  • Une assurance maladie, dentaire et médicale.
  • Un régime d’assurance collective.
  • Une subvention pour les transports en commun (Montréal).
  • Des abonnements de gym entièrement subventionnés.
  • Un programme d’aide aux employés.
  • Un programme de dons des employés.
  • Un salon Blue + une salle de jeu.
skills: ['Concevoir des conditions/spécifications détaillées pour l’équipe de développement.', 'Des congés/vacances illimités.', 'Des abonnements de gym entièrement subventionnés.', 'Ils ne recrutent pas une liste de compétences mais des personnes avant tout. Bien sûr il vaut mieux avoir le savoir faire, mais ce qui compte c’est surtout qui vous êtes.']

title: Indigenous Marketing Specialist
description:
Job Reference: 93806

Company Overview

Do you want to work with one of Canadaâ€™s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!

---Kindly apply directly on our website at www.spiritomega.org, not through Indeed. Thank you

Our well established client is seeking a Indigenous Marketing Specialist to work Remotely in Canada.

What's in it for you?

  • Work with one of Canada's "Top 100 Employers," with possibility of extension or permanent placement.
  • Type: Permanent
  • Location: Remote, Canada
  • Role: Marketing Specialist, Indigenous     
  • Competitive Compensation and Benefits.
  • Representation by an award-winning staffing agency that takes pride in our personalized approach to staffing, ensuring you are a valued member of the team - not just a number.

Do you want to serve as a trusted advisor and work with the Marketplace leaders to plan and execute a full complement of marketing initiatives to drive growth and enhance market positioning? Read more below!

What will your typical day look like?

In this role you will join in-house marketing team; key responsibilities include assisting in the execution of Canadaâ€™s Reconciliation Action Plan based on the guiding commitments and targets under the pillars of Education, Employment, Inclusion and Economic Empowerment. You will join a passionate team leading Indigenous strategy to help embed reconciliation across internal functions of the firm as well as work with key external stakeholders. The person in this role will provide communication support, tracking the impact of our commitments as well as driving marketplace efforts. Including executing on marketing tactics such as thoughtware development, event planning, online activities, sponsorships, speaker and eminence programs.  In this fast-paced role, you will deliver marketing campaigns on time, on schedule and on budget; all while delivering ROI.   

About the team

Has been committed to supporting Indigenous leaders, communities, and organizations for nearly 30 years. As a firm we are advancing reconciliation by fostering meaningful and lasting relationships in working with Indigenous peoples, clients, and communities. In this role you will join a passionate team within Deloitteâ€™s in-house marketing agency.

Enough about us, letâ€™s talk about you

  • Minimum 3-5 years of marketing experience
  • Bachelor degree or diploma in business, marketing, communication or related field
  • Demonstrated interest in and commitment to furthering reconciliation with Indigenous and non-Indigenous peoples
  • Strong communication skills, written and verbal with a keen eye for detail
  • Experience working with senior professionals in a fast paced environment often with tight deadlines
  • Demonstrated effective project management skills. Must be able to effectively manage multiple tasks and timelines independently
  • Lead the implementation of marketing and communications campaigns or campaign initiatives as identified in the marketing plan. This may include, but is not limited to tactics such as:
    • collateral and thoughtware development (reports)
    • event planning including virtual
    • digital and social media coordination
    • sponsorships
  • Have a high standard of quality and provide quality assurance review on all projects
  • Bilingualism (English, French, and/or any Indigenous language) is an asset

CLOSES SOONER IF A SUCCESSFUL IS CANDIDATE IDENTIFIED - APPLY ASAP 

Kindly submit your resume in Word format and ensure your work history includes the Month/Year for every employer. 

**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**

Looking for more opportunities? Check out our website at www.spiritomega.org

Don't see a posting that suits you? Apply to our "General Application" and our recruiters will get in touch when they have a job that fits you!

Follow us "Spirit Omega" on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter for all our new postings.

title: Sales Analyst
description:
Water Made Exciting!

At SodaSteam, we are growing fast and looking for problem-solvers and thought leaders that are ready to grow with us. If you have the energy and determination, then we'll provide the tools you need for success. We have fantastic benefits and a variety of perks that create an outstanding work environment for all our employees

Job Summary:

The Sales Analyst will be responsible for the development of analytics processes and capabilities and fostering a fact based approach throughout the organization. The incumbent utilizes sales data, shipment data, inventory data, custom research, and software tools to formulate insights and recommendations to help the business achieve their overall objectives. The Analyst plays a key role in sales analytics to drive profitable growth and joint value creation with our customers.

Benefits

  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with Employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop, train and implement a data analysis tools which will encompass the design and building of a central multi-sourced database. Efficiently develop reporting leveraging database architecture.
  • Lead liaison with Israel IT to facilitate request and leverage corporate tools and expertise
  • Promote a fact-based approach by incorporating multiple data sources to drive more accurate recommendations to optimize sales.
  • Lead data analyses and leveraging multiple data sources to develop actionable insights.
  • Manage large quantities of data, developing reports using BI tools including MS Access. Ie. ROI calculation
  • Provide guidance to Sales based on insights on how to improve efficiency based on key levers such as product, place, price and promotion.
  • Work on special projects as assigned by Manager.


Country:
Canada

Requirements:

  • University Degree in business or a related areas
  • 5+ years of experience working in a Sales Analyst or similar type of role
  • Experience working in the CPG or retail arenas
  • Hands-on experience using customer specific portals (e.g. retail link, dunnhumby, IRI, etc.) & syndicated data (e.g. Nielsen / NPD).
  • Experience working with reporting-database integration and a range of database platforms relational databases, and data-driven reporting applications
  • Advanced MS Office skills, high level MS Access / Excel and ability to quickly learn other customer specific systems
  • Passionate, driven, with a high attention to detail and strong time management skills
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills
  • Ability to develop strong business relationships and influence key internal/external decision makers
  • Customer-centric with a high sense of urgency
  • Be able to manage ambiguity and takes personal initiation.
  • Proven leadership, analytical and strategic thinking abilities are essential


﻿SodaStream Canada is committed to an inclusive, recruitment and selection processes. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, SodaStream Canada will provide accommodation throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please advise the Human Resources Department

title: Category Specialist
description:
Job Description

Responsibilities1

8 to 10 key responsibilities

  • Provide in-depth category knowledge based upon professional qualifications and/or extensive experience in Category Management in the development of Category Plans within span of control.
  • Provide advice & expertise and be the internal SME on the spend category including market and category intelligence, influencing the refreshment of Category plans.
  • Delivery of annual value savings.
  • Build and manage a specialist service delivery for internal stakeholders. Form an operational link between Business Requirements and market capabilities.
  • Ensure that there are regular benchmarks of values with relevant stakeholders.
  • Manage senior level relationships in category.
  • Form Supplier Relationship Management plans for all suppliers and apply Account Management & Governance of suppliers.
  • Collate & analyze all supplier performance data and lead all meetings. Manage profile with suppliers.
  • Examine and rationalize existing supplier base.
  • Act as an escalation point & provide assistance in resolving supplier performance issues.
  • Drafting and management of RFP's in a consistent format to ensure new requirements are effectively and accurately communicated to incumbent and potential suppliers. Negotiation of all pricing and terms to ensure that excellent value is demonstrated.
  • Interface with all functions as appropriate.
  • Evaluate and develop processes, systems, and controls to implement continuous improvements.
  • Establish and monitor valid supply contracts for all goods and services in area of personal control. Interface with all functions as appropriate.
  • Consolidate where there are multiple contracts per supplier (create Framework contracts).
  • Use technology (i.e. e-Sourcing and Contract Management system) to improve the effectiveness of the role.
  • Evaluate and develop processes systems and controls to implement continuous improvements.
  • Ensure contracts are communicated effectively to internal stakeholders for their efficient usage.
  • Ensure compliance with corporate policies & procedures and ensure control processes are in place and adhered.
  • Coordinate pre-planning of material requirements with operations.
  • Provide effective forecasting and costing.
  • Ensure an effective flow of order information from procurement to payment
  • Drive improvement in vendor performance relative to quality, delivery and cost.
  • Monitor service levels to ensure that performance metrics meet customer requirements.
  • Maintain and manage the pricing levels in JDE system as well as the product purchased directly.
About Us

Civeo Premium Services Employees LP is a premier remote workforce lodge operator for the Western Canadian resource industry. We help people maintain healthy, productive and connected lives while living and working away from home. Our unique approach focuses on guest wellbeing, operational efficiency and community building - making us a leading provider of accommodation solutions.

title: Marketer
description:
Hello!

I am looking for a couple people that are interested in some part time work doing flyer dropping/lead generation for my local painting business. I am offering $20/hr, and you will have the flexibility to make your own schedule. This is a perfect job for anyone who can commit some hours per week but need it to be on their time.

We knock on doors and simply ask people if they have considered doing any painting this summer. If yes, then we get their information so we can follow up with them. If no, then we move on to the next. We are following guidelines and procedures that our BC government has outlined for us.

Typically our team goes out for about 2 hours, twice a week in the evenings. After coming to one session, you can make your own schedule and plan around your daily life. You can go in the afternoon or evening, for as many hours as you would like. This is a very straightforward job ideal for an individual with some spare time and a need for money.
