title: Marketer
description:
Job Summary: SWP Edmonton NE is looking to hire a marketer. We are looking for outgoing, positive and money driven marketers that can work part time throughout the spring/summer. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

Our hours will consist of Monday to Thursday 5:00pm to 8:00pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm, with your choice of a minimum of 4 hours per week. You can design your schedule to work around your busy schedule.

All training will be provided!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:
  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others
Pay Structure:
Every crew member can expect to make a minimum of minimum wage and our last years highest earning employees were averaging $25/hr. Specific pay structure will be discussed during our first phone call.

Bonuses:

  • Per Lead

Requirements to apply:

  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work
  • Communication
  •  Vehicle or reliable transportation
  •

You can design your schedule to work around your busy schedule.', 'Motivated to Work', 'Honest']

description:

We are looking for outgoing, positive and money driven marketers that can work part time throughout the next 6 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it. The job consists of going door to door in local neighbourhoods and asking for names and numbers of those wanting work done on their homes(painting only) 

Our hours will consist of Monday to Tuesday 4:00pm to 7:00pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm, with your choice of a minimum of 4 hours per week. You can design your schedule to work around your busy schedule.

All training will be provided!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:
  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others
Pay Structure:
Every crew member can expect to make a minimum of minimum wage and our last years highest earning employees were averaging $25/hr. Specific pay structure will be discussed during our first phone call.

Bonuses:

  • Per Lead
  • Per Estimate
  • Per Lawn Sign

Requirements to apply:

  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful

  • Communication

title: Part-Time International Marketing Assistant
description:
Department: International Education and Development
Campus: Barrie
Classification: Support Staff
Posting Date: February 3, 2022
Salary Range: $18.95 - $24.58
Hours per week: Up to 24 hours per week - Current hours anticipated to be 24 hours per week
Status: Part-time (Regular)

Reporting to the Director, Global Engagement, International Education and Development, the incumbent assists with departmental marketing media, including print, digital copy, website and social media. Specific duties include, but are not limited to:

Media Design:
• Assisting with concept development, design and production of multi-language communications and marketing documents ensuring material conforms to cultural norms and that translation services are coordinated. Documents / materials may include case studies, photography, digital communications, program guides, paid and unpaid media, brochures, videography, and reports to raise awareness of the programs and services.
• Creating graphic design images for various digital media.
• Producing and maintaining international student information graphic video series
• Assisting with Marketing and Communications with student recruitment efforts by producing high-quality communications (multi-language formats as needed) such as alumni testimonials, blogs, webinars, etc. in accessible formats for a wide range of audiences
• Assisting in the daily updates of departmental social media in various applications globally by answering inquiries and posting information on social media platforms.
• Assisting with the development of an annual internationalization marketing plan which may include assisting with the development of graphics or content for the plan.
• Ensuring all website designs are AODA Compliant and accessible in other countries across all browsers and all devices
• Generating media usage reports using web analytics (user engagement, user feedback, etc.), summarizing information if applicable, and providing the appropriate international manager with the material which is used for decision making (i.e. negative comments received on a specific topic may warrant the manager to decide to remove the content or re-word the content)

Events:
• Assisting with photography collection at various on and off-campus events
• Participating in international department and college-side events on behalf of the international department such as Open Houses, Come Together Week, college events and community events.
• Assisting with communication efforts to promote events to international students

Projects:
• Assisting with organizing and coordinating marketing project activities which includes requesting assistance, and communicating the task requirements, to student and staff international team members
• Assisting with marketing efforts on various departmental projects
• Aid in the coordination and collection, analysis, distribution and response with stakeholder communications in relation to project scopes, creative development and feedback, and facilitates the flow of information with clear establishment of milestones and/or deadlines

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Successfully completed a two-year postsecondary diploma in web design, graphic design, marketing, or a related field.
• A minimum of two years experience working in web design, graphic design and/or marketing.
• Experience working in a post-secondary environment would be an asset
• Demonstrates sensitivity to different cultures and able to working in challenging environments
• Excellent communications skills, both written and oral
• Strong computer skills and experience using the MS Office Suite (i.e. Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access), Adobe Suite (i.e. InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator), and Social Media
• Organization and time management skills
• Strong knowledge of campus and community services and Georgian College programs
• Experience gathering, analyzing data and preparing reports, including website data analytics
• Ability to work independently as well as part of a team

Georgian College supports diversity, equity and a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. Georgian College is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you are contacted to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please advise the interview coordinator of any accommodations needed with respect to any materials or processes used to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process.

Alternate formats will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process.

Georgian College has a COVID-19 vaccination procedure in place. As a condition of employment, employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 to work on any campus, or a facility owned, operated or controlled by Georgian College unless they have a valid medical or religious belief/creed reason for not getting vaccinated, which reason will be considered on a case by case basis and which will be subject to the College's accommodation processes.

Applications for this position must be received by 11:59 p.m. on February 9, 2022. While we thank all applicants, only those contacted for an interview will be acknowledged.

title: Research Associate - Toronto
description:
Research Associate

We're a smart, dedicated and fun team with huge plans for growth in order to achieve our vision. We're looking for outstanding people to help us reinvent deal origination and we need an incredible individual to help identify M&A opportunities for our clients.

www.finquest.com

About Us:

Finquest is a fast-growing Fintech company, with headquarters in Singapore and additional offices in New York, Toronto, London, Paris, Frankfurt, Luxembourg, Bangalore, and Hong Kong.

Finquest's mission is to reinvent deal origination by harnessing the power of data, AI, and people.  Our team speaks more than 17 languages, and we pride ourselves on our diverse and collaborative office environment across our offices.

We are currently searching for a Research Associate to help identify M&A opportunities for our clients. The position would be based in Toronto, in a hybrid working environment.

You will be responsible for:

  • Using our internal tools, databases and external searches to fulfil clients' expectations in a timely manner
  • Sorting and organizing data and making them easily accessible for decision-making
  • Performing general research on organisations to match and verify companies are relevant to client needs
  • Analysing the types of data/information needed to be collected to serve better our clients
  • Participating in client discussions
  • Working closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Providing input and ideas for new collection methods and process improvement
  • Contributing to developing enhanced organizational practices

Your background:

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • High EQ, strong understanding of the requirements of fast-moving markets and companies
  • Experience using data information providers will be beneficial (for e.g. S&P Capital IQ, Bloomberg, BvD, and other data aggregation programs/ information provider's databases.)
  • Experience of working to and achieving targets
  • Self-motivated
  • Strong written and oral communication skills; including fundamental presentation skills and the demonstrated ability to articulate ideas clearly and appropriately influence others
  • Ability to work and thrive in a multi-tasked, fast paced environment
  • Resilient in overcoming objections and a tenacious and determined attitude when faced with barriers or obstacles
  • Applicants must have the right to work in Canada
  • The compensation package will depend on your profile

title: Market Planning Analyst - 14 month contract
description:
This role is a 14 month contract opportunity

The primary role of the Market Planning Analyst will be to develop a SKU level forecast for the S&OP horizon (3-26 periods), facilitate the periodic Supply Review (SMR) and perform as the Business Process Owner of all the Supply Chain KPIs.

Demand Planning:

  • Keep FuturMaster database up to date
  • Provide updated forecast views on a period basis and articulate the risk/opportunity profile for designated brand family. Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Key Accounts and supply teams as necessary.
  • Develop a rolling 36-month demand forecast by SKU. The forecasting process synthesizes multiple inputs including key assumptions regarding market activities of the brand and sales managers as well as competitors, sales force inputs, syndicated market data, seasonal effects, and historical statistical models to arrive at a forecast of future demand.
  • Collaborate with Sales & Marketing to support and improve the sales forecast accuracy through identifying corrective course of action for gaps and errors. This will be achieved through improved joint forecasting, item level profiling and customer collaboration.
  • Responsible to represent the forecasting team in activity management meetings to ensure activity management projects are accurately updated in forecast models.
  • Translate promotional forecast to SKU level demand for Supply and Manufacturing visibility, driving replenishment and order management processes.
  • Create and monitor display tracking reports against forecast submission. This includes end-of-period reports as well as daily actual vs. forecast reports.
  • Drive business process improvement and adherence to Global forecasting best practices.
  • Support Demand Planning manager on DMR preparation.

Supply Planning
  • Lead the periodic Supply Review to provide a constrained outlook on inventory, shipments & warehouse capacity
  • Perform the duties of a Business Process Owner for all KPI and reporting which includes
  • Supply Chain KPI dashboard consolidation
  • Developing and maintaining the dashboard in Power BI
  • Trouble shooting report accuracy and data issues
  • Publish & own the Ageing Inventory (270 Day Report)
  • Collaborate with sales and marketing on ageing inventory
What can you expect from Mars?
  • Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
  • Join a purpose driven company, where we're striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
  • Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
  • An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

title: Sales & Marketing Coordinator - Amico Clinical Solutions
description:
Sales & Marketing Coordinator– Amico Clinical Solutions
Richmond Hill, Ontario

Are you looking for a challenging job opportunity, in a very stable industry, working with a great team of people? Check us out at www.amico.com.

Amico Corporation is a rapidly growing manufacturer of Medical Equipment with 8 manufacturing facilities employing over 800 people across North America.

Amico Clinical Solutions is currently looking for a marketing savvy, energetic self-starter to join our growing team!

Your primary responsibilities will include:
  • Developing sales documents and marketing materials such as Spec sheets, Manuals, Instruction videos, etc.
  • Social media management and creating content for various social media platforms.
  • Assisting Sales in completingand finalizing RFPs and reviewing contract documents
  • Participating in and facilitating the filming of product demo videos.
  • Helping to schedule / facilitate sales meetings and web conferences
  • Scheduling quarterly dealer update meetings
  • Supporting sales representatives and coordinating sales related activities: Sample tracking/ coordination, project reporting and internal project documentation
  • Schedule management and coordination
  • Creating and tracking custom reports
  • Other administrative duties as required.
Job Requirements:
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively interact with a variety of individuals and functions throughout the company.
  • Ability to manage relationships with customers, distributors and co-workers to ensure customer satisfaction.
  • Ability to learn quickly and grasp knowledge on a diverse set of products.
  • Basic computer proficiency with MS Office Applications. Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite is an asset.
  • Comfort with being on camera is an asset.
  • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Must be personable, organized, and have a strong attention to detail.

Compensation: Base Salary + Benefits
Job Type: Full-time

*Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Brands Team Lead/Paid Ads Specialist (FT)
description:
E-commerce Brands Team Lead & Paid Ads Specialist

Hey there. We’re Outgive!

If you’re reading this, chances are you’re either looking for a new job, someone thought of you and sent you this link, or you saw something here that drew your interest. Regardless of how you get here, we hope you’re as excited about this role as we are excited to meet you!

Let’s break down the FAQs of this job ad to help you decide if this is the right opportunity for you.

What does Outgive do?
Outgive is the parent organization of several different powerhouse brands and companies. All of them have one thing in common, and that is e-commerce! We are a fast-growing company at the intersection of technology and digital marketing.

With humble beginnings in Toronto, Outgive was established in 2013 by two friends and has grown to become a global team of 350+ specialized experts. We take pride in being more than just a place of employment, but by creating environments where anyone can bring their whole selves to work. As Outgivers, we share a passion for the e-commerce and digital industry, supporting collaboration and diversity, and finding innovative ways to carve success for our clients and ourselves.

Where can I find more information about Outgive and what it’s like working there?
Visit our website at www.outgive.ca to check out our complete family of companies, or visit us on social media @outgiveinc to learn more!

What’s awesome about being an Outgiver?
Our company isn’t just about profits. It’s built around the community. We want you to enjoy doing what you do best, and we promise to give you the autonomy and support to do it in a way that works for everyone - our customers and clients, the company, and most importantly, you. Some of the benefits we offer include:
  • Flexible work schedule. Never have the feeling of being late again!
  • Unlimited paid time off. Want a few extra vacation days for your overseas trip? No problem. Need to extend your weekend staycation? Just let us know!
  • Birthday and work anniversary celebrations. We love to celebrate you! We’ll gift you gift cards or dinner for these special occasions. We promise not to make you awkwardly stand there while we sing “happy birthday” to you.
  • Remote work options are available. Work where you work best (though this may vary on the type of role and responsibilities). Many of our team members are working from home 80-90% of the year (permanent work-from-home opportunities available).
  • Drop-And-Go Offices are available. Prefer a change of scenery or tired of hearing your roommates daily 9 am Zoom calls? We have frequently sanitized, recently renovated, and pet-friendly offices in the GTA! Casual dress code in effect and come and go as you please!
  • Free healthy snacks. Just let us know what snacks or coffee/tea keep you fueled, and we’ll stock them for the kitchen.
  • Office gym. Eat too many of those snacks? Our employee-only office gym at our head office in Mississauga is available for you 24/7. It’s no Globo gym but it’ll do!
  • Paid time off to volunteer. Are you involved in a local non-profit or do you enjoy pro-bono consulting? Outgivers get paid time off to give back to the community.
  • Recognition programs. Convert your daily or weekly peer-to-peer brownie points for gift cards, trips, food, and more!

What’s the job?
We are looking for a full-time E-Commerce Brands Team Lead and Paid Ads Specialist to join our growing team. Reporting directly to the Founder, you’ll be able to launch your career with opportunities to execute your own paid ads strategies.

Monitor and enhance online sales activity.
  • Ensure User Experience of the website including Design & Aesthetics, Content, and Navigation, Branding / Marketing, checkout funnel, and promotional campaigns.
  • Own and manage SEO measurements and monitoring methodologies.
  • Manage, analyze and draw conclusions on specific e-commerce KPIs (conversion rate, bounce…).
  • Ensure that all e-Commerce activity is consistent with the brand's sense of purpose.
Manage Competitive, market, and best practices intelligence.
  • Analyze digital role in the consumer path to purchase & consumer online searches.
  • Stay up to date with the market, consumers & competitors.
  • Collect and connect working knowledge on the e-retailers.
Achieve excellence through optimization and innovation.
  • Create and maintain an online e-business plan: e-promotional calendar, product exclusivities, cross-selling mechanisms, data ownership within eCommerce brands' websites, and e-retailers ones.
  • Create synergies between inside and outside partners in marketing or digital activities.
  • Drive Performance marketing and CRM initiatives.
  • Drive Growth, Develop and implement creative solutions to drive and convert more visitors.
We will provide you with new learning opportunities, the ability to execute your own creative ideas, and continuous professional development for your career.

Is it remote?
Cubicles are so 2018. We’re all about letting you work where you work best. We are 100% supportive of remote or hybrid work if that’s what you prefer. Let’s chat more about how we can create the best working environment for you. Our address is 7676 Woodbine Avenue, Markham, ON, L3R 2N2.

What’s the pay?
Starting at $52,000 - $55,000 ($31.25/hr) with a big emphasis on “starting”! We’re hoping to continuously grow your skills, this role, and the salary that comes with it!

Am I qualified for the position?
We don’t believe in a strict list of “qualifications”. We care more about the passion for the industry and role, the grit you have to learn new challenges, and your ability to work well with others who you can learn from! Here are some general guidelines of what we’re looking for:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, E-commerce, or a similar field preferred.
  • Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience.
  • Thorough understanding of marketing elements (including traditional and digital marketing such as SEO / Social media etc.) and market research methods.
  • Demonstrable experience in marketing data analytics and tools.
  • Solid computer skills, including MS Office, marketing software, and applications.
  • Well-organized and detail-oriented.
  • Exceptional communication and writing skills.
  • Commercial awareness partnered with a creative mind.
  • Exhibit our 4 core values. Our 4Gs – grit, growth, gratitude, and greatness – are what drive us all to keep growing and learning as Outgivers.

Will I be able to succeed in this role?
Take a moment to ask yourself if you embody some, if not all, of our 4Gs - grit, growth, gratitude, greatness. If you think you have a driven personality combined with an appreciation for collaboration, teamwork, and creative freedom, then you definitely belong here!

How do I apply?
If you got this far and still feel excited about the opportunity, click the apply button today to complete an application!

title: Research Associate
description:
Zip Code: M1L 2L1

Job ID: 3261

Standard Hours: 10-15

Compensation Range: $15.00 - $18.00

RetailData partners with the largest retailers in the world to provide competitive intelligence solutions. With consumers dynamically shifting their purchasing patterns between the various in-store and e-commerce sales channels, we are perpetually innovating new solutions and products to meet client needs. Our industry-leading expertise in price, assortment and promotional data sets, in conjunction with our expansive technology and analytics platforms, has positioned us perfectly to help retailers navigate these unprecedented retail changes.

Description:

Are you tired of being unsure how much your delivery/driver job will pay? Will the customer tip? We have a great side hustle job for you! Our jobs are preplanned with a flexible schedule, and the faster you get at the job the quicker you are in and out! Flexible when you go in and collect the work!

We provide detailed training to ensure you will achieve maximum efficiency in each store you will collect. You will control how much money you are able to collect per hour!

Great gig to earn extra money by working independently, good for anyone with flexible time to spare!

As a Store Scanning Specialist, you can enjoy the flexibility of choosing when and how much you earn. All you need is reliable transportation to start making money.



Why scan with RetailData?



Choose your own hours! When you work is totally up to you within our clients window

Easy to get started! We will provide detailed training

Earn extra money! Achieve your short-term goals or long-term collecting with RetailData

Make a guaranteed hourly minimum! (only for areas with wage floor)



Benefits:
  • Training to build speed and increase pay.
  • Ability to control what you earn.
  • Advanced notice of work schedule.
  • $400 referral bonus program.
  • As a part-time team member, you are offered identity theft protection, pet insurance, and 401k with match after 6 months and 750 hours worked.
  • Employee stock purchase after 1 year of service.
  • Independent, flexible work schedules that enable a healthy work-life balance.
  • Travel opportunities, locally and out of state.
  • Extra hours available in many areas.
  • Paid drive time and mileage reimbursement.

Come work for an essential business! We put an emphasis on A.R.T = A ccountability, R espect, T rust!

Requirements:
  • At least 18 years of age.
  • High school diploma, or equivalent.
  • Valid driver's license, clean driving record, reliable transportation, and valid automobile insurance.
  • Ability to work approximately 10 - 25 hours per week with scheduling flexibility.
  • Reliability to start and finish assignments on time with the detail needed to satisfy the project criteria.
  • Ability to stand throughout the work shift and lift up to 40 pounds intermittently.
  • Willingness to work in cold temperatures associated with grocery store refrigerator and freezer cases as some projects required collection of items in these store aisles.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: RetailData is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or sexual orientation.

title: Technology Strategist - B2B Marketing
description:
Itâ€™s time to change the world of marketing â€“ and weâ€™re looking at you

Weâ€™re making the fortunes of some of the worldâ€™s most dynamic companies. Weâ€™re transforming marketing from an enabler to a driver of business success. Weâ€™re helping companies to evolve from outmoded outbound marketing to a fully measurable inbound engine. And when we say measurement, we mean the real business kind (not the fluffy old school marketing kind).

Who weâ€™re looking for right now

In this case, weâ€™re after a rounded Marketing Technologist who has experience with the entire Martech Stack and is eager to elevate B2B enterprises and take organizations on a journey of being on the bleeding edge.  The role you will fill is a MarketOne Technology Strategist, a hybrid of business process and technology engineering that focuses on the B2B marketing and sales business process. The types of applications that are primarily, but not limited to Customer Data Platforms, Master Data Management, Content Management Frameworks, Marketing Automation, CRM, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Website Analytics and orchestration of the customer experience. A Technology Strategist is both "a business expert that understands and can apply engineering" and "an engineer that understands how to apply engineered systems to the business"â€”a Marketing Technologist.

With a focus on performance-driven marketing, this is a challenging role that blends business process design with multi-platform/multi-application design and engineering. You will be working in a results-driven and creative environment, so it is essential that you have a passion for the practical utilization of technology to drive pipeline performance â€“ not the shiny objects that distract marketers.

Seeking candidates with subject matter expertise in one or any combination of the following: Marketo, Eloqua, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce CRM, MS Dynamics, Google Analytics, Adobe Web Analytics, Informatica, Pitney Bowes Spectrum, Hadoop, Treasure Data, Twilio, Tealium, Blueconic, Lytrics, Terminus, Engagio

Your day-to-day

  • As the Technology Strategist, you will be a main point of contact on our more strategic and enterprise-size accounts for developing and driving technology adoption, scale and vision setting roadmaps. 
  • A Technology Strategist is expected to perform functional & business requirements gathering for identifying impact, feasibility and scale.  These assessments drive design and implementation of feature engineering/enhancements for assigned clientele to the Technology Strategist. 
  • You will be expected to understand how Web and Application development teams can be utilized within the overall martech infrastructure 
  • You are expected to have deep domain experience and configuration expertise ranging from CMS, MAP , CRM, DMP, DAM, ERP, database management etc and the augmentation of those systems and related processes.  Management of a full stack of technologies is core to this role.
  • You will be advising clients on how to utilize technology platforms to drive better automation, user adoption, UX/CX, BI, CRO and elevate ROI.  
  • You are expected to understand and utilize frameworks such as ABM, SVC, multi-source segmentation and solutions for business problems which span across multiple platforms.
  • Perform and coach others on the advanced functions in the Martech space
  • Creation of presentation, pitch documents and project overview/update materials based on MarketOne established frameworks
  • Mentor and/or manage Application Architects, Engineers and Developers
  • You will work with our Client Services team to support the development project plans, scope and estimates
  • You will partner with the account managers and directors to produce client status reports and develop account resourcing plans

 

Background

  • At least 3 years working experience in Martech field
  • Certification in any of the listed Martech platforms
  • Ability to design and push the boundaries of entire stacks, extending well beyond out of box capability of any single toolset. A growth hacker mindset and a thought leader.
  • Comfortable and familiar with data: Data modelling, orchestration and creating engineered datasets for the consumption of platforms
  • Understands and can produce implementations for concepts such as ABM, CXM, Lead to Revenue and Marketing Attribution
  • Solid B2B marketing experience, preferably with clients in the high-tech, manufacturing, business services sectors
  • A strong background working with and transforming marketing data, including integration of multiple systems within marketing and sales use cases.
  • Evidence of a strong academic background - does not have to have marketing specific.  Business acumen is highly valued in this role.

title: Skilled Marketer
description:
If you're looking for an extremely CHALLENGING role that will reward the HARDEST workers, this might be the job for you. We are looking for a few all-stars to add to our amazingly talented team for this summer ahead. This year is going to be a GREAT one, with a company goal of maximizing growth while maintaining a fun and enjoyable experience for our team, through our Work Hard, Play Hard strategy.

- Strong work ethic

- Enjoy working outdoors

- Minimal Fear of heights

- Great teamwork skills

Benefits

- Positive team atmosphere

- Strong mentorship program

- Extra incentives/raises

- Top-tier training

The application process is highly competitive, and priority is given to the earliest applicants. To apply to join the team for summer 2021, send in a resume outlining why you are the best pick.

title: Product Marketing & Training Specialist (Bilingual)
description:
This is a bilingual role, where proficient and fluent French language knowledge is a requirement. This person in this role is responsible to plan, design, build, implement, and deliver training on our tool and platform, on best practices, use cases on our digital solution for our customers (OEMs and Dealers) as well as for our sales and sales support teams, in French (and/or English. This person will also be responsible for creating memos, communications, and training material on product-related updates or for feature rollouts in French (and/or in English)

This role interacts with business sponsors, product teams, subject matter experts, facilitators, and end-users while contributing to the skills, knowledge, and competency improvement of the sales and dealer success support force.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

1. Support & Implement internal and client-facing product communications Training and Customer-first initiative by conducting all sales and technical training classroom sessions to improve skills, knowledge, and competencies. Recommend changes to training programs through the analysis of courses evaluation, providing options for improvement.

2. Create & develop training materials/programs including trainer guides, participant materials, and evaluation systems. Identifying learning objectives and selecting instructional methodologies. Develop and deliver specialized training to introduce and reinforce new systems and processes to the sales team.

3. Work closely with front-line leaders, keeping abreast of trainees, analyze sales performance of the sales team & facilitate additional training as required. Develop effectiveness by assessing the application of learning to job performance, recommending future training and development programs. Coaching to reinforce sales skills (new and existing salesforce) by assessing each Sales Representativeâ€™s current competencies, determining training required, and researching, designing, or learning appropriate training programs.

4. Work in conjunction with HR to facilitate effective on-boarding of new sales representatives. Support and coach new sales representatives during their transition period from training to being fully productive.

Job Requirements:

  • University degree or equivalent (R),
  • Training certificate (A)
  • Minimum 3-5 years of sales and technical training (R)
  • Management experience (A).
  • Demonstrated leadership & communication skills
  • Experience in the development and delivery of sales curriculum.
  • Computer proficiency in M/S Office and web browser.

Skills:

  • Strong communication (written & verbal) & presentation skills
  • Ability to coach, develop and provide feedback
  • Dealing with ambiguity
  • Ability to effectively manage projects
  • Strong work ethics
  • Ability to work independently, with minimum supervision

Note:

  • A valid driverâ€™s license and the ability to travel â€“ up to 25-50%

title: Marketing Content Coordinator
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy, and urbanization.

Are you curious by nature and love to turn a list of facts into a compelling story? Do you enjoy applying your versatile writing skills and creativity? If so, look no further and consider joining us!

Due to continued growth, GHD is seeking a Marketing Content Coordinator to join the Marketing and Communications team in our Ontario region. This role can be located in Waterloo, Mississauga, Whitby, Markham or our Toronto office. As our Marketing Content Coordinator, you will assist with content development of our marketing materials including client-focused collateral and capability statements in support of client and prospect marketing.

Responsibilities:
  • Write and produce marketing content for case studies, brochures, placemats
  • Build strong positive relationships while working with our MarComms team to support collateral message development
  • Produce visual content using existing Word, PowerPoint and InDesign templates
  • Collaborate and coordinate with Pursuit’s team on shared branded content, tools and resources as part of day-to-day operations
  • Coordinate with internal partners to ensure all content adheres to templates, processes and brand standards
Skills, Competencies and Qualifications:
  • A bachelor’s or master’s degree in English, Business, Communications, Journalism, Marketing, or equivalent education
  • Minimum 1 year of experience coordinating and writing technical proposals or marketing collateral for an engineering, construction, or professional services organization
  • Proven strong communication skills both written and verbal
  • Ability to build strong positive relationships
  • Meticulous attention to detail as well as strong organizational skills with the ability to schedule and manage multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines
  • Demonstrated ability to come forward with solutions to challenges/issues
  • Proficient in Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, and InDesign
  • Understanding of marketing techniques (layout, graphics, strategy-to-win)

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Senior Advisor, Marketing Strategy & Branding – Customer Experience (Montreal Dorval, QC, CA)
description:
Senior Advisor, Marketing Strategy & Branding – Customer Experience-MON18587

Description

BOMBARDIER

Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

In your role, you will:

• Work with cross-functional teams, to develop and implement a world-class customer experience that will strengthen the Bombardier, improve market perception, and drive new and repeat business through the use of innovative marketing solutions.
• Create and implement a strategic marketing plan to support the growth of Customer Services & Support.
• Develop and execute marketing strategies and campaigns such as email, search engine marketing, social and cross-media advertising that incorporate strong analytical measurement capabilities and supports the growth and promotion of Bombardier Customer Services & Support.
• Support the execution of a creative social media and content strategy that supports the vision and strategy for Bombardier Customer Services & Support.
• Plan and execute marketing automation campaigns for Bombardier by conceptualizing, setting-up and delivering robust lead generation campaigns, based on in-depth knowledge of our customers.
• Evaluate campaign analytics to analyze KPIs, identify end-user patterns and make recommendations to continually improve campaign effectiveness.
• Promote continually our brands and educating internal collaborators on our branding strategy.
• Define communications KPIs, tracking their progress and making recommendations for improvement;
• Partner with other members of the Communications, Marketing and Public Affairs team to ensure plans are integrated across functions and aligned for the greatest possible impact;
• Serve as strategic advisor to subject matter experts to generate opportunities for appropriate media interactions while assisting in their understanding of and compliance with organizational messages, both on a day-to-day basis and at targeted industry events or airshows.
• Develop and disseminate marketing material: key messages, videos, brochures, factsheets, print and digital advertising campaigns, signage, direct mail pieces, etc.
• Optimize the mix of marketing & communications channels to achieve strategic objectives.
• Suggest innovative solutions to communicate with the industry’s core audience.
• Lead the governance for major marketing projects through, rigorous project management, regular meetings with different management levels of the Marketing and Customer Experience organizations.
• Provide branding guidance for industry events (invitations, show booth, videos, etc.).
• Allocate and monitoring budget according to the marketing & communications plans.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

• You hold a university degree business, marketing, communications or in a related field.
• You have a minimum of eight years’ work experience within the marketing field.
• You are passionate about marketing, storytelling and creating compelling content that resonates with our target audience.
• You are a self-starter who is capable of working both autonomously and collaboratively.
• You have the flexibility and ability to adapt to a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
• You have strong customer orientation.
• You possess strong verbal and written communications skills with an ability to interact and communicate effectively with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders.
• You demonstrate advanced problem-solving skills.
• You are bilingual (French and English) with excellent writing skills and communication skills in English.
• You have strong presentation skills and is comfortable presenting to all levels of an organization.
• You are proficiency using Salesforce Marketing Cloud is considered an asset.
• You have demonstrated initiative as well as excellent project management skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities;
• You have experience dealing with large-scale change in a matrixed environment;
• You have amazing PowerPoint skills;
• You have a strategic mindset, you’re energized by change and driven by results and you’re proactive, solution-driven, and detail-oriented;
• You have a love for online communications with an aptitude for technology.
• You have the ability to work calmly in a fast-paced, complex environment and adapt to changing stakeholder requirements, ambiguous situations or crises.
• You have a background in storytelling with strong writing skills that can fit a complex idea into a handful of words;
• You hold a passion for media, social media and any storytelling tools leaders employ in the public sphere;
• You have an in-depth understanding of social media principles and practices

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Your ideas move people.

title: Marketing & Proposal Coordinator
description:
Overview:

Walsh Canada is currently seeking a Marketing and Proposal Coordinator  for our Toronto office.

 

The Marketing and Proposal Coordinator will support  the marketing and pursuits team in the writing and productionof compelling communications that resonate with our targeted audiences, to enable Walsh Canada to win new business and establish/support our brand identity in the market.

 

Walsh is a rapidly growing, highly diversified construction company, and we constantly seek builders and business people to join our industry-leading team. Walsh employees are "built to succeed" - competitive entrepreneurs with strong character who are energized by working on a team to meet challenges and are willing to take risks after careful planning. There are many compelling reasons why exceptional people should consider a career with our company:

  • Challenging, complex projects
  • Creative and innovative problem solving environment
  • Supportive, communicative managers who reward your success
  • Opportunities for growth, training, and development
  • Flexibility to build what you want, where you want
Responsibilities:
  • Write, edit, format, and produce content for all of Walsh Canadaâ€™s marketing and communications initiatives
  • Lead design conception, development, and layout of content for client proposals, marketing collateral, templates, and other corporate communications (notices, newsletters, etc..) based on prescribed goals
  • Review and analyze client solicitations to develop schedule of deliverables for production of proposals and statements of qualifications
  • Direct and assist other staff and project partners to provide the necessary data/information to accurately respond to the requirements of the communications assignment, including establishment and adherence to themes, key messaging and strategy
  • Coordinate and create outputs (printing, assembly, exporting) in production of marketing and communications material
  • Develop internal communications and newsletters and communications of varying formats (project wins, new initiatives, charity and community events)
  • Provide coordination and administrative support for campaigns
  • Translate company information, data, and statistics into illustrative graphic representations and into marketable information
  • Build and maintain an organized database of communications materials and proposal content
  • Review and analyze all current communications processes and material for continuous improvement and innovation opportunities
  • Update and maintain customer relationship management (CRM) database
  • Assist in gathering, tracking and reporting on market intelligence
  • General office and administrative tasks, as required
Qualifications:
  • Degree or Diploma in Marketing, Communication Public Relations or related field
  • 2 - 4 years of experience in Communications, Marketing and/or Proposal development.
  • Expert proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (lnDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop), Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills (written and oral).
  • Some experience in writing technical proposals, as well as general proposal writing skills.
  • Expert at visualization, layout, and/or graphic design skills to facilitate appealing and effective communication.
  • Strong writing and editing skills (including grammar and punctuation).
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Attention to detail and excellent proofreading abilities.
  • Ability to multi-task, be proactive, work independently or in a team setting and establish priorities.
  • Efficiently work under pressure in a dynamic deadline-driven environment.

The Walsh Group offers  competitive wages and benefits,  including:

  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
  • Generous Vacation Time & Paid Holidays
  • Company RRSP Matching Contributions
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Maternity Leave Policy
  • Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • Term Life and AD&D Insurance

If hired by The Walsh Group, you must be in compliance with your employment locationâ€™s COVID-19 related requirements, if any.

 

The Walsh Group, Ltd. Is committed to providing equal opportunity to qualified applicants with disabilities to compete for jobs. To request a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, please contact the Human Resources Department at 312-563-5905 or

hr@walshgroup.com

.

 

An Equal Opportunity Employer, Disability/Veteran

title: Research and Marketing Associate
description:
Our mission is to help our clients create and preserve wealth by providing the best real estate investment sales, financing, research, and advisory services available.

Founded in 1971, Marcus & Millichap (NYSE: MMI) is a leading commercial real estate brokerage firm focusing exclusively on investment sales, financing, research, and advisory services, with nearly 2,000 investment sales and financing professionals in 80+ offices throughout Canada and the United States.

Marcus & Millichap closes more transactions than any other real estate investment brokerage firm in the nation. In 2021, the firm closed 13,255 transactions with a sales volume of approximately $105 billion CAD.

The firm has perfected a powerful property marketing system that integrates broker specialization by property type and market area; the industry’s most comprehensive investment research; a long-standing culture of information sharing; relationships with the largest pool of qualified investors; and state-of-the-art technology that matches buyers and sellers.

title: Business Development Consultant (Sales)
description:
Creating Peace of Mind by Pioneering Safety and Security


At Allegion, we help keep the people you know and love safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 brands, 11,000+ employees globally and products sold in 130 countries, we specialize in security around the doorway and beyond.


At Allegion: We’re Redefining Security . Allegion products help keep people safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 highly recognizable brands sold globally like Schlage, LCN, Von Duprin, Glynn Johnson, Locknetics, Ives etc., we specialize in security around the doorway and adjacent area: everything from residential locks and portable security to commercial locks, exit devices, openers and closers, electronic access control and workforce productivity solutions.


At the core of this $2.7 billion business is the knowledge and experience of over 11,000+ dedicated employees across the globe and - we’re growing!


If you are a dynamic, driven, visionary problem solver focused on providing solutions to customers, boosting brand awareness, and improving competitive product performance in local markets all while advancing your career within a warehouse, then this opportunity is perfect for you: Allegion Canada is currently looking for a Residential Territory Manager to join our winning team in Mississauga, ON.


The Residential Territory Manager is responsible for driving all demand creation activities for the Allegion product portfolio in the Single and Multi-Family vertical markets across Alberta– with a specific focus on the Schlage Residential product offering – as well as the management of the assigned accounts responsible for the delivery of market share growth in these important market segments. The ideal candidate will utilize prospect selling sales skills to identify and enhance relationships with key decision makers within the developers, builders, interior designers, installers, and distributors that support these markets.


What you will do


+ Lead the local execution of the Single & Multi Family programs to targeted accounts to drive market share growth by developing business relationships with major influencers in the region.

+ Establish Territory Business Plans that align to Business goals and Key Initiatives and will include the following: dealer targets, builder targets, product training, investment strategies, and revenue goals

+ Utilize Dynamics CRM to effectively manage the sales process, account planning and collaboration across multiple functional areas.

+ Networks with all types of end-users and influencers, including single & multi-family builders, installers, remodelers, architects, designers, consultants, general contractors, integrators/low voltage by way of active participation in industry events and associations

+ Utilizes existing marketing programs to maximize market-share growth for our residential product portfolio

+ Develops and maintains list of current and prospective customers to include top 30 single & multi-family owners, builders with corporate offices in region

+ Responsible for meeting budget and expense parameters for optimizing operating profit

+ Supports the business marketing strategies by providing accurate and timely sales reports and competitive information to the Regional Sales Organization.

+ Utilizes specification writer for determining new construction specifications in the Multi-Family vertical

+ Maintain excellent industry, territory, and product knowledge to identify trends, displacement opportunities and competitive activity that will allow for market disruption and share gain in both new construction and aftermarket channels.

+ Provides forecasting data for Inventory Management Team


What you will need


+ 5-7 years of Consultative, solution-based sales experience with similar/relevant industries and products

+ Strong collaboration skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively across functions (marketing, customer care, operations etc.). A Team player with a positive attitude and aptitude for learning

+ Ability to communicate effectively at all levels, outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

+ Ability to work with and influence a variety of indirect and direct accounts

+ Self-motivator and entrepreneurial mindset with a strong Consultative Solutions based sales background

+ Able to work at building a business. Small scale to larger scale builds up.

+ Ability to think strategically and problem solve with entrepreneurial commitment to achieving goals.

+ Strong organizational skills with the ability to execute on business plans.

+ Customer-centric with the ability to balance both customer benefits and business financials effectively.


Allegion is a Great Place to Grow your Career if: 


+ You are seeking a rewarding opportunity that allows you to truly help others.  With thousands of employees and customers around the world, there’s plenty of room to make an impact. As our values state, “this is your business, run with it” (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html) .

+ You value personal well-being and balance because we do too! 

+ You’re looking for a company that will invest in your professional development.  As we grow, we want you to grow with us. 

+ You want a culture that promotes work-life balance.  Our employees enjoy generous time off, because at Allegion we recognize that you have a full life outside of work! 


What You'll Get from Us:


+ A commitment to Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging: making a difference and leading with purpose

+ High energy, influential, cross collaborative team environment

+ Opportunities to leverage your unique strengths through Clifton Strengths testing and coaching.

+ Customized individual development plans and growth maps to help you unlock your full potential and career graph with Allegion.

+ Competitive base salary

+ Flexible, Hybrid model of working


+ Health, dental and other insurance coverage, helping you “be safe, be healthy” (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html#serve)   

+ Tuition Reimbursement  

+ Employee Discounts

+ Community involvement and opportunities to give back so you can “serve others, not yourself”  (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html#serve)


Want to know more about us? Follow this link https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/index.html to learn more.


Apply to join our team today. We look forward to hearing from you!


We Celebrate Who We Are!


Allegion is committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. Together, we embrace all differences and similarities among colleagues, as well as the differences and similarities within the relationships that we foster with customers, suppliers and the communities where we live and work. Whatever your background, experience, race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, disability status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law, we will make sure that you have every opportunity to impress us in your application and the opportunity to give your best at work, not because we’re required to, but because it’s the right thing to do. We are also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If for any reason you cannot apply through our career site and require an accommodation or assistance, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team .


© Allegion plc, 2020 | Block D, Iveagh Court, Harcourt Road, Dublin 2, Co. Dublin, Ireland


REGISTERED IN IRELAND WITH LIMITED LIABILITY REGISTERED NUMBER 527370


Allegion is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/equal-opportunity.html)


Privacy Policy

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
location: Area F (Mcconnell Creek/Hatzic Prairie), British Columbia
description:
Replicant was founded on the belief that machines are ready to have useful, complex conversations that will transform the way they interact with the world, starting with customer service.

Replicant is building the world's first autonomous contact center that works out-of-the-box to solve customer problems over the phone using voice AI. You can think of Replicant Voice as a self-service, Thinking Machine™. Just like agents, Replicant is able to speak with customers in a natural tone, answer questions without delay, and deflect calls to resolve customer issues quickly. Now, enterprise customers can eliminate hold times, manage unpredictable call volumes, and give agents time back to resolve high empathy cases with a new, human + AI operating model.

If you're excited by AI and human-to-machine communications and want to make an impact with great technologists and strong go-to-market leaders, then look no further. We've grown our team by 3x, increased revenue by 4x, and were named a top enterprise AI company by The Information. We currently serve Fortune 500 customers, run millions of AI calls per month in production, and are increasing our footprint globally.

Replicant is looking for a full stack product marketer who can contribute across all aspects of our business. The Senior Product Marketing Manager will engage with stakeholders across product, sales and marketing to translate our industry-leading technology into compelling messaging, enable the sales team with outstanding tools and content, and help establish Replicant as the premier conversational AI company. This role will be instrumental in driving the success of our GTM strategy, from prioritizing verticals, identifying our ICP, defining our personas, and delivering messaging and content. This position will report into the Sr. Director of Marketing. 

What You'll Do

  • Positioning and Messaging: Develop clear, compelling messaging that sets us apart from competitors and drives sales with both prospects and customers
  • GTM Strategy: Define and manage go-to-market strategy for key industries including messaging, positioning, launch planning, sales enablement, and customer adoption.
  • Verticals and Personas: Identify and prioritize top vertical industries based on TAM, use cases and other criteria. Help define our ideal customer profile and build / maintain our buyer personas
  • Enablement: Work with customer-facing teams and partner with sales enablement to create high-impact narratives, content, collateral and training to drive acquisition, conversion, and expansion
  • Competitive Intelligence: Identify Replicant’s strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities through in-depth market research and enable customer-facing teams to succeed in competitive situations with supporting collateral including win/loss analysis and objection handling
  • Sales Collateral: Create sales and customer-facing content, videos, webinars, and product assets that distill core messages and are inspiring and relevant to companies of various industries and sizes – from mid-market to complex global enterprises
  • Market Research: Talk regularly to customers and prospects to develop a rich understanding of our market, our customers, their needs and how to drive value for them with new business plays
  • Metrics and Iteration: Develop and track metrics (both qualitative and quantitative) that help us understand the success of our products in the market and seek to continuously improve upon that success

What You'll Bring

  • Living our Values: Comfortable embodying Replicant’s values of ownership, humility, high standards, care, low ego, and inclusion
  • Storytelling Mindset: You have deep empathy for customers and are able to adapt how you communicate to best reach and engage your audience. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Passionate: You are deeply engaged in the success of the company, and your own personal growth
  • Curious: You are a lifelong learner who actively seeks new experiences, and wants to understand Replicant’s business, our market, our customers and our technology
  • BA/BS or equivalent working experience in enterprise SaaS and/or AI
  • 4-6 years of experience with product marketing, content marketing or sales/solutions engineering
  • Experience with product-led GTMs and delivering products to market
  • Leadership experience across large, geographically distributed teams
  • Ability to lead and communicate cross-functionally with sales, customer success and other departments

Perks

For all employees, we offer:
  Remote working environment that respects time zone differences
  Highly competitive salaries, equity, and for US Employees, a 401(k) plan
  Top of the line healthcare (medical, vision, and dental)
  Unlimited paid time off, with a minimum of 15 days off per year
✈️  Amazing team trips & offsites where you can find our CEO baking bread for the team

Our Values

Replicant has three core values. It is critical that everyone who joins the team feels excited and moved by these values as every new team member makes an impact on our culture.

Blade Runners: We take ownership and pride to influence the outcomes of our goals. We are successful, and like a Blade Runner, use the tools at our disposal to reach our objectives. We value open and honest communication and proactively seek feedback along the way. We are a company driven to grow and achieve both individually and as a team.

Bread Makers: We are humble and strive toward an egalitarian culture. No task is too big or too small. We work together to achieve our goals and develop our company mission. We believe that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts in everything that we do.

Självdistans (Self-Distance): Självdistans is Swedish for self-distance. It's the ability to critically reflect on oneself and one's relations from an external perspective. With this in mind, we act with objectivity and always remember that we are not our work. There's no perfect science to growing a team or business, but we trust everyone at Replicant to point out our blind spots and humbly admit their own.

By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Content Marketer
description:
Become one of the most impactful Content Marketers on the planet!

WHY YOU WILL LOVE FINGERPRINT FOR SUCCESS (F4S) 

We are a groundbreaking technology platform that is expanding and growing rapidly around the world.We are looking to onboard and hire the next generation of content marketing managers to help our customers set and achieve their crazy big goals.

Fingerprint for Success (F4S) is the future of human development. We are on a mission to empower individuals and teams to solve the worldâ€™s biggest problems. Featuring a vast range of tools for collaboration, performance, wellbeing, diversity and inclusion, plus a huge library of AI and human coaching programs, with F4S anyone can develop and achieve amazing things at work and in life.

Established in 2016 in Sydney Australia and backed by some of the worlds best in tech (Co-founder of Google Maps, CEO of Zappos, Co-Founders of Canva and more), F4S is founded and lead by one of the worldâ€™s earliest professional coaches and researchers, Michelle Duval.

We are a digital-first, small but fast-growing values-led team, genuinely on a mission to change the world. We are swift, passionate, hard-working, scaling ourselves at the same pace we grow our product and customers. We invest deeply in our company culture and our teamâ€™s wellbeing, knowing this is the well from where the worldâ€™s greatest products and companies flourish. 

Who you are:

  • An open-minded person who is willing to learn and become one of the of the most impactful content marketers in the world 
  • A person with insatiable curiosity and unrelenting drive to learn, succeed and lead by example
  • A person who is a force for good and celebrate individual uniqueness
  • Be driven by helping their team meet and exceed aggressive conversion targets and individual career goals. 
  • Be passionate about creating purposeful and valuable content that helps business professionals grow better.
  • Be highly organized and have a high level of accountability for the quality and outcomes of your work and your teamâ€™s work.
  • Desire to learn new digital content marketing strategies and tactics
  • Able to work independently and effectively in a team
  • Be open to receiving constructive feedback
  • Strong attention to detail, analytical and love solving problems
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent time and project management skills

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Brainstorm and ideate interesting content topics and plan editorial calendar on regular basis
  • Coordinate with freelancers and contributors to fill up content pipeline  
  • Proofread and edit other team membersâ€™ work, and carry out fact-checking as needed
  • Learn and carry out SEO and Social media best practices to generate maximum views for our articles
  • A natural curiosity about talent and human development and how people growth impacts organizations
  • Ability to thrive in a dynamic, high-growth, and collaborative global environment
  • An independent self-starter with an insatiable curiosity and unrelenting drive to learn, succeed and lead by example
  • Your own unique talents! If you donâ€™t meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why youâ€™d be a great fit for this role in your cover lette

Qualifications (any or all):

  • Entry level 
  • Diploma
  • Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma
  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Post Graduate Diploma
  • Professional Degree

Where?

This role is initially fully digital/remote, eventually establishing our US Hubs for regular teaming and events. Given our HQ in Sydney Australia, the ideal candidate will be based on the west coast or in Austin, Texas to benefit from the overlapping timezone windows. 

Why Join us?

  • Empower our users with helpful content
  • Learn digital marketing and content marketing real-life skills
  • Bring direct impact to the business and see blog traffic grow with your efforts
  • Be among team members who believe in working and playing hard 
  • Flourish in a flat organizational structure with no office politics

 

Benefits

At F4S, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts with providing benefits that allow our employees to care for themselves, support their families, and give back to their community. 

  • Access to F4S coaching
  • A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Per year: paid holidays and leave 
  • Learning and Development stipend
  • Amazing high performing remote global team 
  • Incredible culture and community

We are hiring for many role types including: Full-time, part-time, contract, internships.

We look forward to you joining us in our very real mission to make human development accessible to everyone!

How to get started?

Complete the F4S Questionnaire (15-30 mins) here to help us better understand your work-style motivations and how we can best support your onboarding.

title: Spécialiste Marketing de Contenu / Content Marketing Specialist
description:
Spécialiste du contenu marketing 

5 raisons pour lesquelles tu accepteras cet emploi : 

  1. Ton talent est considéré comme un élément crucial dans le succès de ton équipe.
  2. Ta capacité à collaborer avec différents acteurs importants fera toute la différence.
  3. Tu partageras des idées et nous t’écouterons et t’apprécierons!
  4. Tu développeras des compétences et acquerras des connaissances qui iront bien au-delà de ton imagination.
  5. Tu profiteras d’un horaire flexible dans un environnement cool et décontracté.                                    

Quels types de défis t’attendent chez Seedbox?

  • Superviser la performance du contenu pour plusieurs marques  ;
  • Identifier les contenus qui performent bien et ceux qui performent moins bien afin de réagir et/ou d'apporter des changements rapidement ;
  • Communiquer avec les directeurs de contenu afin de fournir un aperçu de la performance du contenu ;
  • Préparer des analyses mensuelles de la performance du contenu et des rapports spécifiques demandés par les partenaires ;
  • S'assurer que l'image de marque soit respectée sur tous les canaux de vente et demander les changements nécessaires lorsque les en-têtes, les bannières des sites, les images de publipostages, les curseurs et les vignettes des scènes ne sont plus à jour;
  • Soutenir la responsable du marketing de contenu dans son initiative visant à renforcer la compréhension et le respect de la vision du produit ;
  • Maintenir une perspective bien équilibrée du marché et de nos marques en utilisant les informations recueillies par l'analyse des données, les rapports des canaux de vente, les recherches sur les concurrents, les commentaires des membres et les tableaux de bord des équipes ;
  • Recommander des idées de contenu nouvelles et innovantes en faisant preuve de clairvoyance en ce qui concerne les dernières tendances à venir via les médias sociaux et analyser les résultats ;
  • Assister aux réunions de pré-production et s'assurer que les nouvelles tendances sont incluses dans les scripts à venir;
  • Collaborer avec le directeur de la gestion des produits sur la stratégie de lancement du contenu en préparant des compilations et des échanges de scènes ;
  • Participer activement aux plans marketing de lancement du site ;
  • Valider les engagements des partenaires et renforcer les directives de livraison du contenu ;
  • Agir en tant que personne de référence pour la promotion du contenu de plusieurs marques auprès des membres, travailler en étroite collaboration avec d'autres membres de l'équipe sur la modération des commentaires et informer les utilisateurs existants des nouvelles initiatives de marketing par le biais de « beamers » et d'autres outils de communication.

Toute ressemblance avec des personnages réels ne peut être que fortuite, mais signifie que nous te voulons chez Seedbox... 

  • Formation en marketing, commerce ou communication ;
  • Minimum de 2 ans d'expérience pertinente en marketing en ligne, création de contenu ou similaire ;
  • Bonne connaissance des différentes étapes de la production de contenu telles que la préparation de scripts, la communication avec les équipes de production, la coordination avec les équipes de post-production et de marketing ;
  • Bonne compréhension des principes de marketing ;
  • Bonne connaissance des différentes plateformes de contenu telles que les sites web, les sites de streaming, les médias sociaux et les médias imprimés ;
  • Capacité à analyser rapidement le contenu et les tendances de consommation ;
  • Capable de travailler efficacement dans des délais serrés ;
  • Organisé avec de solides compétences en matière de planification ;
  • Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale ;
  • Souci du détail. 

Es-tu aussi... 

  • Passionné de création de contenu de haute qualité?
  • Bien organisé avec une grande attention aux détails?
  • Confortable à l’oral et à l’écrit? 

Nous avons très hâte de t’accueillir alors applique dès maintenant!

Content Marketing Specialist

Top 5 reasons why you want this job: 

  1. Your talent is considered a crucial element to the teams’ success.
  2. Your ability to collaborate with different important stakeholders will make the difference.
  3. You will provide and share ideas and we will listen and appreciate!
  4. You will develop skills and gather knowledge beyond your imagination.
  5. You will enjoy flex time in a cool and casual environment! 

What kind of challenge would you be looking at?

  • Supervise content performance for many brands;
  • Identify over-performing and under-performing content in order to react and/or make changes quickly;
  • Communicate with content directors to provide insight into content performance;
  • Prepare monthly content performance analyses and specific reports requested by partners;
  • Ensure that branding is respected across all sales channels and request the necessary changes when assets and banners are not up to par. This includes website headers and banners, mailing images, website sliders and banners and thumbnails.
  • Support the Content Marketing manager in her initiative to reinforce the understanding and respect of product vision;
  • Maintain a well-rounded perspective of the market and our brands using information gathered via data analysis, sales channel reports, competitor research, member feedback, and teams’ scorecards;
  • Recommend new and innovative content ideas by being forward thinking regarding latest trends via social media and monitor outcomes;
  • Attend pre-production meetings and ensure new trends are included in upcoming scripts
  • Collaborate with the Product Management Director on content release strategy by packaging compilations and scenes trades;
  • Actively participate in site launch marketing plans;
  • Validate partners’ commitments and reinforce content delivery guidelines;
  • Act as point person for promoting brands content to members, and work closely with other team members on comment moderation and Inform existing users of new marketing initiatives through beamers and other communication tools

Any resemblance to the character described below is purely coincidental but means that we want you at Seedbox…

  • Educational background in Marketing, Business or Communication;
  • Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in online marketing, content creation or similar;
  • Good knowledge of the different stages going into content production such as preparing scripts, communicating with production teams, coordinating with post-production and marketing teams;
  • Solid understanding of marketing principles;
  • Good knowledge of various content platforms such as websites, social media, and print media;
  • Ability to analyze content and consumer trends quickly;
  • Able to perform effectively under tight deadlines;
  • Organized with strong planning skills;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Detail-oriented.

Are you also…  

  • Passionate about creating beautiful content?
  • Well-organized with strong attention to detail and consistency?
  • Comfortable in oral and written communication?  

We can’t wait to welcome you, so apply today!

title: Research Associate
description:
Job Advert:

About Euromoney Institutional Investor

Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC (www.euromoneyplc.com) is listed on the London Stock Exchange and is a member of the FTSE 250 share index. It is an international business-information group covering asset management, price discovery, data and market intelligence, and banking and finance under brands including Euromoney, Institutional Investor, BCA Research, Ned Davis Research and Fastmarkets. The group also runs an extensive portfolio of events for the telecoms, financial and commodities markets.

 

About the Division

The Asset Management segment includes our brands and businesses that serve the global asset management industry; BCA Research, Ned Davis Research and Institutional Investor. This segment provides independent research that enables our clients to make informed investment decisions; runs networks and conferences that bring asset allocators and asset managers together in an effective and efficient way; and provides editorial content and data that are critical for the industry to stay informed and make deals.

 

About BCA Research

BCA (www.bcaresearch.com) is the leading independent provider of global investment research. Since 1949, BCA's mission has been to support its clients in making better investment decisions through the delivery of leading-edge analysis and forecasts of all the major asset classes and economies, as well as educating, informing and stimulating discussion through clear and thought-provoking research. The firm maintains a head office in Montreal, with offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Hong Kong, Sydney, Cape Town, and SÃ£o Paulo.

 

About the Role

The Research Associate will support the Vice President, Geopolitical Strategy and the team, through the production of a specific product, oriented research and publication charts; including packs and data maintenance.

Working alongside BCA Research's Geopolitical Strategy product, here is what a typical day might look like:

  • You will be a chart apprentice responsible for researching, generating and maintaining chart and production runs
  • You will support basic economic and financial market research by working with the database group or finding information from available databases or online resources
  • You will contribute to all aspects of publishing, including tagging reports
  • You will work with the Layout & Design team and facilitate the publishing process by ensuring a cohesive formation of the final report (formatting, presentation etc...)
  • You will collect and process economic and statistical data
  • You will further develop strong skills in APL, Bloomberg, Excel and data sourcing
  • You will support basic client requests
  • You will be responsible for proofreading

Your behavioral competencies  

  • Achievement and detail orientation
  • Concern for order, quality and accuracy
  • Information seeking
  • Initiative
  • Analytical and Conceptual thinking
  • Teamwork, Initiative and Customer service orientation
  • Organizational commitment
  • Acquisition of professional expertise
  • Fast learner
  • Innovation

 

Requirements

  • Uundergraduate degree, in political science, finance or economics â€“ Masterâ€™s degree an asset
  • Enthusiastic interest in US politics
  • Intermediate level abilities in producing and understanding charts
  • Basic understanding of coding and superior skills in Excel
  • Fluidity with stats package and ability to search in datasets
  • Good knowledge of Bloomberg and Stata or R (Python an asset)
  • Familiarity with econometric methods
  • Firm understanding of economics and financial concepts and terms
  • Ideally a minimum of 1 year of experience in a research role
  • Experience in the financial services industry, preferably within an investment institution

 

 

Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
