title: Silicon Alliances Business Development Lead
description:
Canonical is the company behind the popular Ubuntu operating system with a view to being the best open-source company in the world. Our mission is to accelerate innovation by making free and open-source tools accessible to developers and enterprises from the cloud to IoT, from Silicon Valley to the farthest corner of the world. 

Canonical is committed to hiring and growing careers of promising, passionate individuals across the globe.

The team

The Silicon Alliances Team works with the leading semiconductor companies  to combine open source adoption with innovative customizations to get the most from each new chip. With our semiconductor partners, we develop joint product roadmaps, drive delivery, formulate go-to-market plans and conceptualize new business models, enabling differentiated hardware and robust product life-cycle support while still anchored on best-in-class Ubuntu. The end goal is a frictionless experience to deploy, maintain, and develop on any hardware from cloud to edge. 

This role 

The successful candidate is someone who is passionate about both technology and business development with a unique blend of wide ranging skills. If you are someone who can effortlessly switch your analytical and strategic thinking hats, to find creative solutions and can be comfortable doing technical deep dives with engineering, this challenging role is for you.

Reporting to the VP of Silicon Alliances, the role has high executive visibility both inside and outside the company. You will manage and grow our relationships with one or more silicon partners and be the primary contact for all stakeholders on both sides. As part of this role, you will be called upon to drive top initiatives spanning company boundaries. You will work cross-functionally with engineering, product, marketing and sales teams to facilitate new business, leading definition of joint products, solutions and complex programs relying heavily on your communicating and influencing skills.   You will ensure that robust project plans are created, tracked, and executed. You will develop a deep understanding of partner strategies, technologies and roadmaps and identify overlap with Canonical's current and future products.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop understanding of Canonical product portfolio.
  • Establish, maintain and grow technical and executive relationships at partner companies.
  • Champion Canonical products at the partner and vice-versa.
  • Work with other stakeholders to increase awareness of Canonical's portfolio in the ecosystem.
  • Develop account plans with a view to increase Canonical's direct and indirect business.
  • Ensure mid to long-term strategic alignment with one or more silicon partners.
  • Engage and influence Canonical product and engineering to refine plans and ensure delivery.
  • Manage market messaging, collateral and launch plans across products.
  • Negotiate successful contracts.

Basic Qualifications

  • B.A / B.S / B.E degree in science, technology and/or engineering.
  • Fundamental understanding of the semiconductor industry and ecosystem.
  • Experience in business development, technology strategy or similar functions.
  • Engineering or program management experience.
  • Ability to grasp complex material and synthesize key points.
  • Disciplined and self motivated for a remote-first workplace environment.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Customer facing experience.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in software and system architecture
  • MBA or graduate degree in science, technology and/or engineering.
  • Experience in consulting, account management, customer facing roles or similar functions.
  • Proven consultative selling ability
  • Expert negotiator with strong influencing and persuasion skills
  • Ability to think and work at both strategic and tactical levels
  • Understanding of cloud, datacenter, IoT/edge and PC technologies
  • Understanding Canonical's strategy and competitive position
  • Open source / Linux experience is a nice to have
  • Demonstrated exceptional collaboration and relationship building skills
  • Track record of organizational leadership

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Scallop Product Specialist
description:
Overview:

 

Scallop Product Specialist  

 

True North Seafood is Cooke's consumer brand with a premium positioning in North America, both in retail and foodservice. True North Seafood is the go-to brand for trusted seafood â€“ our main priority is to bring our consumers closer to the source.

 

As a global seafood company, Cooke has operations in North America, Europe, and South America.   Our companyâ€™s success is driven by our dynamic, highly skilled, and innovative management team, supported by dedicated employees who  live in coastal  communities  and contribute to the local areaâ€™s economy and sense of community.  

Reporting to the Director of Global Supply, the Scallop Product Specialist will be fully responsible for the scallop portfolio, serve as the scallop subject matter expert, and be the vital link between the global supply chain, sales, operations, marketing, and new product development. The preferred hub for this role is New Bedford MA, Suffolk VA, Saint John, NB, Canada, or Dartmouth, NS, Canada, with consideration for a hybrid working arrangement.

   

Responsibilities include

  • Act as the link between all functional areas of the scallop supply chain, including harvest, processing, logistics, marketing, and selling
  • Develop the market segmentation strategy for the scallop portfolio in the North American market
  • Oversee the forecasting process, manage inventory volumes, and report on sales performance for the scallop category
  • Lead the development of the North American scallop pricing strategy and provide input to pricing decision makers
  • Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the global competitive landscape for the scallop category, including knowledge of supply, demand, product offerings, and pricing fluctuations
  • Participate in sales calls and customer presentations
  • Work with the marketing team to develop educational content, sales tools, and customer presentations for the scallop category
  • Prepare analysis and develop recommendations for scallop market opportunities
  • Act as the internal advocate for the scallop portfolio, sharing market knowledge, building species knowledge internally, and profiling the category
  • Lead the go-to-market plan for scallop product launches in North America
  • Lead all scallop initiatives across the business

This exciting new role has been developed to ensure that we meet our customerâ€™s needs and expectations while strengthening our position and volumes with customers across North America.  

 

Requirements include

  • 8+ years of experience working in a seafood company or an environment where you would have had broad exposure to seafood
  • Analytical, solution-oriented mindset with problem solving skills
  • Excellent Microsoft Office acumen (excel, word, power point)
  • Understanding of pivot tables, proforma financials, and modeling scenarios
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Team player, the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and management
  • Global travel will be required

The Opportunity  

The role description is just one part of the story.  This is your opportunity to grow, to work within the parameters of the role but to reach your fullest potential.

We are a team that is driven to succeed. We count performance, we reward contribution, and we recognize talent.  

It is about being at the centre of a global leader in seafood and knowing you are an important part of that growth.  

The ability to bring your passion for learning, desire for growth and energy for moving your career forward is what we offer.

 

The Why  

Why Cooke? Simple â€“ we are a company that rewards initiative, resourcefulness, and work ethic. We will champion your growth and provide you with the platform to create your path, your career, and your future.  

 

NOTE: The recruiter is reviewing and interviewing eligible applicants for this position as they are received. If you are interested in this posting, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.

 

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
Marketing Automation Specialist

About the client

Company is a Certified IT Firm Specialised in CRM Consultation, Implementation, Support & Training Services. We are not a simple ERP firm, nor are we software resellers. We're CRM specialists. We make sure that our clients have the best CRM platform for their business and that it's implemented the right way.

Job Purpose 

This is marketing automation and digital marketing role working with our Marketing Automation platforms (HubSpot, Sugar Market,  Creatio Marketing, Microsoft Dynamics 365,  Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Pardot). This role consists of a mix of technical and strategic expertise and we are looking for a resource that will work directly with our clients. We have built a unique marketing automation implementation approach and we are looking for somebody that will support us in this approach. The candidate must have a background in digital and automated marketing.

Qualifications: 

  • 3 years experience in marketing and a minimum of 1 year of direct marketing automation experience;
  • Bilingual: knowledge of French and English;
  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, advertising, communications or equivalent;
  • Be a team player with excellent interpersonal skills to work collaboratively with colleagues and partners;
  • Demonstrated knowledge of CRM and marketing automation platforms;
  • Strong time management skills to deliver on multiple projects and timelines; 
  • Demonstrated knowledge of digital engagement techniques, tools, and measurements;
  • 1 year + experience with at least one marketing automation platform (HubSpot, Sugar Market,   Creatio Marketing, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, and Pardot.

title: Account Strategist
description:
Major Tom is the next iteration of digital marketing — a full-service agency that’s been purpose-built to help organizations thrive in an increasingly complex landscape. With headquarters in Vancouver, Toronto, and New York, you can find us on Zoom during either Pacific or Eastern Daylight Time.

Our roster of international clients includes NYU, COBS Bread, Holt Renfrew, OUAI, Denny's, and Cactus Club Cafe.

Who We Are:

We’re a group of people who create work we’re proud of for folks we believe in. Our team is made up of industry specialists covering the spectrum of strategy, marketing, development, and creative.

We all share a belief that passion and accountability are critical to delivering exceptional work. Our biggest heroes bring humility, an open mind, and a positive attitude to our team every single day. An informal — yet professional — group, we truly care about one another and you can bet that we’ll care about you, too. For more on our culture, check us out on Glassdoor, Facebook, and Instagram.

Who We're Looking For:

We are on the hunt for an Account Strategist with at least three years of professional experience in managing client relationships, project management and digital strategy.

The ideal candidate is a "tactical strategist", meaning you are just as energized thinking about the big picture as you are executing campaigns. This is an amazing opportunity for someone who enjoys building strong client relationships, digital strategy, project management and likes to keep their technical skills sharp.

What We’re Looking For:

The must-haves:

  • 3+ years working in a digital marketing agency or in an in-house digital marketing position. Ideally, you'll have experience where you spearheaded digital strategy for your clients, are a strong project manager, and have excellent communication skills.
  • 2+ years of campaign management in Google Ads
  • In-depth knowledge of search engine optimization best practices
  • Experience with Google Analytics
  • Experience running Facebook paid social campaigns
  • Experience in digital media planning and buying
  • Excellent presentation skills and comfortable speaking in client/project meetings
  • Ability to maintain job performance and a positive attitude in an entrepreneurial organization that is going through hyper growth

What We’re Looking For:

Not deal-breakers, but assets:

  • eCommerce experience
  • Experience with Email Marketing Campaigns and/ or Marketing Automation

What You'll Get To Do:

  • Develop, retain and grow client relationships
  • Communicate regularly with clients ensuring their goals are being met and are happy with Major Tom services
  • Meet with Major Tom agency partners and work with these partners to plan and execute client campaigns
  • Set up and manage Google Ads campaigns
  • Setup and manage Facebook/Instagram campaigns
  • Create and execute SEO strategies
  • Create and execute on Google Analytics implementations
  • Monitor client marketing initiatives on a weekly basis to ensure that the activities are undertaken to match the budget of the project and will help the client achieve their goals
  • Proactively make strategic campaign recommendations to clients
  • Update and monitor client reports. Ongoing analysis of key metrics to deliver insightful analysis and optimizations.

Some of the Benefits & Perks You’ll Get:

  • Paid time off and bonus time off during the holiday season to spend time with your loved ones without thinking about work.
  • Flexible working hours and work-from-home options. You know how and when you work best, and we trust you to do it.
  • Comprehensive medical benefits, including a healthcare spending account, so you can take care of yourself and your family.
  • Access to LinkedIn Learning and support in your professional development because we want to help you achieve your goals.
  • A wellness program including weekly meditation so you can take care of your mind.
  • Regular Lunch and Learns covering a vast array of topics all designed to keep you informed on the industry and our agency.
  • Access to internal committees led by subject matter experts that are designed to tackle plans or solve problems. These committees ensure that everyone within our agency has the opportunity to learn about the different facets of our organization. Are you a project manager fascinated by work in the creative department? No problem, sign up and see how it’s done.

Major Tom is committed to equal opportunity and fair treatment for all. The company prohibits discrimination on the basis of age, race, disability, ethnicity, marital or family status, national origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information, gender identity, medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law.

Location: whilst this posting location states Toronto, we are open to applicants across Canada! We are working remotely and don't have plans to mandate a return to office policy. For applicants based in Vancouver, we have a beautiful office space available downtown for those who want a break from working at home.

title: Research Associate
description:
Remote work from Canada

Company

Adoc Talent Management is seeking Research Associates for its client, a cutting-edge company that mixes big data with social science. The company develops and provides a Software as a Service (SaaS) solution and is a pioneer in the field of technology-enabled ethnography at big data scale. The company is currently hiring Research Associates to support their growth.

Job

This position offers an extraordinary opportunity to work in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment. This role would involve various studies from plant-based proteins and sustainable packaging in food, to the future of women’s sexual health. Their clients make investments to future-proof their businesses using the results of state-of-the-art research.

Challenges is plentiful in this role and you will develop Saas platform and methodology’ expertises. You will interact regularly with an interdisciplinary project team (other researchers) to deliver completed analyses and reports using the Saas platform.

You will demonstrate the ability to collaborate and develop/maintain relationships inside and outside the firm to enable effective completion of business objectives. You will be interfacing with clients by presenting research (typically over video conference) throughout the process — from project briefing through to delivery.

Profile

  • You hold an undergraduate degree in social sciences or humanities (anthropology or sociology preferred)
  • You are fluent in English. Another language is an asset (Portuguese, French, Spanish, Mandarin).
  • You are either born in Canada or have lived in North America for at least 10 years, to better apprehend this culture (most of their clients are North-American companies).
  • You enjoy working as a team on large complex projects and have strong attention to details and quality control. You demonstrate excellent analytical and communication skills (both written and oral). You are proficient and have strong skills related to technology as apps for presentations, document creation, conference calls etc.
  • You have the ability to work fast, efficiently and under pressure. The position includes to learn quickly and work under tight deadlines and keep tasks moving. Organised and independent, you demonstrate the capabilities to prioritize multiple tasks.

Assets:

  • You have professional experience (especially in research)
  • You were research assistant in university where you gain great experience in research helping PhD students or teachers

As a Researcher, you will be comfortable in an environment that requires a high level of autonomy and intellectual curiosity. Successful candidates will be energetic leaders and have the opportunity to work for a disruptive company.

Thank you for sending your application (CV + cover letter + salary expectations) to Adoc Talent Management (www.adoc-tm.ca).

title: Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager
description:
WHO WE ARE 

At Personify, we build strong connections with our clients so they can build strong connections with their communities. One of the most diversified and fastest-growing technology providers of integrated software solutions, we are innovative leaders in the industry and respond to the needs of our clients through products that include: 

  • A2Z Events, a multi-event platform that enables clients to manage their events from start to finish, including floor plans, financials, managing contracts and sponsorships, and increasing engagement through mobile applications and a networking suite. 
  • CommUnity, an online community platform for those with common interests to connect, learn and collaborate.  
  • WildApricot, an all-in-one solution that automates and simplifies workflows enabling nonprofits and associations to manage their membership, streamline their processes, and make room for human connections. 
  • MemberClicks, an easy-to-use member management cloud solution aimed at small to medium-sized nonprofit organizations and associations. 
  • ThreeSixty, an enterprise management solution for associations, nonprofits, YMCAs and JCCs to engage, manage and grow their membership. 
  • And more. 

At Personify, we're in the relationship building business, powering conversations, donations, events, and foundations through analytics, tools, and robust backend management systems. With 300+ employees in our offices in Austin, Atlanta, and Toronto, and as part of remote teams across Canada and the US, we're the people designing the technology that reaches 30,000+ clients resulting in 3B+ interactions a year with our products. Joining us is a chance to take your skills and expertise and build solutions for the real world that strengthen the connection between clients, their mission, and their communities. 

WHO WE NEED 

You will own paid search (PPC, SEM) demand generation for Personify's SMB products (WildApricot and MemberClicks), developing end-to-end campaigns from initial brainstorm to execution. This role requires significant experience with paid digital media: running quick and cost-effective tests, optimizing ad copy and landing page copy/design, and reporting. You will be responsible for testing new paid channels in addition to managing all current PPC, retargeting, and programmatic efforts. Collaboration is the key to success for this role as you will be working with other marketing team members, sales, and outside agencies to execute on the go-to-market strategies optimizing the conversion of marketing efforts into pipeline and revenue.  

WHO YOU ARE 

The ideal person for this role is a self-motivated, goal-oriented, organized individual who is obsessed with meeting monthly, quarterly, and yearly goals. You are an inquisitive self-starter who loves to solve problems, think outside of the box, analyze data, and make decisions based on quantitative results. 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU 

You will be working with an amazing team of marketing and sales professionals that are invested in your success. We work and play hard, celebrate results, learn from our mistakes, and work to continually improve our performance so that everyone succeeds. 

HOW YOU WILL MAKE AN IMPACT 

  • Work with internal subject matter experts and two outside agencies to build digital campaigns (PPC, retargeting, programmatic)  
  • Manage Gartner Digital Advertising relationship, including overseeing client review process, optimizing product overviews, managing bids to ensure they are in line with the budget and generating monthly, quarterly, and yearly budgeted MQLs 
  • Increase ad click thru rates and landing page conversion rates through regular, methodical A/B testing 
  • Design and implement lead conversion campaigns including email marketing drips, nurture and recycled lead lifecycles.  
  • Manage list segmentation and scoring to deliver more targeted and relevant messaging to improve engagement and ultimately conversion.  
  • Partner closely with marketing and sales teams across Personify to ensure proper messaging, timing, and execution of campaigns across email, web personalization, and advertising efforts.  
  • Explore, test, deploy, and analyze new paid channels 
  • Develop, document, and implement repeatable testing processes 
  • Leverage reporting, analytics, and marketing technology stack to optimize strategy and execution continuously 
  • Provide detailed reports and proactive solutions to the team and senior leaders 

WHAT YOU BRING 

  • Bachelor's degree required 
  • 4-5 years of demand generation experience with a complete understanding of paid media  
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required 
  • Strong work ethic 
  • High accountability 
  • Excellent time management skills 
  • Desire to continually grow and improve 
  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills 
  • Preferred Salesforce and Marketo experience

WHY JOIN US? 

We are committed to creating a balanced, inclusive, and equitable workplace.  

  • We recognize and appreciate the varied experiences, backgrounds, and knowledge our team can bring to our culture, operations, products, and relationships internally and externally. 
  • We have an impactful recruitment diversity strategy to increase representation across the company at every level. And, we're working with our teams to create employee resource groups that further support our people in the safe spaces and ways they need to feel heard. 

We're proud of our evolution. We promote – and live – a culture of not just listening but acting, making ourselves available and accessible. 

We're a great place to work. 

Guided by our values, inspired by our clients, and forging ahead with optimism and the commitment to service of a new President and CEO, Scott Collison, at the helm, Personify is driven by our purpose. We empower our clients, from small nonprofits to large enterprise organizations, to build strong connections with their communities, ultimately enabling them to achieve their missions. And, our leadership team brings profound expertise and a deep commitment to taking Personify to the next level. 

With generous paid-time-off, flexibility, and the option to be fully remote, we prioritize the well-being of our teams. Choosing where to power up their laptops empowers our employees to connect with each other and our clients from anywhere while meeting their life demands and without sacrificing their performance. In fact, we know it makes them do better, feel better, and enjoy being part of our company.  

Recognized by Built In Austin in its Best Places to Work Awards for three years in a row in 2019, 2020, and 2021, we spend our days creating a virtual place and physical space where people are comfortable being themselves, feel supported and heard, enjoy each other's company, and have an opportunity to shine.  

Apply now. 

Personify is a company made up of people who like to work with brilliant teams passionate about delivering exceptional solutions to our clients. We're a place to make an impact, see the difference, and accelerate your career doing something you love. 

We know not everyone gains their education and skills the traditional way, so if you feel you have 70% of the qualifications you are looking for and you are ready to make a difference, submit your application. Of course, we can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider the full scope of who you are and what you bring. 

Personify is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran or disability status, or other protected characteristics.  

Employment offers are contingent on the candidate successfully completing a background investigation in compliance with federal, state, and local laws.

title: #3692 Pricing Specialist
description:
Our client, one of Canada's leading companies, is hiring a remote Pricing Specialist! Their Strategic Pricing Team is looking for a senior manager, who will be driving their cloud pricing activities and strategies. This individual will work closely with their sales teams across the country, and must possess the business acumen and leadership. Bilingualism is an asset (English and French).

Perks You'll Love
- Join one of Canada's leading companies
- Tackle new development projects
- Enjoy top career & development opportunities

What You'll Be Doing
- Develop pricing strategies in order to win with maximized profitability and gain market share
- Work with cross-functional teams to understand customer Requests for Proposal (RFP), Requests for Quote (RFQ), and other pricing requests
- Gather market and competitive intelligence through different channels, and build database to support pricing decision.
- Prepare strong and well-supported business case to executives for pricing review and approval
- Collaborate with sales and product to align pricing with account and product strategy for deals
- Establish relationships with cloud partners to understand the partner/channel eco-system, offerings, promotions and incentive programs to optimize and complete pricing activities
- Develop methodology to deal with customized requirement, such as non-standard clauses, and leverage legal/product to obtain back-to-back support from partners
- Work with procurement and product to continue to optimize partner agreement (e.g. discounts, reciprocity etc.)
- Identify opportunities to keep on automating and improving the pricing process to drive efficiency and compliancy.
- Build relationships with other stakeholders across the organization - i.e. product, finance, BI and delivery to understand all aspects of the deal to recommend the optimum pricing strategy

Skills You're Bringing
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with an ability to synthesize large amounts of knowledge and data
- Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills. Communicate effectively with confidence and assertiveness
- Not afraid to challenge the status quo or implement initiatives to drive positive changes
- Ability to manage internal and external escalations and provide feasible solutions
- Ability to manage multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously, and deliver targeted outcome
- Demonstrated ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced working environment and meet tight deadlines
- Good understanding of financial modeling: cash flow, competitive analysis, sensitivity analysis
- Superb MS Office skills, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
- Knowledge of cloud partner incentive programs and order operation is a plus.
- Bilingualism (English and French) is considered an asset.

Preferred Qualifications
- 4+ years experience in a pricing role in telecommunication services, or 5 years in a similar role in other industries.
- Education â€“ Preferred B.Com. from an accredited university

We Are An Equal Opportunity Employer
All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Canadian Work Authorization
All applicants MUST be authorized to work in Canada. Any applicants not meeting this criteria will not be notified and will not be considered eligible for the position.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Position: Marketing Coordinator
Location: Waterloo, Ontario
Education: BSc/BA or diploma in Marketing, Communications, or equivalent 
Division: Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job:

Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the Marketing Coordinator supports the development and implementation of the content, social and event marketing strategies.  Through creative storytelling and other methods, you will develop, publish, disseminate compelling and engaging communications and marketing content, ensuring alignment to Clearpath brand and purpose and supporting corporate strategy and marketing objectives.  You will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of Clearpath social media channels, community growth and brand engagement, social media monitoring, measurement and reporting, content research and development, writing and design for social media.  Finally, you will play a supportive role in planning, managing and executing marketing events including robotics conferences and tradeshows, and other marketing related activities as required. 

Responsibilities include:

  • Develop, optimize and publish engaging content to support lead generation and nurturing  (e.g., customer stories, robot spotlights, event recaps, announcements, video scripts,  etc) 
  • Ensure all content aligns with brand voice, tone, and editorial guidelines.
  • Generate, edit, publish and share daily content (original text, images, video) on company social media channels that builds meaningful connections and encourages engagement
  • Moderate all user-generated content in line with the moderation policy for each community
  • Create and manage editorial content calendar and syndication schedules 
  • Support and assist with event planning, administrative, and logistics duties for key robotics conferences and tradeshows
  • Assist in designing and creating emails, including the Clearpath monthly newsletter, landing pages and other marketing materials
  • Assist in adding, modifying and administering products on the Clearpath store using the Shopify ecommerce platform.

Skills and Experience:

  • BA in Communications, Marketing, Business, New Media or Public Relations
  • Strong understanding of inbound marketing strategy and search engine optimization (SEO)
  • Proven working experience in content and social media marketing 
  • Strong writing and editing chops, with a talent for distilling complex ideas into plain language. Whether writing long-form guides or micro-copy, you work hard to make every word matter—even under a tight deadline.
  • Demonstrable social networking experience and social analytics tools knowledge
  • Knowledge of online marketing and good understanding of major marketing channels, web development and design, email marketing and marketing system administration.
  • Detail oriented with ability to accurately and efficiently proofread all communications for accuracy and brand compliance
  • Well-organized and detail oriented
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, unpredictable environments
  • Able to coordinate and work effectively across many teams 
  • Fluency in English

Bonus:

  • Experience in a marketing role is preferred. Bonus if you’ve worked at a technology company. You have a track record for producing content that moves the needle. 
  • Experience with basic photo and video editing using Adobe Photoshop, Premiere or Canva
  • Experience with web tools including Pardot, Hootsuite, Wordpress, Social Media platforms.
  • A passion for learning about your audience (robotics researchers and developers) and how Clearpath’s  products fulfill their needs—as well as a genuine interest in the robotics space. 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863

title: Marketing Design Coordinator
description:
Carter’s Inc. Canada, a growing national retailer of children’s apparel, requires a Marketing Design Coordinator for our Corporate Head Office in Mississauga, Ontario.

Reporting directly to the Sr. Visual Merchandising Manager, the incumbent in this position will be responsible for the following:

- Preparing retail print marketing campaign materials in English and French, including design, file preparation for approvals and printing, and master distribution lists for print production and shipping

- Creation of digital and print advertisements for promotional campaigns, temporary and permanent graphics for retail stores, and other materials as required by internal and retail store partners

- Graphic design resources for the Canadian office

- Creation of multilingual packaging based on existing package design and adherence to brand standards; managing creation, workflow and approval process

- Creation, maintenance and distribution of marketing communications and tools including weekly internal and competitive reports, master store data, promotional campaign checklists, line sheet binders, and retail store tools

- Coordination of marketing materials and supplies for new store openings, and on-going retail store requirements

- Responding to and acting upon daily requests in support of retail stores including tracking marketing kit shipments and arranging for replacement tools to be sent

- Working with multiple external and internal partners to help manage production process and project timelines


Keyword: Marketing Design Coordinator
Required Experience:

- Expert knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite - InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop

- Knowledgeable with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

- Experience creating various marketing and print materials from concept through to final print preparation in a corporate or marketing agency environment

- Familiar working with print vendors to communicate design specifications for quoting and proofs

- Strong listening and communication skills with service driven expertise

- Excellent organizational and time management skills to balance multiple projects

- Ability to work efficiently to meet deadlines without compromising accuracy, attention to detail or quality

- Be self-motivated and take initiative - Works well independently or collaboratively

- Knowledge of retail marketing strategies and merchandising an asset

- A portfolio of work demonstrating design experience is required

- Degree or diploma in Marketing or Graphic Design

- Normal office environment

- Role is based in our Mississauga office location

NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The duties described may be changed or reassigned at the discretion of management, and the employee may be required to perform duties that are not listed in the job description.


From: Carter's|OshKosh

title: Business Development Consultant
description:
Adaptability, grit, and heart are what make us stand out from the rest. When you join our Business Development Representative team, youâ€™ll gain more than just a job title and a paycheck. Youâ€™ll find yourself surrounded by like-minded team members who share a growth-oriented mindset and our vision for success. Within our forward-thinking and supportive environment, you have the ability to build character, become a leader, and develop professional advancement. With the support of fellow Business Development Consultant team members and confidence in yourself, we genuinely believe that anything is possible. 

Witness our Business Development team members strategizing together, sharing fresh ideas in open-forum brainstorming sessions, and creating knockout solutions one after another to drive sales margins. If youâ€™re adaptable, imaginative, and embrace challenges with open arms, youâ€™ll be right at home with our Business Development Team.

 

Business Development Consultant Responsibilities: 

  • Seek new business opportunities by establishing and expanding relationships with current and prospective decision-makers
  • Stay up-to-date with new products, services, pricing, and sales promotions by attending daily meetings and training courses
  • Contact potential clients through lead generation and residential visits
  • Study each product offered by our top tier clients and be able to persuasively educate potential consumers of how each works and its specifications; understand how to upsell and recommend complementary merchandise
  • Customize product solutions to increase customer satisfaction and improve profit margins
  • Present sales pitches, product reports, and other valuable data to potential consumers in a way that promotes our clients brand and mission and helps the audience identify a need for the product or service
  • Participate in the development of business plans and be prepared to review and discuss ideas with senior leadership

 

Business Development Consultant Requirements: 

  • 1-2 years of experience as a Business Development Representative, Sales, Account Manager or similar role
  • Driven self-motivated individual with a hunter mentality who is capable of working independently to exceed sales objectives
  • Experience developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas
  • Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Attention to detail in all task completions

 

As a Business Development Consultant, youâ€™ll enjoy: 

  • Personalized training, mentorship, & career development program
  • Exciting tropical retreats (Post COVID-19) and company-sponsored vacations
  • Uncapped commission incentives and bonuses
  • Intense client exposure for some of the best names in their industry
  • Holidays off!

title: Spécialiste régional du marketing (Québec)
description:
General Function

Relevant du directeur du marketing canadien, le spécialiste régional du marketing de Saucony (Québec) s’efforcera d’offrir les meilleurs programmes de marketing auprès des consommateurs à nos partenaires régionaux. Il soutiendra le parcours du consommateur de Saucony par le biais des points de contact numériques et d’aires de vente au détail de nos principaux partenaires de vente au détail dans leur région. Il devra également éduquer le personnel de vente et susciter son enthousiasme. Le candidat retenu aura un état d’esprit positif et gagnant, combiné à son intérêt pour la responsabilité, et la capacité d’avoir un impact mesurable sur une petite équipe avec une marque de consommation passionnante et établie.

Primary Duties

Soutien aux comptes régionaux (Québec/Ottawa/Maritimes)

  • Effectuer le service de produits/d’événements/du marketing de nos principaux partenaires de comptes, p. ex. Sport Experts, Running Room
  • Obtenir la plus grande part d’espace, dans les principales portes de destination et succursales, en coordination avec les représentants locaux des ventes et sur le terrain
  • Planifier les lancements de produits en synchronisant les plateformes et les campagnes en magasin, numériques, sociales et événementielles, et en les mettant efficacement à profit
  • Assumer la responsabilité des initiatives de formation et de motivation des employés des concessionnaires, en créant des défenseurs des produits Saucony au sein des magasins physiques et numériques
  • Travailler en collaboration avec les représentants commerciaux de Saucony sur les marchés régionaux et aider à l’exécution du plan de croissance stratégique pour nos comptes Lighthouse/Tier 0
  • Tenir à jour les actifs de la page de la marque, en effectuant le marchandisage, ainsi que la mise à jour et la création des actifs selon les besoins du calendrier de lancement des produits saisonniers dans le canal de vente de gros
  • Soutenir la localisation du contenu mondial sur le marché québécois (c.-à-d. point de vente, brochures, matériel de marketing, etc.)
  • Tenir à jour le portail éducatif du personnel pour le personnel francophone afin qu’il dispose des connaissances nécessaires à la vente des produits Saucony
  • Élaborer des calendriers saisonniers pour les séminaires sur les produits en respectant les dates de lancement des produits pour chaque saison
  • Interagir avec le personnel des magasins pour susciter son enthousiasme au sujet des produits Saucony
  • Assister aux réunions de magasin, aux événements, aux salons professionnels, aux soirées de démonstration et organiser des séminaires sur les produits pour les comptes ciblés, au besoin
  • Effectuer la mise à jour et le suivi des budgets mensuels de déplacement et de marketing; soumettre des rapports mensuels ou trimestriels au chef du marketing de terrain.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required

Qualifications du bon candidat :

  • Baccalauréat exigé
  • Minimum 2 ans d’expérience en marketing ou en ventes
  • Solide trousse d’outils numériques pour la création de contenu ou la gestion des médias sociaux pour un détaillant
  • Expérience du commerce de détail, particulièrement avec une industrie axée sur l’athlétisme à l’extérieur
  • Doit être enthousiaste, énergique et avoir une passion et un intérêt personnel pour le secteur
  • Doit être ambitieux, organisé et avoir de solides compétence en gestion du temps car il ou elle travaillera à l’extérieur du siège social
  • Solide compétences en leadership, initiative et communications
  • Doit être sociable et avoir une personnalité agréable pour traiter les interactions quotidiennes avec ses homologues, les gens des comptes clients et les consommateurs
  • Capacité de gérer les besoins et les attentes variés des détaillants qu’il sert
  • Capacité et disponibilité pour travailler les soirs et fins de semaine (samedi et dimanche) en raison de promotions de détails nécessaires
  • Excellentes aptitudes pour la réalisation de présentations et capacité de s’intégrer harmonieusement à un auditoire extrêmement diversifié
  • Doit avoir un permis de conduire valide en règle
  • Excellentes capacités écrites, verbales et de présentation, ainsi qu’une attention marquée aux détails
  • Solides compétences analytiques et stratégiques
  • Capacité de respecter des délais stricts et exigeants
  • Solides compétences de priorisation et d’organisation

CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL

Environnements normaux de bureau et de commerce de détail, ainsi que des activités d’athlétisme à l’intérieur et à l’extérieur.  Déplacements fréquents nécessaires.

   

Les énoncés ci-dessus visent à décrire la nature du travail et la charge de travail générales, mais ils ne constituent pas une liste exhaustive de toutes les responsabilités, tâches et compétences qui pourraient être requises.

title: Communications Specialist - UPI Energy FS - Guelph, ON (Guelph, ON, CA, N1H 8M1)
description:
GROWMARK is an agricultural cooperative serving cooperatives, retailers, businesses, and customers in Canada and the U.S. We provide customers with fuels, lubricants, crop nutrients, crop protection products, seed, construction services, equipment, and grain marketing assistance. In addition, GROWMARK owns FS PARTNERS and UPI Energy FS, as well as the FS trademark used by affiliated member cooperatives. GROWMARK is large enough to offer solid career opportunities, but small enough to provide a family-oriented, welcoming environment and great benefits.

 

 

General Accountability:


Under the direction of the Director, Sales and Marketing, the Communications Specialist is
primarily responsible for creating and disseminating internal and external communication materials. The position is also accountable for marketing program support and execution as directed.


Reports To:   Director, Sales and Marketing
Location:   105 Silvercreek Parkway North, Guelph, ON N1H 8M1

 

Specific Accountability:


• Assists the Director, Sales and Marketing with the planning, scheduling and execution of
Training/Product Launches and/or other presentation/education related functions for UPI Energy FS (“UPI”) Direct, Member Co-operatives, and Retail Operations.
• Designs and maintains electronic and paper presentation templates and related graphics
as required.
• Assists with the development and production of various graphic designs including but not
limited to posters, invitations, cards, brochures and other publications.
• Work collaboratively with outside design vendors to produce files to UPI specifications. • Orders promotional items, corporate wear, premiums and incentives as required.
• Oversees the planning and implementation of rollouts for Sales/Promotion events and
product launches (e.g. Dieselex Gold).
• Co-ordinates the production of required collateral materials to support the sales team, gas
bars and other functions as required.
• Work with Joint Venture partners to steer graphic design towards a cohesive look and
feel.
• Responsible for all UPI decaling including but not limited to; trucks, tanks, gas bars etc.
• Work with Digital Developer to create various digital materials as needed. Ex. Digital
ads, social media
• Develop and maintain brand guidelines/standards for each product and overarching UPI
brand.
• Facilitates Sponsorship program and ensures fulfillment of all approved sponsorships. • Assists the Director, Sales and Marketing with administrative support as needed.

 

Requirements:

 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each specific accountability satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform specific accountabilities.
• Post-Secondary degree or diploma in communications, marketing, public relations, or a
related field
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Highly effective project management, prioritization, multi-tasking and time management
skills
• Computer literate, including effective working skills of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint,
email and Adobe Products
• Works well with others and handles direction and criticism in a positive manner

 

Working Conditions:


Indoors in an air-conditioned environment, with minimal physical effort required.

 

Disclaimer:
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to the classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills required of personnel so classified.

GROWMARK, Inc. strives to provide a benefits package that delivers competitive pay for performance, recognizes your dedication to our mission and helps us attract and retain the highest caliber of talent. The cornerstone of our benefits package is the company funded health and dental plan for full time employees, as well as an employer matched defined contribution pension plan, along with life and disability insurance.

We are an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process. Employment may be contingent upon receipt of an acceptable and job-related background check, motor vehicle report, and/or reference check, as applicable and permissible by law.

title: Programmatic Media Analyst (Toronto)
description:
Programmatic Media Analyst brings together the best of StackAdapt analytical capabilities – drawing from internal and 3rd party data sources to combine data-driven findings into insightful reports and dashboards to help internal and external clients to transform their programmatic execution strategies.
 
As a Programmatic Media Analyst you will gain exposure to working with individuals from functional areas within the company. Your technical expertise and understanding of operating KPIs will help our Revenue team to identify key growth opportunities across different industries and brands.
 
Programmatic Media Analyst reports to the Director of Analytics and will own analytical service delivery and special projects from start to finish. Additionally, the Programmatic Media Analyst will provide support to Campaign Optimization team with out-of-the-box ideas and data-driven recommendations.

StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in Canada for this position.

title: Category Coordinator
description:
Reach Beyond!:CHC provides unmatched helicopter services that enable our customers to reach beyond â€“ to work in remote and challenging destinations that limit others â€“ and come home safely. We are dedicated to our purpose of getting our customers where they need to be, when they need to be there, anywhere in the world â€“ safely and reliably. All you have to do is get on board!

At CHC, we pride ourselves on our values and culture:
Simplicity: Finding the most efficient way in everything we do
Agility: Moving quickly and decisively
Collaboration: Working together with candor and transparency
Innovation: Creating solutions and leading change
Ownership: Working with passion and doing what needs to be done
Role Summary:

Role Summary:

The Indirect Category Coordinator will be responsible for assigned product groups and/or regions, support of various projects and administration of assigned Indirect Category corporate functions such as the procurement system, Travel, Credit Card, Facilities, etc.     The goal is to support various initiatives designed to improve internal customer service, improve efficiency and drive ongoing cost savings.

Key Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities:

 

Responsibilities will include:

 

Procurement:

  • Support ongoing enhancements and improvements of overall global Procurement Program
  • Full visibility on suppliers, spend and key stakeholders for assigned regions and or product group
  • Liaise with Indirect Supervisor and Category Manager to leverage category knowledge to identify new opportunities
  • Establish new / preferred vendors and pricing through implementation of catalogues in procurement system to expand self service program
  • Obtain RFQs for non-catalogue items, negotiate best terms and price and supplier selection
  • Action and manage purchase order requests for non-catalogue goods/services; ensure order acknowledgements are processed, orders expedited as required, vendor delivering to committed dates, conforming to all internal and external regulations and QA requirements.
  • Monitor and manage all open orders for assigned area
  • Stakeholder engagement and user support in terms of training or other questions relating to the Indirect programs
  • Collaboration with regional supply chain personnel to support regional objectives and align with opportunities
  • Supplier relationship management
  • Collaboration and engagement with Safety and Quality as necessary
  • Prepare regular reporting such as KPIs and overall spend reports
  • Ensure any purchase orders are complete and received in the system to allow AP to pay invoices according to payment terms and collaborate closely with AP on any issues
  • Ensure compliance to CHC Procurement and other relevant policies

 

Program Administration:

  • The Indirect Category owns various global indirect programs that include Travel, Facilities, Credit Card and the Indirect Procurement System.
  • Administrative support of assigned indirect programs may include:
    • User support and monitoring program email box to ensure issues are addressed
    • Support new users to the program including training support
    • Running various reports to monitor compliance to the program and escalation of any issues
    • Support any program expansion in project coordinator role including maintaining and managing project action logs
    • Participate in Supplier Business Reviews to review KPIs and overall performance
    • Identify areas of process improvement in order to reduce costs
    • Other tasks as assigned specific to each individual indirect program
Qualifications, Skills & Attributes:
  • Bachelor's Degree Preferred
  • Minimum 2 years purchasing experience preferred
  • Strong business acumen / maturity and high degree of professionalism
  • Be able to develop strong relationships both with internal stakeholders and external vendors
  • Be a problem solver / outside the box thinker
  • Adaptable to changing priorities
  • Proficient with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint & Word) and generating reports
  • Experienced and displays a level of confidence in dealing with 3rd party vendors including negotiation of terms and pricing
  • Team Player, self-motivated and results driven. Must be a self starter and flexible to work within a global team.
  • Strategic thinker that wants to develop career within a global organization
  • Training/experience in Continuous Improvement (Lean, Six Sigma) (NOT required, but good to have)
  • Supply Chain accreditation (CPP, CPSM, CPIM, CSCP) (NOT required, but good to have)
  • Ability to demonstrate ethical conduct
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Employees must comply with and adhere to all company policies
  • May perform other duties as assigned.
  • International travel may be required.

title: Marketing Assistant - TPT - OHVA / Business Development
description:
Posting #: 2021-886602

Non Union

Position:Marketing Assistant

Department: Oakville Hospital Volunteer Association / Business Development

Status: Temporary Part-timeuntil approx. February 28, 2022 (Must provide availability up to a 0.6 FTE)

Hours:Monday to Friday - Days

Site:Oakville

Halton Healthcare takes great pride in providing quality, compassionate healthcare services to our rapidly growing communities. As a progressive and vibrant healthcare organization, we take healthcare to a new level to meet the urgent needs of ourcommunity's growing and aging population. We are adistinctive centre of healthcare excellence that offers first-rate care in an innovative environment that supports the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual needs of the community.

Halton Healthcare’s vision of Exemplary patient experiences, always , goes beyond just the patient experience; it has shaped our entire culture and remains at the core of every interaction in our organization, from our patients & families to our staff, physicians and volunteers. We believe in exemplary PEOPLE experiences always!

This is what you'll be doing:

Social Media

  • Assist in marketing and advertising promotional activities on diverse media platforms
    • Facebook
    • Websites
    • Youtube
    • Internal Intranet
    • Constant Contact – Email Campaign Blast

Campaigns
  • Support the Marketing Department in daily administrative tasks and odd jobs
  • Tracking sales data
  • Dispersing Marketing Material
  • Maintaining Promotional Material Inventory
  • Maintaining a database
  • Sending out e-mail campaigns

Project Search:

Business development Social Media & Marketing Student Volunteer Position:

  • Uploading to Facebook pages –4 Business Development Facebook pages
  • Upload communication to daily dose for our retailers, as well as BD hospital events for OTMH, Milton and Georgetown.
  • Using an e-marketing program called Constant Contact to reach clients that follow our events.
  • Execute all communication plans – which could consist of walking around the hospital and placing marketing pieces in pre-approved areas
  • Preparation of logistics for all events at the hospital and externally. May be asked to attend events if it falls during their placement time.
  • Printing to the Colour printer
  • Cutting and lamination
  • Computer knowledge a must. – Excel and Word
  • Some telephone work

This is what you’ll need to do it:
  • Strong knowledge of social media
  • Goal oriented ability to stay focused on creating winning results
  • Excellent time management
  • Some marketing experience would be an asset
  • Excellent communications both verbal and written, interpersonal and organizational skills and ability to manage and engage in a volunteer based working environment
  • Hours/days of work may vary due to the demands of the business must be available during hours of operations.

Date Posted: October 21, 2021

Internal Applications due by: October 28, 2021

Please apply if you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

W e thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.

In accordance with Directive #6, Halton Healthcare has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination and Management Policy. All new hires must be fully compliant with our Policy as a condition of employment with Halton Healthcare. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of vaccination or proof of a documented medical exemption as part of the hiring process.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation. All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products. We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Hiring a ContractMarketing Coordinator
Duration: 12 +Months
Client Location: Mississauga, ON   
Work Schedule:  40 Hours Weekly
Pay Rate $32/hourly


Benefits: ACA Compliant Medical Insurance
Qualifications:
To be successful in this role you must have a flair for marketing, an attention for details and a willingness to jump in with both feet.
 Ideally you will have held a similar role within the Hair Care / FMCG industry although a general marketing background and the right attitude will also be considered.
Minimum Requirements:
 * University degree in Business Marketing or related field.
* Proficiency with PC applications MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
* Strong analytical skills.
* Highly organized and detail oriented.
 * Superior communication, organizational, and project management skills.
* Proven ability to independently manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment.
* Team player with a positive attitude.
 * Fluency in English is essential, and French is beneficial.
 * Strong work ethic and integrity.

Responsibilities:
* Lead the promotional movement cycle for all brands including but not limited to creating, completing and maintaining distributor buyers guides, master promotional movement trackers and promotional pages (printed & digital).
* Overseeing the bi-monthly update and distribution of UPC/IDH product listing forms, order forms and sample order forms.
 * Work closely with Brand and Digital teams in the bi-monthly update of our rewards program website (mySKP.ca)
* Support team with processes related to new product introductions onto e-commerce, distributor and store channels including but not limited to completing product introduction forms (NIF, NIS forms), updating merchandising assortments (POGs), assisting in gathering and designing necessary marketing assets.
* Develop and execute in store, e-comm and social marketing mix to support national sale events.
* Maintain Marketing assets updated, including but not limited to order forms, master product listings, price lists, brand books, marketing manuals, artwork folders, etc.
* Lead the Professional Hands VIP mailer program.
* Assist in preparation for team/brand meetings, including but not limited to annual conferences, SME meetings, distributor/sales meetings, bonding sessions, etc.
* Assist in planning and execution of corporate events such as Tradeshows. Attend and participate in selected Tradeshows as needed.
 * Report information on the latest haircare/hair color products, trends, and insights across platforms (social media, blog, print/digital magazines).
 * Continuously research and compile information about competitive new market, advertising, and formulas and present competitive findings to team and brand managers.
 * Develop and implement processes to improve promotional planning cycles and existing processes





*Candidates cannot begin assignment until drug and background screenings have been successfully completed.*
On-Board was founded in 1976 by Robert L. Wilson to provide Engineering and Design services to the chemical manufacturing industry. Today, On-Board is a thriving privately held family of companies with services including: Consulting, Professional Engineering, Industrial Maintenance and Facility Management, Contracted Manufacturing and Production Services, as well as Temporary Staffing and Recruiting throughout North America. 
 
The On-Board Family of Companies conducts operations through its Corporate Headquarters located in East Windsor, NJ along with Regional Offices in New Castle, DE and Wake Forest, NC.  On-Board’s Mission is to provide “Flexible Service by applying the talents of our people, work processes and technology to meet our clients’ expectations in a Safe, Responsible and Dependable manner.”

title: Marketing Performance Analyst
description:
Marketing Performance Analyst

Primary Location : CA-QC-Montreal Island-Montreal

Employee Status : Regular :

Schedule : Full-time Number of hours (if position is part-time indicate the number of hours): : 37,5

Position summary : Would you like to make the most of your talent to improve our client experience?

Then keep reading!

+ Do you have experience with large marketing data environments?

+ Do you want to play a key role in identifying approaches to make recommendations to clients concerning their product and service offerings?

+ Do you want to be a part of the cultural and technological shift in the marketing sector?

This position reports to the Marketing Business Intelligence Manager of the Data Valorization team.

Your role :

+ Assume the leadership of marketing performance in your sector and collaborate closely with various cross-sector teams

+ Analyze and interpret financial, marketing and client data; collect, analyze, interpret and explain differences; and recommend/ensure that corrections are made

+ Establish methodologies for monitoring the performance of customer journeys and campaigns, and building business cases.

+ Follow up on the profitability of our initiatives and make appropriate recommendations

+ Identify and analyze the needs of stakeholders in order to create work systems, tools and processes that respond to their needs, facilitate decision-making and configure information more effectively.

+ Analyze major variations, identify opportunities and risks in order to recommend and submit action plans

+ Regularly monitor the development of initiatives and client portfolios, as well as contribute to the recommendations needed to support trends (acquisition, retention, migration, life cycle)

+ Lead the process for defining business targets and sector objectives, and ensure budget performance follow-up

+ Influence orientations and policies related to your professional area of expertise within your activity sector, and ensure the buy-in of the other parties involved

+ Anticipate/detect capacity issues in the Management team by maintaining a log of initiatives underway and upcoming, and the corresponding workload required

+ Analyze strategic and priority projects in the Marketing Strategy and Execution sector, which involves producing complex business cases, understanding and explaining the issues related to the projects, assessing the stakeholders who are affected and the expected benefits

+ Prepare the files and documentation required to participate in the various committees.

Required competencies :

+ Bachelor’s degree in a related field plus 6 years of relevant experience OR master’s degree in a related field plus 4 years of relevant experience

+ Experience with PowerBI tools

+ Strong ability to analyze results of all kinds (profitability, product conversion, efficiency, etc.)

+ Experience in presenting data to Management

+ Skilled at conceptualizing qualitative and quantitative data

+ Knowledge of the Marketing sector

+ Experience in financial analysis

+ Knowledge of SAS and SQL, an asset

+ Knowledge of the banking industry and financial institutions, an asset

+ Rigour, accountability and good at managing priorities

+ Strong analytical and synthesis skills, and ability to explain concepts

+ Bilingualism, both spoken and written (English and French)

Your benefits

Upon hiring, you'll be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family:

+ Health and wellness program, including many benefits

+ Flexible group insurance

+ Defined benefit pension plan

+ Employee Share Ownership Plan

+ Employee and Family Assistance Program

+ Preferential banking services

+ Community involvement program

+ Telemedicine

+ Virtual sleep clinic

These are just some of the many benefits we offer. Due to the current pandemic, our entire team is working remotely. We’ve also rolled out several additional measures to ensure your health, safety, and well-being during the pandemic.

People first

We’re a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people. Our mission is to have a positive impact on people’s lives.

Our core values of partnership, agility and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that’s accessible to all employees.

We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodation, feel free to let us know during our initial conversations.

We welcome all candidates! What can you bring to our team?

Are you ready to live your ambitions?

#LI-EG1

Job field : Business Intelligence and Data

Job Posting : Oct 4, 2021

Unposting Date : Oct 19, 2021

Work Postal Code: : H3B4L2

title: Marketing Specialist IT/IS
description:
Impact Healthcare

Roche Diagnostics is not only a healthcare leader but has the ambition to become a leader in digital health. Our digital teams are laying the groundwork for the future by developing various  innovative digital solutions centered around patients; supporting faster access and more efficient use of healthcare spend. Do you want to be part of this transformation, bringing technology & insights to healthcare; supporting earlier diagnosis, connecting various technologies and helping clinicians in finding the right treatments? 

Our Core Lab & Digital Solutions Marketing team aims to set the strategy, build partnership in transforming our healthcare system. Come join us!

 

Making a Big Difference

As a Marketing Specialist IT/ IS you will be responsible for all on market digital products (Navify, Viewics, cobas infinity to name a few). You will be the resident business expert for the IT / IS products in your portfolio. You will interact with the appropriate global development and commercialisation teams across North America, Europe and Asia. You will work closely with members of the Commercial Operations and the Regulatory & Quality chapters to ensure that all on market digital solutions and SW applications are relevant to the Canadian market. You will collaborate across the Marketing team of Specialists and Strategists to ensure the best strategies and tactics are being deployed with the Commercial Operations team.

 

Responsibilities:

*Position location; Reside anywhere in Canada with the understanding of meetings focusing on EST

  • Own pre-market plan/business case for new products- which lead to launch

  • Responsible for co-creation of innovative software applications and product enhancements addressing Canadian market issues.

  • Train and work collaboratively with the Commercial Operations team to keep bi-directional updates on products, competition & product challenges, liaison with North American and European development centers

  • Become a business matter expert on the portfolio for the Canadian Market

  • Responsible for the successful management of the products' life cycle from 'cradle to grave' in their respective BU portfolio

  • Will work closely across Chapters to ensure products are relevant, competitive and viable for the Canadian Market.

 

Requirements 

  • 5+ years’ experience in software development, Product Owner roles

  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent field 

  • Experience in the design and/or implementation of SaaS models, cloud solution using AWS

  • Agile, Growth Mindset and willingness to New Ways of Working a must

  • Understanding of Public Healthcare System preferably Canada 

  • Bilingual in English and French preferred

  • Reside anywhere in Canada with the understanding of meetings focusing on EST

  • Minimal travel up to 25% annually

 

Impact sur les soins de santé

Roche Diagnostics n'est pas seulement un leader de la santé mais a l'ambition de devenir un leader de la santé numérique. Nos équipes digitales préparent le futur en développant diverses solutions digitales innovantes centrées sur le patient ; favoriser un accès plus rapide et une utilisation plus efficace des dépenses de santé. Voulez-vous faire partie de cette transformation, apporter la technologie et les connaissances aux soins de santé ? soutenir un diagnostic plus précoce, connecter diverses technologies et aider les cliniciens à trouver les bons traitements ?

Notre équipe Marketing des solutions pour le laboratoire central et numériques vise à définir la stratégie, à établir des partenariats pour transformer notre système de santé. Venez nous rejoindre!

 

Faire une grande différence

En tant que spécialiste marketing TI/SI, vous serez responsable de tous les produits numériques du marché (Navify, Viewics, cobas infinity pour n'en nommer que quelques-uns). Vous serez l'expert en la matière résident pour les produits IT/IS de votre portfolio. Vous interagirez avec les équipes de développement et de commercialisation mondiales appropriées en Amérique du Nord, en Europe et en Asie. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les membres des chapitres des opérations commerciales et de la réglementation et de la qualité pour vous assurer que toutes les solutions numériques et applications logicielles sur le marché sont pertinentes pour le marché canadien. Vous collaborerez avec l'équipe marketing de spécialistes et de stratèges pour vous assurer que les meilleures stratégies et tactiques sont déployées avec l'équipe des opérations commerciales.

Responsabilités

*Localisation de l’emploi:Résider n'importe où au Canada avec la compréhension que les réunions sont durant l’heure normale de l’Est

 

  • Propre plan de pré-commercialisation/analyse de rentabilisation pour les nouveaux produits - qui conduisent au lancement

  • Responsable de la co-création d'applications logicielles innovantes et d'améliorations de produits répondant aux problèmes du marché canadien.

  • Former et travailler en collaboration avec l'équipe des opérations commerciales pour tenir des mises à jour bidirectionnelles sur les produits, la concurrence et les défis liés aux produits, en liaison avec les centres de développement nord-américains et européens

  • Devenez un expert en affaires sur le portefeuille pour le marché canadien

  • Responsable de la gestion réussie du cycle de vie des produits du « berceau à la tombe » dans leur portfolio de votre unité d’affaires respective

  • Travaillera en étroite collaboration entre les chapitres pour s'assurer que les produits sont pertinents, compétitifs et viables pour le marché canadien.

Requis

  • Plus de 5 ans d'expérience dans le développement de logiciels, rôles de Product Owner

  • B.S. ou M.S. en informatique ou dans un domaine équivalent

  • Expérience dans la conception et/ou la mise en œuvre de modèles SaaS, solution cloud utilisant AWS

  • Agile, esprit de croissance et volonté de nouvelles façons de travailler un must

  • Bilingue anglais et français, de préférence

  • Résider n'importe où au Canada avec la compréhension que les réunions sont durant l’heure normale de l’Est

  • Voyagement minimal jusqu'à 25% par an
