title: Brand Associate
description:
POSITION TITLE: Associate: Brands and Specialty EMPLOYMENT CLASSIFICATION: Non - Exempt POSITION REPORTS TO: Assistant or General Manager DEPARTMENT: Operations POSITION SUMMARY: The Brands Associate is responsible for delivering sales and excellent customer service in designated stores. This position performs tasks on the sales floor or in a support environment. This Associate takes pride in the Brand, is passionate about product and delivering a positive shopping experience in a service focused, well-maintained and friendly environment. POSITION REQUIREMENTS: • Demonstrated selling experience in a service oriented retail setting. Preference towards the store’s products • Demonstrated ability to assess customer needs, upsell and make recommendations, preferably with prior knowledge of the product lines. • paced Demonstrated ability to promote product, influence customers and work with a team in a fast service environment • Significant interpersonal and relationship, demonstrated ability to stay up to date with industry products and services. Retain and apply product knowledge DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: • Put the customer first at all times • Provide memorable, highly personalized customer service through needs analyses and product recommendations. • Offer customers promotional products and services • Be able to resolve customer service issues and escalate as required • Create and maintain good working relationships with fellow associates • Maintain store appearance with respect to visual merchandising, housekeeping and maintenance standards • Efficiently and accurately conduct customer transactions on our POS • Efficiently and accurately conduct receiving, cycle counts, product returns and transfer transactions, etc. on our handheld • Efficiently and accurately complete any required process controls (paperwork, etc.) • Follow company policies and procedures and maintain a safe working environment • Process all point of sale transactions in a friendly, quick, and efficient manner while complying with the company’s Cash Handling and Loss Prevention Standard Operating Procedures • Successfully show consistent performance on quarterly selling observations POSITION QUALIFICATIONS: • Passion for and knowledge of the Brand and product category • Ability to work various shifts in a 7/365 team orientated environment • Excellent customer service skills and an ability to communicate effectively using the English language • Strong sense of personal pride • Self-starter able to prioritize and handle various tasks simultaneously • Capable of working in a team environment and committed to driving sales results • Ability to adapt to changing priorities and unexpected situations 2849 PACES FERRY ROAD | OVERLOOK I, 4TH FLOOR | ATLANTA, GEORGIA 30339 |ph. 404.344.7905 | fax. 404.349.3226 • Ability and willingness to accept and provide feedback • Proficiency required in reading, writing, and mathematics • Ability to pass the Federal Criminal History Records Check, Paradies Background Check, and the applicable Department of Transportation requirements • Computer work, heavy lifting (40 lbs.), long standing periods, climbing lifting, bending, nights or weekend work, based in a store or group of stores; early morning, evening and weekend work and holidays This position description is merely intended to describe the primary elements of the position. The Paradies Shops reserves the right to change the position description and to assign additional duties and responsibilities as necessary. This position description does not constitute an employment contract of any kind. Acknowledged: ____________________________________________ __________________________

Sales Associate

title: Senior Marketing Operations Specialist
description:
About Us

Our mission is to make hourly work easier for local businesses and hourly workers. Homebase currently serves more than 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses with everything they need to manage their hourly teams: employee scheduling, time clocks, payroll, team communication, hiring, onboarding, and compliance. Just don't call us "Human Capital Management." We have built tools for the busiest businesses, so owners and employees can spend less time on bullsh*t and more time on what matters. The Homebase team brings small business expertise from Intuit, Square, OpenTable, Yelp, Gusto, and First Data. Homebase is backed by leading venture investors Bain Capital Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Plus Capital, and GGV Capital.

You

  • You are a data-driven marketing operations manager who has broad experience across a large marketing automation tech stack
  • You love process - building new processes, improving current processes, and translating marketing requirements into campaigns
  • You're a problem solver - ready to jump into the data to troubleshoot any issues that come your way or discover new insights to drive growth
  • You love to learn - from new methods of data analysis to new communication best practices
  • You enjoy synthesizing data into actionable insights for others in your organization
  • You enjoy working within a data model architecture, ensuring standardization and cleanliness of customer data in various platforms
  • You love working across an organization - from Product to Engineering to Customer Success, and more
  • You are passionate about helping local small businesses and are excited to use email (and other methods) to communicate with small business owners
  • You have a customer-first mindset, building experiences that serve the needs of your target audience
  • You have a background in marketing operations but are also interested in learning new skills from data pipelines/migration to sales operations to customer journey mapping

The Job

As a member of our growing marketing team, you'll work closely with our marketing, product, and customer success leaders to shape the future of our chat & email marketing systems. You'll not only lead our chat marketing efforts, but you will be pivotal in centralizing how we communicate with our customers across our customer success, sales, marketing, and product teams. You'll own our data migration efforts, ensuring that customer data is passed from our internal systems to our marketing automation tools. This role also presents the opportunity to expand your scope of work outside of chat & email, as there will be opportunities to learn and work on sales operations, customer lifecycle mapping, landing page testing, etc.

Responsibilities

  • Develop new communication strategies within our current email & chatbot marketing system, communicating with over 100K small business owners 
  • Own data migration efforts from our internal systems to marketing automation vendors
  • Report on effectiveness of email & chatbot marketing to senior management
  • Partner with Customer Success to design and implement new email & chatbot workflows to support sales operations processes
  • Design and implement new email, text, chat, or other communication workflows for different steps of the customer journey
  • Conduct and measure A/B tests to learn, optimize, improve our communications
  • Build custom lists of customers to communicate with based on actions taken within our product
  • Identify and troubleshoot technical and data issues with with Data and Engineering teams
  • Work with our Marketing and Product teams to attract Homebase customers, encourage them to use our product, and get them to pay
  • Build a multi-channel view of customer touchpoints, tying together points of contact across Sales, Marketing, and Product
  • Ensure we are always complying with relevant chat, email, text, and other regulations

Must-Have

  • 2+ years experience managing email & chat marketing automation platforms 
  • 4+ years of marketing experience
  • Chat software experience (e.g. Drift, Intercom, Zendesk, Podium) and experience building out chat playbooks
  • Email marketing software experience (eg. Iterable, HubSpot, Pardot, Constant Contact) and technical experience expanding scope of email marketing program
  • Strong data analysis skills - proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets is a must
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g Looker, Google Analytics, Tableau, Domo)
  • SQL experience or willingness to learn
  • Working knowledge of HTML
  • Excellent understanding of what makes a good/effective email; copywriting and editing skills are a plus
  • Strong attention to detail and the ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Ability to synthesize data and present actionable insights
  • Comfort taking on projects outside of your defined role
  • Be self-directed and able to manage complex projects from end-to-end
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic, fast paced environment, serving as a cross-departmental marketing resource across multiple time zones

What We Offer You

  • Supplemental Benefits 
  • Stock Options - Everyone is an owner
  • Fun Team Activities
  • A dynamic, well-connected, productive team that is thriving while working from home and who have found new ways to connect and have fun despite social distancing

At Homebase, we value our differences, and we encourage all to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Homebase is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: Business Development Manager - RMG - Ottawa and Atlantic Canada - Remote
description:
Business Development Manager - RMG - Ottawa and Atlantic Canada - Remote

MCAP at a Glance

Joining MCAP means you will be a part of our diverse workforce of highly talented individuals who are recognized for their expertise and success! At MCAP, your professional expertise, commitment to teamwork and passion for service excellence are recognized and rewarded with competitive total rewards offering, a career with continuous learning and development (formal & informal training), and exciting opportunities in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment.

The Role

This position is responsible for representing RMG's to the Mortgage Brokerage community in a specified territory. Primary responsibility is to retain and grow existing business with current RMG registered brokers/agents and develop and acquire net new business with brokers/agents not currently registered with RMG in a specified territory.  The Business Development Manager will be accountable for annual achievement of specific targets set at the beginning of each fiscal year.  The primary focus is on funded volume specific to net new origination and refinance with additional secondary targets based on other business unit priorities as set by the VP, Sales (i.e. high ratio vs. conventional split). 

This role will work primarily out of a remote home office with travel required to brokers and the MCAP office.  BDMs must possess a valid driver’s license at all times.

The successfully candidate will be supporting Ottawa and Atlantic Canada . 

Relationship Management – Retain, Grow, & Acquire

  • Deliver and manage the “Optimal Broker Experience”
  • Create awareness of MCAP's RMG products with new Mortgage Brokers by:
  • Presenting to small or large groups selling  value proposition
  • Position products and services
  • Increase results with existing MCAP Mortgage Brokers
  • Identify unforeseen needs and opportunities and construct a plan to address
  • Utilize sales and marketing programs to add additional value to the broker relationship (i.e. Mpoints loyalty program)
  • Negotiate with brokers to gain a commitment on volume
  • Assist in registration and creation of new MCAP Broker/Brokerage profiles and creating a Mortgage Broker/Brokerage file for each account for MCAP management while updating all information in Salesforce.com
  • Identify new/potential Brokers/Brokerages
  • On a frequent basis, contact potential new brokers and set up appointments to present MCAP’s value proposition
  • Inform and educate new brokers on products and programs
  • Perform relationship building activities in a professional manner encouraging open communication with respect to market trends and competitive intelligence
  • Hold brokers accountable to committed volumes, funding ratios, and any other metrics as determined by MCAP.
  • The use of agendas for scheduled meetings, accompanied with broker score card and co-agent reporting.

Marketing

  • Create and implement innovative campaigns to drive business in a specified territory
  • Communicate on a timely and regular basis utilizing Salesforce.com the following:
  • Rate updates
  • Incentive programs
  • Program and policy updates
  • Education
  • Service levels
  • other
  • Attend industry events both association and mortgage brand specific
  •  Man tradeshow booths

Planning

  • Develop an annual strategic territory and account plan
  • Manage monthly expenses prudently to assist in growth of the business
  • Create a touch-point strategy to organize work week, appointments and presentations
  • Identify the Broker’s business style and personal attributes in order to foster a strong working relationship with MCAP
  • Follow up on leads in a timely manner in order to capitalize on the opportunity to increase our customer base

Reporting

  • Update and maintain all broker information within Saleforce.com
  • Complete full Know Your Client (KYC) profiles for all Submission Agents within Salesforce.com
  • Log all daily activity in Salesforce.com- maintaining minimum levels
  • Log any promotions or specials in Saleforce.com

What You Bring To The Team 

  • Minimum 5 years sales experience – Financial Services  
  • 2 years underwriting experience is an asset
  • Results oriented
  • Creative and innovative
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent organizational and time-management skills
  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Ability to build meaningful and trusting relationships
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment
  • Effective negotiation skills
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient with MS Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Web-Ex, etc
  • Strong customer service skills.
  • Self-driven, motivated with the ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • Carries out duties with integrity and takes responsibility for actions.
  • Thorough knowledge of mortgage broker network and emerging industry trends
  • University Degree
  • Accredited Mortgage Professional (AMP, preferred) or courses to satisfy provincial regulatory requirements

If this sounds like you and you are looking to be a part of one of Canada’s largest independent mortgage finance companies in Canada, then we want to hear from you!

Be A Part Of Something Great

MCAP is Canada’s largest independent Mortgage Finance company with over $140 billion in assets under management providing mortgage solutions for residential and commercial properties. For over 35 years, MCAP originates, trades, securitizes and services mortgages in offices across Canada. MCAP originates residential mortgages exclusively through the mortgage broker channel as we believe that a professional mortgage broker is a consumer's best option and MCAP actively promotes the services of mortgage brokers across the country. MCAP is also a leader in the Canadian residential construction lending market with over 25 years in the business. Our teams of dedicated professionals serve a variety of developer, construction and lender clients across Canada.

Position #: req1439

Employment Status: Permanent Full Time

Location: Toronto; Ontario

Number Of Openings: 1

Department: Residential

Internal Job Title: Business Development Manager


The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in the position.  It is not designated to contain a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

MCAP provides equal opportunities for all applicants and is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported throughout the recruitment and employment process. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Content Marketer
description:
We are looking for a self-motivated and talented individual to manage and lead our communications. In this position, you will be in charge of producing high-quality content that engages customers and builds brand recognition.

Your main duties will also include creating informative content, press releases, articles, and media opportunities to share our company's brand, products, and services. The ideal candidate will be an excellent communicator, with brilliant presentation and organizational skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Create informative and interesting press releases, press kits, newsletters, and related marketing materials.
  • Develop and implement effective communication strategies that build customer loyalty programs, brand awareness, and customer satisfaction.
  • Prepare detailed media activity reports.
  • Plan and manage the design, content, and production of all marketing materials.
  • Work with different marketing teams to generate new ideas and strategies.
  • Supervise projects to guarantee all content is publication-ready.
  • Create communication and marketing strategies for new products, launches, events, and promotions.
  • Respond to communication-related issues in a timely manner.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in communications, journalism, public relations or relevant field.
  • A minimum of 5 years experience in a similar role.
  • Proven experience in B2B SAAS startups.
  • Strong knowledge of communication practices and techniques.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

title: Growth Marketer (Remote)
description:
About Bird&Be

The current fertility experience is broken, and we want your help fixing it. We offer personalized fertility kits, designed to help our customers optimize their outcomes, no matter the stage of their journey. With rising infertility rates, our kits will help educate our customers on their fertility health early, and help them take action with personalized supplements and prescription medication that is scientifically proven to impact outcomes. All delivered together in a beautiful box right to their doorstep.

All of this will be done under a brand umbrella that resonates with our customer base. We see a future that is different from the current "family planning" aisle filled with blue and pink boxes, plastered with photos of white babies. Our brand will reflect the modern millennial. Less First Response, more Knix. 

We are a very early stage startup, and are building a brilliant team that is excited to help solve this complex problem. 

About you

You want to be part of a small, very early stage startup that is having a massive impact on people’s lives. You are self motivated, love to collaborate, and are resourceful. You’ll need to be as passionate about our vision and as ambitious for growth as the founding team.

We are dealing with very emotional (and sometimes traumatic) subject matter for our customers, so your empathy must run high. You will need high level knowledge of digital strategies and a digital-first approach to communications and community development. You are an expert in multi-platform formats and strategies - Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest, Tiktok, Twitter, blog, etc. You are highly experienced in directing paid/organic search strategy, display advertising, content and retention marketing and emerging marketing channels. You understand and utilize analytics to find ways to improve performance across all channels. 

The work

This role is focused on digital marketing and community development, reporting directly to the CEO. Your role is to lead and drive communications in the US and Canada, build and expand our online audience, community and user base.  You’ll be working closely with our designer and developer to execute creative and effective marketing campaigns, turning small budgets into highly successful outcomes.  You will need to be nimble and resourceful and be able to recommend changes as we test different customer acquisition strategies.

Your responsibilities:

  • Work with the CEO/COO on development and execution of highly creative communications strategies for Bird&Be in Canada/US

  • Lead digital marketing strategy to amplify the impact, influence and visibility of brand and product launches

  • Focus on building brand awareness and authority, driving traffic and growing the business

  • Align digital marketing support to amplify PR strategy

  • Analyze metrics to understand where we need to improve performance, make changes, or double down on a highly functioning strategy

Role requirements:

  • Experienced (3+ years experience) in launching small to large-scale digital (earned and paid) campaigns with an understanding of ROI and measuring customer insights

  • You are passionate about driving stories across different social channels 

  • Excellent knowledge of media, cultural landscape and societal dynamics in Canada and the US

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills and full proficiency in English

  • Strong problem solving skills with a creative approach

  • Thrives in a scrappy, fast-paced environment

  • Generous and passionate team leader with strong organizational skills

title: Franchise Marketing Strategist
description:
The 401 Group of Companies, is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's fastest growing dealer groups offering a full line of automotive, recreational vehicle, powersport and marine products and services. The 401 Group of Companies has 20+ locations across Ontario including the Blackshop Restaurant and Wine Bar as well as our headquarters, both located in the thriving city of Cambridge, Ontario. Our brands include but aren't limited to Kia, Mitsubishi, Volkswagen, Hyundai, Yamaha, 401 Auto Financing, CampMart and Grand River Boats. If you have a growth mindset like us, we'd love to see your resume and have a conversation. The opportunities at the 401 Group of Companies are endless!

 

Location: 2200 Eagle Street North, Cambridge, ON


Hours: Monday - Friday 8 am to 5 pm 

 

 This role will specifically focus on marketing for our franchises as we continue to grow the 401 Group of Companies!


Role and Responsibilities:  

  • Build on and execute the 401 Auto RV Group’s organic social media content strategy by growing our audience, increasing engagement and driving conversions and clicks 
  • Create a robust franchise social content calendar through content planning and real-time customer engagement
  • Create engaging written content including customer stories, articles, whitepapers, blogs and any other media coverage
  • Create, edit, publish and share content to attract and engage the 401Group of Companies social community across all corporate platforms for franchises our ie: Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, TikTok and Pinterest 
  • Collaborate with internal departments to create buzz and excitement around new franchise products, partnerships, employment opportunity/employer branding and other corporate messaging 
  • Monitor all mentions and DMs to ensure they meet the 401 Auto RV Group’s branding and professional image and direct/escalate inquiries as appropriate 
  • Protect the company’s brand and keep a consistent pulse on relevant Canadian automotive & RV news and trending topics 
  • Provide insights for the organization based on social listening, market trends and platform innovations 
  • Utilize your analytical ability to evaluate customer experience across multiple channels and customer touchpoints 
  • Other duties as designed

     

    Qualifications and Skills: 

    • Successful completion of post-secondary education in communications, digital marketing, or public relations 
    • 3+ years of experience in social media marketing, content marketing and communications
    • Direct experience growing a following on social media on behalf of a growing, mid-size, start-up and professional brand 
    • Previous experience in marketing and developing social content for an automotive company is considered an asset 
    • Technically savvy and knowledgeable in social media platforms as outlined above and how to optimize each platforms use 
    • Strong understanding of social analytical tools such as Google Analytics, Hootsuite and Webtrends Analytics 
    • Strong understanding of social media metrics and the ability to convey them to internal partners 
    • Working knowledge of graphic design tools ie: Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva
    • Proven ability to produce high quality and creative work while understanding the requirements of design including typography and layout 
    • Proven ability to be highly innovative, and effective in creating visually appealing content 
    • Exceptionally strong communication skills – written, verbal and interpersonal 
    • An entrepreneurial spirit and creative mindset 
    • Valid G Driver's License and acceptable driving record 

     

    The 401 Grouo of Companies is an equal opportunity employer and we are pleased to accommodate individual needs within our recruitment process. Please speak with our HR department should you require any accommodation.

title: Skilled Marketer
description:
If you're looking for an extremely CHALLENGING role that will reward the HARDEST workers, this might be the job for you. We are looking for a few all-stars to add to our amazingly talented team for this summer ahead. This year is going to be a GREAT one, with a company goal of maximizing growth while maintaining a fun and enjoyable experience for our team, through our Work Hard, Play Hard strategy.

Requirements

- Strong work ethic

- Enjoy working outdoors

- Minimal Fear of heights

- Great teamwork skills

Benefits

- Positive team atmosphere

- Strong mentorship program

- Extra incentives/raises

- Top-tier training

The application process is highly competitive, and priority is given to the earliest applicants. To apply to join the team for summer 2021, send in a resume outlining why you are the best pick.

https://www.facebook.com/HammerWC

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
As a Marketing Coordinator, you will be managing a series of on-going projects, applying a data-driven approach to drive our marketing decisions, and ideating on different marketing strategies. You will also help contribute to managing our social media channels and build our brand presence in the local entrepreneurship ecosystem. Below are a few of the exciting initiatives that you could be a part of:


As a Marketing Coordinator you will be responsible for:

  • Content ideation (social media and blog)
  • Work along side Project Leads to execute EntSoc projects (launching pilot versions, creating drafts and revisions, conducting primary research – this also includes taking part in cross-team projects)

title: Sales & Marketing Coordinator Remote
description:
Role

This particular function is mainly in charge of supporting the company throughout the regions, by controlling the business, industry preparation as well as campaign execution, which includes strategic and tactical plan to increase penetration inside new places, by delivering need & sales targets. The job will even support the buyer Liaison Officer in ensuring almost all nearby location engagement is extensively planned and opportunities are backed.

Responsibility
  • Execute all web, SEO/SEM, email, social media and display and search advertising campaigns, sales funnels, Content Marketing
  • Maintain social media presence
  • Collaborate with internal teams to create landing pages, keyword research, ad copy, banner designs and optimize user experience
  • Measure and report on the performance of all digital marketing campaigns
  • Produce marketing content for promotion across digital marketing channels, including email, website, social media, search, and chat.
  • Plan, develop and optimize paid media campaigns.
  • Work with strategic partners and stakeholders on workflow processes and systems to maximize effectiveness.
  • Report on project progress and engage in client, user, and partner communications.
  • Build knowledge bases around processes, business rules and assist in documenting best practices.
  • Work closely with internal teams to bring campaigns to life while driving and measuring key business results
  • Analyze and gather data
  • Identify A/B testing opportunities, executing and optimizing against results
  • Review and test emails, campaigns, and features before launch
  • Stay on top of new trends in digital marketing content and strategy
  • Create engaging monthly social media content calendars.
  • Generate and utilize web analytics codes & tracking. Plan and develop email campaigns.
  • Regularly update the website and other properties with marketing content.
  • Design creative assets for social media channels, email campaigns, websites, and landing pages. e.g. Canva, Photoshop, Illustrator
  • Produce and analyze monthly performance reports.
Requirements

Client service

- Client Service refers to the ability to communicate efficiently and professionally with clients. At work, client service skills are required to interact with clients on behalf of the employer.

Teamwork

- Teamwork refers to the skills needed to interact with other people. At work, people work with others in pairs and in small and large groups to coordinate tasks, share resources, plan, make decisions, negotiate, solve conflicts and complete other activities that involve teamwork.

Communication

- Communication refers to the skills needed to exchange thoughts and information with other people. This exchange can happen orally by speaking, listening and using non-verbal cues, such as body language or in writing. At work, people use communication skills to talk to customers, discuss products with suppliers, explain work procedures to co-workers, participate in virtual sales meetings with clients, and other activities that involve verbal or written exchanges.

Digital skills

- Digital technology refers to the skills needed to understand and use digital systems, tools and applications, and to process digital information. At work, people use digital technology skills to input, access, analyze, organize, create and communicate information and ideas using computers, software, point-of-sale equipment, email, podcasts, web applications, smart phones and other digital devices.

Leadership

- Leadership refers to a number of skills, including communication, relationship building, and the ability to delegate and traits such as honesty. At work, leadership skills are required when working in a team, demonstrating initiative, and taking responsibility for the completion of tasks that require multiple employees.

Department Mission / Job to be done

AKP Solutions is a small consulting firm located in Toronto providing general business management and professional consulting services through independent contractors since 2019. In response to COVID-19, we are proud to be building Cansulta, a website and online community for small business owners and entrepreneurs who need to manage and grow their business to connect with vetted consultants. Cansulta is an innovative online platform dedicated to the shared success of entrepreneurs and consultants centered on its core tenets of accessibility, affordability and automation. Our internal activities include the research, planning, design, development, project management, marketing, and support services required to maintain the platform.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
About PSD Citywide

 PSD Citywide is a full-service firm offering research, consulting services and software to the North American public sector market. Our client base includes hundreds of small, mid-sized, and large municipalities from across North America, provincial/state and federal government agencies, and private sector entities. We are an industry leader that specializes in enterprise asset management and financial budgeting for municipalities. Over our years of experience, we have developed cutting-edge software solutions for our client’s asset management and financial budgeting needs, leaving behind mature and manageable programs making positive impacts in local communities.

 

PSD Citywide’s service areas are configured to meet three essential needs for governments: policy research and analysis, high-performance technology, and credible data. Through our infrastructure and financial consulting practice, we work with decision-makers to refine organizational systems, programs, and processes for better corporate outcomes.

 

As we continue to grow our team, we are seeking a full-time Product Marketing Manager to join our Marketing team. This is a remote based role. The ability to travel will be required in this role. 

 

Description

The Manager of Product Marketing leads the development of the product’s competitive differentiation, product positioning, product messaging, and go-to-market strategies, as well as ensuring that sales, marketing, and customer success is always aligned and informed. At this capacity, they are also responsible for overseeing the creation of sales tools, marketing collateral, and product training - being the intersection between the buyer, customer, sales, and product development.

 

Qualifications


  • Minimum of 3 years of Product Marketing Manager experience.
  • 5+ years working at a SAAS company with $2M to $25M in revenue.
  • Experience working as or with a Product Manager.
  • Preference given to those with experience in the marketing of professional services.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, an affinity for public speaking, and presentations to large and/or senior management team.
  • University Degree or College Diploma.

 


Responsibilities & Duties

 

  • Working with the product and consulting teams, package and deploy new software modules and consulting services for sale in respective markets, including all collateral and training.
  • Provide feedback to the product team from sales, customer success, and sales enablement to guide the development of timely competitive product enhancements.
  • Develop and deliver ongoing internal and external training and communications to educate audiences of new product enhancements in an accessible and easy to comprehend format.
  • Lead the development of all product messaging, including the development and maintenance of talk tracks, message houses, and related scripts to support sales and customer success.
  • Communicate effectively with both internal and external senior-level management to properly relay key features and benefits of new and existing products and services.
  • Act as the “infomediary” between engineering and the end user.
  • Provides process and knowledge training for the sales team.
  • Manages the demo experience and acts as a subject matter expert on our products and services to prospects, as needed.
  • Other duties assigned.

 

Recruitment Process

All resumes will be reviewed for experience working with key technologies. Only those who qualify will be contacted for an initial screening interview. We strive to provide a quick recruitment process, but to find the right candidate for the job the process may take up to a month to complete. We will let the candidates know if we will not be moving them to the next step in the process.

 

Phone Interview

If you are invited to a screening interview you will discuss your experience with one of our HR team members. This interview is an opportunity to get to know a little more about the company, the type of work we do and impact we have.

 

Virtual Interview

Candidates invited to a virtual interview will meet with our hiring team and HR. This will allow the candidate to get to know the team as well as learn more about our processes, culture, and growth opportunities we have at PSD.

 

Why work with us?

Employee personal and career growth is important to us, and we will encourage you to pursue the things you care about.  We have a mentoring program that matches you with a senior developer for your first three months to ensure you get fully acquainted with our tech. We also encourage continuous learning through a Training & Development program allowing our developers to fully explore their interests and contribute to different product development teams at PSD.

 

Employee Perks

  • Competitive Salaries
  • Full Benefits Package
  • Work from home
  • Relocation Assistance Program
  • Company Matched RRSP Contributions
  • Flex Hours & Paid Time off
  • Social and Charity events and initiatives
  • Ergonomic Workstations

 

PSD is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this when you apply, and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
Does this sound like you? You have that optimism that you can have a career that changes the world. You want to work with people, make a difference in their lives, and get the breadth of experience you can build a meaningful career on.

If so, you'll find what you're looking for here.

About MakerKids

MakerKids (https://makerkids.com) is an award-winning learning platform that is building core technical, programming, and social-emotional skills for kids. Parents use MakerKids to augment their child's core curriculum with small group project-based learning programs that have won the endorsement of psychologists, Intel, and other child education advocates. We run classes on coding, robotics and Minecraft. Our classes help kids develop confidence, social skills, resilience and a positive relationship with technology. We ignite kids' potential and inspire them to be inventors, entrepreneurs, and innovators. Kids have started businesses, won prizes from NASA, and reported positive mental health outcomes. We are a pioneer in the education industry, having started the first and largest makerspace for kids in the world. Today, we provide amazing interest-driven virtual and in-person STEM programs to help kids move from being consumers to creators. We've been featured in major media such as Wired, Popular Science and Forbes, and have spoken at TEDx, SXSW, Maker Faire, MakerCon, and more. We are a social impact company and our mission is to help people reach their potential and make a positive impact on the world. We are leading classes that improve kids' lives significantly, enabling them to see their own power and realize that they can make a difference. Come change the world with us, one kid at a time.

We're growing quickly, and we're looking for leaders to grow with us and ultimately drive our mission forward. Right now, we're looking for a Growth Marketing Manager.

Why Join Us

In addition to making a positive impact on the world, you can participate in our:

  • Staff discount on MakerKids programs
  • Fun social events with the team like karaoke, escape rooms, improv classes, and other activities
  • Referral Program
  • Flexible schedules available
  • Paid Vacation
  • Compensation commensurate with experience, and bonuses based on targets
  • Equity
  • Generous learning budget
  • Opportunities for growth and advancement

You'll love this role if you:

  • Want to have a positive impact on kids
  • Want to share your love for technology and making
  • Dig a relaxed, casual, and fun work group (warning: musical theatre nerds and Dungeons & Dragons players among us)
  • Did we mention having fun while working? We like doing stuff together online or in-person – virtual coffees, improv classes, escape rooms, and other staff socials
  • And we also take our work seriously, create space for each other's opinions and perspectives, and pursuing success together

We just raised funds, we are partnered with a university on a research project in progress, and you will get to shape the future of the company and grow your own team. 

    The Role

    The Growth Marketing Manager will run and/or oversee the day-to-day marketing functions of our MakerKids experience. You'll accomplish this by running and/or managing our paid ads (or working with an ad specialist on ensuring our paid ads are achieving proper ROI), SEO, website, CRO, email marketing, social media marketing, affiliate marketing, design, promotional calendar and blogs. 

    Once you've learned how our marketing runs, you'll turn your attention to optimizing our marketing and growing revenue. You will define and champion the overarching marketing strategy, so we'll be very open to any improvements you can make to achieve your vision. 

    Responsibilities: 

    • Establish and implement growth strategies to support MakerKids' revenue goals. Set and implement strategies to grow qualified, profitable external traffic to our products and services, maximize sales and revenue, and meet other business objectives through various marketing strategies.
    • Take ownership of running and/or overseeing our marketing team functions: reporting, paid ads, SEO/SEM, Content Marketing, Multiple call-to-action landing pages, Social media engagement, email marketing, affiliate marketing, and more.
    • Own the budget, measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs) 
    • Lead campaign design and build to test ad copy, landing page, bidding, and audience targeting to find opportunities to drive incremental growth.
    • Recommend the suite of tools, technologies, automation and processes necessary for scaling our marketing efforts. Identify and test new customer acquisition opportunities to improve performance and/or reduce expenses, with a drive to rapid growth in new customer acquisition.
    • Focus on MakerKids' brand and differentiating message, our market and buyer personas, competitive analysis and industry analysis
    • Take a proactive, problem-solving approach to improve our current marketing procedures and delivery to maximize our revenue
    • Lead the onboarding, training, and supervision of new marketing staff, contractors and agencies as needed as we grow.
    • Steward the website and design we use every day
    • Manage the marketing materials to meet high quality standards
    • Create brand awareness and other marketing activities to increase our growth

    This is a varied position that will include an operations component as well, and if you have experience as a Marketing Manager, that variety will feel familiar. You'll have our full support to make changes that will make a lasting difference on our business.

    You're the right fit for this role because you have a customer-centric mindset, and are always looking for ways to improve marketing, or tackle high-leverage challenges to make things work better.

    Role Details

    This is a full-time, permanent position.  All MakerKids staff are currently working remotely and will continue doing so until it is safe to return to office or have the option of remaining remote. This position can return to office, or can remain remote indefinitely.

    Our bright, colourful, playful makerspace office is located at 2451 Bloor Street West in Toronto, steps from Jane TTC station, which is a good home base for meetings. We are currently working remotely. This position could be remote indefinitely, or in-person or a hybrid as mutually agreed upon.

    Qualifications

    If you have these, you'll be a great fit:

    • Experience growing revenue in a marketing position
    • Experience with managing or overseeing marketing areas such as website/SEO, copywriting, affiliate marketing, promotional calendars, growing followers, making/overseeing design, writing email newsletters that convert, and managing/overseeing paid ads (with knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Adwords, and Facebook Ads Manager)
    • Strong leadership experience, grit, and self-starter capabilities
    • An ability to pass a criminal background check with vulnerable sector screening

    Anything on this list would be an asset:

    • Experience with Wordpress and/or Webflow
    • Startup experience (preferably in a company that grew substantially within the time worked)
    • Good understanding of SEO
    • Good analytical skills (Google Analytics, Segmetrics, Heap, Looker, Tableau, Google Adwords, Facebook Ads, and/or Hubspot)
    • Design experience
    • UI/UX experience
    • Bachelor's degree in any related field

    If this opportunity sounds like the meaningful, career-building challenge you've been looking for, we can't wait to meet you!

    We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us.

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
What's MoneyClip?

MoneyClip is a digital wallet that provides Canadians with simplified access to the world of Decentralized Finance (DeFi). Building on peer-to-peer payments, MoneyClip is growing into a broad financial application built on the blockchain. At MoneyClip, we're combining unique cutting-edge technology with beautiful products that will change the way we understand and use money in our day-to-day lives.

Your Role: Growth Marketing Manager

You'll be joining our growth marketing team, with the responsibility of accelerating our user growth and engagement by leveraging digital channels. 

The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to create and execute effective acquisition strategies, launch new marketing programs, build relationships with agencies, networks, and optimize ongoing activities. This will be a hands-on tactical role where you'll have ownership and agency to effect valuable business metrics through innovation and experimentation. 

What You'll Do: 

  • Execute and oversee the growth strategy and conversion of our mobile apps and the website
  • Develop and execute acquisition and engagement strategies to deliver marketing campaigns that position the company solutions competitively 
  • Manage the customer journey end-to-end, from top of the funnel marketing campaigns to user activation initiatives
  • Identify new growth opportunities through user research, market research, competitor analysis and data analysis
  • Map conversions metrics and make proposals to improve key KPI's (Acquisition / Activation / Retention / Referral)
  • Measure, optimize and review key metrics to constantly improve funnel performance
  • Review and analyze marketing campaign performance data to identify trends and opportunities, as well as develop best practices to increase efficiency and effectiveness of campaign results.
  • Define paths of success through the creation of best practices within both organic and paid acquisition avenues
  • Demonstrate ability to work at the planning level (generating bold and innovative ideas for growth via paid and owned channels) and the expertise to see them through to execution
  • Provide complete performance reporting and analysis on mobile marketing campaigns and take relevant action on insights gained

What You'll Need:

  • A self-starter mentality: the ability to work independently, self-educate, build, communicate and execute on a growth marketing strategy
  • Data-driven mindset with a strong creative, imaginative flair for out of the box growth ideas and a proven track record of using metrics to develop and iterate campaigns
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to find ways to execute ideas with available resources and/or constraints
  • Understanding or curiosity of Cryptocurrency, DeFi, Web3, or Blockchain 
  • B.A./B.S. degree preferred, or equivalent experience
  • Digital marketing background in ASO, SMM, PPC (ASA/UAC), Email marketing, referral or retention marketing 
  • 4+ years of relevant work experience in mobile marketing or digital marketing with 2+ years of experience in mobile marketing strongly preferred 

Why MoneyClip?

  • Market competitive salary commensurate with experience
  • We're a stable, funded startup with a highly determined and capable leadership team
  • We're still early-stage. If you've always wanted to be a part of something bigger, make a lasting contribution and disrupt the market, this is your opportunity 
  • We are the future. Our product offering connects directly to DeFi (Decentralized Finance) protocols which are powered by Blockchain. We're pushing the envelope and challenging the status quo 
  • We invest deeply in our team members through an annual professional development allowance of $2,500
  • We offer team members a comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, vision) from day one
  • We are a remote-first company with the possibility of a hybrid option in the future
  • We will provide the resources, technology, and tools to ensure you are successful and give you a comfortable budget to set up your home office 
  • We take pride in our startup culture, deeply focus on collaboration and working towards the wider vision of bringing DeFi products to the masses 
  • A minimum of 3 weeks of vacation, generous sick and personal day policies, and offer parental leave top-up
  • A great team, yes really. 

Thank you 

As a thank you for considering applying to the role, click on this link to download the app for $15 cash in your MoneyClip wallet, no strings attached! 

We'd love to hear how you'd make the product and/or marketing better, please feel free to reach out on any of our social channels. 

Want to hear more? Visit our website and learn more!

MoneyClip is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors. MoneyClip is pleased to provide any accommodations you may require during the interview process. To request accommodations, email careers @moneyclip.io.

title: Manager, Marketing
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">The Manager, Marketing is responsible for driving qualified traffic and sales to all channels while building awareness, engagement and growth in the brand, focusing on supporting the print and GM categories. This role is responsible for the development of external marketing campaigns that line up and support the storytelling function, strategic vendor partnerships, and traffic driving promotions, while delivering on KPI’s. _WHAT YOU’LL DO: _ *_Functional_* * Support the Storytelling process as it pertains to developing seasonal omni-channel marketing programs that deliver against marketing goals in the most on-brand, innovative, effective and efficient manner * Lead cross-functional omni development and briefing of seasonal and everyday campaigns to studio partners and external agencies * Collaborate with Marketing Director to develop compelling media campaigns and assets * Measure and analyze program effectiveness through tracking of advertising, promotional analysis, contribution of insights for planning, post-mortems and ROI, in collaboration with cross functional teams and media agency * Own day-to-day relationships with the General Merchandise merchant partners, including managing vendor partnerships * Manage sales promotions for full house business keeping key functional partners updated and aligned on objectives, concept and roll out * Act as marketing lead for Retail support * Provide marketing insights for Weekly Business Review including tracking of competitive activity (omni retail & advertising) and apply observations and learnings to drive Indigo business * Oversee postmortem activities cross-functionally, for each campaign * Ensure the completion of team deliverables and set/adhere to team budgets, as applicable * Act as an advocate for the customer by placing them at the forefront of all design and decision-making processes * Proactively identify and anticipate customer expectations and needs * Embrace and seek out technology that creates high tech and high touch solutions for Indigo’s customers * Challenge the status quo and consistently identify areas for improvement, diagnose issues and working to resolve them *_People_* * Build strong teams by attracting and developing the best talent * Bring out the best in others, empower and constructively stretch talent * Give authentic feedback on performance and potential * Ensure all team members understand where they stand and have clear performance objectives aligned with Indigo and team goals * Collaborate with others to drive flexible and iterative solutions, quickly and easily * Share technical knowledge with others and actively seek to learn from those more knowledgeable than yourself * Help others see the impacts of their efforts and proactively engage other functions to get input * Encourage others to freely share their point of view and be open to feedback * Accountable for the overall engagement, productivity, turnover and bench strength of the team *_Cultural_* * Model Indigo’s beliefs and convey a positive image in everything you do * Celebrate diversity of thought and have an open mindset * Take an active role in fostering a culture of continual learning, taking risks without the fear of making mistakes * Embrace, champion and influence change through your team and/or the organization _WHO YOU ARE: _ * 5 years’ experience in marketing, in a similar orrelated role * Relevant undergraduate degree * Strong ability to see the total organization with an integrated perspective * Strong strategic and creative aptitude * Ability to lead and manage cross functional teams including non-direct reports * Strong analytical skills, both quantitative and qualitative * Project Management skills * Experience developing integrated campaigns (direct, digital and mass) * High attention to detail and strong organizational skills * Excellent written and verbal communication skills * A willingness to take risks and make decisions; creative and innovative approach to problem solving * Service driven with a passion for the Indigo brand * Desire to continuously learn and improve what and how we do * True believer in teamwork and the ability to understand the impact of one’s actions on another team, individual or process * An optimist who supports what is right and helps to fix what is wrong At Indigo, we are committed to our communities, our customers, and each other; together we can make a positive impact. We know that fostering diversity and inclusion brings out your full potential and creates a joyful and welcoming environment for everyone. We are driven to be an equitable employer, which highly values your diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that you, in all your uniqueness, belong at Indigo. We welcome all applicants and encourage applications from individuals who identify as Black, Indigenous, a person of colour, LGBTQ2+ and people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request to individuals who self-identify as having a disability or special need. Please contact Human Resources at 1 (888) 881-3177 (toll free) or Support-HR@indigo.ca if you require an accommodation at any time during the recruitment process. *WELCOME HOME*</section>

title: Brand Manager-Contract
description:
Overview:

PMA Canada is the largest private Sales and Marketing execution partner of fine spirits, wines, beer and coolers in Canada. We represent a number of premium brands in the beverage alcohol industry.   We have delivered strong, uninterrupted sales growth since the Company foundation 40 years ago. We pride ourselves on providing Service Excellence for our Brand Owners, Customers & Consumers.

 

The Brand Manager fosters strong relationships with brand owner partners and trade development to develop the brand vision and goals for Canada. Collaborating closely with the key internal stakeholders in the development and execution of ATL & BTL budgets and plans. The Brand Manager is the go to expert in Marketing/ Brand Management for the brands to achieve annual brand objectives that outpaces category growth.

 

Deliver superior brand performance by enabling saliency and advocacy with the influencers (OP Bartenders, Customers, Consumers and Media where applicable) and lead the charge to recruit new and lapsed consumers working in conjunction with the PMA Marketing and Customer Marketing team, Agencies, the PMA Sales Force and Customers (Retail, On-Premise outlets & chains). This is a contract role.  

Responsibilities:

Key Deliverables:                                        

â€¢             Commercial Results: Brand Depletions (Sales), Market Share & brand ROI (at the level of Can $ income less A&P) beats plan.

â€¢             Brand Owner Engagement: Proactively engages the Brand Owner team and Director, Brand Development to align on annual Brand Plans and Activations within brand guidelines.

o     Develop and establish clear brand communication & activation strategies that drive brand growth, image & equity.

o     Develop activity plans from aligned consumer strategies and provide direction, tools and materials for activation.

â€¢             Ensure effective management of assigned budgets, collaborating with Trade Development Team/Regional Sales.

â€¢             Conduct measurement and evaluation of Above the Line (A.T.L.) and Below the Line (B.T.L) campaigns as needed.

â€¢             Be direct point of contact for assigned suppliers/3rd parties and foster strong relationships

â€¢             Provide monthly/quarterly reporting, performance tracking, A&P reconciliation for assigned brands

â€¢             Measure brand performance in conjunction with supplier KPIs

â€¢             Responsible for maintaining consistency of brand messaging and presentation

â€¢             Collaborate with internal stakeholders to drive achievement of brand plans

â€¢        Other Duties as assigned  

Company Values:

â€¢             Team Work

â€¢             Professionalism

â€¢             Leadership

â€¢             Enthusiasm

â€¢        Creativity  

Behavioral Competncy Requirements:

â€¢   Accountability

â€¢   Transparency

â€¢   Consumer Centricity

â€¢   Inspection of Expected Results

â€¢   Ownership of the Business

â€¢   No Blame Fixing

â€¢   Strategic Thinking

â€¢   A Bias for Action

â€¢   Business Curiosity (eager to dive into the numbers)

â€¢   â€œThumb on the Pulseâ€ of bar scene and lifestyle trends

Management Competncy Requirements:

â€¢             Business Performance Management including Budget and/or P&L experience.

â€¢             Proactive Stakeholder Engagement & Management Approach

â€¢             Analytical and influencing skills with fact based approach.

â€¢             Strong planning and collaboration skills with a flair for project /event management

â€¢             Financial / Business Acumen / Responsible budget management and tracking.

â€¢             Leadership, ability to motivate and inspire others to drive achievement of goals.

â€¢             Sound Judgment & Decision Making with ability to recommend action.

â€¢        Meausurement & Evaluation (ie. Return on Investment analysis.)  

 

                                                     

 

Qualifications:

Functional Competency Requirements:

â€¢ Ability to translate brand positioning and strategy into actionable tactics

â€¢ Consumer & Trade Driven Strategy Development

â€¢ Brand Planning (On-Premise / Retail including recruitment components of brand planning)

â€¢ Strategic Thinking rooted in consumer Insight with bias for action including Annual Brand Plan development and execution with strong understanding of market, category, competitor and consumer trends.

â€¢ Commercial Acumen, ability to prepare a business case and secure buy-in from stakeholders.

â€¢ Analytical and influencing skills with fact based approach.  

Knowledge Competency Requirements:

â€¢ Canadian Beverage Alcohol Industry: Route-to-Market Structure & Compliance and Marketing Regulations

â€¢ LCB & On-Premise Marketing Program Alternatives & Differing Regulations by Jurisdiction

â€¢ Market, Category, Competitive Set & Consumer Trends

â€¢ Understanding of Marketing Disciplines and their respective Intended Impact on Consumer Behavior & Attitudes

â€¢ Canadian Advertising Regulations & Standards

â€¢ Principles of Agency Partner Management

â€¢ Computer Literacy: Microsoft Office (Excel, Power Point, Word, Outlook), Google Docs, Analytical tools and Social Channels

Experience Required:

â€¢ 2 to 3 Yearsâ€™ Experience in marketing, sales and or Event management preferably within Beverage Alcohol or CPG Spaces

â€¢ University Degree in Business with emphasis in Marketing or Sales Management preferable

â€¢ Retail or On Premise experience / in-depth understanding a plus.

The successful candidate will be required to submit proof of full vaccination in accordance with PMAâ€™s Covid-19 Vaccination Policy. Accommodation requests for new hires that are unable to get vaccinated against COVID-19 for a reason related to a protected ground pursuant to the applicable human rights legislation may request accommodation by providing proof of required accommodation.

title: Senior Growth Marketing Manager
description:
Goodfood (TSX:FOOD) is a leading online grocery service in Canada, delivering fresh meal solutions that make it easy for members from coast to coast to enjoy delicious meals at home every week. Goodfood’s mission is to make the impossible come true, from farm to kitchen, by enabling members to do their weekly meal planning and grocery shopping in minutes. Goodfood members get access to a unique selection of products online as well as exclusive pricing made possible by its world-class direct-to-consumer fulfillment eco-system. Goodfood currently has more than 350,000 active subscribers and over 4,000 dedicated and passionate employees across Canada.

As our Senior Growth Manager, you will be responsible for leading the end-to-end paid social, display, online video campaigns execution and optimization as well as lead our affiliate program and other growth initiatives. Reporting to the VP of Growth Marketing, you will drive customer acquisition for both our meal kit and new 30-minute grocery delivery offerings, as well as lead a growing team.

You will be called upon to work cross-functionally with the CRM team, operations team, and technology team to bring new products and services to Canadians. The ideal candidate is an experienced leader and a data-savvy performance oriented individual who has a passion for digital media, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and who will be passionate about finding new ways to grow our brand.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead the development of Goodfood’s paid social, search, and online video strategy across all ad platforms, allocate and optimize our multi-million dollars monthly media budget across platforms and funnel stages to reach acquisition targets
  • Identify and lead alternative growth initiatives such as our affiliate program or door-to-door sales activities and continuously think of new ways to attract customers, collaborating with other functions of the business and new partners as needed
  • Evaluate creative performance by campaign type and channel with your team and work with internal and external partners to continuously improve creative performance
  • Lead a team of paid specialists, strategists, and analysts and facilitate their professional development
  • Work cross-functionally with the CRM team to facilitate their multi-channel journeys for known members in order to maximize LTV
  • Work with the marketing technology team and digital product team to build and maintain tracking, feeds, AdTech products, and improve landing page experience and relevance
  • Keep track of latest industry trends, best practices and competitors and translate into concrete ideas for Goodfood

DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Experience with managing a high performing team in performance marketing for a high-growth D2C or e-commerce brand.
  • 5-10 years of experience in a digital marketing role, with hands on experience in executing paid social, search, display, and online video campaigns
  • At least 3 years of experience managing a team
  • Experience working in tandem with multiple agencies
  • Strong analytical and data interpretation skills and experience working with web analytics platforms such as Google Analytics & Data Studio, hands on experience with Google Tag Manager an asset
  • Strong planning, forecasting, and budget management skills
  • Knowledge of the AdTech landscape, experience negotiating technology contracts and media buys an asset
  • Proven track record of executing large scale campaigns and managing >$1M dollar monthly budgets across multiple channels
  • Track record of launching innovative growth strategies
  • Experience in conversion rate optimization and working with digital product teams an asset
  • Customer-centric mindset, great attention to detail, great communications skills, willingness to adapt to rapid change, and ability to prioritize

Why Goodfood?

Our team strives to give our members a world class customer experience. We believe in being ambassadors of the brand to make the impossible come true from farm to table!

What we have to offer our employees:

  • Protective gear and COVID-19 measures to keep you safe;
  • Competitive group insurance plan;
  • Free groceries every week;
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan;
  • Employee Stock option program;
  • Goodfood credit;
  • Annual fitness credit;
  • Personal No Questions Asked days;

title: Jr. Software Product Analyst - Sales
description:
â€œPBS is the fastest growing â€œAll Inclusive Business Platformâ€ vendor in North America and weâ€™ve only just begun! â€œ 

The Opportunity:

We are changing the way people buy and service cars one dealership at a time. In business for over 30 years, PBS is the third largest DMS (Dealership Management System) provider to the North American retail automotive industry. Each month we welcome hundreds of new users to our software platform, and we need your help.

We are unique in the industry because we view our customers as business partners, technology innovators, and friends. Our software can run all aspects of an automotive dealership with sales, service, inventory management, and accounting modules.

And that's where you come into the picture. While specific roles are posted, PBS is always open to pivoting with quality people and adding to the team based on your skills and the needs of our customers. After you join the team, we will continue the process of moving you into new roles based on your talents, growth, and interests.

 

The Role:

As a Jr Software Product Analyst (Sales module) you will be working within the Development department and will be responsible for problem management, quality assurance testing, documenting and participating in the full development lifecycle of new and existing software features and services for the Sales module of our software.

 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Manage multiple tasks at once, maintaining exceptional quality
  • Collaborate with team members to plan and design new features
  • Investigate, replicate and escalate problems and bugs
  • Execute test procedures on bugs and new features
  • Review requirements analysis
  • Create new product documentation
  • Participate in team meetings and SCRUM
  • Minimum one Development-defined onsite engagement per year

 

â€‹Qualifications:

  • University degree; or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • 1 years QA and/or industry experience
  • Advanced Microsoft Office knowledge
  • Experience with Agile software development, MySQL and with bug tracking tools will be a definitive asset
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively in both a team atmosphere and independently
  • Exceptional attention to detail, outstanding prioritization and organizational skills, including strong project management skills
  • Strong problem-solving skills.  Willing to dive into difficult technical issues
  • Flexible, fast learner who thrives in a constantly changing work environment
  • Exceptional time management skills

 

What we offer:

  • Internal promotion and growth opportunities
  • An education department dedicated to helping you with professional and personal development
  • The opportunity to travel
  • Access to an onsite gym at some locations and/or corporate membership to Goodlife
  • Free parking
  • Staff events
  • Bonus for product certification up to $4,800 per year
  • Great referral bonus
  • Staff discounts with GM, Dell, and more

 

PBS Systems is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Disability Assistance (Requests on your application status will not receive replies.)

PBS Systems is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including any job seeker with a disability. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to recruitment@pbssystems.com. In your email please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting and the Job Title of the position for which you are applying.

JOIN A WINNING TEAM AT PBS Systems

At PBS Systems we thrive on inspiring pride among our team members and envy among our competitors.

Our culture rests on providing opportunity and challenge for our team members while encouraging healthy work-life balance.

To keep growing and building on our success we look for like-minded individuals to join our team.

Bring your passion, energy and experience.

We will give you the training, support and encouragement to succeed.
