title: Global Marketing Manager: Energy, Resources & Industrials - Deloitte Global (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada 
All Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Edmonton; London; Markham; Mississauga; Montreal; Ottawa; Vancouver; Vaughan 

 

 

Our Purpose

 

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

  • By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
  • Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
  • Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness. 
  • Experience a firm where wellness matters.
  • Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
  • Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.

 

Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with premier thought leaders in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?

 

What will your typical day look like?

 

The Global Clients and Industries (GC&I) team within Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited (DTTL) is responsible for driving growth and alignment within the Deloitte member firm network to deliver a consistent experience and the very best of Deloitte across the network to our Global Crown Jewel/Global Strategic (GCJ/GS) clients. The goal is to serve our GCJ/GS clients with quality and distinction and make a measurable, tangible, and attributable impact.

 

GC&I Marketing and Communications directs, manages, and coordinates high impact, global marketing campaigns to deliver on the sector/industry, business, and member firms marketing strategies to promote solutions/services, business, and industry insights, and create a unique client experience. These multifaceted marketing campaigns are designed to enhance Deloitte brand eminence, reaching a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders, including clients, media, government, non-government organizations, industry influencers, and the internal Deloitte network.


An exciting opportunity exists to join the Global Energy, Resources & Industrials Industry group (ER&I). As the Global Marketing Manager, ER&I you will develop and execute integrated marketing and communication plans drawing upon all elements of the marketing mix/communications channels. Specifically:

 

  • Work with Energy, Resources & Industrials Marketing Leader to consult and collaborate with all stakeholders i.e., Global Industry Leader/Global Sector Leaders, Businesses and Member Firm leaders to clearly define Marketing Campaign objectives and deliver expected results.
  • Manage the marketing strategy and campaign for the Industrial Products and Construction sector.
  • Collaborate with member firm (MF) marketers to support the development and execution of the global marketing strategy and campaigns e.g., amplification of MF content/supporting research and distribution of content to clients through member firm CRM systems.
  • Assist with third party relationships in collaboration with industry/sector teams and the Industry Marketing Leaders (e.g., key industry associations/partners, agencies used for design/development of content, event and conference organizers for sponsorships and profiling). 
  • Assess needs, write, edit, produce, and manage distribution of internal and external marketing content for the campaigns; leverage internal resources (e.g., GC&I Marketing Services team, Green Dot Agency, CoRE Creative Services, Global PR, additional internal design studios, internal channel owners, etc.) to effectively execute on the planned campaigns across all channels.
  • Ensure compliance with legal and DTTL brand standards for marketing as appropriate.
  • Manage sector/industry marketing campaign metrics (ROI) and provide input and feedback to help shape delivery and measurement process; adjust plans and tactics based upon collected metrics. 

 
 

 

About the team

 

Deloitte Global Culture:

 

At Deloitte, we expect results. Incredible—tangible—results. And Deloitte Global professionals play a unique role in delivering those results. We reach across disciplines and borders to serve our global organization. We are the engine of Deloitte. We develop and lead global strategies and provide programs and services that unite our network. In Deloitte Global, everyone has an opportunity to lead. We see the importance of your perspective and your ability to create value. We want you to fit in—with an inclusive culture, focus on work-life fit and well-being, and a supportive, connected environment; but we also want you to stand out—with opportunities to have a strategic impact, innovate, and take the risks necessary to make your mark. Deloitte Global supports our talented professionals in answering the question: What impact will you make?

 

Global Clients & Industries provides expertise and knowledge around industries, clients, and markets to win new engagements, retain clients, and increase market share. Using industry insight, a multidisciplinary approach, and cross-border collaboration, we support lead client service professionals and their teams around the world.

 

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

 

You are someone with:

 

  • 5-8 years of experience in marketing and communications
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Power Point and Excel.
  • Strong business acumen and an ability to drive campaign content/approach from the view of the audience.
  • Advanced skills in English, verbal and written.
  • Excellent communication, writing, and editing skills; with an ear for authentic, persuasive language, strong listening skills, and quick understanding of audience and content.
  • Open-minded creativity and imagination; a good eye for compelling visual design.
  • High attention to detail.
  • Strong collaboration skills; team-oriented with ability to manage multiple projects at once.
  • Strong relationship building/relationship management skills and proven influencing skills.
  • Up to 20% travel may be required.
  • Experience in Industrial Products is a plus

 

Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:

  • You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
  • You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
  • You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.


The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities!  Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates that represents the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes candidates from Indigenous communities in support of living our values and our commitments to our Reconciliation Action Plan . We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

 

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Field Marketing Manager - Canada
description:
PURPOSE OF THIS JOB

Translate the National Community and Special Ops strategy to the field in assigned markets. Manage the Field Marketing Specialists and Part time Community Cebadors, and define priorities for each one of the markets.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

· Work closely with the Community Network and Special Operations national teams to implement national strategy

· Work with local Sales team to find new business opportunities, impacting the heart and lifestyle of local consumers, ultimately leading to successful development of the business.

· Implement and uphold a logistical systems for warehousing and infrastructure to ensure the right tools and management are in place to support the local needs, succeeding in premium appearance with the smallest footprint possible.

· In depth understanding of the consumer in various fields across the different regions which forms the basis of local idea generation and execution.

· Management of branded tools being used by Field Marketing Specialists and other employees in assigned markets/regions e.g., Event Vehicles, Event Equipment etc.

· Develop and manage the regional budget with the support of the Field Marketing Director and National Managers.

· Regularly review the environmental impact of the teams marketing activity working with the wider field marketing team to develop a year round plan and new initiatives to keep impact to a minimum, ensuring we leave the places we operate in better than we found them.

· Manage field expenses and general administration (i.e. PTO approvals, payroll, etc.)

· Build smart and mutually beneficial collaborations by working with other brands, organizations and networks that bring added value such as expertise, networks, goods, budget or facilities.

· Coordinate with agencies and specialized companies when outsourcing event logistics.

· Create and support local key events, scenes and marketing opportunities in line with Guayaki brand values that are relevant to the local communities and consumers, in alignment with the Special operations National Team

· Ensure that every consumer experience with the brand is a positive one thanks to love for the detail and premium execution at events and all other field marketing activities.

· Act as a role model to your team and display the Guayaki values with a consistent tone of voice that is motivating and inspiring.

· Source, hire, train and manage a diverse team of Field Marketing Specialist that perfectly fit the field scenes and brand.

· Set regional objectives and clear goals with your Field Marketing Specialist to ensure accountability to their key deliverables and conduct on-going performance evaluations.

· Provide on-going coaching and support to ensure Field Marketing Specialists achieve their deliverables.

· Create new and innovative ideas that bring the brand to life and capitalize on new business opportunities. Tapping into local networks, scenes and partner, based on the knowledge and ownership of your region and the global and national priorities.

· Regularly assess and identify development needs of the Field Marketing Specialist working closely with the Field Senior Manager to help make it happen.

· Identify and nurture key talent within the Guayaki Community network giving them opportunities to live up to their potential. Communicate deeper collaborative opportunities with National Community team or Partnership team when applicable.

· Source, hire, train and manage a diverse team of Part Time Community Cebadors in alignment with National Community strategy.

· Train the regional Guayaki team (including sales) on necessary brand strategies and relevant execution guidelines.

· Oversee Fan Club field operations in your region in alignment with National Community strategy.

· Work with FMS team and with National Community Manger to collect feedback regarding Branded collateral to continuously improve branded materials and merchandise to Brand team.


MINIMUM EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS

· BA Degree in Business, Marketing or related field required

· Minimum 5-7 years of relevant work experience in field marketing and implementing integrated campaigns across multiple locations.

· Knowledge of digital marketing, advertising and event planning

· Ability to multi-task and work effectively with a variety of tasks and business partners (both internal and external partners); must be able to work cross-functionally with internal sales and operations teams to effectively generate, execute and report on marketing programs.

· Ability to interact with various levels of stakeholders and make decisions based on data and insights

· Expert knowledge of marketing planning tools and strategies

· Proven business thinker with solid strategic skills and capacity to understand business from a market, region, P&L, and product perspective.

· Professional team-player, collaborative, and open to feedback

· Strategic, self-motivated, intellectually curious, innovative and resourceful

· Dynamic communicator with great oral and written skills.

· Big picture thinker and adaptable to changing environments

· Detail-oriented, organized and proactive

· Approaches new and different ideas with curiosity and open-mindedness


TRAVEL / PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Travel

Travels 50% in your allocated Region supporting the key markets

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

· Employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear.

· Employee frequently is required to walk and sit.

· Employee is occasionally required to stand and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

· Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus

title: Bilingual Manager, Integrated Marketing
description:
Company Description

Cineplex is synonymous with entertainment. Known as Canada’s largest and most innovative film exhibitor, we’re so much more than movies - operating The Rec Room, Canada’s favourite destination for ‘Eats & Entertainment’ and Playdium, specially designed for teens and families.

At Cineplex, change and disruption are nothing new. Infusing innovation into everything we do has fueled our evolution as a fully-integrated, diversified and growing organization with exciting career opportunities in our locations and corporate functions. Grow with us, and explore roles in operations, food services, hospitality, digital commerce (CineplexStore.com), digital (Cineplex Digital Media) and cinema media (Cineplex Media), consumer loyalty (SCENE), finance, human resources, technology, amusement solutions (Player One Amusement Group), and more.

Proudly recognized as having one of the country’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, we rally behind our values of Teamwork, Innovation and Excellence. 

We are creative, curious and love thinking big. The next evolution of Cineplex starts here, with you. 

Learn more about our businesses through the links below. 

Cineplex | Cineplex Digital Media |  | Cineplex Media | Cineplex Store | Player One Amusement Group | Playdium | The Rec Room | SCENE 

Job Description

Integrated Marketing Manager is responsible for supporting all calendarized programs that integrates cross-functional marketing efforts for Cineplex, Cineplex VIP, The Rec Room and Playdium brands. The role is accountable for development and execution of the Marketing calendar delivering measurable attendance driving and revenue focused marketing programs, pulsed campaigns, and regional amplification.  

Manage themed and timely marketing campaigns, support, and execute cohesive programs with presence across all marketing channels, partnering with creative and media teams, to drive attendance, revenue, and average basket.

Partner and manage the development of holistic marketing campaigns supporting the Entertainment and Prepaid Products businesses that drives revenue and attendance objectives.

Identify regional, and local high impact, attendance driving opportunities and initiatives, and leverage regional marketing toolkits to amplify calendarized programs.

Leverage Cineplex and SCENE databases to gain insights into consumer purchase behaviour to help develop marketing and communication plans to help develop targeted marketing and communication plans, and post-campaign reporting

Support and manage internal and external partners from French adaption, and creative services to media, assisting with ad hoc media relations local support.

Qualifications

  • College Diploma in Marketing or Business Administration
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Business Administration
  • 2 - 4 years of marketing experience. 
  • Ability to follow a proper creative and media brief protocol and oversee budgets
  • Experience developing strategic promotions and marketing communication plans      
  • Experience taking part in and leading cross functional team based projects.
  • Experience in managing a budget and financial planning.
  • Proven experience developing conversion based integrated marketing strategies across the customer journey, including traditional, out of home, experiential and digital touch points.
  • Experience working with creative agencies, managing assets, production, and delivery
  • Experience working with media agencies, managing, and planning activation plans
  • Experience managing and activating sponsorships/partnerships.
  • Experience with program development, and revenue projections, to campaign analysis and reporting on results that support marketing and business objectives.
  • Experience with data and customer segmentation as the basis for discovering actionable insights.
  • Agency experience
  • Strong project management, time management and organizational skills.

Who you are:

  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload while multi-tasking to meet deadlines in a fast-changing environment.
  • Ability to manage and operate comfortably at a tactical level.
  • Ability to influence across and up without reporting line authority.
  • Not afraid to challenge the status quo and conventional wisdom with innovative ideas.
  • Highly energetic team player with a strong attention to detail and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within the Marketing team and cross-functionally with other groups.
  • Analytical thinking, both from a customer experience and business results perspective.
  • Highly collaborative team player.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of budget management.
  • Bilingualism (English and French) required


Additional Information

Inclusion & Diversity:

Cineplex is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable. 

Accessibility

Cineplex is committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit or restrict their access to employment opportunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us at 416-323-6600 or via email at

jobs@cineplex.com

.

Interested applicants, please apply today.

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment’s standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.

No Agency Calls Please

#CB

LANG: EN

title: Manager, Performance & Growth Marketing (Programmatic, Social)
description:
Company Description

As a trusted partner to the world’s leading loyalty programs, Points builds, powers, and grows new ways for members to get and use their favorite loyalty currency. 

More than 1 billion loyalty program members touch our products through brands like Hilton, Air Canada, Lyft, British Airways, United Airlines, Air France-KLM, Chase Bank, Etihad Airways, and many more. Our team of 250 people across 5 global offices works together to build and launch new solutions, solve complex challenges for our partners, and create a one-of-a-kind company culture.

Click here to learn more about Points!

Job Description

Points is looking for a Manager, Performance & Growth Media (Programmatic, Social) to join our team for a permanent position in our downtown Toronto office.

The Manager, Performance & Growth Media will be responsible for paid media buying and marketing activity on multiple worldwide Travel Loyalty Partner accounts supporting Points primary products.

In this growth-focused role, you will be media buying and some planning across existing channels and new media channels, with a focus on Programmatic and social platforms. The Objective is to drive traffic and revenue growth across all Loyalty program Partner portfolios under your management.

Reporting to Senior Manager, Performance Marketing, the person will be responsible for:

  • Prepare MDG campaign media plan, leveraging experience across Partners for optimal channel selection, targeting strategy and maximize overall effectiveness 
  • Media Buying: Hands-on media campaign setup across multiple digital paid media channels (including social, programmatic display and native) to ensure media is delivered on time with high quality, and campaign performance targets are met or exceeded. 
    • Use of first and third-party data and segmentation to reach desired target audiences is an important part of this function.
    • You also will work with agencies (SEM, Affiliate) to share, support and grow performance for your Partners.
    • Frequent monitoring & optimization and post-campaign analysis of campaign media performance to maximize campaign revenue and improve budget efficiency.
  • Ongoing responsibility for identifying growth opportunities across new/existing media channels and targeting tactics for Partners under management.
  • Financial Management: Working with the dedicated media specialist, maintain oversight of day-to-day budget and financial management activity for campaigns across multiple media channels
  • Ongoing communication with internal and external creative and account teams responsible for creation of required media ad units and copy, to align to larger Marketing campaign objectives.
Qualifications

  • 3-4 years hands-on experience with paid digital media channel campaign buying and planning, setup, ongoing optimization, measurement & testing.
    • Candidates should have experience with a selection of programmatic display (preferably Google Digital & Video DV360) and social media platforms. 
    • Some experience with affiliate and Search marketing is a bonus.
    • Experience working with mid-size clients and as a part of media teams in growth mode 
  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field.
  • Experience leveraging first and/or third-party data sets to effectively target media audiences, combined with broader media targeting sets.
  • A demonstrated ability to develop, track and improve key performance metrics, including Return on Ad Spend and CPA optimization with a strong focus on conversion metrics to drive increased campaign ROI.
  • Experience working with campaign budgets, departmental/group budgets, and working with Financial/Accounting teams.
  • Strong attention to detail in overseeing complex projects and time-sensitive deliverables.


Additional Information

The health and safety of Points’ employees, guests and business partners is a very high priority. Our view that maximizing COVID-19 vaccination rates among employees is one very important strategy to lessen the hazard of COVID-19 in our physical workspace. As such, all new Pointsters are required to be fully vaccinated in accordance with their regional guidelines.

Points is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing an accessible recruitment process.

We welcome applications from all qualified individuals and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of gender identity or expression, race, ethnic origin, creed, place of origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, and any other category protected by law. Upon request we will provide accommodation for applicants with disabilities.

All your information will be kept confidential.

title: Marketing Supervisor (Associate Brand Manager)
description:
Refer A Friend

Company Description


At McDonald's, we are committed to being the best, and that starts with finding the best people. We have built a team of extraordinary people from around the world. We are problem solvers, risk takers, innovators, and thought leaders that take our work seriously, but have fun doing it. We challenge ourselves to get smarter and sharper every day, we value personal and professional growth, and believe in rewarding and celebrating our successes.


Job Description


Position title: Marketing Supervisor – Dessert & Value
Department: National Marketing
Position band: Supervisory/Consultant (Global Grade G3)
Reports to: Marketing Manager
Type of position: Full-time

The Opportunity
We currently have an opportunity for a Marketing Supervisor to join our team at the Toronto Corporate Office. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment filled with non-stop action, then this role is for you!

Who you are
You have the ability to build strong relationships and work collaboratively in a team environment with both internal and external parties. You love to solve problems and can think critically to make the right decisions. You have strong organizational and planning skills to move the company forward and make an impact on strategic initiatives. You are a change agent, with strong communication skills who can effectively support our system in a fast paced and agile environment.

What’s in it for you?
This is an unparalleled opportunity to join a winning organization during an exciting time of transformational change. You will gain exposure across all levels of the organization, from your team members to the Executives and Franchisees. You are looking for a company with a winning culture where you can grow in depth and breadth while making a tangible impact on central initiatives. You are looking for an opportunity to build marketing programs for one of the world’s biggest brands.

**This position is a Flex Hybrid Model, requiring 3 days in-office and 2 days remote.**

Principal Accountabilities
In addition to following McDonald’s policies and procedures, principal accountabilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Assist the National Marketing Senior Manager on our Beef, Burgers, Desserts and Value portfolios; leading the cross-functional and external teams (Menu, Merchandising, Supply Chain, Operations, Legal and Quality Assurance, Advertising Agency) on the execution of marketing campaigns, retail promotions and product launches to ensure projects are on strategy, approved by all stakeholders, and within required timelines
  • Strategic lead for advertising campaigns and retail promotions; leading the development of communication briefs and cross-functional briefing presentations and providing strategic feedback on advertising campaigns and retail promotions (merchandising, mass, digital, social, owned assets & media plans)
  • Lead quarterly mailer program from strategy to execution and manage all key stakeholders through the process, including Regional Marketing teams
  • Key point person for agency conversations and responsible for internal review and approval of campaigns and promotions to ensure they adhere to brand standards & legal regulations
  • Work with Consumer and Business Insights teams to understand category opportunities, consumer needs, and identify opportunities to drive sales and visits
  • Marketing lead for Deployment and Restaurant Execution of promotions
  • Responsible for developing communication for the field to ensure proper understanding of marketing promotions and flawless execution; includes developing content and presenting on Restaurant Operations Webcasts, developing content for internal website with promotional information, and utilizing internal communication tools to communicate to the field in a timely manner
  • War Room lead for marketing promotions; required to gather key information from each team on the success of the promotion and facilitate the War Room discussion; provide follow up action items and communication, and facilitate any post-promotion recap required to support future promotions
  • Responsible for the growth of the portfolio through a deep understanding of consumers and the competitive landscape. From a thorough analysis of consumer research, this role will identify strong consumer insights and market trends to deliver impactful Marketing programs and breakthrough product innovation.

Qualifications


  • The experience:
    • 4-5 years of marketing experience in consumer retail or service marketing
    • Ability to work in fast-paced and multi-functional matrix organizations is an asset
    • Digitally savvy with understanding in how to reach consumers in a social world
  • The education: Post-secondary education with a focus on Marketing, Business or related discipline
  • Technical skills: Advanced skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Collaborative and communication skills: Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills and the ability to effectively interface with management, staff, and external partners.
  • Innovative problem-solving skills: Critical thinker and ability to escalate when assistance is needed in a timely manner.
  • Project management experience: Organized with the ability to make critical decisions to execute project activities without error. Detail oriented with the ability to work independently, and with others in the context of a team

Additional Information


McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

title: Entry Level Marketing and Sales Coordinator
description:
We are looking for entry-level Marketing and Sales Coordinator to help with the project for our client. The right candidate will help with marketing events and marketing promotions with clients, customer service, sales training, and sales strategy development!

 

We do offer in-house training to applicants with no sales and marketing experience.

 

We have a diverse team with well-rounded individuals. The environment and energy within the office are contagious. We have a team of hard-working and self-motivated individuals that are able to meet and exceed goals. We have a work hard play hard mentality and those who like challenges receive incentives such as trips, rewards, and special team outings!

 

If you:

*Wish to work in a fun and diverse environment

*Want the opportunity to learn and gain skills 

*Enjoy the ability to move up the ranks based on performance

*Would like the opportunity to travel

*Work well in teams and individually

*Have a competitive entrepreneurial spirit 

*Like to take on challenges and new tasks

*Would like to be fully trained 

 

Please apply with your resume attached. To be qualified for the position, you must be available full-time and be 18 years or older to pass a criminal background check. Thank you and good luck!

title: Pricing Director
description:
Pricing Director


Advert:


People make Sage great. From our colleagues delivering ground-breaking solutions to the customers who use them: people have helped us grow for more than thirty years, and people are driving our future as a great SaaS company. We're writing our next chapter. Be part of it!


At Sage, we recognize that the world of work has rapidly shifted over the last few years, particularly how we work. That is why we have committed to working in a hybrid way going forward. Human connection is an essential ingredient of the 4 principles that make up our Flexible Human Work hybrid framework and we want to be transparent in what that looks like when you join our Sage family. On one hand, our offices will continue to play an important role in our future and serve as a place for spontaneous conversations, connection, collaboration as well as focused time. On the other hand, we have learned to reimagine where and when we work and to unlock that flexibility and innovation for our colleagues offering them the opportunity to work flex across their home, Sage offices or customer sites.


We invite you to join us and help us write our next chapter. Follow us on our social media sites to join in conversations about open positions and company news! #lifeatsage #sagecareers. If you would like support with your application (or require any adjustments) please contact us atcareers@sage.comfor assistance. All qualified applicants will be thoughtfully considered and never discriminated against based on their race, color, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.


Job Description:


Reporting to the VP, Pricing and being a key member of the global pricing team, the Innovation Pricing Director is responsible for: researching & developing new pricing models for Sage; developing and embedding stronger pricing capabilities across Sage; working on key global and local pricing projects – typically with global responsibility for one or more key product sets; and supporting local activities in one or more Sage markets by providing pricing and broader commercial expertise to local management. The role will require close collaboration with finance, product marketing, marketing, sales and channel marketing teams, both at a local and global level.


Key Responsibilities:


Key accountabilities and decision ownership: (8 or 10 max)

• Drive innovation in pricing models and approaches, to support Sage’s ambitions in the digital network space.

• Defines and delivers new pricing recommendations for one or more key product categories and works closely with global and/or local Sales, Product Marketing, Marketing and Finance teams to do so.

• Formulates pricing logic, rules and controls to support the delivery of new pricing recommendations.

• Supports development of strategies to maximize adoption of cloud products, migrate existing customers, and deliver increased revenue per customer.

• Designs and undertakes pricing research projects – with support from external agencies.

• Develops and delivers training sessions on pricing and best practice sharing activities, in order to help raise the quality of pricing decisions at Sage.

• Partners with Finance to provide data, analytics and expertise to support making strategic and tactical pricing decisions on an ongoing basis – including pricing and financial modeling support.

• Partners with Sales, Marketing and Finance to correctly position product portfolio and establish pricing content aligned with product/sales strategy and revenue objectives.

• Evaluates the customers’ requirements to inform new pricing decisions; coordinates with Marketing to ensure customer feedback is incorporated into pricing recommendations through customer research, surveys, focus groups, etc.

• Contributes to monitoring of ongoing competitive (pricing) environment to ensure practices do not adversely impact company reputation or customer satisfaction.


Function:


Performance and Pricing


Country:


Canada


Office Location:


Toronto;Remote


Work Place type


Hybrid

title: Canada/NA Commercial Marketing Manager
description:
Canada/NA Commercial Marketing Manager

Description -

At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. We use ideas to put technology to work for everyone. And we believe that ideas thrive best in a culture of teamwork. That is why everyone - at every level in every function, is encouraged to have original ideas, to express them and to share them. We trust anything can be achieved if you really believe in it, and we will invest in your ideas to change lives and the way people work. This vision is what sets us apart as a company.

We’re looking for a Commercial Marketing Manager (B2B), with a proven track record of executing end-to-end marketing strategies that drive business results.

The ideal candidate has strong skills in digital marketing, with deep knowledge and experience of social marketing, content marketing, events and media. In addition, a strong business acumen to lead data-driven end-to-end marketing, from insights to execution with proven ability to measure ROI.

Core responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the design, development and execution of go-to-market (GTM) marketing plans for customer segments (e.g., B2B, commercial, channel and multicultural markets). This includes advertising, promotional initiatives, events, digital marketing including; search, programmatic, ABM, social media, marketplaces, that will drive B2B/SMB customer alignment and generate demand.
  • Key activities include assessment of customer insights and identification of target segments for products, services or solutions offerings and development of the customer journey, through close partnership with sales, channel partners and customers.
  • Lead the development of marketing strategies and plans of the Personal Systems portfolio in close collaboration with sales, category, global marketing, alliance partners and external agencies.
  • Manage both demand gen and brand building aspects of marketing for Personal Systems.
  • In-depth knowledge of industry or customer segments, offerings/strategy and demand generation and field marketing programs.

Education and Experience Required:

  • BA or BS in Marketing or related field; MBA is plus.
  • +5 years marketing experience.
  • B2B/SMB segment experience required.
  • Industry, sales, channel, reseller, alliance partner (Microsoft, Intel, AMD, etc.) and/or program management experience is a plus.

Knowledge and Skills Required:

  • This role will require you to have a data driven marketing outlook with sound knowledge of Marketing fundamentals.
  • Digital marketing mastery with demonstrable knowledge and experience of social marketing content marketing and media strategic marketing.
  • Strong experience in creative work such as advertising, messaging and campaigns.
  • Experience in managing channel marketing (both online and offline) is ideal.
  • Strong project management skills: stakeholder management, problem solving, digital marketing automation, hyper-targeting, customer profiling/segmentation.
  • Practice in event planning and execution.
  • Experience with digital programmatic, media, and SEM/SEO planning is preferred.
  • Account Base Marketing, Eloqua marketing and lead management knowledge is a plus.
  • Excellent written/oral communications and analytical skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills; ability to manage virtual teams.
  • Passion for technology, and experience working in fast-paced innovation categories.

#LI-POST

Job -

Marketing

Schedule -

Full time

Shift -

No Shift premium (Canada)

Travel -

Relocation -

EEO Tagline - 

HP Inc. is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.

title: Director, Business Development & Communications
description:
Company Description

We’re a creative consultancy. That means we put creativity at the center of all our thinking—be it strategic consulting, design and advertising or product and service design. If you believe in the power of creativity to transform how people think and behave, you’re in the right place.

Job Description

Leo Burnett is looking for a director, Business Development & Communications to work alongside our Executive Leadership Team, in a newly created and integral role. 

This is a role requiring strong business, sales & marketing, negotiation, proposal & presentation development, and people skills to manage the agency growth & profile. It is both New Business Driver and Marketing Leader for the agencies within Leo Burnett Group. This will be achieved through strategic development of agency PR, new business strategy and implementation and new product implementation. It is a fluid through the line role that will work with multiple groups within the agency, including the executive team and with our sister agencies within the Publicis Groupe Country model. Support for this role will come from across the agency teams dependent on each initiative. 

This role reports directly to the President of the Company. 

  • Develop an outbound new business plan by identifying opportunities and markets for Leo Burnett Group companies to pursue   

  • Scout out Client business movement locally and cross border and become a go-to name for RFPs. 

  • In partnership with the President, you will develop relationships with third party new business consultants locally and cross-border to ensure we are receiving opportunities from them that are relevant for our skill-set and experience 

  • Work in collaboration with Leo Burnett Chicago to identify and utilize current best practices, approaches, tools, etc. 

  • Work in collaboration with Canada Country entities from Publicis Groupe to drive both inbound and outbound opportunities for principal and practice brands 

  • Evaluate new opportunities using the Leo Burnett Group framework, to ensure resources focus on the right opportunities for the business and people 

  • Manage and deliver RFPs in collaboration with the President and/or appropriate teams 

  • Participate in new business contract negotiations and involve internal stakeholders 

  • Manage the transition of new business to appropriate team in collaboration with deparment heads 

  • Manage and deliver against company growth targets 

  • Negotiate to secure the best deal for our business  

  • Help launch new products to market both with external communications (paid, owned and earned) and in collaboration with the key departments involved in the specific product 

  • Drive the profile of the organization and key leadership individuals through owned & earned media avenues across key markets 

Qualifications

  • Have a passion and experience with creativity in all forms (branding & advertising, user experience & product design) 

  • Experience in driving the profile of a business through paid, owned and earned communications 

  • Strong communications, resourcefulness and organization/project management skills 

  • Proven ability to successfully work with multiple stakeholders and competing priorities 

  • Excellent interpersonal skills and EQ.  

  • Strategic thinker, and can see beyond the trees. 

  • Strong negotiation skills 

  • Charisma and energy to drive important initiatives through the business 

  • Embodies our Leo Burnett Values including our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 



Additional Information

Leo Burnett Toronto is an equal opportunity employer with a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Drawing on valuable perspectives and insights from our unique workforce allows us to continue sharing our creativity with the world. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and will provide appropriate accommodation for candidates with disabilities or accessibility needs throughout the recruitment process, upon request. Please contact our recruiter for any questions, accommodations or specific requests.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
GameDriver is looking to hire a full-time Product Marketing Manager to build our brand and increase our exposure in the video game, AR and VR industries. Are you a strong marketer with experience in software, test automation and/or gaming? Are you excited about introducing new tools for developers in the fastest growing technologies? Can you build relationships with, and connections to, key players in these software segments? Are you looking for a unique opportunity with a fast-growing software test automation startup? Would you like to work from home? If so, please read on!

This remote product marketing role earns a competitive salary of $80,000 - $100,000 (CDN) /year, depending on experience. We provide great benefits and perks, including an extended benefits plan, stock options, and flexible hours with unmetered PTO. If this sounds like the right opportunity to leverage your tech industry communications and management skills, apply today!


ABOUT GAMEDRIVER

Founded in the San Francisco Bay area in 2018, GameDriver's mission is to bring test automation capabilities to the video game industry, including 2D, 3D, VR, and AR experiences across PC, mobile, console, and standalone VR platforms. We believe that the best way to improve quality is through better testing. The only way to consistently improve testing is to automate as much as possible. We deliver the only solution in the industry that provides cross-platform testing using a standard set of tools. Unlike other automation techniques, GameDriver works from within the game.

We are a VC-backed software startup, so our company tends to attract a certain kind of employee. It's important that we hire the right people, so we approach hiring in the same way that we approach our business. Through innovative thinking, we create a fulfilling work experience that enriches the lives of our employees!


A DAY IN THE LIFE OF THE PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER

As our Product Marketing Manager, your primary mission is to spread the word about GameDriver and our business value proposition, while working efficiently to put us in front of the right people at the right time. You are a charismatic, sociable person who can effectively develop relationships with influencers, podcasters, and media in the video gaming, AR, and VR industries. You will seek out and attend relevant game industry events, such as online and in-person conferences, where you will engage potential partners (console manufacturers, game engine developers and complementary software companies), industry influencers and customers (major and independent game studios, and enterprises).

In collaboration with our other departments, you create messages for our partners that fit their individual personas and platforms while accurately representing GameDriver. You coordinate with public relations service providers, advertising agencies, and content producers to help develop our image and spread our name into the game and immersive experiences spaces. You take pride in building positive relationships to accelerate our business!


QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER

  • Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in marketing, business or communications
  • 5+ years of experience in the software industry
  • 4+ years of experience in product marketing
  • 2+ years of marketing experience in software, SaaS, video games, AR/ VR, or test automation.

Can you develop the voice of a fast-growing software company while building an effective plan to reach target audiences? Are you highly organized and collaborative? Can you effectively manage a wide range of service providers and agencies across multiple time zones? Do you enjoy working from home? If yes, you might just be perfect for this product marketing position!


WORK SCHEDULE FOR OUR PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER

This role is fully remote so you can work from home on a flexible schedule. Some travel may be required.


ARE YOU READY TO JOIN THE GAMEDRIVER TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this marketing role, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting you!

Location: Remote

title: Development Manager
description:
Location



Toronto - 3381 Steeles Avenue East, Suite 100



Business




As part of Brookfield Asset Management — one of the largest alternative asset managers in the world — we harness our resources to bring a fresh approach, unparalleled creativity, relentless innovation, and sound ESG practices to the planning, development, and management of buildings everywhere. From offices, retail spaces, and logistics facilities to multifamily residences, hospitality establishments, and mixed-use structures — we are reimagining real estate from the ground up.




We see tomorrow, today. At Brookfield Properties, we’re a fully integrated developer so we know what it takes to go from concept to concrete, from blueprint to building. From vision, experience, resources, and ethics, every day we take these ingredients to partner with our communities, collaborating with the places where we work, customizing developments to meet the neighborhoods’ specific needs, and identifying the highest and best use for each property to create unique and lasting places that bring people together. Learn more (https://www.brookfieldproperties.com/en/our-businesses/development.html) .




If you're ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply




Job Description




Your Team


The Development Manager is responsible for managing the short and long term needs of a multi-phase, mixed-use master-planned community in the 905. In coordination with the Director and Production Manager, the Development Manager will oversee all day-to-day tasks of the project to ensure it is staying on schedule and budget. This individual has a strong work ethic and exceptional time management skills, with the ability to set goals, establish timelines, and handle multiple competing objectives with little oversight.The Development Manager is responsible for coordinating, monitoring, and communicating development approvals, this includes: product development, site and phase planning, assessing site servicing, detailed building design and engineering approvals, site construction liaison management, proforma and schedule management and project turnover to respective tenants/owners. This position requires the individual to embrace every aspect of the master planned community including; the vision, architectural direction and lifestyle it will curate and be a passionate advocate to all who are involved in the project (internal/external) to ensure the vision is achieved. This individual will assist the Director by updating presentations on a frequent basis to management to keep all appraised on the project’s progress and to request approvals on subsequent phases.




Your Key Deliverables


Project Management:

+ Invoice coding, budget management, contract control, and other accounting duties to accurately track project phases and respective budgets

+ Schedule management and updating on a weekly basis in Microsoft Project

+ Informed on all planning policies, issues, and information that could alter current or future phase plans

+ Coordinate the design and entitlements of the project phases from massing feasibility stage, concept design, entitlement approvals, construction drawings, permitting, construction and close out

+ Invoice coding, budget management, contract control, and other accounting duties to accurately track project phases and respective budgets

+ Schedule management and updating on a weekly basis in Microsoft Project

+ Informed on all planning policies, issues, and information that could alter current or future phase plans

+ Coordinate the design and entitlements of the project phases from massing feasibility stage, concept design, entitlement approvals, construction drawings, permitting, construction and close out

+ Request pre-consultation meetings with the Town, manage SPA submissions and tracking/resolution of all comments, and clearance of all conditions throughout the process to allow for smooth transitions to building

+ Build relationships and set meetings with approval authorities to resolve concerns in a swift manner

+ Manage the clearance of draft plan of subdivision conditions in coordination with Director of Land (horizontal external works lead), and register the relevant plans to create the development blocks to allow for phased development

+ Manage the design and entitlement process of the project to align with targets outlined in 5-year business plan

+ Assist with updating business plan projections for the project during the annual review in coordination with finance and the real estate analyst

+ Manage vision and design charettes as needed to develop individual phase visions in coordination with relevant team members

+ Work with development, estimating, construction and the consultant team to design the project within the approved budget and in accordance with the project vision.

+ Manage any consultant selection, preparation of requests for proposals and project background packages, circulation and comparisons of proposals to the team to make selections, as needed

+ In coordination with the Production Manager, manage drawing package evolution for the purposes of building permit and tender processes

+ Manage permitting process including meeting with CBO and respective Town staff to ensure alignment in project phasing and approach

+ Manage value engineering of the design in coordination with the Estimator, Production Manager, Construction team (CM) to save costs but maintain project vision

+ Coordinate with the Construction team during preconstruction and construction, providing design input and coordinating consultant responses to any issues that arise

+ Assist with coordinating with Marketing team to support project specific marketing activities prior to launch, including; sales center construction, blacklines development, review of renderings, review of branding material and development of other collateral as needed. Ensure all materials speak to the target market and brand of the project

+ Coordinate with Décor team to review Schedule B’s, select finish packages and review and approve any suite design changes

+ Assist to refine sustainability components of the project, including third party certifications, building upgrades, technology, district energy planning

+ Support any other project related tasks as they arise with confidence and accountability




Stakeholder Focus:

+ Build and maintain strong external relationships with relevant planning, governmental, and approval agencies

+ Receive and respond to inquiries from stakeholders and address concerns in a timely manner

+ Commit to understanding stakeholders and building collaborative internal and external relationships with any partners, customers, and community members

+ Assist in evaluating Architectural and Engineering consultants’ performance to expected results

+ Develop and maintain positive relationships with consultants and contractors






Other Duties:

+ Prepares agendas and necessary collateral in advance of project meetings and presentations, including post meeting minutes, action items, and delegation of follow-up deliverables

+ Ensure site is maintained in a clean and orderly state by conducting monthly site visits and coordinating any upkeep with relevant staff

+ Maintain project digital file system and organize in accordance with Infill department standards




Must Haves

+ Minimum of 5 years experience in development of residential or mixed-use condo projects

+ Post-secondary Degree or Diploma in Architecture, Planning or related field

+ Expertise in reading and understanding drawings, specifications, and construction documents

+ Strong knowledge of the planning, land development and construction process as well as condo market trends

+ Exceptional critical thinking, time management, prioritization, and organizational skills; possesses the ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently

+ High sense of urgency, great attention to detail and able to work independently in accordance with tight timelines

+ Strong verbal and written communication skills across internal and external relationships

+ Comfortable working in cross-functional teams; proven ability to influence and contribute to organizational success across multiple levels

+ Fast learner able to handle fast-paced environment; possess a positive ‘no task is too small’ attitude

+ Knowledge of Microsoft Suite, AutoCAD, Revit, Bluebeam, ProCore, LandDev or other software’s is an asset






Your Opportunity




We are proud to offer our employees what they value most:

+ Competitive compensation

+ Excellent extended health benefits

+ RRSP program

+ Generous tuition assistance program

+ Leadership development and mentorship programs

+ A culture based on our values of Passion, Integrity and Community





We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will accommodate the needs of all qualified applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: Head of Consumer Marketing
description:
Our client is a fast growing healthtech platform that is helping empower thousands of patients to take ownership of their health. They just announced series A funding and are in high growth mode. What's more, they've built an incredible customer base (150k patients) even before introducing marketing. Quite the feat.

As part of their on-going growth, our client is on the hunt for a Head of Consumer Marketing wholoves a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, balancing both high level strategic thinking and brand discipline, while not being afraid to roll up their sleeves and pitch in to make great things happen for our patients.

As a critical member of the Marketing team reporting to the CMO, the Head of Consumer Marketing is responsible for all things related to patient marketing, from driving awareness and adoption of of the platform with our patients, to brand stewardship and creative development, to our external communications strategy with patients and healthcare providers.

About the role:
As Head of Consumer Marketing,You will:
  • Lead the development and execution of our direct-to-consumer patient marketing campaigns
  • Own the strategy and execution across our paid, owned and earned channels
  • Help us continue to evolve and refine our brand identity and messaging
  • Work collaboratively with the B2B and Product Marketing teams to ensure consistency and efficiencies across multiple marketing verticals
  • Lead and grow a team of marketing experts, including content marketing, visual design, interaction design, web development, copywriting and lifecycle marketing
  • Manage external agencies, including creative and paid media agencies, to deliver against our business goals
  • Lead our external communication initiatives
  • Help us deliver our vision of a best in class patient experience by working cross-functionally with our Product and Patient Experience teams
  • Be responsible for delivering on our patient-focused business goals and contributing to the growth of our business
About you:
  • You have a university degree in business or marketing
  • You have 12+ years experience in direct-to-consumer and brand marketing, ideally working with a combination of large, recognizable consumer brands and high growth startups
  • You have 5+ years of people management and know how to attract, develop and motivate top talent to deliver great work and achieve their goals
  • You have an intuitive understanding of brand strategy and marketing campaign planning, including experience managing multiple internal and external stakeholders and collaborators
  • You consider yourself eager, clever, ambitious and deeply curious about our patients and their experience
  • You are highly self-motivated and directed, willing to work under tight timelines and with minimal direction
  • You are highly organized, detail- and deadline-oriented with the capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • You thrive in a collaborative, team-first environment, understanding how to work cross-functionally and create alignment, and knowing how to lead from both the front and the back
  • You have a growth mindset and comfort level operating in fast-moving environments
  • A major plus is direct to consumer and technology industry experience
Reasons you might want to join this growing company:
  • The opportunity to have a direct impact on improving healthcare
  • Competitive salary and benefits, including equity in our fast-growing company
  • A dynamic, passionate and collaborative culture
  • Four weeks paid vacation (that they insist you take)
  • The latest, greatest technology to ensure you can do your job effectively
  • A winning strategy and market potential

title: Gestionnaire Marketing – Collations sucrées / Marketing MGR - Sweet Snacks
description:
Bimbo Canada compte parmi les premiers producteurs et distributeurs de pains et de produits de boulangerie frais emballés en importance. Parmi ses marques, on compte Dempster’s®, Villaggio®, POM®, Bon Matin®, Ben’s®, Healthy Way®, McGavins® et Vachon®. Dempster’s est la première marque nationale et compte parmi les chefs de file dans la catégorie des produits de boulangerie axés sur la santé et le bien-être au Canada. La société exploite 19 boulangeries et emploie environ 4 550 collaborateurs au Canada. Elle poursuit l’objectif de créer de la valeur en étant à la fine pointe de l’innovation en matière de fabrication et de prestation de services dans l’industrie de la boulangerie grâce à l’amélioration de ses processus et de ses services de distribution et à son souci continu d’offrir des pains blancs et de grains entiers, des tortillas, des bagels, des pains de seigle, des brioches et des petits pains haut de gamme

En 2014, ses ventes s’élevaient à 928 millions de dollars. En tant qu’unité d’affaires autonome de Grupo Bimbo, la Bimbo Canada souhaite faire croître ses segments de boulangerie à valeur ajoutée en misant sur la santé et le bien-être tout en se taillant une place dans de nouveaux segments de boulangerie et réseaux de distribution. La société continuera d’accroître sa part de marché et ses marges bénéficiaires au moyen d’investissements dans les catégories de produits à grains entiers et en misant sur la poursuite de ses activités d’innovation dans d’autres catégories de boulangerie et de collation.
Bimbo Canada dessert les principales chaînes d’épicerie, les points de vente au détail et les exploitations de services alimentaires dans l’ensemble du Canada. L’entreprise distribue ses produits de marque dans les segments commerciaux des magasins économiques, grand public et haut de gamme. Elle est la plus importante productrice de la plupart des grandes catégories de boulangerie. Elle fournit également des produits de marque maison aux épiceries et aux services alimentaires.
Résumé des fonctions
Relevant de la Gestionnaire principale, Marketing – Collations sucrées, la personne sélectionnée prendra en charge le processus d’innovation et de commercialisation d’un groupe de marques de collations sucrées par l’entremise des activités commerciales s’y rattachant, tout en s’assurant de saisir et de comprendre les besoins des consommateurs. Avec l’aide d’une Assistante, Gestionnaire, cette personne dirigera et coordonnera toutes les activités de marketing, d’innovation et de commercialisation des produits, et ce, en travaillant quotidiennement en étroite collaboration avec plusieurs acteurs clés multidisciplinaires, internes et externes.

Le titulaire du poste aura comme principales fonctions :
  • Élaborer et à mettre en œuvre une stratégie et des plans marketing pour le lancement d’une marque de collations sucrées afin d’atteindre les objectifs de croissance de l’entreprise, tels que les volumes de vente et les objectifs de profitabilité;
  • Planification stratégique, c'est-à-dire revues des activités, des plans de marketing, des plans de communication
  • Pleine responsabilité et gestion des « P&L » : de la création au respect de l’exécution en magasins;
  • Assurer une communication constante en termes de suivi de rapports financiers et analyses continus (expéditions et consommation);
  • Gestion du budget de publicité et de promotion;
  • Leadership en innovation pour les produits de collations sucrées incluant les recherches consommateurs, identification des opportunités et tendances actuelles, mise en place de stratégie de mise en marché, gestion du processus d’innovation - de l’idéation à la mise en marché et le support marketing et promotionnel s’y rattachant ;
  • Diriger et coordonner la gestion de projet et les relations avec les équipes multidisciplinaires internes du support créatif et avec les agences externes: conception d'emballages, conception / production du matériel promotionnel, recherche, création des programmes promotionnels pour les consommateurs, marketing numérique et gestion des relations publiques;
  • Exécuter, c.-à-d. créer les outils de lancement pour la promotion aux consommateurs et la vente aux clients tout comme les projets en lien avec la rénovation / innovation des produits et des emballages;
  • Gérer les activités quotidiennes marketing et résoudre les différents problèmes avec des acteurs internes clés de toute discipline, notamment: marketing client, comptes majeurs, achats, affaires réglementaires, fichiers maîtres, finances, développement de produits, assurance qualité, ventes, cout de revient, opérations et logistique;
  • Responsable du développement et de l'analyse des rapports du portefeuille de marques nationales concurrentielles, des analyses de marché (Nielsen) et financières (pivots), comprenant la création et présentation des revues d’affaires.

Compétences requises:
  • Un diplôme universitaire de premier cycle en administration des affaires (idéalement avec une spécialisation en marketing); (note : les candidats détenant une formation équivalente, jumelée à une expérience jugée pertinente seront considérés lors du processus de sélection);
  • Minimum trois (3) ans d’expérience dans une position similaire dans le secteur des produits emballés pour la vente au détail, notamment dans le cadre d’un poste occupé en marketing;
  • Solide pensée analytique avec une bonne compréhension du secteur de la vente au détail sur le marché canadien;
  • Grandes aptitudes analytiques et capacités de mettre sur pied des plans stratégiques et des initiatives concrètes;
  • Excellentes compétences en communication et en techniques de priorités; personne énergique et enthousiaste possédant de solides compétences en relations interpersonnelles et étant capable de travailler au sein d’une équipe et de façon autonome;
  • Aptitude démontrée en gestions d’équipes multidisciplinaires, autant internes qu’externe (agences promotionnelles et/ou de publicité);
  • Faire preuve d’un sens de l’urgence et d’une approche pratique, capable d’établir des priorités;
  • Connaissances approfondies en informatique (Excel, Power Point, Word, etc.);
  • Bilinguisme avancé, français et anglais, parlé et écrit;

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bimbo Canada is Canada's largest bakery, operating for more than 100 years. It is a leading producer and distributor of fresh packaged breads and snacks with more than 1,000 products across 18 brands Canadians know and love, like Dempster's®, Stonemill®, Villaggio®, Vachon® and Takis®.  We are proud to feed Canadian families with safe, high-quality products they can trust made by Canadians, for Canadians at 16 bakeries, 15 sales centers and 191 depots across the country.
Bimbo Canada is a wholly owned subsidiary of Grupo Bimbo, the world's largest baking company. Together, they are nourishing a better world with delicious baked goods and snacks by building a sustainable, highly productive and deeply humane company. The company is dedicated to building a diverse workplace that promotes equity and belonging, where all employees can develop and contribute to the transformation of the company, the baking industry and our communities.
For more, visit www.bimbocanada.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram.

Role Summary
Reporting to the Senior Marketing Manager, - Sweet Snacks, the selected candidate will support the innovation and commercialization process of the sweet snack brands group through the related commercial activities, while capturing and understanding consumer needs. With the help of an Assistant, Manager – reporting into them, this person will lead and coordinate all marketing, innovation and product commercialization activities, working daily in close collaboration with several key multidisciplinary, internal and external players.

Roles and Responsibilities
This person will –
• Develop and implement a strategy and marketing plans for the launch of a brand of sweet snacks in order to achieve the company's growth objectives, such as sales volumes and profitability objectives.
• Conduct strategic planning, i.e., activity reviews, marketing plans, communication plans.
• Be responsible and manage a P&L: from creation to compliance with execution in stores.
• Ensure constant communication in terms of monitoring financial reports and ongoing analyzes. (Shipments and consumption)
• Manage the advertising and promotion budget.
• Drive innovation for sweet snack products including consumer research, identification of current opportunities and trends, implementation of marketing strategy, management of the innovation process – from ideation to marketing and related marketing and promotional material.
• Lead and coordinate project management and relationships with internal multidisciplinary creative support teams and with external agencies: packaging design, design/production of promotional materials, research, creation of consumer promotional programs, digital marketing and public relations management.
• Create and manage launch tools for promotion to consumers and sales to customers as well as projects related to the renovation / innovation of products and packaging.
• Manage day-to-day marketing activities and resolve various issues with key internal players from all disciplines including customer marketing, major accounts, purchasing, regulatory affairs, master files, finance, product development, quality assurance, sales, costing, operations and logistics.
• Be responsible for the development and analysis of competitive national brand portfolio reports, market (Nielsen) and financial (pivotal) analyses, including the creation and presentation of business reviews.

The Ideal Candidate
The sought individual person is a results oriented one, with high sense of ownership and autonomy and one who is client focused and values teamwork. This person has a strong sense of urgency, as well as an ability to adapt to unforeseen situations and is able to work under pressure.

Requirements
• An undergraduate university degree in business administration – ideally with a specialization in marketing. (Candidates with equivalent training, combined with experience deemed relevant, will also be considered during the selection process)
• A minimum of three (3) years of experience in a similar position in the retail packaged goods sector, particularly in a marketing position.
• Strong analytical thinker with a good understanding of the retail sector in the Canadian market.
• Strong analytical skills and ability to develop strategic plans and concrete initiatives.
• Excellent communication and prioritization skills; energetic and enthusiastic individual with strong interpersonal skills and ability to work within a team and independently.
• Demonstrated ability to manage multidisciplinary teams, both internal and external (promotional and/or advertising agencies);
• Demonstrate a sense of urgency and a practical approach, able to set priorities.
• Good computer skills (Excel, Power Point, Word, etc.)
• Advanced bilingualism, French and English, spoken and written.
skills: ['Solide pensée analytique avec une bonne compréhension du secteur de la vente au détail sur le marché canadien;', 'Minimum trois (3) ans d’expérience dans une position similaire dans le secteur des produits emballés pour la vente au détail, notamment dans le cadre d’un poste occupé en marketing;', "Responsable du développement et de l'analyse des rapports du portefeuille de marques nationales concurrentielles, des analyses de marché (Nielsen) et financières (pivots), comprenant la création et présentation des revues d’affaires."]

title: Director, Business Development, Marketing and Outreach
description:
Director, Business Development, Marketing and Outreach

Company Overview:

Greensaver is Ontario's leading not-for-profit energy conservation organization. For nearly 30 years, we've protected our environment by helping people, businesses, and utility companies reduce their carbon footprint. Through our efforts, we have helped over 100,000 homeowners, renters, small businesses, and housing providers reduce their energy consumption, overall utility costs, and generally improve their lives. We deliver energy efficiency programs for government agencies, utilities and other clients, serving thousands of individual customers. 

Objective: The Director of Business Development, Marketing and Outreach directs the business development activities of the organization and leads new business development, customer outreach and recruitment and drives new sales business for the company playing a key role in Greensaver’s bottom line. He/she also oversees marketing and communications of the corporation. Both B2B and B2C experience is preferred, as is the ability to think strategically and get results. A positive track record with growing home services, energy efficiency business development and/or dealing with housing providers are all useful experiences.

Job Status: Permanent, Full-Time      

Reports to: President & CEO, Greensaver

Duties of the Director, Business Development, Marketing and Outreach include:

  • Responsible for the overall management of strategic and operational Marketing, Business Development and Sales and Outreach activities, both for the programmatic and the consumer business side
  • Develops and organizes new business development initiatives: initiates engagement with targeted accounts and leads the opportunity development process; develop opportunities from the first lead, until close; personally develops and converts opportunities with senior client and customer executives and leads RFP response processes
  • Manages sales, marketing & outreach for Greensaver services and/or products with a focus on both new business development and sales and outreach for existing clients/business
    • Overall management of sales, marketing and business development activities
    • Marketing and outreach activities designed to attract participants, support program delivery goals and implement corporate strategy
    • Sales management for individual programs to generate planned volume of leads and/or clients
    • Supporting sales and marketing activities of GHES (homeowner retrofits)
    • Oversight of management group which includes: Outreach and Sales Manager, Marketing Manager and Manager, Business Development
  • Works closely with the President & CEO to ensure strategic focus and alignment with organizational growth plans and targets.
  • Provides market feedback to Greensaver’s President & CEO regarding competitive offerings, prospect needs and generates business development ideas; planning and coordinating the implementation of business plans and the penetration of new markets
  • Works closely with peers and senior management to align sales, business development and marketing strategies and solutions: required to align appropriate sales opportunities to meet business and financial objectives and will be expected to know Greensaver customers’ business needs
  • In cooperation with human resources, manages recruitment, performance, training, coaching and development of the business development, outreach and marketing team(s)
  • Creates development plans and growth opportunities for direct reports
  • Directly works with key (current and potential) clients and identifies opportunities to partner with them to grow our business
  • Drives increased revenue and bottom line, in order to achieve Greensaver’s ambitious goals
  • Oversees and manages department budget, focusing on exceeding goals, quality standards and cost efficiencies
  • Enforces company policies consistently and in an equitable manner
  • Performance evaluated through KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and/or Personal Scorecard
  • Other responsibilities and duties, as assigned by the President & CEO

* The President & CEO of Greensaver may amend responsibilities, role and reporting structure, from time to time, in line with changing organizational strategy, structure and roles.

Requirements of the role:

  • Bachelor’s Degree/ MBA in business/ marketing or industry related fields
  • Over 7 years’ experience in a similar role, with demonstrated track record of success
  • Experience with the energy industry, especially energy conservation, utility programs, home services and responding to RFPs is considered a distinct advantage
  • Excellent negotiation and communications skills, with different stakeholders, and a proven track record of successfully acquiring new business, preferably in both B2B and B2C
  • Strategic oversight with a hands-on management approach in daily activities
  • Ability to use MS Office; working knowledge of data analysis, performance/operation metrics, IT/Business infrastructure would all be considered an advantage
  • Outstanding strategic, organizational, team building and leadership abilities
  • Excellent interpersonal, decision-making, delegation, management and problem-solving skills

Compensation:

Compensation consists of Base salary, a performance bonus, determined by Scorecard and KPI achievement, and full company benefits, consisting of regular medical benefits, Greensaver EcoBenefits, generous vacation pay and a corporate RRSP matching plan.

Please send your resume (and Cover Letter) to the Attention of Hajnalka Corbo, Director, Human Resources at hajnalka.corbo@greensaver.org

Please quote Director, Business Development, Marketing and Outreach in the subject line.
