title: SAM Business Development Manager
description:
Job Summary

The ITAM Solutions Consultant’s (SC) is responsible for developing ITAM-related sales opportunities within the allocated sales territory, or customer accounts. ITAM services and deliverables are not all direct revenue-generating, the terms “customer” and “prospect” are expanded to include both revenue and non-revenue generating ITAM activities.

 

The ITAM Solutions Consultant will be a point-of-contact for prospective customers of ITAM services and tools. The SC will prospect, develop, and proactively drive new sales opportunities and support marketing activities for ITAM services and will manage the “pipeline” of prospective customers to assure full utilization of resources and continual expansion of the customer base. The SC will coordinate with other SHI sales personnel to manage ongoing customer relations as they relate to deliverables to assure the customer’s expectations are reasonable, that deliverables are within the capabilities of the organisation, and that ongoing relations with the customer are continually expanding and improving. The SC is also the key owner of customer engagements to assure delivery of services to the customer’s expectations and satisfaction.

 

The ITAM Solutions Consultant will ideally be experienced in selling and promoting ITAM, SAM, Consultancy or Services and can be based either from our Somerset NJ, Austin TX, Los Angeles CA, San Francisco CA, Milton Keynes UK, Paris France offices, or Nationwide from a home office; however, it is expected that this role will require frequent travel both nationally and internationally (50%).

About Us

Founded in 1989, SHI International is an $12 billion global provider of IT solutions and services. SHI currently has 5,000 employees worldwide.

To learn more about SHI International Corp, visit our website: www.shi.com/careers

What SHI Can Offer:

  • World Class Facility includes on site gyms and cafeterias
  • Ongoing opportunities for personal and professional growth and development due to our strong promote from within philosophy
  • Work in an up-beat, creative, and fun environment
  • Benefits including medical, vision, dental, 401K, and flexible spending

Responsibilities

The ITAM Solutions Consultant will:

  • Actively promote the sale and adoption of all ITAM Services including but not limited to Managed, Baseline, Hardware, Process, and Consultancy Services within both the SHI sales team and direct with SHI customers.
  • Work as part of the ITAM sales team provide sales support to the ITAM Solutions Specialists, working as a team to ensure a positive customer experience and sales outcome.
  • Support the allocated sales region/territory/accounts to promote and develop the adoption of ITAM services and ISVP partners.
  • Actively promote the sale and adoption of SHI approved ITAM Select Vendor Program (ISVP) tools within both the SHI sales team and direct with SHI customers.
  • Own the financial number for the allocated sales territory or accounts, it is a requirement to meet or exceed all financial and management targets.
  • Engage and work proactively with ITAM Customer Success to ensure smooth handover of customers as well as supporting the ongoing relationship with our customers.
  • Pursue and manage customer/prospect opportunities by working with the respective SHI Sales representatives.
  • Work with SHI customers and prospects to present and promote ITAM Services and tool opportunities through conference calls, on-line meetings, and face-to-face customer presentations:
  • Create customer proposals and statements of work for ITAM services.
  • Complete responses to RFIs/RFPs/RFQs for ITAM services.
  • Create sales tools and customer-facing documents for postings to MySHI and other internal communication vehicles.
  • Travel for customer facing, department, vendor meetings and ITAM educational seminars or events.
  • Create and manage multi-year sales plans to ensure that all personal and business targets are met or exceeded.
  • Report Pipeline on a specified cadence to the Director - ITAM Sales, accurately forecast future sales and forming sales plans to adapt to constant shifts in the marketplace.
  • Interface with pre-approved and selected ITAM Select Vendor Partners to promote and support their ITAM services and initiatives.
  • Stay current on all changes/updates to product entitlements that could affect ITAM/SAM services; this includes but is not limited to collaborating with the SHI Licensing department, direct communication with vendors/manufacturers, participating in license and ITAM online communities
  • Support all ITAM marketing events and campaigns providing reports and feedback as requested to support the holistic process.
  • Collaborate with SHI’s Services departments to target Service opportunities with ITAM/SAM components.
  • Present and demonstrate Services, tools & ISVP Tools to Customers and SHI Sales.
  • Attend and support SHI events and vendor shows
  • Manage general projects assigned by Director – ITAM Sales.
  • Assist with onboarding and training for new ITAM team members including shadowing and mock calls etc.
  • Assist with the creation of new ITAM Marketing Materials
  • Present ITAM related presentations to customers at SHI Summits
  • The ITAM Solutions Consultant is expected to understand all aspects of the ITAM and Software life-cycle – from licensing to purchasing to deployment to decommissioning. 

Qualifications

  • Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent preferred as well as a minimum of 2 years of experience within the IT Asset Management field
  • The ITAM Solutions Consultant will be experienced is selling and promoting ITAM, SAM, Consultancy or Services

Required Skills

  • Strong entrepreneurial spirit: a desire and willingness to “do whatever it takes”
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent sales & customer relationship skills
  • Good research skills and the ability to manage details
  • Excellent organization and time management skills
  • Ability to stay self-motivated and self-directed
  • Willingness to adapt to changing business and technical priorities
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-performance team environment
  • Strong Active Listening skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Resourceful with ability to adapt quickly to changing environments
  • Strong history of proven ITAM sales experience.
  • Ability to create high-quality documentation with precision
  • Willingness to travel as needed
  • Ability to work with deadlines
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Highly organized and methodical

Certifications Required

The ITAM Solutions Consultant will hold some or all of the following accreditations or similar vendor accreditations; if the accreditations are not currently held the ITAM Solutions Consultant will be required to study and pass a minimum of the five mandatory of the following accreditations within a short period of commencing the role:

  • Mandatory certifications:
  • Complete all LISA Training Modules & pass all Exams
  • ServiceNow Sales Fundamentals
  • Microsoft 365 Fundamentals (MS-900)
  • ITAM Select Vendor Program vendor training as requested
  • Supplemental certifications:
  • Volume License (70-705) 

 

SHI is seeking a well-rounded experienced ITAM SC and therefore we welcome all other relevant skills and experience.

Additional Information

  • FLSA Status: Exempt

Equal Employment Opportunity – M/F/Disability/Protected Veteran Status

 

The estimated pay range for this position in Colorado is $55,000 -$85,000, which includes a base salary bonuses and commissions. The compensation for this position is dependent on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and market location, and therefore will vary from individual to individual. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Benefits may include, but are not limited to, medical, vision, dental, 401K, and flexible spending.

Job Wrapping 1

#LI-Remote

Job Wrapping 2

#SHICANADA

title: Cyber Insurance Marketing Manager
description:
"At Cowbell, our mission is to protect small to medium-sized enterprises by making cyber insurance accessible to all. Join our fast-growing team of diverse and passionate individuals on this mission to reinvent how businesses manage cyber risk and buy cyber insurance.

Cowbell is a fast-growing, next-generation cyber insurance provider, built on cutting-edge technology by a team of seasoned professionals united in their mission to achieve our ambitious goals. We believe in a people-first culture and know that great work isn't done without a phenomenal team, so we make sure to reflect that in our core values, benefits & wellness program. 

In support of increasing demand, we are actively looking for ambitious people, who are not afraid of hard-work, ambiguity and a dash of chaos, to join our team and be part of a growing institution where they can hone their skills and develop new ones in a fun, challenging and dynamic environment.

If that sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Cowbell Cyber is hiring an CyberInsurance Marketing Manager  to join our Marketing Department team. 

The Insurance Marketing Manager should have a strong background in commercial lines, preferably cyber insurance because this role is tasked with supporting and managing the relationship with our top broker partners with marketing support such as content writing and co-branded marketing materials, CE course instruction, and ongoing cyber insurance product training.

What you will do:

  • Produce and Develop Cyber insurance focused co-branded content:broker marketing kits, case studies, etc.
  • Lead CE Courses and Webinars for Cowbell's partner agencies 
  • Be the Cowbell Champion at Industry Conferences with the sales team and drive market awareness
  • Present at client partner office visits representing the marketing team
  • Cross-collaborate with internal departments: sales, underwriting, claims, and marketing teams
  • Manage the ongoing Cowbell Cyber broker relationship at the marketing level
  • Have ability to engage with senior level stakeholders
  • Providing data analytics, research, and pushing forward marketing initiatives in the market for brokers and agents
  • Provide ongoing training support for broker agencies
  • Be passionate about cyber insurance or insurance in general
  • Build broker presentation decks
  • Marketing Administrative Duties where needed

What Cowbell needs from you:

  • 5 years Insurance Experience Required; Cyber Insurance preferred
  • Bachelor's Degree preferred
  • Advanced Technical writing experience
  • Advanced skills in Powerpoint, Google Slides, & Canva
  • Strong people management skills 
  • Must present well both verbally and in writing
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment, that's constantly changing
  • Should be a self-starter and strategic thinker
  • Excellent Project Management Skills 
  • Possess initiative, creativity, and "thinks outside of the box"
  • High energy level with a strong service oriented attitude
  • Great time management skills and be highly organized

What Cowbell brings to the table:

  • We are certified as a Great Place to Work. 
  • Nationwide medical, dental and vision coverage plus life insurance, long term disability and flexible spending accounts.
  • 401K matching. 
  • Employee equity plan for all and wealth enablement plan for select customer facing roles.
  • Comprehensive wellness program including unlimited PTO, monthly wellness day off, subscription to meditation app, lunch and learns, book club, weekly lunch stipends, happy hours and much more.
  • Professional development and the opportunity to learn the ins and outs of cyber insurance, cyber security as well as continuing to build your professional skills in a team environment.

title: Director, Business Development, Marketing and Outreach
description:
Director, Business Development, Marketing and Outreach

Company Overview:

Greensaver is Ontario's leading not-for-profit energy conservation organization. For nearly 30 years, we've protected our environment by helping people, businesses, and utility companies reduce their carbon footprint. Through our efforts, we have helped over 100,000 homeowners, renters, small businesses, and housing providers reduce their energy consumption, overall utility costs, and generally improve their lives. We deliver energy efficiency programs for government agencies, utilities and other clients, serving thousands of individual customers. 

Objective: The Director of Business Development, Marketing and Outreach directs the business development activities of the organization and leads new business development, customer outreach and recruitment and drives new sales business for the company playing a key role in Greensaver’s bottom line. He/she also oversees marketing and communications of the corporation. Both B2B and B2C experience is preferred, as is the ability to think strategically and get results. A positive track record with growing home services, energy efficiency business development and/or dealing with housing providers are all useful experiences.

Job Status: Permanent, Full-Time      

Reports to: President CEO, Greensaver

Duties of the Director, Business Development, Marketing and Outreach include:

  • Responsible for the overall management of strategic and operational Marketing, Business Development and Sales and Outreach activities, both for the programmatic and the consumer business side
  • Develops and organizes new business development initiatives: initiates engagement with targeted accounts and leads the opportunity development process; develop opportunities from the first lead, until close; personally develops and converts opportunities with senior client and customer executives and leads RFP response processes
  • Manages sales, marketing outreach for Greensaver services and/or products with a focus on both new business development and sales and outreach for existing clients/business
    • Overall management of sales, marketing and business development activities
    • Marketing and outreach activities designed to attract participants, support program delivery goals and implement corporate strategy
    • Sales management for individual programs to generate planned volume of leads and/or clients
    • Supporting sales and marketing activities of GHES (homeowner retrofits)
    • Oversight of management group which includes: Outreach and Sales Manager, Marketing Manager and Manager, Business Development
  • Works closely with the President CEO to ensure strategic focus and alignment with organizational growth plans and targets.
  • Provides market feedback to Greensaver’s President CEO regarding competitive offerings, prospect needs and generates business development ideas; planning and coordinating the implementation of business plans and the penetration of new markets
  • Works closely with peers and senior management to align sales, business development and marketing strategies and solutions: required to align appropriate sales opportunities to meet business and financial objectives and will be expected to know Greensaver customers’ business needs
  • In cooperation with human resources, manages recruitment, performance, training, coaching and development of the business development, outreach and marketing team(s)
  • Creates development plans and growth opportunities for direct reports
  • Directly works with key (current and potential) clients and identifies opportunities to partner with them to grow our business
  • Drives increased revenue and bottom line, in order to achieve Greensaver’s ambitious goals
  • Oversees and manages department budget, focusing on exceeding goals, quality standards and cost efficiencies
  • Enforces company policies consistently and in an equitable manner
  • Performance evaluated through KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and/or Personal Scorecard
  • Other responsibilities and duties, as assigned by the President CEO

* The President CEO of Greensaver may amend responsibilities, role and reporting structure, from time to time, in line with changing organizational strategy, structure and roles.

Requirements of the role:

  • Bachelor’s Degree/ MBA in business/ marketing or industry related fields
  • Over 7 years’ experience in a similar role, with demonstrated track record of success
  • Experience with the energy industry, especially energy conservation, utility programs, home services and responding to RFPs is considered a distinct advantage
  • Excellent negotiation and communications skills, with different stakeholders, and a proven track record of successfully acquiring new business, preferably in both B2B and B2C
  • Strategic oversight with a hands-on management approach in daily activities
  • Ability to use MS Office; working knowledge of data analysis, performance/operation metrics, IT/Business infrastructure would all be considered an advantage
  • Outstanding strategic, organizational, team building and leadership abilities
  • Excellent interpersonal, decision-making, delegation, management and problem-solving skills

Compensation:

Compensation consists of Base salary, a performance bonus, determined by Scorecard and KPI achievement, and full company benefits, consisting of regular medical benefits, Greensaver EcoBenefits, generous vacation pay and a corporate RRSP matching plan.

Please send your resume (and Cover Letter) to the Attention of Hajnalka Corbo, Director, Human Resources at hajnalka.corbo@greensaver.org

Please quote Director, Business Development, Marketing and Outreach in the subject line.

title: CSG User Experience Architect/Senior Experience Architect
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Customer Success Group

Job Details

Salesforce Experience Design is a group of passionate designers who build transformational experiences by turning human insights into business impact at Salesforce scale. Playing an integral part in the Customer Success Group, we partner alongside Service, Sales, Marketing, IT, and Human Capital Management Lines of Business across all industry verticals to help customers ignite the full power of Salesforce through a design-centric approach delivering useful, usable and desirable experiences.

Our work environment appeals to self-motivated, flexible team players that have great interpersonal skills and lots of curiosity. We believe in peer relationships rather than hierarchies; in teams rather than lone thinkers. Salesforce is all about an open collaborative approach and we believe it is the key enabler for us to deliver innovative, ground-breaking work. As part of Salesforce’s Customer Success Group (CSG), our designers follow a consultant approach including working with different Salesforce colleagues across various engagements, willingness to travel when required and understanding the value of working on site.

We are looking for a passionate and pragmatic design thinker who is eager to join a fun, collaborative and innovative team. The focus of the role is interactive—web and mobile applications, interactive design and user experience. The Experience Architect serves as the project leader and main point person for Experience Design engagements. They are responsible for leading the experience strategy and establishing and maintaining the highest quality of execution across all work. they will be responsible for the vision for an engagement as well as being able to lead multi-disciplinary project teams. The Experience Architect must always provide team leadership, build positive relationships and cultivate collaboration with the customer.

Responsibilities:
Success will be measured by your contribution and collaboration within the Experience Design group — leading, advising and aligning project teams and customers to build successful outcomes and ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction. Specifically, the areas of focus will be: leading a variety of engagements, actively participating in the Salesforce culture, and continually ensuring your skills and role requirements are met.

Design Leadership:

  • Demonstrate Design-Thinking methods and participate and supply to new methods and offerings
  • Assist with digital strategies and visions and ensure these are communicated effectively
  • Understand and guide research, interaction and visual design across the Salesforce platform, driving towards the highest level of quality and execution
  • Present concepts clearly and support design decisions
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to other designers within the Experience Design group

Client Engagement:

  • Lead changes in project scope, identify potential issues, and adjust when necessary
  • Collaborate with internal team members to structure project work, plan and complete client proposals
  • Identify new business opportunities and be able to connect appropriate people to support
  • Lead and drive key experience design activities throughout a project’s lifecycle including research, workshops, and conducting interviews and synthesizing
  • Multi-task and perform well under pressure in a constantly evolving environment with key stakeholders and teams
  • Build close relationships with customers and key stakeholders and ensure project teams and client understand roles, responsibilities and vision of project

Team Leadership:

  • Lead, coordinate and manage the work of a project team either independently or in conjunction with key project team members
  • Manage and maintain team motivation and morale
  • Identify and resolve or bring up issues within the project team
  • Engage and partner with external clients and other partners when required
  • Support recruitment efforts for teams within the studio across different geographies
  • Collaborate and lead effectively with remote team members
  • Lead a project team of Experience Design colleagues with multidisciplinary backgrounds including visual design, interaction design, information architecture, etc.

Preferred Qualifications & Skills:

  • At least 8-10 years relevant industry experience
  • Relevant degree or professional qualification(s)
  • Proven ability to lead multidisciplinary teams to create impactful customer solutions.
  • Proven track record of building client relationships and being client facing
  • Proven experience designing applications that balance user needs, business requirements, commercial interests and technological constraints
  • Proficient in relevant software packages (Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, UX-related, Prototyping (InVision, Flinto, Marvel, Proto.io), etc.)
  • Well-versed in technology and software development as it relates to design
  • Proactive, self-sufficient and professional, with strong organizational, time management and communication skills
  • Passionate and enthusiastic about delivering design and user experience excellence
  • Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
  • Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time
  • Design consulting background a plus
  • Knowledge or experience using Salesforce products
  • Experience with Microsoft Dynamics, Oracle, SAP or other enterprise software
  • Experience working across a variety of industries, including B2B and B2C

For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $121,600. You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce.com andSalesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.Salesforce.com andSalesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes.Salesforce.com andSalesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement withSalesforce.com or Salesforce.org.

Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Strategy Director (Remote)
description:
We believe that small, collaborative, and cross-functional teams are best equipped to ship the most optimal project outcomes. Within these teams, members of our Strategy group help to bring focus and direction, ensuring the work we produce is supported by principles, delivering on the needs and expectations of both end users and the business.


As Strategy Director, you'll lead teams through research, concepting, and ideation to develop innovative digital solutions based on insights. You’ll guide clients towards new opportunities to strengthen the brand and drive growth across digital channels. Through collaboration, you’ll establish the agency as a trusted partner in defining transformative digital experiences. You’ll stay informed and close to culture and trends, from brand to business model innovation, from startup to enterprise. Your understanding of all things e-commerce, direct-to-consumer, and the unbundling of legacy business will help guide the work you lead and the solutions you present as authentic, insightful, and innovative.


This role is open to remote candidates with preference for Toronto or NYC.


What You’ll Do


  • Define the approach and methodology for your engagements
  • Develop briefs, requirements, project plans, and product roadmaps
  • Guide teams towards a clear understanding of our clients, their business, and objectives
  • Lead and direct teams through the concepting and ideation process
  • Plan and lead research efforts and analyze and distill findings into actionable insights
  • Engage client-side stakeholders through workshops, presentations, reviews, and pitches
  • Manage, lead, recruit, and mentor Strategy team colleagues
  • Work with VP Strategy to continually improve and refine capabilities and approaches
  • Contribute to agency marketing, thought leadership, and events


What You’ll Bring


  • 8+ years experience in the digital agency, startup, or consulting space with 2+ years experience managing and leading teams
  • A strong portfolio demonstrating skill, craft, thinking, and expertise
  • Deep knowledge of digital platforms, devices, and technologies with specific focus on web, mobile, e-commerce, and digital in-store
  • Experience across brand strategy, product strategy, service design, journey mapping, user experience, content strategy, information architecture, and interaction design
  • Experience developing qualitative and quantitative research plans, facilitating studies, and distilling insights
  • Experience engaging clients and leading workshops with senior to C-level level stakeholders
  • Strength in presenting, persuading, and selling through ideas to small and large audiences
  • BA/MBA preferred but not required
  • Ability to work within PST and EST time zone work hours


About Engine Digital


At Engine Digital, we believe modern business is driven by a focus on the customer and built upon exceptional brand experiences, seamless digital commerce, and frictionless services. It is through this lens that we help our clients to harness design as the foundation for differentiation and a driver of growth.


We’re committed to building a diverse team and to operating an inclusive organization that represents the makeup of our community. We do not accept discrimination on the basis of gender, race, ethnicity, citizenship, origin, religion, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, or military status.


No recruiters, agencies, or phone calls please.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Head of Acquisition Growth Marketing
description:
About Teamwork:

Teamwork’s project management platform is designed to ensure that our customer’s business is efficient, organised, profitable and happy! Our purpose is clear - we are on a journey to be the one place for all client services, everywhere. Our relentless customer-focus has been rewarded with thousands of amazing customers all across the globe and millions of users who sign in every day, to trust us with enabling their business. We pride ourselves on creating market leading software, working with outstanding people, and going above and beyond for our customers. Trusted by more than 20,000 teams across 170 countries, Teamwork is in acceleration mode: our purpose is clear - we are on a journey to be the one place for all client services, everywhere.Our people are the reason for our success and our focus as we look to scale and grow. We believe in hiring great people and look to ensure everyone has the best possible experience of work, everyday. Our values inform everything that we do and shape our decision making. We strive to be open and transparent, humble and customer focused. And we thrive on curiosity, getting results and working together relentlessly to deliver excellence. We are a company of action, full of triers and doers: we try things, we make mistakes, and we learn from them. Our personality is unmistakable: we work hard, take joy in our wins and each other's successes and important life events. And we care and support each other when life throws lemons. More than anything we embrace a straightforward approach to getting things done.





The opportunity:


As our Head of Acquisition and Growth Marketing we are looking for an energetic and experienced leader to grow and scale the growth revenue functions of the marketing department at Teamwork. Reporting directly to the CMO, you will set the tone and strategy for our global marketing demand generation, performance marketing, and CRO for both the self-service model as well as sales-assisted. This is a hybrid role for someone who understands and can balance building a sales assisted funnel and product-led team for customer acquisition and conversion. As the leader in acquisition and growth marketing, you will be responsible for developing key KPIs and building a high performing team. You are comfortable working at a fast pace and are equal parts rigorous in modelling accountability, while also coaching and building a team of global marketers.  

  • Set the strategy, plan and manage ongoing resources needed to achieve performance marketing goals and revenue outcomes; this will be a combination of hiring in house talent and outsourced functions
  • Build, lead and coach a team focused on aligning efforts to outcome and ensuring each member is supported and mentored to achieve their potential
  • Build and manage marketing performance dashboard, revenue, and growth experimentation KPIs across the funnel with a breakdown for both our sales assisted and product led journeys 
  • Drive and manage the go-to-market strategy for our new business acquisition, freemium product and self-serve funnel: including website performance, end-to-end demand generation programs, webinars and digital events, lead nurture programs, and affiliate and channel marketing
  • Implement a strong experimentation culture in marketing and partner with our Product Marketing team to drive performance and optimizations across the entire marketing lifecycle: specifically around acquisition, engagement, adoption, and monetization (or website → trial → conversion → expansion) (7/10)
  • Set and manage overall performance marketing budget for customer acquisition and new business. Managing a strong CPL across channels (7/10)
  • Implement ongoing integrated marketing initiatives that drive up demand for our ideal customer profile. Specifically through improving our MQL/PQL pipeline and stronger trial adoption, middle of funnel conversions, and freemium to paid conversions 
  • Manage outsourced agency and contractual partnerships: from freelancers to agencies supporting SEO, CRO, etc. 
  • Partner with Sales leadership and the SDR team to support ongoing optimizations to the hand off and lead qualification process 
  • Partner with Product to run multivariate experiments and share learnings for continuous optimizations; specifically around acquisition, engagement, and monetization


What good looks like:
  • Demonstrable experience as a proven leader in the SaaS Marketing space, with a strong preference for having worked in both product-led growth (self-serve) as well as sales assisted
  • Ability to balance marketing strategy, vision, and tactical execution in a hyper growth environment
  • Exceptional people management and leadership skills with the recognized ability to grow and retain a high performing team - preferably with experience of building global teams, valuing diversity of thinking and experience
  • Direct experience and a thoughtful approach to what Acquisition and Growth Marketing should be like in a growing SaaS environment; including key KPIs and performance metrics 
  • Excellent analytical skills with a clear bias to data driven decision making 
  • Comfortable with project management across multiple teams and work streams
  • Excellent written and presentation skills; extremely detail-oriented and the ability to handle ambiguity and present ideas and results to an executive team
  • Experience working with Marketo and Intercom preferred 
  • Collaborative, humble and comfortable working in a global remote friendly organisation 
  • A degree in Marketing, Communications or related discipline 


We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.



What you can expect:

We are a remote-friendly team, with the option to work out of our Cork HQ campus, Belfast or Boston hubs - or fully remotely. At Teamwork we believe that work is what you do, not where you sit.

You will experience a collaborative and flat culture, where titles are less valued than delivering outcomes that impact and move the dial. We want you to have what you need to hit the ground running, so you will get the best kit to help you do your best work from Day 1. Our onboarding program will give you the opportunity to meet Teamworkers, learn about our market leading product and get under the hood of our Grow and Scale strategy.  

We expect our people to work hard, level up and turn up every day focused on being their best for each other and our customers. In return, you can expect to know what success looks like in your role, and have regular check-ins with your manager. In addition we will work with you to grow your career with Teamwork.

But when all is said and done we want you to have fun and enjoy working with us! We put a lot of effort into having regular social events, a weekly all staff catch up with quizzes and prizes to be won, and an annual staff gathering Grand Council focused on celebrating the wins, planning for success and building connection & collaboration. Strengths that have made us what we are today! But take some time and read more about our story and our values here



Core Benefits and Perks:
  • Employee Share Options (ESOP)- we mean what we say when we say, ‘act like an owner’!
  • Competitive salary & OTE
  • 30 days vacation from Day 1
  • Pension - matching 5% PRSA
  • Health plans and wellbeing programs
  • Give Back program
  • Ministry of Happiness social club
  • Educational resources and generous allowance to support development
  • Inclusive policies - maternity, paternity & parent leave, as well as a focus on flexible working
  • Recognition programs


Teamwork is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.


Requirements:

None

title: Sr. Marketing Manager, Special Markets
description:
Join a team that is changing millions of lives.


Transforming smiles. Transforming lives. Transforming an industry.

 

Align Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ: ALGN), makers of the Invisalign® system, and iTero® intraoral scanners, is the industry leader and innovator in medical devices which focuses on revolutionizing the dental and orthodontic industry. Align Canada opened its first office in the heart of downtown Toronto in 2017 after more than 15 years servicing the Canadian market.   With a trajectory accentuated by accelerated growth and innovation, Align Canada continues to reinforce its consumer presence as the most advanced clear aligner system in the world while building a highly regarded employer brand in Canada, being certified as a Great Place to Work in Canada since 2019.

 

At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the Orthodontic and General Practice dentistry industries with the introduction of the Invisalign system. Globally, iTero intraoral scanning technology has been used in more than 3.6 million restorative scans for crowns, bridges, and implants.

 

We are excited to announce the addition of the new role of Sr. Marketing Manager of Special Markets, that will be responsible for the development and execution of targeted marketing strategies that drive growth of both Invisalign cases and iTero utilization in the DSO (Dental Service Organizations) customer segment.  

With a focus on B2B and B2C conversion, as an experienced marketer, you will lead the development of the strategy through to the execution and management of traditional and digital marketing plans that drive demand across multiple channels that ladder to the Dental Support Organization (DSO) business objectives in support of our brand and customer experience in the professional channel. Reporting to the Director of Retail and Consumer Marketing based in the Canadian headquarters office in downtown Toronto, this customer-centric, business saavy and collaborative marketing professional will serve a critical role to influence and focus cross-functional teams on the right initiatives that will drive business results executing with key DSO customer C-suites and clinical leaders.

 

In this role, you will…  -

  • Manage a range of projects, coordinate activities, work cross-functionally and collaboratively with the North American organization including alignment with business development managers and channel marketing teams to develop programs and strategies.
  • Develop strategies for, build, execute professional engagement programs targeting general dentists, orthodontists, and their teams with the objective of fortifying clinical confidence and deepen customer relationships to facilitate the continued digital adoption evolution
  • Understand customer mindsets/behaviors and key barriers to adoption.  Develop strong relationships with marketing/communications counterparts within DSOs to understand their business
  • Effectively incorporate insights into development of strategic B2B and B2C marketing plans, programs, and communications to grow Align’s DSO channel revenue and market share. Success is measured by case volume growth and performance against forecast.
  • Develop metrics and measure ROI on Corporate Accounts marketing initiatives.  Understand and communicate Corporate Accounts business trends.
  • Lead and collaborate with Align consumer marketing and professional marketing colleagues to share experiences, ideas, and insights to strengthen Align Technologies’ competitive advantage.
  • Represent Corporate Accounts perspectives on platform development, product strategy and launches.
  • Contribute to the Annual Operating Plan by defining strategic initiatives, and lead agencies through to implementation
  • Develop and maintain collaborative relationships with North American counterparts and cross functional internal partners to champion initiatives and ensure adequate support and resourcing to ensure success
  • Update and maintain the marketing department's resource portal and lead DSO event planning and execution
  • Develop and maintain relationships with external agencies/vendors and stakeholders across the NA organization, including sales, marketing, finance, and operations.
  • Take on other special projects or duties as required or assigned

 

In this role, you’ll need …

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or equivalent experience required, preferably in a B2B and/or B2C environment
  • 10+ years of professional marketing experience with a background in marketing management (including messaging, promotions and program) in a B2B industry. Preference will be considered for candidates with pharma, medical device, corporate dental experience is an asset.
  • Strong knowledge of marketing automation demonstrating a clear familiarity with Customer Relationship Management and Content Management System software
  • Solid track record of success working with traditional and digital marketing tools, Salesforce/Pardot preferred
  • Proficiency with MS Office suite including Word, Excel, Outlook, Adobe Photoshop illustrator, InDesign and PowerPoint required.
  • Creative, self-disciplined, and capable of identifying and completing critical tasks independently with a high sense of urgency
  • Proven ability to learn technical product knowledge in a highly complex industry
  • Track record of being a balanced (analytical and creative) strategic thinker who demonstrates strong problem-solving skills, analytical capabilities, project management, business analysis experience (including implementation, tracking, problem resolution and reporting)
  • Superior written, oral and presentation English communication skills, with French/English bilingualism an assetConfident and dynamic personality that is an effective & engaging
  • presenter to audiences of varying sizes and composition (including study clubs, conferences etc.)Legally entitled to work in Canada and travel within Canada and occasionally to the US (about 20% of the time)

 

Sound like a good fit? 

 

Great!   Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested.

 

Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network.     

 

About Align   

   

Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives. Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools, and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics, and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials.    

   

By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the thing’s employees say make Align Technology a great place to work.    

   

We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information.   

 

Global Diversity Statement:

At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time.

 

#LI-JM1

#LI-Hybrid

title: Director, Omnichannel Marketing
description:
About Us:

Numinus Wellness (TSX: NUMI) helps people to heal and be well through the development and delivery of innovative mental health care and access to safe, evidence-based psychedelic-assisted therapies. The Numinus model - including psychedelic production, research, and clinic care - is at the forefront of a transformation aimed at healing rather than managing symptoms for depression, anxiety, trauma, pain and substance use. At Numinus, we are leading the integration of psychedelic-assisted therapies into mainstream clinical practice and building the foundation for a healthier society.


Our North Star

Be the most trusted brand in the psychedelic space.


Our Mission

We are bringing transformative healing to communities through innovative therapies backed by science and scalable operations.


Our Vision

A world where everyone feels connected and whole.


Our Values

  • Be in service to self and others
  • Build something that captures our collective ideals
  • Be dedicated to the art and the science
  • Have courage to do the right thing
  • Be committed to doing our part in the process of Truth and Reconciliation with Indigenous Peoples

Job Summary

Numinus is looking for a Director of Omnichannel Marketing to own the customer journey by developing marketing strategies that drive awareness and growth of the Numinus brand, including clients, clinics, and the communities it fosters. Reporting to the Vice President of Marketing and working cross-functionally, with functions such as product development, clinic operations, practitioner relations and IT, this person will bring their track record of success in consumer, lifestyle and/or health-oriented brands to all marketing activities across channels that include traditional, digital, paid, community, customer journey, content, influencer, brand, partner, affiliate, event, and field. Working closely with agency partners, you’ll be instrumental in identifying, quantifying, and executing opportunities that drive long-term sustainable growth and awareness.


Individual Accountabilities:

  • Drive and deliver end-to-end, client-focused, digital & traditional marketing strategies to accelerate growth, creating client loyalty through relevant content and initiatives.
  • Own and drive the customer journey. Develop and implement the most appropriate course of action to meet client needs, while driving growth and loyalty.
  • Content: drive and deliver engaging content across all Numinus platforms.
  • Community: develop, drive, and deliver the Numinus community through a membership economy lens. Driving growth through relationships with our clients, creating them as lifelong advocates and users of our programs and products.
  • Social: drive and deliver a world-class social media presence that drives best-in-class brand awareness and community across all platforms.
  • CRM: drive and deliver the Numinus salesforce marketing cloud programs to engage and grow our subscribers through personalized and relevant content, driving qualified traffic to clinics and numinus.com.
  • Performance marketing: drive and deliver all performance marketing initiatives to accelerate growth, across all markets.
  • Gather insights on consumer behaviour and provide strategic recommendations on branding, positioning, demand generation and awareness campaigns.
  • Clinic marketing: drive and deliver clinic marketing strategies to attract new clients, build lasting relationships and drive conversion through best-in-class initiatives.
  • Events: drive and deliver events and experiences that inspire our clients, positioning Numinus as the industry leader in collaboration with our communications team.
  • Agencies: drive key agency partners across performance marketing, social, web development, creative to drive brand awareness and growth and establish KPIs and success metrics, holding agencies and internal teams accountable for results.
  • Support clinic operations to drive product and programming experiences online and within clinic locations through a marketing lens.
  • Work cross-functionally with product and operations (and others) teams to lead the day-to-day functions of the department, supporting corporate objectives.
  • Report on and analyze campaign performance and recommend optimization opportunities across all channels.

Key Support Accountabilities:

  • Strong copy editing/short-form writing skills.
  • Analytically inclined, outstanding organizational skills with meticulous attention to detail and strong project management skills.
  • Strong background in developing and carrying out persona-focused and/or industry-specific marketing campaigns.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to work effectively with a geographically dispersed team.
  • Ability to balance multiple projects, prioritize and perform effectively under pressure.





Position Requirements

  • 7+ years senior leadership experience in growth marketing.
  • A track record building consumer/lifestyle and/or health and wellness brands in both B2B and B2C.
  • BA/BS in Marketing, Communications, or related field; or equivalent experience with demonstrated proficiency. MBA is an asset.
  • Experience scaling a North American or global brand.
  • An entrepreneurial mindset with proven success delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
  • The ability to identify trends and turn actions into insights.
  • The ability to present ideas to the executive team.
  • Experience providing team leadership.
  • Strong attention to detail and start-to-finish leadership of campaigns and projects.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience in health, biotech, life sciences and/or technology would be an asset.
  • Experience managing teams.
  • Bilingualism would be an asset.
  • Deep knowledge and appreciation for the psychedelics-assisted space.

title: Senior Marketing Manager
description:
Senior Marketing Manager
We are looking for an ambitious Senior Marketing Manager to be responsible for developing and
overseeing all aspects of our marketing strategy. You will focus on creating, implementing, tracking and
optimizing our digital and print marketing campaigns across various marketing channels including
establishment and maintenance of corporate partnerships.

To be successful as our Senior Marketing Manager, you must be highly self-motivated, proactive, and
have expertise in current marketing tools and strategies in order to execute successful marketing
campaigns inclusive of an eCommerce model. This is a great opportunity to make your mark in a
company full of growth and potential.

Responsibilities:
â— Develop and implement marketing strategy
â— Undertake competitor research and analyses
â— Conduct market research to establish customer trends and habits
â— Establish goals and objectives in order to reach our customers through appropriate marketing
channels (digital and traditional)
â— Create marketing materials to drive brand awareness and engage communities across different
channels including print, web and social media
â— Ensure brand consistency across all channels and work cross functionally
â— Assist with the analysis of marketing data, including campaign results, conversion rates, and
online traffic in order to drive sales and improve future marketing strategies and campaigns
â— Coordinate with agencies to deliver large scale campaigns
â— Build and maintain relationships with new and existing customers through prospecting and
networking
â— Work together with Sales department to devise and monitor promotions and discounts
â— Establish and maintain strategic relationships with businesses and organizations to in stimulate
referrals and awareness

Qualifications:
â— Bachelorâ€™s degree in Marketing or related field is an asset
â— Proven work experience in a similar role (5 years experience)
â— Fluently bilingual (FR and EN)
â— Strong copywriting skills
â— eCommerce and/or Real Estate industry experience is an asset

title: Marketing Manager II
description:
Job Summary:
  • The Marketing Manager, Product, will support the Canadian Wealth & Asset Management retail business in delivering on its growth objectives by executing on the marketing strategies outlined in the annual marketing plan and transforming them into industry-leading marketing solutions.
  • With a strong Client on innovation and customer centricity, this B2B marketing role requires a strong entrepreneurial spirit to enable the individual to own, develop, launch and scale innovative marketing campaigns; drive digitization and improve operational efficiencies to propel the Marketing transformation already underway.
  • This individual will lead and develop best in class customer experiences to elevate the brand, drive customer value and accelerate sales growth.

The Marketing Manager’s mandate is to:
  • Develop integrated marketing plans to help deliver on the firm’s growth objectives.
  • Oversee execution of large complex integrated marketing campaigns and product launches which includes collaborating with multiple internal teams and external agencies.
  • Partner with analytics and media agency to measure and track key performance metrics against targeted outcomes, driving actionable recommendations and insights.
  • Responsible for ensuring our Canadian website content is current, accurate and relevant.
  • Lead the execution and promotion of key publications in the Canadian Retail Investment market.
  • Working with Editorial, Sales and Portfolio Management teams, drive content and strategy development.
Key Accountabilities
Marketing Campaign Planning & Execution
  • Develop integrated marketing plans for each campaign to meet the campaign’s brand awareness and consideration objectives.
  • Meeting key KPIs.
  • Refine creative concepts in partnership with internal stakeholders and external agencies, and ensure strong business alignment.
  • Refine media strategy and ensure media plans align back to business and target audience.
  • Socialize marketing plans with internal partners (digital, investment teams, sales, leadership, legal and compliance) and external partners (agencies, translation, research companies, vendors).
  • Facilitate compliance approvals and French adaptation through translation partners.
  • Lead the design and build of campaign landing pages through disciplined briefing and collaboration with internal digital partners.
  • Develop communications and materials to support the sales enablement process.
  • Execute on all production deliverables with hyper focus on accuracy, timeliness, and process efficiency.
  • Ongoing and thorough measurement of all in-market media to optimize media spend.
Operational Efficiency
  • Support marketing modernization and transformation efforts by implementing processes that unlock efficiencies across the entire Canada marketing organization.
Digitization
  • Seek and implement innovative and automated processes to enable marketing to focus on high value functions.
  • Build and refine digital marketing capabilities that deliver an enhanced experience and are more closely aligned with the needs of customers.
Measurement & Analysis
  • Build a Marketing Dashboard that clearly demonstrates marketing value back to the business.
  • Build discipline within the campaign execution process to measure media performance and to optimize media spend.
  • Isolate and socialize saves from marketing automation and operational efficiency efforts.
Job Requirements (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Competencies):
  • At least 7 - 10 years of progressive experience.
  • Experience working in a global, matrixed organization, with a traded corporation.
  • Creative thinker and strong collaborator that models corporate core values.
  • Excellent influencing skills.
  • Solid project management background with demonstrated ability to deliver with accuracy and timeliness.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree.
  • Advanced degree or certifications a plus.
  • Investment product knowledge is considered an asset.
Key Problems/Challenges:
  • Balancing multiple projects and changing priorities.
  • Accountable for delivering projects on time and on budget.
  • Influencing and negotiating to secure resourcing and, buy-in, in a resource constrained, competitive environment.
  • Managing internal and external resources to achieve targets.
  • Constantly refining marketing tactics to better support the business development effort.
Scope (Dimensions & Organizational Impact):
  • This role requires the incumbent to be largely self-directed, especially as it relates to projects.
  • The role includes leveraging the skills and knowledge of a diverse group of individuals including sales executives, product/marketing management, marketing services resources, senior management, and external consultants.

title: Director, Sales and Marketing (Hybrid)
description:
WHO IS DIAMOND?

We're a strategic, creative and client-focused group of people working hand in hand to solve problems for some really great brands. We love problems above channels. Insights above fads. Ideas that drive tangible results for our clients.

We are one of Canada's largest independent agencies. It's this fact that drives what makes us different from most other agencies. While we have enterprise-sized ambitions we've retained our start-up DNA, which is our tenacity; relentlessly focused on breakthrough ideas and client satisfaction. We're always embracing change; from our clients, the industry and within the four walls of our operation.

Learn more at: experiencediamond.com

OVERVIEW:

The Sales and Marketing team is responsible for driving growth from new clients and marketing Diamond as a top tier agency to the industry.  The team is led by a founding partner, with big ambitions to elevate Diamond as the “go to” shop in Canada. Part of our growth plans include expanding into the US. 

The Sales and Marketing Director will be responsible for collaborating on the sales and marketing strategy, championing the plan within the agency,  and executing with excellence. The Sales and Marketing Director will use their knowledge of the Canadian advertising industry and relationships to achieve the objectives set by the organization.

This position will report to the SVP, Growth and work with a variety of stakeholders across key positions in the agency.  

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Collaborate and build on the existing sales and marketing plan
  • Lead the execution of the Sales and Marketing plan
  • Create and manage the Sales and Marketing Scorecard to track real time performance 
  • Test a variety of tactics to learn high return on investment activities
  • Work with internal departments at the agency, to brief and deliver sales and marketing activities including:  Creative ideas that get international attention, thought leadership content, awards submissions etc.   
  • Ownership of Diamond owned channels (LinkedIn, web, Instagram) and develop and execute a content plan 
  • Represent the company with the SVP of growth at key industry events
  • Write press releases and target key industry trades 
  • Build relationships with industry trades
  • Market research on new categories and entrants coming to the Canadian market 
  • Contribute to building a case study library to better document the agencies work 
  • Lead/Steer/Contribute to RFP responses and submissions
  • Ownership of RFP subscription services to mine potential opportunities 
  • Manage inbound leads that come through the agency
  • Proactively bring new ideas forward that contribute to the success of the Sales and Marketing team

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum of 5 years in the Marketing and Advertising Industry
  • Passionate individual who can motivate teams to deliver  
  • Outgoing personality, infectious enthusiasm for growth
  • Likes to be around people, and networking

TO APPLY:

Are you looking to become a team member in a growing privately-owned marketing agency? Qualified candidates that are in search of a new challenge are encouraged to apply. We truly appreciate everyone's interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. We offer a competitive compensation package with enviable benefits.

title: Junior Ad Operations Coordinator
description:
Company Description

We are on the hunt for a versatile, self-driven, Junior
Ad Operations Coordinator to join our team, to work on our diverse set of web monetization funnels, catering to premium clients and our own web properties.

For this role, you only need a general understanding of social platforms and search products such as Facebook and Google Ads. The training is done “on the job” as we’re acutely aware not a lot of people do what we do!

Job Description

  • Launching paid media campaigns on multiple ad networks following a clearly outlined procedure, which can include things such as ad copywriting and image creation and manipulation. The campaigns are all loaded via our internal media management platform.

  • Analyze data, craft insights, and make recommendations on a daily basis relating to the nature of the content, landing page templates and monetization performance

  • SEM / SEO keyword research to enhance paid traffic funnels

Qualifications

  • Paid digital media buying experience on at least one of the following platforms: Facebook/Instagram, Taboola, Outbrain, Google, Microsoft Ads or Gemini.

  • Fluent in English (spoken/written), comfortable with crafting ads (copy and images)

  • Desire to work in a very fast-paced environment and handle multiple initiatives at one time.

  • Strong analytical abilities and the ability to communicate findings

  • Excitement to learn new platforms and uncover opportunities in new media channels

  • Self-starter mentality with a drive to succeed

  • (preferred but not mandatory) Bachelor’s degree in Business or Marketing with a strong inclination for statistical analysis.

  • (preferred) Bilingual English and French, any European language such as Spanish and German is a major plus.



Additional Information

Psquared bring to the table:

  • Fast-growing list of premium clients and partners, 300% revenues growth in the last 2 years
  • competitive base salary and bonus structure, eligible for employee stock options 
  • Flexible work hours and location. The applicants can be located in Toronto or Montreal, happy to discuss work arrangement for applicants within North America.
  • Health & Dental Plan
  • Flexible vacation plan
  • Working on adding tons of stuff to this list!

The applicants can be located in Toronto or\xa0Montreal, happy to discuss work arrangement for applicants within North America.']

title: Channel Marketing Manager - Canada
description:
Company Description

The Channel Marketing Manager is responsible for the implementation and execution of channel-specific marketing strategies to achieve P&L objectives across Strategic Business Units (SBU’s).  They will be skilled at working on cross-functional teams including SBU’s, Digital/eBusiness, Sales, Marketing Services and Global Brand Management (GBM).

Job Description

Main Responsibilities

Channel Management

  • Collaborate with SBU Product Marketing teams to identify and implement growth initiatives within our current product portfolio as well as expansion areas.
  • Understand SBU P&L objectives and drivers to make sound go-to-market recommendations in order to drive top and bottom lines.
  • Collaborate with Sales, Product Marketing, Marketing Services and GBM in the areas of:
  • Growth initiatives
  • Program development and implementation
  • Research including competitive insights and recommendations
  • Presentations and training delivery on new and existing product
  • Build and maintain channel expertise through field travel, attendance at industry events, competitive analysis and close collaboration with Sales and SBU partners.
  • Partner with SBU’s to develop customer channel plans directly tied to joint business planning shared objectives.
  • Manage a comprehensive ongoing channel situation analysis that monitors sales, margin and volume across key products and customers. Develop improvement action plans to address unexpected challenges.
  • Leverage Business Intelligence to access channel data relating to program/promotional effectiveness and make improvements based on insights.
  • Partner with Sales and SBU’s in the preparation and presentation of results in monthly/quarterly business reviews.
  • Partner with Global Marketing Services to ensure development of 2D, 3D and digital collateral to drive product launches, promotions, key marketing campaigns, programs within channel and customer-specific marketing. Collaborate with planning teams to ensure product availability for planned channel programs and/or product launches

Merchandising

  • Partner with GBM in the design, creation and development of all merchandising programs, displays, and promotional vehicles.
  • Partner with local design agencies to meet specific marketing material design requirements for Canadian channels.  Collaborate with and create communication for Customer Service, Display, Planning and Service teams to seamlessly execute launch, distribution and rollout of all merchandising activities.

 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or a related field is required; MBA is preferred.
  • Minimum of 5 years of Sales and/or Marketing experience is required. experience within the Consumer/Durable Goods industry is preferred
  • Advanced computer skills in Microsoft Office. Adobe Creative Suite is an asset.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence, collaborate and build trust.
  • Demonstrated solid financial acumen, analytical skills and problem-solving ability.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the business and in front of customers.
  • Ability to travel up to 10% of the time.


Additional Information

Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Fortune Brands' GPG is an equal opportunity employer. GPG evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.


Reasonable Accommodations

Fortune Brands' GPG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@moen.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information

title: Marketing Program Manager (REMOTE / HYBRID)
description:
Company Description

At Viral Nation, we're passionate about creating deep customer bonds through personal connections.

We're a global digital innovation group powering the social ecosystem through integrated solutions that align strategy, talent, media, and technology. Viral Nation includes a full-service influencer marketing agency, VN Marketing; creator and athlete-influencer management agencies, VN Talent and VN Sports; and software division, VN Tech.  

As the global leader in influencer marketing, our diverse, multidisciplinary team is proud to fuel growth for the world's leading brands, including Anheuser-Busch, The Coca Cola Company, Disney, Hasbro, Meta Quest, Tencent, Tim Hortons, TJX, and Uber.

Viral Nation is seeking an experienced Marketing Program Manager to fuel growth and expansion for our full-service digital and social agency, VN Marketing. Our perfect match is a data-driven demand orchestrator passionate about producing measurable, repeatable results. With a focus on building and accelerating the sales pipeline, this is an opportunity to make a quantifiable impact while working with an experienced (and fun!) team.

Job Description

What you’ll do

  • Plan, execute and optimize programs and campaigns to drive awareness and generate pipeline for our VN Marketing agency division.
  • Collaborate with marketing leadership and sales to establish go-to-market strategies and determine the most effective programs to meet revenue goals
  • Gather and analyze customer insights and industry data to build successful campaigns that resonate and inspire action
  • Own tactical execution of integrated marketing programs across social media, SEM, display, email, webinars, events, and more
  • Manage projects and campaigns across multiple contributors, including agencies, clients, talent, vendors, partners, and internal teams
  • Monitor and analyze performance with a critical eye for continuous improvement while ensuring compliance with brand guidelines

 

 

Qualifications

Who you are

  • Five years’ proven work experience in marketing program management, preferably in an agency or technology environment
  • Demonstrated ability to take marketing projects and campaigns from concept to completion, including analyzing and reporting results to management
  • Familiarity with leveraging marketing automation, blogging, and social media to generate traffic, convert visitors into leads, and then nurture them into clients
  • Track record of working collaboratively across functional teams to achieve collective business goals
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize in a dynamic work environment, keep stakeholders informed and adhere to deadlines
  • Excellent written and verbal communicator with an acute attention to detail
  • Comfortable working directly with clients, talent, and partners as needed
  • Proactive, adaptable, critical thinking problem solver
  • Familiarity with HubSpot preferred


Additional Information

Viral Nation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in our agency. Viral Nation welcomes applications from people with visible and non-visible disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruiting and selection process.

Viral Nation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in our agency. Viral Nation welcomes applications from people with visible and non-visible disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruiting and selection process.

title: Development Manager
description:
DevelopmentManager
Real Estate Development
Residential Highrise
Toronto, ON


The Development Manager is responsible for all aspects of assigned high-rise, mid-rise and redevelopment or infill residential development projects, including visioning, planning approvals, overall project management leading up to leasing, building permits, and registration/occupancy. Collaborating with other departments, the Development Manager has project-scale budgeting, scheduling, and financial reporting accountabilities.

Development Manager Duties:
  • Manages all aspects of development applications—official plan amendment, zoning by-law amendment, committee of adjustment applications, plan of condominium, etc.—including upfront visioning, preparation of initial submissions, revisions to comments, finalizing any relevant agreements, clearing conditions, and registration.
  • Effectively liaises with consultants, municipal staff, politicians, neighbours, and other external stakeholders in obtaining planning approvals that meet or exceed companies’ objectives, budget and schedule.
  • Reviews and interprets various technical documents—planning, engineering, legal, financial, etc.—to identify concerns and opportunities generally, while specifically managing the consultant team in the preparation, submission, and revision of required reports, agreements, etc.
  • Manages consultants in preparing site and building drawings, as well as accurate statistics to enable iterative analysis that leads to constructive design and programmatic recommendations.
  • Manages financial pro-forma/budget updates and uses other financial tools to evaluate concept plans, product mix, and other programmatic options to help inform both project visioning as well as subsequent development applications and leasing recommendations.
  • Reviews, interprets, and incorporates qualitative and quantitative market research and analysis to understand potential renters, their aspirations, and competing offerings in the market so as to inform product offering, pricing, and demand assumptions.
  • Manages the building permit and registration process for high-rise and medium-density rental projects.
  • Manages, collaboratively with Sales & Marketing and Construction Manager, respectively, in the lead up to leasing launches as well as construction starts, with on-going support provided following those milestones.
  • Interacts with various internal departments and divisions to ensure financial and non-financial inputs and assumptions are current and accurate.
  • Reviews, tracks and reports on overall project budgets and schedules—including cash flow forecasts, variance analysis, partner reporting packages, etc.
  • Manages the preparation of succinct and accurate reports, agendas and minutes for internal, consultant, and/or partner meetings to track project progress as well as on-going responsibilities and deadlines.
  • Keeps current with the specific political, regulatory, and market trends to keep the business informed of potential changes within the development industry.
  • Assist with the monitoring and assessment of planning notices and policy changes that may affect owned properties; and
  • Other duties within the scope, spirit and purpose of the job, as requested by management



Development Manager Requirements:
  • Completion of a Bachelor’s degree in related field (e.g. Planning, Engineering, Architecture) and a minimum of 5-7 years’ experience in Real Estate development. Residential experience is required and retail/commercial experience is an asset.
  • Knowledge of planning policy in other provinces will be considered an asset
  • Effective communicator with demonstrated written and verbal skills (ie. report writing, presentations and meeting facilitation)
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
  • Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proven ability to collaborate and build strong working relationships with other departments and with people at various levels of the organization.
  • Independent proactive self-starter, with the ability to effectively manage various projects simultaneously to meet strict deadlines.
  • Works well in a cross functional team environment and has a positive outlook and attitude.
  • Good time management and organizational skills.
  • Member of CIP, OAA, PMP or LEED AP certification would be an asset

Development Manager Salary:
Market leading compensation, Bonus, Benefits, Education, Project diversity and stability!


Development Manager Similar Job Titles:
VP Development
Vice President Development
Director Development
Senior Director Development
Senior Development Manager
Developer
DevelopmentManager


Interested?
Apply below

Only applicants with the legal right to work in Canada can be considered for this opportunity.
We thank all those who express interest in this opportunity however only those short-listed we be contacted.
