title: Marketing Associate
description:
Passionate about driving the hospitality industry forward? Cloudbeds is looking for a Marketing Associate who has some marketing experience or a Marketing degree and wants to grow their career in this function. This exciting role will work across all marketing functions to gain on-the-job experience and elevate Cloudbedsâ€™ marketing effectiveness. 

Location: Remote - CA
 

What Youâ€™ll Do:

  • The Marketing Associate will be responsible for supporting the global marketing team at Cloudbeds.
  • The candidate will work on a range of projects and initiatives for the department. Examples of projects to be worked on independently include but are not limited to the following: updating the website with new content, posting and sharing content on social media channels, assisting in video content creation and production, crafting messaging and communications for tradeshows and related campaigns, link building and digital PR, and supporting branding initiatives for customers, prospects, and recruitment efforts.
  • Create and run the influencer marketing program
  • Support and manage the Cloudbeds Community program
  • Maintain consistent corporate brand image throughout product lines, promotional
  • materials, and events
  • Ensuring that content such as blog posts and case studies are posted and uploaded to our website with proper images and tags
  • Updating, listening, responding, and carrying out best practices for digital media platforms (currently Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and YouTube)
  • Researching and analyzing new digital and social media trends to monitor the competitive online landscape

Experience & Skills:

  • You have 2-3 years of experience in a Marketing role, ideally in the B2B tech industry.
  • You have a Bachelor's degree, preferably in Sales, Advertising, Marketing, or Business Administration.
  • Strong collaboration skills and the ability to establish and maintain goodwill with clients and employees
  • Excellent verbal, written, facilitation, and presentation skills and are eager to refine further and develop these skills 
  • Self-starter with a demonstrated capability to manage multiple projects, prioritize a variety of tasks, and think on your feet to meet ever-changing needs and deadlines
  • Exceptional organizational skills and meticulous attention to detail
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with quick turnarounds
  • Adept at working cross-functionally, problem-solving, resolving conflicts, and suggesting ways to improve processes
  • Strong understanding of different social media platforms and how to create content to leverage each platform most effectively
  • Proficient in the use of GSuite Office software (email, Notes, Slides, and Sheets); knowledge of design tools like Adobe or Canva or video editing tools for social platforms are a plus
  • Ability to learn new technology systems quickly
  • Results-oriented and team-first attitude
  • Inclination to learn and grow professionally
  • Strong creativity and drive for all things marketing and social media
  • Demonstrated project and/or writing experience required
  • Experience with internet-based research
     

About The Marketing Team:

Cloudbedsâ€™ global marketing is responsible for the growth of Cloudbeds through a data-driven approach. Our team is responsible for demand generation, public and analyst relations, brand and communications, content, and product marketing. We aim to communicate the value of Cloudbeds to global audiences. 

Our company culture supports flexible working schedules with an open Paid Time Away policy and allows all team members to travel and work remotely with great people. If you think you have the skills and passion, weâ€™ll give you the support and opportunity to thrive in your career. If you would like to be considered for the role, we would love to hear from you!
 

Company Awards to Check Out! 

  • Fastest Growing Companies | Inc. 500 (2018 & 2019) 
  • Best Places to Work | Inc Magazine (2017 & 2018)
  • Best Places to Work | HotelTechReport (2018, 2019, 2020, 2021)
  • Best Property Management System | HotelTechReport (2021, 2022)
  • Best Hotel Management Software | HotelTechReport (2022)
  • Start-Ups to Watch | Forbes (2018)
  • Best Startup Employers | Forbes (2020, 2022)
  • Technology Fast 500 | Deloitte (2019, 2020, 2021)
  • Top 100 North America | Red Herring (2020)
  • Connect MIP Award (Technology)

 

Cloudbeds is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that celebrates the diversity in our global team! We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Cloudbeds is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Cloudbeds will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process or perform essential job functions, please contact our HR team by phone at 858-201-7832 or email at accommodations@cloudbeds.com.  

 

 

To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Cloudbeds. Staffing, recruiting agencies, and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit applications, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Cloudbeds does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Cloudbeds employees, or any other company location. Cloudbeds is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
Company Description

For 60 years, Manitoulin Transport has been providing comprehensive transportation and logistics solutions for clients across North America. Our success lies in our innovation and safety, and our dedication to reliable, on-time delivery. So, if you know where you’re headed, we have the training and career development to help you get there.

Job Description

  • Assist in the conceptualization and development of various marketing tactics including advertising, print, email marketing, website, video, SEO, and social media

  • Assist National Account Executives in responding to RFPs and tenders

  • Plan and coordinate special events, conferences, and sponsorships

  • Research and gather information from external and internal sources to fulfill writing tasks

  • Collaborate with marketing and other team members to support brand initiatives

  • Develop communication materials 

  • Prepare reports and analytics to evaluate campaigns to ensure objectives are met

  • Support sales in the preparation and delivery of presentations, business proposals, and other marketing initiatives as required

  • Coordinate with vendors including agencies, publications, printers, and suppliers 

 

Qualifications

  • Degree in communications, marketing, or business

  • 3-5 years experience in digital marketing and communications

  • Strong writing skills

  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines

  • Strong analytical and problem solving abilities

  • Excellent organization skills and attention to detail

  • Dependable, reliable, self-motivated, and goal-oriented

  • Flexible and able to work with individuals of all levels in the organization to meet goals

  • Ability to multitask and prioritize workload

  • Strong computer proficiency (demonstrated experience in PowerPoint, Word, Excel)

  • Adobe Creative Suite and WordPress proficiency an asset 

  • Transportation industry experience an asset



Additional Information

What do we offer to you? 

  • Comprehensive Benefits Program
  • Profit-Sharing Opportunities
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Opportunities for Growth and Advancement

title: Senior Brand Manager
description:
As our senior Brand Manager, you will focus on driving the brand strategies and plans, to deliver volume, revenue, profit and brand equity growth in line with the Canadian brand/category strategies.

 

About the role

Reporting to the Marketing Director, you will:

  • Work with the Marketing Director in the development, ownership, and implementation of the annual brand and product marketing plans and corresponding budgets, taking an active role in the communication of plans
  • Take a lead role in communicating and advocating for local marketing strategic needs with global marketing stakeholders
  • Ensure the organization has an understanding of the great marketing activations and strategies through leading inter-departmental meetings, lunch and learns, and quarterly updates
  • Build strong relationships with cross-functional teams across to ensure effective delivery of projects
  • Lead the Assistant Brand Manager by coaching, mentoring, development opportunities & conducting formal evaluations
  • Assist Marketing Director in new category expansion research, strategy, planning and implementation
  • Lead agency relationships, providing feedback and challenging the status-quo to identify innovative marketing solutions
  • Participate in the development of brand creatives
  • Manage and regularly measure the brand marketing budget, focusing on ROI and improvement spend efficiencies
  • Together with cross functional stakeholders, review market data for relevant insights, observations and recommendations
  • Participate in the planning, development, execution of, and analysis of a marketing research and findings
  • Review internal & external data sources for brand, product and business building opportunities
  • Participate in the design, execution and rollout of key NPD projects to support new business opportunities
  • Support Global Product Managers and local Sr. NPD/Product Manager in the execution of label and packaging design changes for existing products and development for new products
  • Working with key internal stakeholders, lead the development of trade marketing support tools

     

    Who are you?

    You will have a 3-5 years’ experience in Brand and Product Marketing within a Tier 1 FMCG environment. You will also have hands-on experience in the creation and full execution of brand plans, strategy development and managing creative agencies, and in building and executing promotions/partnerships with a consumer and shopper lens.

     

    Your education will include a university degree withing marketing, business equivalent field, and you will have experience with Nielsen and/or other market analytics tools, with Power BI experience considered an asset.

     

    With excellent interpersonal skills and experience working across cross-functional teams, you will utilize your strong strategic and analytic thinking skills to utilize data to support business decisions. With strong communication skills and high attention to detail and an action-oriented mindset, you will have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment utilizing organizational, prioritization and multi-tasking skills.

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
A multinational client is seeking a Growth Marketing Manager who is adept at scaling and growing various digital programs. You will also be responsible to create strategies and expand the client's rapidly growing Resale subscriber base. In this role, you will collaborate with team members and agencies on optimizing existing performance marketing channels as well as to test and scale new channels. 

This is a remote position. We welcome candidates from any location. Resumes are to be submitted in English.

Responsibilities

  • Able to understand the targeted customers, product, and business strategies.
  • Lead the ideation and execution of product changes that drive growth and improved conversion.
  • Own the end-to-end strategy, planning, and execution of our paid social and performance marketing campaigns, referral programs, and customer acquisition via owned channels including app, web, and SEO.
  • Innovate. Continuously test and optimize targeting, bid strategies, creative, and landing page/app experience to drive volume and ROI.
  • Deliver critical reporting and analysis to fuel marketing optimization.
  • Leverage tools and technology to automate campaigns and reporting.
  • Plan and lead cross-functional efforts to take known product optimizations and implement them in other places.

Requirements

  • At least 5 years of digital marketing experience managing campaigns across multiple channels, focused on performance, growth, and/or product marketing.
  • Strong analytical toolkit with advanced skills and an understanding of attribution and how to leverage it to track marketing efforts.
  • Hands-on experience managing performance marketing campaigns across channels (SEO, ASO, Paid Digital, Email marketing, referral marketing) to deliver profitable growth to target and budget.
  • Familiar with current technologies/vendors on what to use to achieve targets.
  • Develop and manage digital marketing dashboards for traffic and user acquisition, conversion performance, spend, and revenue targets.
  • Problem-solver with an orientation toward hypotheses and insights.
  • Excellent project management skills with strong attention to detail.
  • Strong communication skills; able to communicate and present at a senior level as well as cross-functionally.

 

About Hire Digital

Hire Digital is a network of top-performing marketing, technology, and creative talent with clients such as Unilever, Stripe, Shopify, Philips, and Marriott. Through our technology platform, we assemble dedicated talent teams for brands and enable fast-growing startups and enterprises to grow and scale their digital programs with improved ROI and decreased costs.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
THE OPPORTUNITY:

The Marketing Manager, reporting to the President, leads the Marketing team and works closely with the Public Relations and Communications teams. In this role you will support all areas of the business and directly influence every aspect of Crozier’s marketing including strategy & creative development, campaigns, event management, media strategy, and continual improvement.

This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative marketing professional who brings strong knowledge of key marketing elements that drive successful business outcomes and has proven experience in advancing projects from design stage through to measurement. To be successful in this role, you are also a versatile leader, great communicator, and an energetic, organized self-starter.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Lead all marketing project workflows and organize the creation of marketing materials for assigned business units.
  • Partner with Public Relations and Communications teams to formulate and deliver marketing strategies that elevate the Crozier brand, attract talent, and bring best practices across all offices and business units.
  • Implement and support marketing strategic planning initiatives.
  • Collect and analyze data from marketing campaigns to evaluate performance, share findings and make recommendations to multiple stakeholders.
  • Create, edit, and manage copy for a variety of media, including websites, social media, promotional materials, and advertising.
  • Direct the development, distribution, and completion of Crozier website and various projects with creative agencies.
  • Direct social media content strategy and provide feedback on creative, planning, and content calendar.

WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field.
  • Minimum of ten (10) years’ related experience building B2B marketing strategies and campaigns.
  • Experience within the engineering consulting or professional services environment is a definite asset.
  • Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing new methodologies that drive continuous improvement via marketing data collection, analysis, and process enhancement.
  • Excellent organizational, communication, planning, analytical, project management and consulting skills to balance multiple priorities and meet business objectives.
  • Energetic collaborator with the ability to motivate and mobilize a high performing team, including in a virtual environment.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Creative Suite and Google Analytics.
  • Demonstrated experience on social advertising platforms on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram & Twitter.
  • Regular travel between offices required.

WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyers program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family, and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events, and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.

title: Marketing Manager (FT)
description:
Nutraways Enterprises

Marketing Manager

Burnaby, British Columbia
Full-time

About the Job:
Vitasave.ca is looking for a Marketing Manager to join our creative team.

Do you have a passion for strategic marketing, collaboration, leadership, and health and wellness? You will be the leader in promoting Vitasave, our products, and our services. You must show great strengths in management, internal and external communication, be able to analyze and pull marketing data, and take initiative on project implementations. You will work alongside experienced specialists, and a graphic design team, and report to the Marketing Director. If this sounds like you, We welcome your application!

Position Summary: 
  • Planning, developing and directing multiple avenues of marketing strategies to drive sales.
  • Overseeing social media accounts and websites to engage existing customers and establish positive relationships.
  • Able to pull analytical marketing reports to the marketing director whenever the data is requested.
  • Stay up to date on industry trends, regarding new partners, tactics, tools, and trends.
  • The Marketing Manager will work with our brands to form effective marketing plans based on an agreed budget.
  • They will work closely as a team with our internal graphic designers and will create an email, banner, flyer, and poster briefs for them to work from. 
  • They are responsible for scheduling all emails and making sure all banners are uploaded to the website for the current sales.
  • They are responsible for ensuring all aspects of the sale and its functionality are working, online and in-store.
  • They will look at analytics and report on email success rates. 
  • The Marketing Manager will manage campaigns with our external social media agency and ensure all social content is high quality and on-brand. 
  • They will liaise with our Accounting team to ensure all invoices are up to date with suppliers. 
  • Evaluate the established marketing strategy and optimize marketing plans.
  • Lead the marketing team by example, to contribute fully to the achievement of objectives laid out in annual departmental and individual goals.
  • Ability to be self-directed and effective working independently, yet equally comfortable contributing in a global team environment.

 Key Responsibilities: 
  • Maintaining scheduling of sales 3 months in advance.
  • Five years of leadership experience in the business field.
  • Ability to be flexible on a day-to-day basis with task priority.
  • Creating new marketing initiatives through creative marketing processes.
  • Planning, developing and directing multiple avenues of marketing strategies to drive sales
  • Overseeing social media accounts and websites to engage existing customers and establish positive public relations
  • Implementing search engine optimization (SEO) in online media
  • Researching trends and new marketing opportunities, and brainstorming ideas
  • Coordinating and producing financial documents for advertising campaigns, such as budgets, estimates, and contracts
  • Communicating and negotiating with ad agencies, employees, marketing staff, editors, and writers
  • Addressing problems and troubleshooting campaigns
  • Analyzing customer feedback and campaign performance

Email marketing:
  • Creating Basecamp briefs.
  • Uploading, linking, and alt texting, testing, and scheduling in Klaviyo.
  • Creating coupon codes and testing.
  • Accumulating copy for emails using information from our website.
  • Work with developers to update websites to support marketing campaigns and promos.
  • Sale and email analytics are to be recorded at the end of each month.
In-store Marketing:  
  • Educate, and inspire, all store staff about the current sales.
  • Educate staff members via Slack on sales.
  • Collaborate with Store Managers on how to implement marketing sales tactics to store staff. Create target goals and follow up with Store Managers to ensure they are being completed.

Assets:
  • Working knowledge of email scheduling (Klaviyo, Mailchimp, etc).
  • Working knowledge of Shopify.
  • Passion for Google analytics and analytic reporting.
  • Working knowledge of Basecamp, Slack, and Gmail.
  • Interest in health and wellness.

About Nutraways Enterprises

Vitasave.ca is one of Canada’s fastest-growing eCommerce companies in the natural health product industry. Our mission is to make healthy living easy and affordable for everyone.




    About Nutraways Enterprises:

    Vitasave.ca is one of Canada’s fastest growing ecommerce companies in the natural health product industry. Our mission is to make health accessible and affordable for everyone.

title: Director of Marketing - Harvey's
description:
Overview:

Recipe Unlimited Corporation is Canadaâ€™s leading full service restaurant company. Home to such iconic brands as Swiss Chalet, Harveyâ€™s, St.Hubert, The Keg, Montanaâ€™s, Kelseys, Pubs, Bier Markt, East Side Marioâ€™s, Landing Group, New York Fries, the Burgerâ€™s Priest, The Pickle Barrel & Catering, State and Main, Elephant and Castle and Original Joeâ€™s. With this diverse portfolio of restaurants our Home Office Teammates have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of some of the most popular, well-loved brands in Canada. Variety isnâ€™t the only thing we offer â€“ we are passionate about our industry, we celebrate and support diversity of thought, we are innately curious and encourage our Teammates to take ownership. Above all else, we believe in doing the right thing for our people, our communities and our planet.

 

Reporting directly to the Vice President of Marketing, Harveyâ€™s, the Director of Marketing holds shared responsibility for the development and execution of the brand strategy and leads pricing and offer strategies, campaign planning, advertising, ecommerce, CSR initiatives, and new business growth opportunities

 

This includes growing the brand through the building of Brand equity, developing industry-leading programs and content, nurturing Brand loyalty, growing market share, and ultimately driving Corporate and Franchisee profitability.

 

What you will be doing in this role :  

 

  • Leads the development of the annual marketing calendar, working with external agencies, cross-functional partners and direct reports, and the VP of Marketing
  • Responsible for proactive development of programs and campaigns to retain, grow, and acquire key Guest segments, including strategy, concept/offer, pricing/financials, operational considerations, communications support, budget management, and KPIs to measure campaign effectiveness
  • Responsible for developing TV advertising content, and responsible for core team managing all promotion and menu content
  • Leads core menu offering and pricing strategies that contemplates Harveyâ€™s Guest value proposition while driving Franchisee profitability.   Work with Swiss brand team on optimizing offerings for combo locations
  • Oversees the development and management of the brandâ€™s ecommerce platforms (mobile app, ordering website, kiosks, third-party delivery partners) and developing Guest journeys and loyalty, in partnership with central teams and the digital marketing manager
  • Lead and manage a variety of best-in-class Agency and Vendor partners, to achieve Brand objectives.
  • Leads and manages all CSR initiatives, inclusive of brand pillars on sustainability, supporting under-developed hockey, and more.
  • Develops and leads the execution of new business growth opportunities, inclusive but not limited to new daypart and channel growth.
  • Plays a critical role in Brand Insights and Research to track and measure brand equity and brand drivers against key growth segments, overall category share growth and category trends.
  • Lead, inspire, and develop team of fantastic direct reports, following Recipeâ€™s values, leadership competencies, and performance management cycle

 

What we are looking for from you :

 

  • Minimum of 7+ years of Brand Management or Marketing experience
  • Strong knowledge of Advertising best practices and latest trends
  • Experience managing creative production and agencies
  • Experience managing loyalty and an omni-channel marketing environment strongly preferred
  • Strong strategic and creative thinking abilities - able to anticipate future trends and forecast impacts  
  • Strong critical thinking, analytical ability and problem solving skills
  • Demonstrated people management and coaching experience, with the ability to provide challenging and stretching tasks to promote development
  • Effective priority-setter, ability to zero in on the critical tasks that are important  
  • Strong emotional intelligence
  • Excels in variety of communication settings and styles, with an insight to action driven approach
  • Ability to delegate to and influence peers, partners, vendors, and franchisees across different business functions (including Operations, Purchasing, IT, Finance, etc.)
  • An inspirer of people and partners - building positive team culture
  • A drive to be curious, test, and learn!
  • Restaurant experience preferred

 

Whatâ€™s in it for you?:

 

  • Flexible/Hybrid work environment
  • Youâ€™d be joining a close-knit, innovative team of creative and energetic go-getters
  • Youâ€™d be a part of Canadaâ€™s largest full-service restaurant company that leads the industry in size and innovation  
  • 20% associate discount dining card and monthly dining allowance valid at participating Recipe brands
  • A welcoming, fun and safe work environment founded on respect
  • Career advancement opportunities with a company that owns some of Canadaâ€™s most iconic restaurant brands
  • Industry-leading benefits, wellness programs, and total rewards programs



Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.  

 

Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact recruit@recipeunlimited.com.

title: Business Generation & Marketing Manager- Western Canada
description:
Company Description

Do you want to be part of our successful business, supporting the communications function for Turner & Townsend in Canada?  We are looking for a talented Business Generation Manager to support our Growth in Canada

Turner & Townsend is an independent professional services company specializing in project management and consulting across the real estate, infrastructure, and natural resources sectors, with 112 offices in 45 countries. We are industry leaders focused on delivering advanced construction planning solutions, better business outcomes, and enhanced customer experiences to the world’s largest and most notable projects. Advising a prestigious roster of clients across infrastructure, energy, natural resources and real estate, we aim high and deliver exceptional outcomes.

We build projects that increase economic and social mobility, enable new technology and innovation, and improve the quality of life in the communities where we live and work. We’re passionate about making the difference. It could be the hospital they work in, the railway they travel on every day, the energy that powers their car, and the data center they depend on to send an e-mail…we offer the power to move you forward in unexpected, exciting ways!

That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a safer and more prosperous society. Our team is dynamic, innovative and client-focused. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver.  As a result our people get to work on some of the most exciting projects in the world.

This goes beyond ‘simply’ commercial and technical delivery. Our goal is for everyone involved in a project―clients, suppliers, local people, and our own teams—to come away having had inspiring experiences. We love what we do, who we work with and are committed to building a better tomorrow. We are an adaptive and innovative organization, committed to leveraging the full potential of our people. We lead a culture that celebrates and enables individual difference in all its forms and strive to ensure our values permeate everything we do.

Who are you?

You are an experienced Bid Manager/Business Generation Manager  with 7 years minimum post-graduate experience looking for the next step or are currently undertaking a similar role in a similar environment. 

Job Description

Working closely with our Directors and wider team, senior leadership across North America, and other Turner & Townsend colleagues, the Business Generation & Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing, planning and implementing a marketing and business development program to expand Turner & Townsend’s brand profile and market share within the region. The role will be based in our Toronto office with a hybrid working model.

To be successful, the incumbent must be able to demonstrate a sound understanding of marketing and communications planning, effectively lead the proposal/bid preparation process, and demonstrate strong project management skills. The professional will nurture highly collaborative internal client relationships with segment/service line professionals and SMEs to drive an integrated approach.

  • Promote and lead Turner & Townsend’s ‘Bid to Win’ process for all pursuits within the offices in Canada, ensuring engaged participation from directors and SMEs to achieve a high-quality deliverable.
  • Partner with client-facing professionals to develop winning marketing strategies for new business development – supporting the strategy, development and production of custom proposals, bids, presentations, and other client deliverables.
  • Compile and vet existing materials and draft original content for proposals and client materials, identifying compelling copy, themes/concepts and salient points that demonstrate value and expertise.
  • Provide overall creative design direction, while adhering to corporate design/branding standards.
  • Create eye-catching graphics that translate complex processes and approaches into easy-to-understand images and charts.
  • Control deliverables from inception to delivery and communicate successfully with internal team during the lifecycle of an assignment to ensure compliance with deadlines and requirements. 
  • Support key client/account management programs, working closely with the key client leads on localized marketing plans and cross-selling opportunities aligned with project/revenue targets.
  • Ensure client care interviews take place and are logged into our systems.

Marketing planning:

  • Manage the West territory annual marketing and business development planning process, and align it with North America plan; facilitate the implementation of the strategy within the West Coast offices.
  • Advise technical teams on the right marketing activities to achieve their objectives; develop and maintain marketing strategies for current and future clients.

Market intelligence and content management:

  • Support the production of marketing materials for relevant in-region execution of global campaigns and the development of localized copy for marketing collateral and Turner & Townsend global publications.
  • Provide hands-on drafting and project management support for the development of a wide range of sales and marketing materials, including case studies, capability documents, service descriptions, team CVs/resumes, etc.
  • Contribute best-in-class materials, content and final deliverables to internal content repositories (CMS).
  • Support internal marketing initiatives and respond to requests for new marketing material and resources. 

Reporting:

  • Manage the various business development and client databases (e.g., CMD) at the local level, ensuring staff are aware of them, using them properly and that the data within them is accurate.
  • Contribute to regional-level Board reports, performance reviews and summaries, as needed.
  • Provide ongoing reporting and tracking of business development and marketing performance as directed.

Other:

  • Act as guardian of the Turner & Townsend brand ensuring consistency across the region.
  • Champion global/North America programs, deliverables and initiatives across the region.
  • Quality controls: Ensure all work is performed on time, cost effectively and according to Turner & Townsend’s high-quality standards.
  • Complete marketing/BG inductions with all new staff, making them aware of regional strategy, tools, platforms, and resources.
  • Assist regional and global business generation and marketing teams, as needed.

 

Qualifications

Key Skills and Knowledge

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or the equivalent in prior marketing and business development experience.
  • Minimum of 7 years of experience across both bid management and corporate marketing/communications, preferably within the construction consultancy, advisory, legal, architecture, or real estate industries.
  • A comprehensive knowledge of the construction consultancy/advisory business that adds value or strategically enhances deliverables and initiatives.
  • An ability to identify critical messages and unique selling points, and clearly and effectively communicate them, and to modify standard text to meet the specific requirements of each new assignment.
  • An ability to contribute strategic concepts for business and project initiatives and successfully execute those concepts.
  • Excellent project management, organizational and problem solving skills, with a proven ability to implement/enforce procedures and to influence at all levels.
  • Should be a self-starter and possess a strong ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously to tight deadlines, with an ability to work in a highly collaborative team environment.
  • Superior written, analytical and oral communications skills; very detail oriented with an eye for design and graphics.
  • Creative thinker with an ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple way, both written and verbally.
  • Proactive senior-level performer displaying the utmost in integrity, with a solid work ethic.
  • An ability to demonstrate consistently the expectations outlined in Turner & Townsend’s Model of Excellence.
  • Strong PC skills required. As bids/proposals are drafted in PowerPoint, expertise in this software is mandatory. Expert in the use of Microsoft Office package, especially MSWord, Excel and Power Point. Creative Suite proficiency desirable. 


Additional Information

Turner & Townsend is a leading independent professional services company specializing in program management, project management, cost management and consulting across the property, infrastructure and natural resources sectors. With 108 offices in 45 countries, we draw on our extensive global and industry experience to manage risk while maximizing value and performance during the construction and operation of our clients’ assets. We are an Equal opportunity employer who will ensure accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities upon request

Turner & Townsend does not accept any speculative or unsolicited CV’s that have been sent to our internal recruitment team or hiring managers from agencies outside of our preferred supplier list. Any speculative or unsolicited CV’s will be treated as a direct application.

#LI-DS1

Advising a prestigious roster of clients across infrastructure, energy, natural resources and real estate, we aim high and deliver exceptional outcomes.', 'You are an experienced Bid Manager/Business Generation Manager\xa0\xa0with 7 years minimum\xa0post-graduate experience looking for the next step or are currently undertaking a similar role in a similar environment.', 'Minimum of 7 years of experience across both bid management and corporate marketing/communications, preferably within the construction consultancy, advisory, legal, architecture, or real estate industries.']

title: Marketing Manager, Brand and Content
description:
Company Description

Brainrider is a marketing and creative agency with teams in Menlo Park/San Francisco, Los Angeles, Seattle, New York City, London, and Toronto. We work with ambitious marketers, in-house creative teams, and internal agencies to do more, by filling capability and capacity gaps and enabling them to execute their marketing and creative at scale.  

We believe collaboration is at its best when we feel at home, so we work as a team — plain and simple. Whether we’re brainstorming better marketing ideas for our clients, or pushing the gas to meet a tight deadline, it all happens with adaptability, optimism, and teamwork. When you join us, you may be pleasantly surprised to find yourself surrounded by smart, genuinely down-to-earth and inclusive people who want to grow with you.

Are you our next team member?

Job Description

We are looking for a creative thinker with an audience-first mindset for the role of Marketing Manager, Brand & Content. This person will  join our in-house Marketing team to support Brainrider’s branding and marketing initiatives, and will be critical in our goal of reaching brand authority and recognition as a full-house creative agency. 

Brainrider is growing — fast. As part of this growth, we’ve relaunched our branding and messaging to better position our agency and services to our target audiences. As a member of the Marketing department, you will support the team on a variety of campaigns and projects, including: digital ad assets, social media campaigns, content strategy, branded swag, and much more. 

You will be a key player in bringing the Brainrider brand to the world. As we grow as a business and execute campaigns at a greater scale, we need hands-on support cultivating our online presence with relevant, on-brand content. You will own the execution of social and content strategies for on-going brand campaigns and quarterly launches.

This is a great opportunity for candidates who want to work in a startup-like team and a collaborative environment, and make a big impact and win as a team.

Brainrider is a people-first agency, which means your growth and well-being is top-of-mind. This role will be within the Marketing department, reporting directly to the Senior Manager, Brand & Content, and working closely with other Senior Managers and the Marketing Director. 

What You’ll Do

  • Execute quarterly marketing strategies developed with team members, assisting in strategy and research for new campaigns
  • Own and manage social media accounts, monitoring and engaging as needed with community 
  • Lead creative and content strategy in direct marketing channels, developing creative briefs and spearheading campaign launches
  • Own planning and execution of our content calendar, sourcing and copywriting articles, social posts, and press releases
  • Maintain a pulse across social platforms, creating on-going content and digital assets and working with designers to execute ideas
  • Compile analytics reports that capture key metrics for retrospectives and quarterly report-outs
  • On-going development of new brand and content campaign ideas, executing online events, webinars, and other digital initiatives, to reach target audiences 
  • Manage and support internal and external relationships with vendors, PR agencies, etc.
Qualifications

What You’ll Bring

  • 5 years of experience in a content/social/brand, marketing role
  • Knowledge of best practices across organic social strategies
  • Familiarity with SEO, analytics, and inbound marketing concepts
  • Experience developing social strategy, and managing social channels
  • History in a marketing content or editorial-related role 
  • Ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and adapt with changing priorities
  • Background in copywriting across marketing channels
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Team player mentality, voicing concerns and opinions to improve the brand
  • Bachelor's degree in English, journalism, communications, or a related field


Additional Information

Due to COVID-19 guidelines, this role is 100% remote until further notice.

We offer competitive salaries, paid vacation, work from home (WFH) support and set-up assistance, and a wide variety of other great perks!

The fine print:

  • Please include current resume and cover letter — we would like to learn more about you and your experience
  • Candidates selected for next steps will be contacted
  • You can learn more about working with us at Brainrider Careers

Brainrider is a place where everyone can do their best work and be themselves. We work as a team, plain and simple. We respect and value the unique characteristics, skills, and experiences of everyone, and support and champion each other to be the best we can be — for ourselves, our team, and our clients. We recognize that a diverse and inclusive workplace leads to better ideas, better solutions, and better results. And we’re here for that — and for you. We #ridetogether.

Brainrider supports Neurodiverse professionals – if you would like to apply using our neurodiverse hiring process, please contact us at 

BRND@brainrider.com

Relocation and sponsorship are not provided.

title: Content Marketing Manager/Creator
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE


Are you a technology enthusiast with a strong background in Marketing gained in a fast-paced environment looking to make your next move? 


We are FRAMOS, an international product-driven tech company of more than 170 amazing people from all over the world. We are looking for a Content Marketing Manager/Creator to join our team to help achieve our strategic goals and grow our MarComs team further.  


Reporting to the Head of MarComs (based in Munich) your daily responsibilities will be owning all business-oriented content creation activities.


  • You define (or formulate) the content marketing strategy (formats and channels) based on company growth strategy and roll out or all content-related activities 
  • You own all design-related topics and ensure corporate identity rules are adhered to 
  • You set up effective nurturing streams per product category and customer groups according to KPIs 
  • You coordinate all content stakeholders, such as external editors and designers  
  • You analyze and own our website content and update both texts as well as visuals on an ongoing basis 
  • You plan and create relevant content for campaigns and events such as trainings and tradeshows in both Northern America as well as Europe 
  • You support the marketing team with accurate native English proofreading of all kinds of written content 
  • You monitor and measure the effectiveness of content in different channels and are creative around developing new content formats - like podcasts, videos, visuals etc.  
  • In this newly created role, you have the opportunity to develop in a growing international high-tech company. The role can be based remotely anywhere from Canada or Germany.

YOUR PROFILE

As our Content Marketing Manager/Creator


  • You are passionate about a broad variety of marketing communication tools and have gained experience working with these
  • You are excited about working your way deeper into our business and industry in order to understand relevant content and channels
  • You have held a content management related role in a technology B2B environment
  • You are a native English speaker (German skills would be a benefit) 
  • You have proven experience with different content formats such as text, visuals, video, audio and more
  • You have excellent writing and editing skills
  • You can coordinate different agents such as partners, associations and freelancers 

  • You have significant experience in leveraging nurturing streams, email campaigns, media channels for successful lead generation. We expect you have experience with Salesforce/Pardot or similar CRM or Marketing Automation tools

  • You have significant experience in creating/editing specific marketing and technical content areas like imaging, VR/AR, industrial robotics, surveillance, etc.

  • You have an affinity to visuals and are aware of design rules

FRAMOS® is an imaging expert, trusted advisor, and vision solutions provider. Since 1981 FRAMOS implements the best current and emerging imaging technologies for specific customer requirements and applications. FRAMOS meets these requirements with advanced and proven imaging components from a global network of renowned partners, and proprietary IP.
More than 180 FRAMOS employees world-wide are passionate about the unlimited potential of imaging and help customers achieve the optimum results from every possible scenario. FRAMOS drives and ensures the entire product development journey. This journey starts with the careful selection of imaging components, like image sensors, lenses, through various 3D technologies, to custom development tailored to individual needs and time frames. FRAMOS listens and understands customer challenges. With innovative solutions FRAMOS ensures successful project outcomes and develops long-term customer relations.

OUR CORE VALUES:

PASSION  
  • We strive to be the best at everything we do.
  • We want to learn something new every day.
  • We listen, reflect and understand.
  • We go the extra mile.
INNOVATION
  • We constantly improve.
  • We are comfortable proposing unconventional solutions.
  • We develop ourselves personally and professionally.
​TEAM SPIRIT
  • We take care of each other.
  • We give and accept help.
  • We give feedback only on behaviour not on people.
FAIL FORWARD
  • We try, fail, learn and apply.
CUSTOMER 1ST
  • We are passionate about putting our customers at the center of everything we do.
  • We value internal customers just as much as external ones.

title: Head of Marketing
description:
Reporting to the CEO, we are looking for an experienced leader who has a proven track record of successfully driving hyper growth. The right candidate has significant B2B expertise and can be a thought partner for the business.

We are looking for someone that is an expert to tackle both strategy and tactical mandates.

Now having doubled our sales from 2019 but coming out of a difficult Covid period, you will be the first marketing team member, which provides you with the unique opportunity to not only shape the role, but also build the function (and the team) for success.

Desired outcomes in the first year

  • Be accountable for driving demand (increase leads by 10x) and growing revenues across all segments.
    • Develop and adjust the GTM strategy
    • Develop new lead acquisition strategies and channels
      • Manage budgets over different channels
      • Develop sales enablement assets for customer acquisition and bus partners
  • Conduct market research to drive tactics

Responsibilities

  • Plan and manage direct marketing & digital campaigns
  • Grow SEO presence
  • Analyze company's marketing strategy and suggest improvements
  • Plan, implement and manage marketing strategy
  • Direct the maintenance and building of new websites
  • Oversee our Customer Advisory Board
  • Provide our content collaborators with strategic direction to drive thought leadership and messaging across all audiences, including video, blog posts, interactive content, podcasts, polls and surveys, reports, social media, print and more.
  • Implement processes for acquiring, processing and analyzing data about our users, and leveraging those insights to inform actionable marketing strategies that acquire, activate, retain and reactivate our users
  • Oversee agencies, outsourced resources and develop a team

Qualifications and about you

  • Minimum 10 years of experience in a high-tech B2B marketing role owning growth targets and brand strategy
    • Marketplace experience an asset
    • A combination of experience working at startups and large companies
    • Optimist and solution minded
  • Master wordsmith you are able to craft convincing and moving messages.
  • Great collaborator (Sales, Sales Operations, Finance, Operations and Product teams)
  • Keen listener and when needed educator
  • Hands-on experience with CRM, email management and SEO tools like Google Analytics, Google Adwords, SFDC, WebTrends, Pardot, etc
  • Ability to influence and bring others together to achieve goals.
  • Analytical with a data-driven mentality and experience reporting results across the business.
  • A passion for building teams and developing people.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication in English & French.

Our values

  1. We act like owners, the puck stops with us, we make sh*t happen, we play to win
  2. We have a growth mindset, we are always listening to our clients and partner, experimenting & learning, we grow together
  3. We lead with transparency, if in doubt we over communicate, we are not afraid to be vulnerable
  4. We’re in this together, we succeed as a team, we all have unique superpowers and we help each other shine.

About Bus.com:

We’re disrupting the $17B private bus industry (in North America alone) that is where the taxi industry was before rideshare started. We bring extreme value by helping this highly fragmented demand and supply connect. Bringing online, large and B2G demand to operators that wouldn’t otherwise be able to gain access to. We have grown 2.4x YoY and are now set to accelerate our consolidation of the market. Learn more on Bus.com.

title: Lead Graphic Digital / UX Designer
description:
AMA:

THE ONLY DIRECTION YOU KNOW

IS above AND beyond.

 

 

Posted: 2022-05-02
Closing: When Filled
Location: Edmonton South  

 

 

The Alberta Motor Association (AMA) is on the lookout for a Digital Design Lead to guide our Digital Design Team.   You will be guiding a team of skilled designers as part of a larger team that includes copywriters, marketers, developers, analysts, SEO specialists, and executive stakeholders. You will be responsible for contributing to and ensuring the successful conceptualization and design of all visual website, app and other visual assets required to deliver an impactful digital member experience. You are considered an expert in user experience best practices, usability heuristics, accessibility, industry trends and the competitive landscape. You consider yourself individualistic in thought and approach but able to find innovative ways to collaborate for cohesive and big picture solutions

 

Your primary responsibilities include creating user-focused designs informed by market analysis, customer feedback and requirements, and user research analytics to ensure successful large digital projects and visual marketing assets required to deliver an impactful digital member experience.

 

 **This role is an 18-month temporary role**

 

WHAT MOVES YOU

  • Youâ€™re a spirited team leader who knows how facilitate team collaboration
  • Youâ€™re a visionary and forward thinker who is passionate about delivering innovation, quality and value in people, the brand, products and services.
  • You love to share thoughts and ideas â€“ after all, two heads are always better than one.
  • You thrive in fast-paced environments, you are flexible and able to roll with changing scenarios.
  • Youâ€™re a natural when it comes to finding simple solutions to complicated problems and explaining them to others.
  • Youâ€™re both a right-brain and a left-brain thinker and have a good balance between your innovative side and quantitative analytical abilities.
  • Youâ€™re a natural when it comes to execute innovative digital design and effortless UX experiences.
  • Youâ€™re established your skillset and able to rationalize design decisions to stakeholders and leaders.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Report to the Manager, Digital Member Experience
  • Collaborate with the Manager, Digital Member Experience to define and prioritize Marketing and Digital Member Experience projects
  • Participate in the strategic planning of marketing campaigns/projects.
  • Partner with Business Leaders to achieve strategic goals and business objectives.
  • Lead the design of digital creative including but not limited to, web layouts, email layouts, templates, graphic elements, and lead generation funnels.
  • Oversee digital web and app design backlog and roadmap.
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts and business leaders to discover, capture, and assess design requirements.
  • Develop and deliver high level and detailed storyboards, concept diagrams, user interface sketches and mockups, prototypes, and detailed design specifications.
  • Champion the function of UX/UI design through modeling and coaching
  • Solve complex problems in a highly creative, user-centric way through an iterative process of experimentation and attention to detail.
  • Follow UX best practices, usability heuristics, and AMA brand guidelines.
  • Adhere to AMA Brand guidelines.
  • Plans, coordinates, and maintains relationships with external agencies and contractors.
  • Maintain the AMA Digital Brand guidelines and ensures they are accurately represented across all digital marketing assets.
  • Utilize photography library including Agent/Advisor/Instructor photos and imagery used across Marketing assets.
  • Identifies training requirements and makes learning training requirements to the Manager as required.
  • Collaborate with optimization specialists to develop optimal sales funnels.
  • Work closely with the Creative Team and IT Design team to develop and maintain the AMA digital brand and deliver a consistent digital member experience
  • Have a solid understanding of web usability and the importance of the user experience (UX).

 

 

WHAT YOU'VE DONE

  • A university degree in a related field such as UX Design, Digital Graphic Design or Visual Communications.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in lead designer role or previous senior designer experience.
  • Must be an expert in prototyping tools such as Figma, XD, as well as Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Working knowledge of CMS and HTML/CSS technical skills
  • Strong portfolio showcasing knowledge of UX and visual design principles and techniques.
  • Prior leadership or supervisory experience would be considered an asset.
  • Ability to work effectively under deadlines and juggle several large projects simultaneously.
  • Strong knowledge of technical (backend) constraints and implementation.
  • Strong communication and proficient presentation skills.

 

WHAT YOU'LL GET

  • Compensation for your performed services and your time.
  • Bonus pay incentive program.  
  • Flexibility for your work/life balance and earning potential.
  • Excellent support from AMA with our brilliant and up to date industry knowledge.

 

Please note: applicants without a portfolio of work are unlikely to be considered for this position.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Field Marketing Manager
description:
Location: Toronto, Canada
Type of Employee: Full Time

Vocera, now part of Stryker, provides clinical communication and workflow solutions that help protect and connect team members, increase operational efficiency, enhance quality of care and safety, and humanize the healthcare experience. Nearly 2,800 facilities worldwide, including more than 2,300 hospitals and healthcare facilities, have selected Vocera solutions to enable their workforce to communicate and collaborate and engage with patients and families. In addition to healthcare, Vocera solutions are found in aged care facilities, veterinary hospitals, schools, luxury hotels, retail stores, power facilities, and more. Visit https://www.vocera.com/ for more information.   

Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. We offer innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. For more information, visit https://www.stryker.com/              

 Position Description:  As our Field Marketing Manager, you will lead field marketing initiatives for the assigned geographic markets, working closely with the Manager, Field Marketing, country managers, regional sales managers, demand generation and portfolio marketing teams to build and implement effective marketing plans aligned with the business strategy. Marketing programs will target both prospective and existing hospital, health system and aged care facility executive buyers. We are looking for someone who is experienced in leading the strategic and tactical planning and driving execution of regional marketing programs crafted to achieve or exceed revenue objectives. This role will report to the Manager, Field Marketing.

Responsibilities

  • Support the creation and execution of strategic and tactical field marketing plans to achieve business objectives
  • Develop Key Opinion Leaders in the region to create awareness and advocacy of Vocera solutions
  • Research and develop regional POV to inform marketing plan based on market dynamics, competitive landscape, buying process, buyer personas, and healthcare policy
  • Lead development of demand generation programs, including but not limited to events, webinars, media buys, email campaigns and thought leadership programs in partnership with the demand generation, PR/Communications, and Events teams
  • Lead regular cross functional meetings with marketing and international sales to promote effective communication and collaboration
  • Develop and implement co-marketing programs with key reseller partners
  • Develop comprehensive go-to-market and ABM plans in alignment with strategic accounts
  • Collaborate with key partners to adapt and write regionalized content such as emails, direct mail, sales enablement and campaign program content and manage vendors
  • Develop and manage key external relationships with industry associations and organizations, trade publications, and vendors and agencies

Competencies

  • Ability to lead multiple workloads simultaneously with strong organizational skills
  • Self-motivated, able to work autonomously and communicate with remote management
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to influence at the C-Suite level with thought leaders
  • Self-starter who truly enjoys working in a fast-paced, innovative and high-growth environment
  • Outstanding work ethic with high performance and quality standards, enthusiastic and diligent with meticulous attention to detail
  • Passion for results, measurement, and optimization to continuously drive return on investment

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related field or equivalent
  • 5+ years’ experience in marketing, preferably in technology targeting the healthcare vertical; with at least 2 years in field marketing
  • Experience working with globally dispersed cross functional teams and colleagues
  • Strong understanding of sales cycles and large deal complexity
  • Experience with digital marketing including a marketing automation platform, preferably Marketo, Pardot and Salesforce.com
  • Experience with CRM system, preferably Salesforce.com
  • International travel up to 20% of the time
  • Proof of full COVID-19 vaccination required

Belief in Diversity

Vocera Communications is an Affirmative Action Employer committed to workforce diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, or genetic information.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, or genetic information.', 'Collaborate with key partners to adapt and write regionalized content such as emails, direct mail, sales enablement and campaign program content and manage vendors', 'Outstanding work ethic with high performance and quality standards, enthusiastic and diligent with meticulous attention to detail', 'Develop Key Opinion Leaders in the region to create awareness and advocacy of Vocera solutions', '5+ years’ experience in marketing, preferably in technology targeting the healthcare vertical; with at least 2 years in field marketing', 'Experience working with globally dispersed cross functional teams and colleagues', 'Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related field or equivalent', 'Support the creation and execution of strategic and tactical field marketing plans to achieve business objectives', 'Develop and implement co-marketing programs with key reseller partners', 'Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills', 'Develop and manage key external relationships with industry associations and organizations, trade publications, and vendors and agencies', 'International travel up to 20% of the time', 'Lead regular cross functional meetings with marketing and international sales to promote effective communication and collaboration', 'Strong understanding of sales cycles and large deal complexity', 'Self-starter who truly enjoys working in a fast-paced, innovative and high-growth environment', 'Experience with digital marketing including a marketing automation platform, preferably Marketo, Pardot and Salesforce.com', 'Self-motivated, able to work autonomously and communicate with remote management']

title: Associate Manager, Acquisition & Onboarding (Direct Marketing)
description:
Heart & Stroke is a place that values championing health and has a bias for action as we tackle heart disease and stroke. Our mission is to promote health, save lives and enhance recovery. We are committed to a culture that exemplifies our core values: CHAMPION Health, PRACTICE Humility, EMBRACE Change, DRIVE impact, LEARN and GROW and BE HEARTFELT.  

At Heart & Stroke, we believe in equity, diversity, and inclusion; itâ€™s embedded in our values and core mission work to support all people in Canada to lead healthier lives. We are committed to applying this principle to cultivate a welcoming environment that embraces diversity among our employees. Candidates from diverse backgrounds, including but not limited to, Indigenous peoples, racialized and LGBTQ2 communities, women, and people with disabilities, are encouraged to apply. 

Who we need 

The Associate Manager, Early Donors is responsible for the execution of building prospective donor opportunities (lead generation), acquiring new donors, developing, and optimizing their onboarding journey, including retaining them within the first phase of relationship with Heart and Stroke Foundation. 

To be successful in this role, you understand what drives our fundraising campaigns, and continually have an entrepreneurial spirit, driving innovation through test-and-learn opportunities. This role has a data-first mindset and drive for segmentation opportunities. Weâ€™re looking for someone with a passion and the knowledge of how both online and offline tactics support both new fundraising opportunities with donors and engagement to drive strong first time and repeat giving to Heart and Stroke 

How you will make an impact every day 

Business Planning 

  • Work with the Sr. Manager to develop the annual and quarterly fundraising plans 

  • Drive campaigns: planning input and kick-off with vendors execution management, process optimization, tactical results, and integration opportunities across the constituent journey,  

  • Collaborate working through key internal partners to evolve and innovate audience programs 

  • Manage financial campaign budget tracking and forecast inputs for the portfolio, including but not limited to the coordination, review, processing and tracking of invoices, MSAs and SPWs 

  • Conduct analysis/research and contribute insights to the development and evolution of donor-first journeys 

Campaign Planning and Execution 

  • Execution and implementation of the existing and new donor journeys for acquisition including lead generation and onboarding  

  • Deliver on innovative new ways to nurture and solicit new donors 

  • Design and have input into short term tactics and strategies for the portfolio including testing and analytics 

  • Through analytics, intimately understand the prospective donors and the triggers for response and reactivation and apply the learnings into development of tactics  

  • Write briefs for agencies and internal partners including offline and online and donor journeys 

  • Execute onboarding and second gift requests or processes 

  • Manage the execution of all portfolio marketing initiatives, including critical path, budgets, production, and stakeholder involvement/approvals.  

  • Schedules, reviews, and provides final approval of all live data signoffs as they relate to mail campaigns. 

  • Support testing of digital materials (emails, landing pages, etc.) to ensure proper tracking, implementation, link functionality, copy and creative implementation related to the execution of portfolio strategy and execution plans 

  • Modify campaign plans, as necessary, based on real time results, market conditions and new learnings 

  • Prepare campaign post-mortem documents and presentations  

  • Liaise with suppliers and internal departments ensuring that executional needs for the program are met.  

  • Work with agencies/vendors to leverage their expertise in developing compelling marketing communications and supporting program delivery 

  • Work closely with peers to ensure campaigns are seamlessly integrated with each other and messaging consistent 

  • Guide the Acquisition list construction, including who will be targeted, working with the Analytics team and external partners. 

  • Evaluate and measure the results of all campaigns versus targets as responses are received and upon completion of campaign.  

  • Build strong lateral relationships to ensure plans and execution are delivered successfully 

What you bring 

  • Post-secondary in related area 

  • Minimum of 5 years of fundraising experience and strategic planning in an Online and offline acquisition context 

  • Experience in premium and non-premium acquisition mail programs 

  • Analytical capabilities including database segmentation and ROI analysis; Must be able to read the data and construct the story 

  • Experience working with multiple external agency and creative partners 

  • Experience within a fast-paced environment involving multi-tasking and critical deadlines. 

  • Web site and Ecommerce project management experience a plus 

  • Requires strong understanding of motivations/needs of donor groups  

  • Apply data segmentation to execute a strong program of customized messages 

  • Requires working with multiple stakeholders while working through multiple complexities  

  • Ability to balance competing priorities, complex situations and tight deadlines  

  • Strong degree of comfort with ambiguity but able to translate into tactical programs 

  • Data driven thinker with ability to identify and respond to issues and opportunities in a timely manner 

  • Ability to collect and distill data, to provide personal point of view and insights. 

  • Demonstrated ability to construct donor journeys across multiple touch points and channels 

  • Production experience including understanding of variable print 

  • PC Knowledge â€“ Word, Excel, Microsoft Outlook, Power Point 

  • Strong project management skills, attention to detail and ability to handle multiple and competing demands on a consistent basis 

  • Proven success meeting and exceeding revenue targets 

  • Strong interpersonal skills and a strong collaborator 

  • Ability to exercise discretion and good judgement 

  • Established ability to work with data and analytics to maximize response 

  • Excellent writing, editing, and verbal communications skills  

  • Self-initiative is a must. 

  • Flexibility and a very strong sense of urgency 

What we offer 

In addition to a competitive salary, Heart & Stroke believes that time off is integral to the personal health and wellness of our employees. â€¯We offer a generous paid time off package including vacation days, personal days, wellness days and paid companywide closure between Christmas and New Yearâ€™s. In addition, we provide competitive health, medical, dental and vision benefits, basic life insurance, disability, employee assistance program (EAP) and a defined contribution pension plan with employer matching. â€¯Furthermore, our staff enjoy flexible hybrid working arrangements and support with reimbursement for mobile phones and home office set up.  

Apply now 

Beat as one. If you want to join the fight to beat heart disease and stroke while building an engaged and giving community, apply by April 20, 2022.  

To learn more about our mission, our values and the difference our foundation makes in the lives of Canadians at every age, please visit our website.â€¯  

Please know that Heart & Stroke supports the health, wellbeing and safety of our employees and their families and while our offices remain closed, remote work arrangements are currently in place.â€¯ Therefore, interviews are currently being conducted via phone or video call, so we look forward to â€˜virtuallyâ€™ meeting you! 

Heart & Stroke has a vaccination policy that requires all employees to be fully vaccinated unless they have a valid exemption. You can view our policy here.â€¯ 

We are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. If you have been contacted for an interview and require accommodation to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please advise and we will work with you to meet your needs.
