title: Director Maritime Business Development
description:
Position Description


Serco Canada Marine is seeking a dynamic individual to be responsible Maritime Business Development to join our team to assist the Business Unit to grow our domestic and international ship design and marine engineering business.


You will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and developing business opportunities for Serco Canada Marine in accordance with the SCM business strategy. You will lead, manage, and guide the Capture and Proposal Teams through the Serco opportunity lifecycle process.


You will lead, manage, and guide the capture, solutioning, and proposal teams through the Serco opportunity lifecycle. You will report directly to the General Manager of SCM and work with the BD Leads for other Business Units. You will participate in the development of SCM strategies and plans.


In this role you will be responsible for developing new business opportunities, both domestically and internationally and capturing identified opportunities:


· Identify, analyze, and develop business opportunities. Research and analyze market opportunities and recommend opportunities for pursuit. Research public domain materials to develop leads, and contacts. Establish customer contacts particularly targeted at maritime commercial, defence, and international customers. Prepare market strategy presentations.


· Work closely with operational personnel to gather, assess, and validate customer requirements. Plan and organize capture strategy to include white papers, RFIs, sources sought, workshops, gap analysis, call plans, solutioning, gate reviews, black hat sessions, collaboration sessions, budgets, and pre-RFP proposal preparation schedules and reviews.


· Gain internal support, operate independently with limited supervision and feedback, and establish a solid working relationship with technical staff, managers, and peers across Serco.


· Develop and maintain strong customer relationships within both government and shipyards. Establish and maintain working relationships with similar and/or complementary companies to include teaming and partnership discussions.


· Working with communications consultants, lead the marketing of the company’s capabilities. Establishing marketing opportunities with the greatest impact within a marketing budget.


Qualifications


To be considered for this roll the Marine Project Manager will have:

• A Bachelor’s degree.

• 10 years relative work experience is required.

• The candidate must exhibit leadership traits, well developed management skills, and have the ability to obtain a broad knowledge of Serco’s products and services, as well as the needs of current and potential customers, and assist in establishing strategic direction from that knowledge.

• The candidate must demonstrate extensive knowledge, experience, and success in winning captures of large-scale opportunities.

• Strong knowledge and understanding of the marine industry is a must.

• Demonstrated working knowledge of the federal procurement process is required.


Knowledge of the Canadian government’s procurement processes is considered an asset.

• Excellent interpersonal, problem solving, and business acumen. Ability to influence constructively and interact at high levels of the corporate structure. Confidence and experience dealing with senior executives; ability to work efficiently in fast-paced, time-sensitive and often multi-tasking environment.

• Ability to travel, as necessary in support of an opportunity pursuit.

• Ability to use automated tools such as Microsoft Office to present ideas, information, and reports.


Additional desired experience and skills:

• Possessing or the ability to obtain Canadian Security Clearances (Reliability/Controlled Good or higher) maybe considered an asset or maybe required for the role.


Company Overview


Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco Americas has over 9,000 employees and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset - we listen, respect and support them throughout their career at Serco. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying our workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).


To review Serco benefits please visit: https://www.serco.com/na/careers/benefits-of-choosing-serco .


If you require an accommodation with the application process please email: careers@serco-na.com or call the HR Service Desk at 800-628-6458, option 1. Please note, due to EEOC/OFCCP compliance, Serco is unable to accept resumes by email.


Serco does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies without being a contracted approved vendor. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Serco and will not be obligated to pay a placement or contract fee. If you are interested in becoming an approved vendor at Serco, please email Agencies@serco-na.com .


COVID-19 Regulations: Serco complies with all applicable COVID-19 requirements. This may require employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, provide attestations regarding vaccination status and/or COVID-19 testing, or satisfy other conditions of employment that Serco deems appropriate, and employees may be required to show proof of vaccination and/or negative COVID-19 test results as a condition of employment (except in limited circumstances where an employee is legally entitled to an accommodation).

title: Entry Level Marketer
company: Pro Works Painting - North Vancouver, BC
description:
Job Summary:

Pro Works Painting is looking to hire an entry level marketer. We are looking for outgoing, positive and compensation-driven marketers that can work part-time throughout the next 2-6 months. We generally look for fun, outdoorsy people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

Compensation:

  • We pay a competitive $20 per hour and $5 per lead
  • At minimum marketers should expect at least 1 lead per hour
  • Extra $ for Lawn Signs and Bonuses more than 5 leads per 3 hour session!

Hours: Monday - Thursday 5:00pm to 8:00pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm with a minimum of 4 hours per week. You can design your schedule!

All training will be provided!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

Benefits & About the Position:

  • Get out on a walk and enjoy the outdoors while getting paid (even with friends)!
  • Design your own schedule within our Hours of Operation
  • Learn new Marketing and Sales skills that will build a foundation for future employment
  • Make good compensation that reflects your work ethic

 

What you will Learn:

  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others

Requirements to apply:

  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work

title: Development Manager
description:
About the Company:

We are a fully integrated real estate construction, development and asset management company focused on opportunity generation and driven by progress. Ours is a story of evolution; it all began with excellence in construction many decades ago â€“ and a focus on delivering for people. We strive to make each other and the world around us better every day. It shows up in everything we do â€“ from the growth opportunities we provide to our people, to the quality of our projects and the amenities we build into them.

 

Our commitment to craftsmanship, doing the right thing and creating customers for life has cemented our reputation â€“ along with our subsidiary, Bosa Properties â€“ as one of British Columbiaâ€™s most respected privately held companies.

About the Role:

The Development Manager will be responsible for developing and managing real estate projects from inception through construction completion and will be responsible for the success of the projectsâ€™ municipal approvals, design and profitability.

 

General Responsibilities:

  • Develops and executes project plans, schedules and budgets for all assigned real estate projects.
  • Leads and motivates the project team through all phases of development to ensure projects are consistent with approved pre-development objectives and achieve profitability requirements.
  • Manages projects to meet critical dates and quality requirements.
  • Assists in evaluation and due-diligence activities on potential acquisitions.
  • Develops and maintains effective relationships with partners, consultants, community stakeholders, and government authorities.
  • Stays current on market trends in the multi-family residential market which impact the amenities or suite configuration desired by prospective purchasers/tenants.
  • Keeps up-to-date on local competition, market conditions and relevant development by-laws, regulations, and guidelines.
  • Develops relationship with senior management, marketing, accounting, customer service, interior design and construction personnel.

Design & Development:

  • Prepares project objectives, pro formas and project schedules for approval by senior management.
  • Provides necessary updates as required.
  • Retains design consultants in accordance with an approved pro forma and approved pre-development budget.
  • Guides architects and other design consultants through project design bearing in mind construction costs, desirability, market trends, and the target market for each specific project.
  • Prepares exterior and interior development specifications for approvals.
  • Manages development schedules including critical project milestone dates.
  • In conjunction with the Construction project manager, monitors construction documents for compliance with objectives and municipal permits.
  • Ensures required disclosure statements and strata plans are in compliance with all approvals, design and construction documents/projects.
  • Assists with navigating projects through various approval process.
  • Establishes strong relationships with consultants and works closely with them through to the completion of all projects.

Municipal Approvals:

  • Secures all necessary regulatory project approvals in accordance with approved project schedule.
  • Manages the approval process including agency interface & technical information requirements.

Financial:

  • Collaborates with Finance to develop proposed projects, cash flows and overall investment returns for consideration by Senior Management.
  • Maintains the overall development pro-forma throughout the development process monitoring overall project cost and variances from budgets.
  • Manages pre-development budgets and approves consultant invoices.
  • Works with Finance to coordinate the best capital execution to support the project.
  • Balances profit maximization while maintaining design quality.
What you Bring:
  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree;
  • 5 -7 years in multi-family residential development/construction;
  • LEED accreditation (an asset);
  • Architecture, Civil Engineering (preferred);
  • Experience in high-rise residential buildings (preferred);

 

Your Rewards

Our most important offering to anyone that joins the Bosa Properties team is our culture of innovation, achievement, and ownership.   We bring out the best in each other by constantly striving to be world class in all we do. These values are reflected in our Real Estate Projects, our Company, and our People.

 

At Bosa, we also offer a very competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package:

  • Medical and Dental Coverage:  Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost
  • RRSP Matching:  We support your future goals by matching up to 5% of your salary
  • Friends and Family Program:  Early and exclusive access to our newly released projects
  • BOSAconnectâ„¢:  Our annual development conference that is hosted by our leadership and complemented by a range of world-class speakers and workshop experts.
  • BOSALeads:  Our proprietary Leadership Development program designed to support your continued growth, development and leadership capabilities;
  • Professional Development and Education Support

How to Apply

Please submit an application at the link provided. We value your interest in the Bosa Family of Companies.   While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file and consider you for future opportunities as they come available.

title: Marketing Manager/Content Manager
description:
Supporting the Director of Sales, this role helps build direct marketing plans, targeted campaigns, and activated channels to the end of driving consumer awareness and preference, increasing market share, and building broader portfolio and brand awareness. The Marketing Manager will be responsible for building awareness of the hotel through public relations along with the development and execution of content creation for the hotel, with a strong emphasis on digital marketing and social media.
Reports to the Director of Sales to develop and implement public relations, marketing and communications strategy of hotel to ensure that all strategies are set; tactical plans are created and implemented; and that results are monitored and achieved.
 
  • Assist in the development and implementation innovative, hotel specific, public relations, social media and marketing strategies to support Hotel’s objectives. 
  • Works with Operations, Food & Beverage and Sales teams to execute promotions and campaigns to target in-house guests with promotions that drive incremental revenue to the hotel.
  • Develop, implement and manage hotel’s social media strategy
  • Manage and oversee Social Media content and measure the success of every social media campaign
  • Work with Director of Sales and Marketing and Revenue Manager to review analytics to measure success/failure of campaigns.
  • Collaborates with Revenue Management to verify correct offer loading, verifying advertisement targeting is correctly directed at relevant consumer groups
  • Support SEO strategies by understanding keyword priorities and how they integrate into content marketing plans
  • Monitor SEO and user engagement and suggest content optimization
  • Assist in quarterly Hotel Content Manager refresh, specifically offering SEO keyword recommendations for brand photo captions and GDS marketing messages
  • Use social media marketing tools
  • Communicate with industry professionals and influencers via social media to create a strong network
  • Develop relationships with media, public relations agencies, department suppliers and other outside companies in the development of programs to meet marketing and communications objectives.
  • Review, advertising, print and other media for the hotel.  Work with advertising agencies, consulting firms and vendors to maximize advertising investments and ensure ads represent brand identity and are appropriate for target audience.
  • Develop media contacts and database, plan press conferences and other press activities. 
  • Evaluate sponsorship and solicitation requests including manage on-ground activation of sponsored events 
    Prepare and respond to guest and public issues in collaboration with General Manager, DOS and Corporate Affairs.
  • Manage the execution of hotel sponsored events, community/government relations activities, and press promotional activities.
  • Manages photo shoots for seasonal or festive promotions
  • Regularly update hotel, restaurant and third-party websites including website’s press page. 
  • Maintain an up-to-date photo and video library, including a photographic record of all media and special events.
  • Design, coordinate and distribute press kits including monitor and maintain supply of sales collateral.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Marketing Manager 

Job Overview

We are looking for an experienced Marketing Manager to develop and manage marketing programs in specific channels, support business objectives, foster customer retention, execute business development, provide operations support, and advance brand building.


An ideal candidate has 4+ years experience in the restaurant and hospitality industry working to build emerging brands.


About Seth Commercial Corp

Seth Commercial Corporation is the parent company of the La Prep and Chaska brands.


La Prep - La Prep is an upscale bistro-style quick-service restaurant specializing in freshly prepared innovative sandwiches, salads, baked goods and specialty coffees.


Chaska – Our Indian street food concept offers a different take on Indian food that is both delicious and fresh, prepared daily using savoury spices, with flavourful herbs and marinades in place of rich and heavy sauces.

Responsibilities

  • Build marketing programs to support specific marketing objectives across different channels and segments in support of our overall strategic marketing plan
  • Market through various channels and segment databases working with large data sets
  • Develop business cases for marketing programs at the proposal stage and make recommendations on marketing tactics
  • Develop and manage National Marketing Plan for each brand; La Prep and Chaska
  • Evaluate the impact of marketing programs in achieving their stated objectives, including impact on lead flow, LTV and retention
  • Partner with creative teams, other internal stakeholders, and external agencies and vendors
  • Lead the execution of marketing programs from start to finish, driving collaboration with the stakeholders and leveraging the right internal processes
  • Work with the other marketing teams, other internal stakeholders, and external agencies and vendors
  • Work closely with operations to support new and existing locations in their marketing efforts
  • Organize store openings and promotional events at other venues, coordinating with our staff to ensure prompt delivery of materials and merchandise

Qualifications 

  • Experience building complex marketing programs and reporting on the results
  • Exposure to digital and direct response marketing
  • Competence as a creative writer with an eye for great emails and landing pages
  • Strong project management skills
  • Strong problem-solving ability, including metrics-driven thinking
  • Ability to travel as necessary
  • has a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or Business or similar is an asset
  • experience in the franchising industry a strong asset
  • Ability to work unpredictable hours, including some evenings and weekends
  • Familiarity with online content marketing and social media development strategies


At Seth Commercial Corp, we strive to build a diverse and inclusive workplace. Should you need accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know. We are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
This role is 60% work from home

With more than $3 billion in home improvement loans issued to over 500,000 Canadians, Simply Group (mysimplygroup.com) provides consumers with industry leading, high-efficiency, home comfort equipment and financing solutions, to modernize their residential properties. Simply Group knows that its people are its greatest asset and is proud to be Great Place to Work-Certified since 2016, including Best WorkplacesTM for Women in 2021. Being Great Place to WorkÂ®certified creates a sense of unity within our team. We are proud to showcase this badge of honour because it reflects the contributions made by our employees to create a world-class community and culture.  At Simply Group, our goal is to maintain an inclusive work environment and workplace culture as we believe it is truly the foundation of our success. Our goal is to always stay driven, passionate, confident, trustworthy, grateful, and respectful, as delivering top-notch customer service and maintaining a positive work ethic is extremely important to our team. Our lines of business are smashing the status quo and raising the bar in consumer lending. We take an innovative look at the whole picture to offer innovative, comprehensive solutions that break down barriers and improve the lives of our customers and our dealers.

Business Development Manager Responsibilities:

  • Research and identify new business opportunities and seek out the appropriate contact in an organization
  • Generate leads and cold call prospective dealers
  • Meet with dealers face to face or over the phone in addition to fostering and developing relationships with them
  • Understand the needs of your dealers and be able to respond effectively with a plan of how to meet these
  • Think strategically - seeing the bigger picture and setting aims and objectives in order to develop and improve the business
  • Work strategically - carrying out necessary planning in order to implement operational changes
  • Have a good understanding of the businesses products or services and be able to advise dealers about them
  • Ensure staff are on board throughout the organization and understand the need for change and what is required of them
  • Train dealers, they are responsible for initial with respect to Simplyâ€™s processes and protocols and periodically throughout the relationship as dealers onboard new sales reps, etc.
  • Discuss promotional strategy and activities with the marketing department
  • Seek ways of improving the way the business operates
  • Attend seminars, conferences, and events where appropriate
  • Keep abreast of trends and changes in the consumer finance world.
  • Help to plan sales campaigns
  • Create a sales pipeline
  • Negotiate promotions with dealers
  • Increase sales of the dealers
  • Carry out sales forecasts and analysis and present your findings to senior leadership
  • Develop the business sales and marketing strategy for your dealers with their buy-in.

What's in it for You?

  • Full time Hours.
  • High Income Potential - Base Commission OTE $80,000.
  • A friendly and supportive work environment with a constant presence of coaches who will support your personal and professional development.
  • Advancement and growth opportunities.

Qualifications Required:

  • Experience in Sales, Marketing or related field.
  • Experience in the Consumer Lending or Finance Industry
  • Strong communication skills 
  • Ability to manage complex projects and multi-task.
  • Excellent organizational skills.
  • Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty.
  • Proficient in Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.
  • Comfortable using a computer for various tasks.

Simply Group offers a competitive salary, monthly commission, and participation in our group benefits program.

All candidates will be considered, however only qualified candidates will be contacted. Simply Group is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Simply Group is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our HR Team will work with applicants requesting accommodations at any stage of the hiring process. This document is available in alternate formats upon request.

 

BDM

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
description:
What does Shinydocs do? We are a data-centric software company, on a mission to change the way organizations find, understand, and action their data to make better business decisions.Founded in 2014, Shinydocs searches, organizes, and understands unstructured data at scale, providing actionable security, compliance, and business operations insights. We’re partnering with some of the largest companies in the world to revolutionize how they handle information. We are leaders in our field and our people are some of the best and brightest in what they do. Why Shinydocs? We are excited that you are here and interested in learning more about us. Shinydocs is committed to provide a barrier-free and inclusive work environment where everyone belongs. We want our team to be able to do their best work, be their whole selves and experience their full potential. We are an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business and job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or ethnic origin, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or civil status, political affiliation, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the jurisdictions in which we operate.If you require support and/or accommodation during any phase of our hiring process, please do not hesitate to connect with Samantha Sheen-Manor our Talent Acquisition Business partner (ssheenmanor@shinydocs.com). We’ll work to learn more about your needs to provide you the best experience possible and know that all information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential. The future is bright and “shiny” at Shinydocs. We’re a dynamic and diverse team with experience, fueled by passion for the work we do and live by our values of Excellence, Adaptability and Teamwork. You’ll be surrounded by the best and brightest minds who truly value your contribution. They will be excited to collaborate with you and will be cheering you on every step of the way. Oh and you’ll be laughing often throughout the day, either with others, at each other, or at yourself :-)



+ Satisfying Work: We’re building new stuff that solves real-world problems for exciting organizations. Everyone here is self-directed, empowered and enabled to do their best work.


+ Remote First: We’re committed to a remote first work environment. We offer flexible hours and respect our team members schedules to enable them to find the work life harmony that they deserve to have in their lives.


+ Comprehensive Total Rewards & Wellness Package: We collaborate with our whole team to develop programs that meet their needs including offering fully paid group benefits from day one, Health Care and Wellness Spending Accounts, RRSP matching, a Safe Transportation subsidy, Phone and Internet subsidies, and a Worry-Free subsidy that supports those unexpected experiences and help you provide care for your animal companions too!


+ Professional Development, Growth & Purpose: Follow your passion and find purpose in your work. Experience learning opportunities through courses, shadowing, Shiny “U” Sessions & Show N’ Tells.


+ Culture & Communication: Weekly All Hands, Coffee with the CEO, and regular virtual socials and team building activities during core work hours which keeps you connected and respects your work life harmony.


+ Community Commitment: We support a variety of organizations on behalf of our team and we are proud (and active) corporate members of the WIT Network.



If you are curious to learn more and have some of these skills but maybe not all of them we still encourage you to apply as we would love to review your unique background and learn more about you! How will I make an impact? As a Product Marketing Manager reporting to the Senior Director of Products, you will develop effective marketing strategies and communication plans that will bring the value of a line of products to the market. This position will interface primarily with our technical product managers, but also the marketing, sales, development, and customer support teams.Within your first 30 days, you will familiarize yourself with our market and customers. You will gain a good understanding of our different product offerings and begin drafting market strategies for one of our products. Day in the Life: Market Validation - Understanding competitive advantage, conducting competitor analysis and market research.Collaborate - Work with our Sales & Marketing departments to develop product pricing strategies and structures. Customer Centric - Understanding key customer value propositions and creating messaging that communicates that value to target customer personas. Champion Shinydocs Culture - Lead by example; everyone on the Shinydocs team (including you!) contributes to and defines our company culture. Not sure if you have enough or the right experience for this job? Apply anyways. Only 1% of candidates will ever meet every single requirement on most job postings. It’s not a big deal if you don’t meet all our requirements. Diversity of our talent’s backgrounds, skills, experiences and education is what makes us stronger. If you are passionate about what you do, are a great colleague, interested in learning, and willing to work hard, we want to hear from you.


Powered by JazzHR

title: Marketing Director/ Directeur Marketing
description:
The Marketing Director is responsible to drive alignment, consistency and excellence through all marketing processes and projects. They will offer strategic and developmental insight to drive marketing best practices and tools across departments.

In addition, they will manage and direct a marketing team consisting of managers and specialists.

The Marketing Director is responsible for the development and execution of the company’s marketing business plan, establishing accountability and identifying solutions to resolve problems

This role will be perfect for you if:  

  • You are well-versed in clinical research or biotech B2B Marketing-Communication
  • You are recognised for your strategic thinking and your ability to develop and execute a marketing business plan aligned with corporate goals
  • You are an inspiring and visionary leader with an ability to drive, lead and develop a marketing team


RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Oversee, hire, mentor, train, manage and evaluate all members of the marketing team.
  • Develop a marketing strategy that aligns and supports the organization’s strategic goals and growth objectives (value proposition, positioning, etc.) by target audience (sponsors, patients, investigator sites and employees).
  • Identify marketing goals and develop tools to track and measure success.
  • Create and develop a communication plan to drive awareness and excellence with internal and external stakeholders (sponsors, patients, investigator sites and employees).
  • Review and remain abreast of changes and developments in the CRO industry including competitive analysis, marketing best practices, etc.
  • Manage execution of multi-channel marketing campaigns that include support materials such as presentations, email, video, websites, sales tools, etc.
  • Develop and support the implementation of the multi-year corporate brand planning process.
  • Manage the budget necessary for the deployment of the marketing and communication strategies.
  • Provide innovative solutions to help identify new marketing opportunities and process improvements.
  • Lead internal cross functional teams and other 3rd parties (agencies, vendors) to facilitate on time, on quality and on strategy campaigns.
  • For each key target audience (sponsors, patients, investigator sites) ensure the experience is at the heart of brand planning
  • Ensure the sharing and adoption of best demonstrated practices. 
  • Perform all assigned duties in compliance with internal SOPs and external guidelines and regulations. Ensure team members understand and fully comply with compliance requirements.
  • Demonstrate excellent time management and ability to manage multiple complex projects simultaneously.
  • Employee may be assigned to other responsibilities that do not pertain to their former description, if they have the required experience, are qualified and/or have received adequate training


Our company:

The work environment 

 

At Innovaderm, you will work with brilliant and driven colleagues. Our values are collaboration, innovation, reliability and responsiveness. We offer a stimulating work environment and attractive advancement opportunities. 

 

In this position, you will be eligible for the following perks: 

  • Flexible work schedule 
  • Permanent full-time position 
  • Complete benefits (medical, dental, vision, RRSP, vacation, personal days, virtual medical clinic, public transportation rebates, social activities) 
  • Offices near public transportation (Sherbrooke metro station or Saint-Laurent metro station) 
  • Possibility of working from home in accordance with company policies and public health directives 
  • Ongoing learning and development 

 

About Innovaderm  

Innovaderm is a contract research organization (CRO) specialized in dermatology. Since its beginnings in 2000, our organization has benefited from a solid reputation for the quality of its research and services exceeding the expectations of its clients. Based in Montreal, Innovaderm continues to grow and expand in North America and Europe. 

 

Innovaderm is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Innovaderm will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request. 

Innovaderm only accepts applicants who can legally work in Canada. 



Description FR:

Le directeur du marketing est chargé de favoriser l'alignement, la cohérence et l'excellence dans tous les processus et projets marketing. Il offrira des perspectives stratégiques et de développement pour piloter les meilleures pratiques et outils de marketing dans tous les départements. De plus, il gérera et dirigera une équipe marketing composée de gestionnaires et de spécialistes.

Le directeur marketing est responsable de l'élaboration et de l'exécution du plan d'affaires marketing de l'entreprise, et a la responsabilité d'identifier des solutions pour résoudre les problèmes.


Ce poste sera parfait pour vous si : 

  • Vous maîtrisez la gestion du Marketing-Communication B2B dans le domaine de la recherche clinique ou de la biotech
  • Vous êtes reconnu pour votre réflexion stratégique et votre capacité à élaborer et mettre à exécution un plan d'affaires marketing aligné aux objectifs de la compagnie
  • Vous êtes un leader visionnaire et inspirant ayant la capacité de gérer et de développer une équipe marketing



RESPONSABILITÉS


  • Superviser, embaucher, encadrer, former, gérer et évaluer tous les membres de l'équipe marketing
  • Développer une stratégie marketing qui aligne et soutient les objectifs stratégiques et les objectifs de croissance de l'organisation (proposition de valeur, positionnement, etc.) par public cible (commanditaires, patients, sites investigateurs et employés)
  • Identifier les objectifs marketing et développer des outils pour suivre et mesurer le succès
  • Créer et développer un plan de communication pour favoriser la sensibilisation et l'excellence avec les parties prenantes internes et externes (commanditaires, patients, sites investigateurs et employés)
  • Réviser et être à l'affût des changements et des développements dans l'industrie CRO, y compris l'analyse concurrentielle, les meilleures pratiques de marketing, etc
  • Gérer l'exécution de campagnes marketing multi-canaux incluant le matériel support tel que présentations, courriels, vidéos, sites Web, outils de vente, etc
  • Développer et soutenir la mise en œuvre du processus de planification pluriannuelle de la marque corporative
  • Gérer le budget nécessaire au déploiement des stratégies de marketing et de communication
  • Fournir des solutions innovantes pour aider à identifier de nouvelles opportunités de marketing et à améliorer les processus
  • Diriger des équipes inter-fonctionnelles internes et des tierces parties (agences, fournisseurs) pour faciliter la ponctualité, la qualité et la stratégie des campagnes
  • Garantir une expérience hors pair au cœur de la planification de la marque pour chaque public cible clé (commanditaires, patients, sites investigateurs)
  • Assurer le partage et l'adoption des meilleures pratiques démontrées.
  • Effectuer toutes les tâches assignées conformément aux SOP internes et aux directives et réglementations externes. S'assurer que les membres de l'équipe comprennent et respectent pleinement les exigences de conformité
  • Démontrer une excellente gestion du temps et une capacité à gérer plusieurs projets complexes simultanément.

 



Requirements FR:

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ 

 

Éducation  

  • Diplôme universitaire en marketing, en administration des affaires ou dans un domaine connexe.

Expérience 

  • ﻿Minimum de 10 ans d'expérience en marketing-communication B2B, dont au moins 3 ans dans un poste de direction
  • Expérience commerciale pertinente avec une expérience éprouvée au sein de l'industrie CRO/biotech/pharmaceutique liée au recrutement de patients, aux réseaux de sites et/ou au B2B


Aptitudes et connaissances 

  • Solide compréhension et expérience en marketing et/ou en développement des affaires
  • Solides compétences en gestion de projet
  • Compétences établies en analyse commerciale
  • Excellentes compétences en communication anglaise, écrit et parlé. Le français est un atout majeur.
  • Capacité de rassembler différentes idées afin d'avoir une vue d'ensemble
  • Aptitude incontestable à travailler avec plusieurs priorités qui nécessitent de solides capacités à prendre des décisions
  • Peut agir en tant que mentor auprès de l'équipe de marketing interne pour des campagnes sur les réseaux sociaux et des initiatives d'obtention de patients
  • Capacité à agir comme mentor auprès de l'équipe de marketing interne pour les campagnes de réseaux sociaux et des initiatives de recrutement de patients
  • Doit être à l'aise avec la technologie (l'utilisation de divers outils/systèmes pour effectuer les tâches quotidiennes).
  • Excellente connaissance des bonnes pratiques cliniques et des règlements/directives applicables de Santé Canada et de la Food and Drug Administration (FDA)


Our company FR:

NOTRE ENTREPRISE 

 

L’environnement de travail  

Chez Innovaderm, vous travaillerez avec des collaborateurs compétents et dynamiques. Nos valeurs sont la collaboration, l’innovation, la fiabilité et la réactivité. Nous offrons un environnement de travail stimulant et des possibilités d’avancement intéressantes.  

 

Dans ce poste, vous bénéficierez des conditions suivantes : 

  • Flexibilité sur l’horaire 
  • Poste permanent à temps plein 
  • Gamme d’avantages sociaux (assurances médicales, dentaire, vision, régime de retraite, vacances, journées personnelles, clinique médicale virtuelle, rabais sur le transport en commun, activités sociales) 
  • Bureau à proximité du transport en commun (métro Saint-Laurent ou métro Sherbrooke) 
  • Possibilité de travail à la maison en fonction des politiques de l’entreprise et des directives de la santé publique 
  • Formation et développement continu 

 

À propos d’Innovaderm 

 

Innovaderm est une entreprise de recherche clinique contractuelle (CRO) spécialisée en dermatologie. Depuis ses débuts en 2000, notre entreprise à taille humaine bénéficie d’une solide réputation autant pour la qualité de la recherche effectuée que pour la qualité des soins offerts, dépassant les attentes de ses clients. Basé à Montréal, Innovaderm continue aujourd’hui sa croissance en Amérique du Nord et en Europe. 

 

Innovaderm s’engage à assurer une approche équitable ainsi que des opportunités équivalentes pour tous les candidats. À ce titre, Innovaderm fournira sur demande des accommodations aux candidats ayant un handicap, et ce, à travers toutes les étapes du processus de recrutement, si demandé. 

Innovaderm accepte uniquement les candidats pouvant légalement travailler au Canada. 

Le genre masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et dans le seul but d'alléger le texte. 

Requirements:

IDEAL PROFILE 

Education  

  • University degree in Marketing, Business Administration or related field Bachelor’s

 

Experience  

  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in B2B Marketing-Communication, including at least 3 years in a leadership position
  • Relevant business experience with a proven track record within the CRO / biotech / pharmaceutical industry related to patient recruitment, site preferred network and/or B2B

 

Knowledge and skills 

  • Strong understanding and experience in marketing and/or business development
  • Strong project management skills
  • Demonstrated business analysis skills
  • Excellent communication skills in English, written and spoken. French is a strong asset
  • Ability to see the big picture by bringing together different ideas
  • Proven ability to work with multiple priorities that require strong decision-making capabilities
  • Can act as a mentor to the internal marketing team with social media campaigns and patient acquisition initiatives
  • Must be at ease with technology (the use of various tools/systems to perform day-to-day tasks)
  • Good knowledge of good clinical practices, and applicable Health Canada and Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations/guidelines

title: Marketing Associate
description:
Marketing Associate - Digital

SaleSpider Media is seeking an ambitious, digitally-focused, outgoing, organized marketing candidate to work with our sales and marketing team to grow our business in the B2B and Healthcare industries.

We are looking for an enthusiastic marketer to take part in the marketing funnel for our company. You will participate in targeted email campaigns where we nurture targets into leads, and help sales team convert those leads into new customers.

Key Responsibilities / Duties:

Media with the goal of attracting new clientele, particularly for US export of Digital Marketing Services.

The Digital Marketing Associate will:

  • Using multiple resources, and at the direction of the Digital Director, the candidate will build target lists of digital marketing prospect companies and contacts
  • Choose the proper messaging for the prospect companies and contacts, based on the industry of the company and the title.
  • Perform email marketing, delivering messaging to prospect companies and contacts
  • Organize responses and replies to incoming queries
  • Learn the Digital Marketing sales process, working with the Digital Director or other Sales and Marketing team members
  • Work learn the initial steps in a qualifying technique to identify next steps within a pipeline process
  • Work with a schedule for follow-up messaging to prospect companies and contacts
  • Learn how to measure results and optimize the lead nurturing workflows to convert leads into customers.
  • Learn nuances related to email marketing and the need to maintain strict compliance with data privacy laws (Canada - CASL, EU - GDPR, US - CanSpam)
  • Work with multiple channels based on the type of campaign, the target audience and the type of buyer. The candidate will learn about working within the varying business needs and challenges of the various channels. Here are some examples: B2B (Business to Business), Healthcare, Agency vs Direct, Brokers, Event Marketers

Qualifications:

  • BA/BS or equivalent working experience.
  • Past experience with email marketing, lead nurturing, marketing automation, and web analytics; and/or sales experience are assets.
  • Excellent writer and communicator (in both the written and verbal form).
  • Knowledge of digital marketing and media agencies is a definite asset
  • Technical Skills: Word, Powerpoint, Outlook and Excel Skills

What does SaleSpider Media Sell?

SaleSpider Media is high-growth digital media company, selling primarily in the US, and now the UK, while headquartered in Toronto. The company more than doubled sales and profits 2 years running with a stellar list of repeat clients. Clients are primarily Media Agency buyers/planners and Marketing Managers/Directors of Fortune 10,000 Companies.

  • B2B - Business to Businessdigital media. These are our roots with wholly owned business sites and one of the largest and most accurate B2B databases in digital media, which we leverage for Data-Driven Display (banner) campaigns, Video Advertising, Email Marketing, Data Acquisition, Cost per Lead Programs, and Account-Based Marketing. Some of our clients: IBM, Microsoft, Oracle, Lowes etc…
  • Healthcare and Pharma. We own over 15 health resource sites, and partner with over 1,000 health sites, resulting in over 100 million health content webpages to reach 2.6 million Healthcare Professionals in our database (by Specialty and Location), and 90% of US Consumers, Patients, and Caregivers. We sell Digital Display (banner) campaigns, Video Advertising, Email Marketing, and Cost per Lead Programs. Clients include dozens of pharma brands for diabetes, hepatitis, hemophilia, women's health, etc, and hospitals in LA, San Francisco, Dallas, Chicago, NY, etc.

Some of SaleSpider Media’s Clients:www.salespidermedia.com/clients.php

SaleSpider Media’s Brands: http://www.salespidermedia.com/our-brands.php

Why SaleSpider Media is Growing So Rapidly:

  • Established digital media supplier with a strong reputation
  • Diversified offerings - not just a single product
  • Focused on two segments - B2B & Healthcare
  • Warm contacts (database of 50,000 buyers) and existing relationships
  • Strong operations, enabling us to keep 90% of clients with little churn
  • Decline of traditional alternatives (broadcast TV, print, radio etc..)

Why Work at SaleSpider Media:

  • Strong and Profitable Company with Competitive Advantages that win and retain clients
  • Competitive Income Package
  • Rapid Career Advancement and Income Growth in the first Year!
  • Great Industry - Digital Advertising is Growing Exponentially
  • Benefit Plan & Flexible Summer Extended Vacations
  • Perks – Casual Environment, Quarterly Contests & Prizes
  • Travel throughout the US for client meetings and conferences

title: Director of Brand
description:
Youâ€™re a big picture thinker who creates strategy, develops long-term marketing plans, produces, executes and measures best-in-class global brand marketing programs. You know how to inspire teams to create breakthrough ideas. Youâ€™re driven by data, passionate about creative strategy and human-centered storytelling. Curious, entrepreneurial, collaborative â€“ you like building new systems and having freedom to put your next best idea into motion. 

Weâ€™re thrilled to partner with our client â€“ a premium, performance-defining product and systems manufacturer in the extreme sports industry â€“ in their search for someone with the right mix of skills, experience and passion to elevate a portfolio of notable biking brands.  

This role involves leading a team of marketing professionals (PR, digital and sports marketing) to drive brand relevance and resonance. Youâ€™ll also work closely with product marketing and creative teams to lead the strategic planning and execution of content across all owned channels, key retail and OE partners.  

About the role 

  • Build and carry out brand strategies across all channels for the companyâ€™s portfolio of brands 
  • Find ways to strategically position the brand via storytelling that resonates with audiences 
  • Develop and oversee the execution of a global editorial calendar 
  • Oversee the creation and execution of omnichannel, relevant product campaigns for each brand 
  • Measure and report on campaign performance 
  • Lead, coach and develop a diverse global marketing team that includes PR, digital and sports marketing 
  • Create and foster key relationships with marketing creative agencies, business partners and sponsored athletes 
  • Lead all sports marketing efforts, ensuring the company is working with the best athletes in the world and connecting them to the audience via engaging stories 
  • Ensure the digital teamâ€™s work results in a growing community across all owned channels and inspiring, educational content that converts audiences 
  • Guide global PR efforts, managing internal and external resources to support all product and brand initiatives 
  • Work closely with the sales teams to ensure sell-through for the aftermarket, ecommerce and OE partners are thriving 

About you 

  • 10 years of marketing experience in a fast-paced, results-driven work environment for a global brand, preferably within the outdoor or action sports industry 
  • Undergraduate degree or comparable post-secondary education in business, economics or equivalent 
  • MBA with an emphasis on marketing is preferred 
  • Multifaceted experience in everything from brand strategy and media relations to sports marketing and brand partnerships 
  • Proven track record in effectively building, organizing, managing, developing and mentoring a variety of marketing teams 
  • Strong digital marketing expertise across all media 
  • Experience positively influencing and organizing others in a direct management capacity or through interdepartmental projects 
  • Exceptional interpersonal, communication and presentation skills 
  • Proficient with computers, able to learn and leverage new programs 
  • Able to travel (20%) as required 
  • Agency experience is an asset 

About Smart, Savvy Associates 

Our team are experts in helping leaders find marketing, creative and communications professionals in the Pacific Northwest. Our specialty is in building strong relationships: we get to know our candidates and we take the time to explore the job requirements, workplace culture and business goals surrounding each hire. Our goal is to uncover the â€œright fitâ€ candidates who can deliver inspiring results and who can grow with our clients over the long term.

title: UI/ UX Designer
description:
Overview:

Who We Are:

Since 2007, Dealer-FX has been transforming how automotive retailers manage their service operations and how they interact with consumers. Through advanced data integrations and mobile technology, Dealer-FX streamlines processes and communication for automotive service departments while delivering convenience, transparency, and trust to consumers. Dealer-FX is a wholly owned subsidiary of Snap-on Incorporated (NYSE: SNA), which acquired Dealer-FX in 2021.

Dealer-FX has been serving automotive OEMs and dealerships for almost a decade. Dealer-FX is transforming how millions of consumers interact with automotive brands and their retailers. Our platform uses advanced data analysis and mobile applications to deliver convenience, transparency and trust to consumers, and increased efficiency, profitability, retention and brand loyalty to OEMs and dealers.

Responsibilities:

Weâ€™re looking for a UI/UX Design for Dealer-FX. This individual will work closely with the entire product team to move the software forward and collaborate with other designers, developers, and our marketing team. Weâ€™re looking for someone who is open-minded and can apply design thinking and human-centered design methodologies within their day-to-day work. The ideal candidate will actively contribute to user research, design specifications, user flows, prototyping, and visual interface design at a system and micro-level. Weâ€™re especially looking for someone who can instinctively weave iconography, typography, color, space, and texture together to simplify and improve how automotive dealership personnel experiences the next-generation Dealer-FX platform.

 

 A Day in the Life:

  • Work within a close-knit design team on various projects to better the end-to-end experience of our software and mobile apps
  • Adapt your skill sets across challenges within the product life cycleâ€”from identifying problems, research, ideation, and execution
  • Work within our agile team structure to provide quality assurance on our design outputs
  • Design flows and experiences that simplify and distill down complex actions into usable interfaces
  • Give and solicit feedback from the broader product team to continually improve quality

 

Qualifications:

What You'll Bring:

  • 1-3+ years of creative experience in product design
  • Graphic design/UX degree, diploma, or equivalent work experience
  • A design portfolio that illustrates a range of strategic thinking, visual design, and strong UX
  • Technical proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma
  • Knowledge and/or hands-on experience working in rapid product development and an agile environment
  • Strong understanding of core design principles related to typography, grid systems, design specifications, visual hierarchy, color systems, white space, etc.
  • A conceptual thinker who can develop and oversee a creative vision from concept to execution on multiple platforms including mobile, web, and B2B enterprise platforms
  • A keen eye for usability principles and creating great user experiences
  • Experience working on projects from discovery through to shipping/iteration
  • The knack to ask â€œwhy?â€â€”you believe in purpose-driven decisions that are strategically informed to drive meaningful solutions to user problems and opportunities
  • Support for continuous and iterative improvementâ€”you are comfortable with feedback cycles that are openly communicative and generous within one-on-one and large team settings

 

What's in it For You?  

  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Choice of basic or enhanced health benefit plans, dental and vision benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Free underground parking
  • 3 weeksâ€™ paid vacation
  • 1 paid annual volunteer day  

 

No unsolicited agency referrals

Dealer-FX is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Job Summary:

 

       The primary objective of this role is to identify and develop strategic business relationships with potential clients as well as improve the organizationâ€™s market position and achieve financial growth and achieve the annual sales target.  Target market segments for this position are automotive EV/HEV powertrain, aerospace motors, and micro-mobility applications for thin gauge non-oriented electrical steels (NOES) and motor cores.

 

Responsibilities and Duties:

 

  • Coordinate stakeholders & integrate for cross/multi functional team work to breakthrough concerning points to expand business.
  • Oversee product sales from traditional applications (ie., industrial motors, generators, etc) to move into automotive and niche applications (ie., energy storage aerospace/defence)
  • Transforming future market growth and moving to high value stream and added value products, by applying advanced technical and industry knowledge of NOES materials and high efficiency motor applications including high frequency drives
  • Identify new markets and regions where significant growth can be achieved in automotive, micro-mobility and renewable energy applications
  • Lead organization into new markets and breaking new grounds to identify key niche applications and opening new markets for its ultra-thin gauge electrical steel products
  • Advise customers on benefits and tailoring solutions to become a key player in the automotive supply chain and becoming part of the E-mobility revolution
  • Develop new business opportunities and other prospects for potential new clients
  • Participate in pricing solutions

 

Quality Knowledge Requirements:

 

  • Experience with Safe Work Standards/Job Instructions able to Train/Audit
  • Experience with 200 Level Manuals as designated (calibration, doc control, material substitution)
  • Strong knowledge of motor and generator material (NOES) specifications, and processing capabilities, tolerances and needs.

 

Position Requirements:
 

  • Knowledge and hands on experience in structure-property relationship of metallic materials
  • Expertise in understanding mechanical behaviour of metallic materials corresponding to the changes in composition and microstructure
  • expertise understanding fracture mechanisms and the reasons for fracture and failure of metallic materials in service
  • Confidence in performing tensile, impact toughness, hardness, fracture toughness and fatigue testing of materials
  • Competence in using material characterization techniques, such as optical microscopy, electron microscopy (SEM), electronic back scattered diffraction (EBSD), x-ray diffraction (XRD), thermal analysis (TG/DSC/Dilatometer) and surface profilometer to perform microstructural and fractographic analysis
  • Knowledge and experience in the selection of motor core materials to achieve the performance expectations of unique designs
  • Application of high frequency motor drives, and the use of ultra-thin NOES materials
  • Advanced processing and bonding techniques for the production of motor cores for automotive, aerospace and micro-mobility applications
  • Experience and knowledge of non-oriented electrical steels, their production and characteristics.
  • Maintain extensive knowledge of current market conditions in automotive power train, micro-mobility and unique high frequency motor applications.
  • Basic computer programming and web design
  • Knowledge with matlab and nanotechnology
  • Strong technical background and skills; business, sales and marketing acumen, and the ability to sell highly value added motor product solutions.
  • Exceptional verbal and written  and interpersonal communication skills to create strong relationships with partners, clients and team members
  • Able to work well independently and in a team environment
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Understanding of business trends
  • Organizational skills
  • Must be able to travel 50% of the time

 

 If you would like to be considered, please apply by submitting your resume

For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Full time, benefits, vacation, RRSP and Pension offered!

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Business Development Manager Job Description

Job Overview

ARC Business Solutions Inc. is a leading Technology company in North America. Our goal is to create partnerships with our clients by building strong long-term relationships.  As a Business Development Manager for the Managed Services division, you will be part of an energetic team of professionals who are committed to achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. If you are someone who enjoys working with people, is friendly and outgoing and committed to making a difference, then this job could be the perfect fit for you.

Responsibilities for Business Development Manager

  • Ability to build strong Business Relationships with new and existing clients
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Strong listening and presentation skills
  • Develop creative marketing plans and execute on these plans
  • Research accounts, identify key players and generate interest
  • Understand customer business needs and translate them to technology solutions
  • Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails
  • Effectively work in a Team Environment leveraging Teams members strengths
  • Work closely with Technical Operations Manager to translate Business drivers into Technology solutions
  • Ability to develop Strategic roadmaps
    • Translating business impacts into long-term plans
    • Priortizing needs and improvements
    • Budgeting and Planning
    • Communicating the business value of the process
  • Participate in lead generation strategies, such as cold calling, to identify business prospects create and maintain a list of current and potential customers
  • Maintain a log of which customers have been contacted, the outcome of each interaction and issues that need to be flagged for follow up
  • Proactively follow up with customers to get their feedback, guarantee their satisfaction and develop ideas for pitch modification to advertise services more successfully
  • Proven sales experience
  • Track record of over-achieving quota

Qualifications

  • 5 years of experience in Business Development
  • Experience with Managed IT services
  • Possess excellent customer service skills
  • Must be knowledgeable on services
  • Excellent oral communication skills
  • Willingness to work varied hours that change weekly
  • Self-motivated and able to manage time effectively
  • Familiarity with negotiation, upselling and other sales tactics
  • Oversight of a Team Management

title: Business Development Professional (Remote)
description:
Dematic is a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 6,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.

The Business Development Professional will assist the sales team in finding “unseen” customers within the installed base and at targeted accounts, gaining access to key decisionmakers', and securing face-to-face meetings for the assigned account manager. This role will be instrumental in lead generation by identifying, qualifying, and contacting new prospects. The ideal candidate will have business development skills, and a “hunter” mentality. They should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

***This role offers the flexibility to work on a remote model with the understanding that on-site meetings may take place on occasion at our headquarters.

What we offer:

Career Development

We are here to support you for the entirety of your Dematic career. From a fast start of learning Dematic’s history and foundational training to succeed in your role to leadership development programs, technical training and certifications, and Career Navigator to identify challenging new opportunities, our goal is to help you grow beyond your borders.

Competitive Compensation and Benefits

Our attractive and market competitive total rewards packages are designed to reward high performance and to assist in managing your personal and family needs. Dematic offers robust packages based on employment status and national requirements.

Pay Transparency

Dematic is committed to pay transparency. As such, Dematic will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.

However, Dematic will still maintain confidentiality of your pay information. Employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by Dematic, or (c) consistent with Dematic’s legal duty to furnish information.

Global Opportunities

As a global company, our employees are exposed to different ideas and perspectives from around the world. We offer international assignments for qualified employees and wherever possible, we offer flexible working hours and modern workspace design.

Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/

Tasks and Qualifications:

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Proactive Outbound Lead Generation: Identify unseen opportunities in new, competitive, and existing accounts and facilitate interactions with key prospects to drive organic growth.

  • Develop Target Account Growth and Penetration Strategies: Work with the sales team to grow business in targeted accounts via data analysis, campaigns and direct interaction with key decision makers.

  • Optimize Inbound Lead Quality: Increase velocity of lead intake and qualification. Process incoming prospects from Marketing to create a robust pipeline of Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLS). Determine which leads need to be nurtured and which are “hot,” so the sales team receives real business opportunities.

  • Nurture Relationships with Key Decision Makers: Identify and follow key decision makers at target companies, nurture relationships, and create opportunities for the sales team to present solutions. Provide the information and answers prospects need to build trust, increase brand awareness, and maintain a connection until they are ready to make a purchase.

  • Prioritized Pipeline Growth: Work with Market Development Directors (MDDs) to develop a list of top accounts in each vertical. Categorize by Existing, Engaged and Develop. Proactively research and nurture the Engaged and Develop accounts. Identify opportunities for quick wins.

  • Act as conduit for Voice of Internal Customer (VOIC) from Sales to Marketing. Communicate content needs and drip campaign ideas to facilitate lead generation and marketing automation.

  • Surface and alleviate pain points to help Sales be more effective.

  • Contribute to vertical market dashboards and Quick Market Intelligence (QMI) calls.

  • Research target accounts’ business issues and goals to offer appropriate business solutions.

  • Provide actionable data and intelligence to help the sales team drive outcomes.

  • Proactively collect competitive intelligence insights about customer priorities and future ambitions and share with internal customers.

  • Identify key industry events that would result in lead generation.

  • Define and execute territory development plans in conjunction with assigned Account Manager(s)

  • Proactively update Salesforce with new account information, competitive insights, and key contacts at target accounts.

Qualifications:

  • Business or Marketing degree with technical understanding or engineering background with strong sales and business development skills.

  • 6+ years of successful B2B sales experience, preferably in industrial automation, material handling, logistics, e-commerce, supply chain, grocery, food & beverage or general merchandise.

  • Working knowledge of Salesforce.com

  • “Hunter” sales mindset

  • Excellent verbal and written communications, and presentation skills.

  • A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must

  • Ability to travel up to ~20%.

#LI-SM1

title: UX Engineer (Remote Friendly)
description:
At Vendasta, we believe in helping great local businesses survive and thrive in a world that’s more competitive than ever—and we’re growing our team! This is an opportunity to join one of the fastest growing tech companies in Canada and make a direct impact on local economies worldwide. In a world where local businesses all over the globe have had their livelihoods turned upside down, Vendasta continues to help them embrace digital solutions and flourish. 


Vendasta is a certified Great Place to Work and Best Workplace™ for Today’s Youth and Women. Keep reading if you’d like to join us on our mission to support small businesses all over the world.


About the Job

We are building the leading platform for channel partners to provide digital solutions to local businesses. We have ambitious goals over the next couple of years and we are building one of the best design teams in Canada to do so. One big goal over this next year is to unify our platform experience. We are looking to hire a UX Engineer to help make this a reality. If you like diving deep, working in the details, using design systems and making delightful user experiences then you are exactly who we are looking for.


What is a UX Engineer? To put it simply, a UX engineer is a designer who can code, or a developer who can design.


The position is remote-friendly (anywhere in Canada), with the option to work from our office in Saskatoon. Apply and have a virtual coffee with our UX Lead to learn more.


The impact you’ll have

  • Work across teams or even cross-divisionally to implement UI on design-heavy projects
  • Help break down complex user problems into simple and easy to use prototypes
  • Be involved in designing and implementing features from ideation to delivery to adoption
  • To ensure a consistent and cohesive experience for our users by leveraging our design framework
  • Pair and mentor other developers looking to build their front end skills
  • Identify and prioritize design debt and contribute to our design organization goals


The value you’ll bring 

  • 5+ years product design experience, ideally in cross-functional teams
  • 5+ years of front end software development experience (HTML, CSS, and Javascript)
  • Excellent, highly creative communication and critical thinking skills
  • Portfolio showing deep product understanding and craftsmanship, both UI and UX
  • Proficiency with Figma or Adobe XD
  • Solid understanding of cross-platform design systems and technical frameworks
  • Motivated by feedback, but able to take criticism
  • Excellent collaboration skills across disciplines

Bonus Points For

  • Experience with Angular and Typescript
  • Experience with Git and Github
  • Experience with Agile software development practices at SaaS companies
  • Experience building and maintaining a design framework


About Vendasta

So what do we actually do? We create an entire platform full of digital products & solutions that help small to medium sized businesses (SMBs) have a stronger presence online through digital advertising, online listings, reputation management, website creation, social media marketing … and much more! Our platform is used exclusively by channel partners, who sell products and services to SMBs, allowing them to leverage us to scale and grow their business. We’re trusted by 60,000+ channel partners, serving over 5.5 million small to medium businesses worldwide! 


Perks

  • Benefits  - health, dental, life, and disability insurance, an employee assistance program (EAP)*, and $500 annual Health Spending Account. Premiums for health & dental insurance will be covered by Vendasta!
  • Vacation - Minimum 3 weeks paid vacation per year; uncapped sick time policy.
  • Employee Options Program  - get in on Vendasta’s growth and success!
  • Sweet Eats - On site cafeteria with beverages & snacks all day and free catered lunch every Friday
  • Training & Career Development - Education reimbursement program, professional development plans, leadership workshops, mentorship program, and so much more! 
  • Culture - comprised of our core values: Drive, Innovation, Respect, and Agility
  • Social Events -  Ideas on Tap, ski trips, virtual talent shows, yoga classes, and more! 
  • Giving Back -  endless opportunities to take part in programs and initiatives that give back to the community we work in, including paid volunteer time.
Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Business Development Manager (Remote)
description:
Firmex is a global software-as-a-service provider with corporate headquarters in Toronto, Canada. The company’s Firmex VDR service is the world’s most trusted virtual data room, having been used by over 140,000 companies worldwide to share confidential documents for due diligence, litigation and compliance.  

Firmex is currently operating 100% remotely during the pandemic. Once it is safe to do so, you will have the flexibility to work in the office or continue to work from home...or a mix of both! 

As the Business Development (BD) Manager, you will develop and grow the Business Development Representative (BDR) team and help them progress in their sales careers. You will also serve as the go-to expert in the sales organization for the best outbound pipeline generation practices. The BD Manager will report directly to our Vice President of Sales and will build and manage a team of Business Development Representatives.

As our Business Development Manager, you will:

  • Your priority will be to coach, empower, and manage your team, providing guidance on all aspects of the sales process and best practices, building pipeline and driving qualified opportunities for the sales organization. 
  • As the BD Manager, you will help all members of the team strategize the best way to target accounts and develop new opportunities for our sales teams. 
  • Coordinating hiring and the development of the team structure.
  • You will work with the marketing and product teams to provide the BDR’s with continuous learning to help them overachieve their quota and identify and make recommendations for improvement on outreach methods.
  • You will have an intimate knowledge of challenges BDRs commonly face on a daily basis and best practices as to how to overcome those challenges. 
  • Identify and make recommendations to help improve productivity, efficiency, and process.
  • Influence a repeatable and scalable process for generating pipeline as the company scales.
  • Establish 30-60-90 day plan for BDR roles.
  • Create and deliver accurate analysis on individual/team results and maintain reporting to accurately track and manage BDR sales metrics.
  • Conduct weekly 1:1s with each BDR team member, and drive career progression paths for BDRs.
  • Work closely with Sales representatives and management to ensure lead quality and quantity.
  • Foster collaboration with Sales Executives and Sr Sales Executives to penetrate targeted accounts.

What you'll need to be successful here:

  • The ideal candidate is someone who has previously been in a quota carrying role and overachieved in it
  • Experience managing and improving BDR KPIs 
  • Consistent track record of quota overachievement as lead 
  • Understanding of sales process and best practices - preferably within a direct, B2B outbound sales environment 
  • Create open-communication, driving a fun and successful sales team climate
  • High degree of motivation, energy, and creativity in a fast-paced organization 
  • Results oriented, metrics-driven track record 
  • Strong organizational and team management skills
  • Experience with sales management and lead gen software tools (SFDC, LinkedIn, Groove, etc) 
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills 
  • General skills: Motivating others, team building, providing feedback, coaching, self-development, motivation for sales, self-confidence, sales planning, and orienting employees
*Note: This is a summary of the duties that are essential to this role and is not an exhaustive list. Firmex reserves the right to add or amend duties as necessary. 

At Firmex, we’re successful because we care about our clients, and our team members share our core values of humour, success, respect and collaboration. We know that success is derived from motivated people who take pride in building a business that makes a difference. 

Firmex is an equal-opportunity employer strongly committed to diversity and inclusion within the workplace.

Firmex welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities and can make accommodations on request for candidates throughout all aspects of the hiring process.
