title: Director, Content Marketing
description:
Contentfly (YC W21) is building "the" AI-driven platform for producing great content. We're a team of top performers from world-class companies, backed by Khosla Ventures, YCombinator & other top-tier investors. We're one of the fastest-growing Series A companies in the world, scaling from $300k to $6m in ARR in less than a year. We continue to grow at 15% MoM. Boasting a world-class talent marketplace, cutting edge content creation AI & pure smart product building, we have an opportunity to build a product every marketing org on the planet needs: an all-in-one platform for great content marketing.

Reporting to the Vice President of Marketing, the Director of Content Marketing will be responsible for overseeing all content marketing efforts at Contentfly. This individual will bring industry insights and have a large impact on our marketing strategy and brand by delivering best-in-class content.

You Are:

  • Creative, you have a flood of new ideas or are able to propose alternate solutions to solving various challenges that arise.
  • Strategic, you are constantly thinking about the next move and basing decisions on data or calculated hunches.
  • Contrarian, you know that sometimes it makes sense to go against the grain and push the boundaries
  • A Natural Storyteller, you have a way with words that even Shakespeare would be jealous of.
  • Organized, you know where everything is at all times, things happen fast and you are always prepared.

Key Responsibilities:

Here’s what you’ll be doing day to day...

  • Create: Plan and develop a content marketing strategy focused on thought leadership in the content marketing industry. Define our voice, our narrative in the market, and our brand. Write and edit content including white papers, press releases, website copy, and more. Plan an editorial calendar and manage content production
  • Collaborate: work across multiple teams to understand what we can do to better educate our customers and support lead generation.
  • Experiment: experiment with our content and use data to find new ways to engage customers at various stages.

Requirements

Your Experience and Intangible Traits:

The ideal candidate for the Director, Content Marketing position will possess the following competencies:

  • 5 to 8 years of experience with content marketing, ideally in a startup environment
  • Demonstrated ability to lead content strategy
  • Exceptional writing, visual-storytelling and editing skills.
  • Strong project management skills and experience owning an editorial calendar
  • Ability to work autonomously and manage competing priorities

Benefits

Why you'll love working here:

  • Unlimited vacation/PTO
  • Fully remote and distributed teams
  • Full Health benefits
  • Free laptop and home office budget, we've also got your cellphone/internet covered too!
  • Ongoing training and education budgets
  • We'll fly you around the world multiple times a year to hang out with the team in interesting places

Like what you see and think you’re a perfect fit? Apply today.

Please be assured we'll treat any information you share with us with the utmost care, only use your information for recruitment purposes and will never sell it to other companies for marketing purposes. Please review our privacy policy for further information: https://help.contentfly.com/en/articles/4764042-privacy-policy

Contentfly is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to creating a culture with a diversity of talented individuals who join, stay, and work in an environment that enables them to thrive. Contentfly is committed to providing accommodations. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

#LI-Remote

Plan an editorial calendar and manage content production', 'Creative, you have a flood of new ideas or are able to propose alternate solutions to solving various challenges that arise.', 'Exceptional writing, visual-storytelling and editing skills.', '5 to 8 years of experience with content marketing, ideally in a startup environment']

title: Senior Digital/UX Designer - Contract (Remote)
description:
AMA

 

You’re Enthusiastic About

Designing Experiences People Love

 

 

Posted: 2022-05-02Closing: When FilledLocation: Remote

 

 

The Alberta Motor Association (AMA) is on the lookout for a Senior Designer to join our Digital Design Team. You will be responsible for maintaining and designing our many B2C digital products, and be heavily involved in conception and ideation phases, gathering requirements and technical scope, executing high-fidelity prototypes for stakeholder and business review, and working with our development team in refining and ensuring proper implantation of design specifications.

 

You will be working within a team of skilled designers as part of a larger team that includes copywriters, marketers, developers, analysts, SEO specialists, and executive stakeholders. Your primary responsibilities include creating user-focused designs informed by market analysis, customer feedback and requirements, and user research analytics to ensure successful large digital projects and visual marketing assets required to deliver an impactful digital member experience.

  

 

**This role is a remote 18-month contract vendor / temporary employee role**

 

WHAT MOVES YOU

  • You manage your time as expertly as you manage your projects.
  • You’re detail oriented, someone who rolls up their sleeves and gets the job done.
  • You thrive in fast-paced environments, are flexible and able to roll with changing scenarios.
  • You know how to tailor online experiences and are a self-professed “people person".
  • You get what it means to be part of the team. And when it comes to learning, you’re like a sponge and consider yourself to be a lifelong student.
  • You handle even the tightest deadlines with a cool head and clear vision - nothing slows you down.
  • You’re web and app-savvy and up to date on the latest trends, tools, and methods.
  • You are passionate about good, consistent, pixel-perfect design, and strive to give users the best possible experience.
  • You like working closely with different team members and business units to make sure we are solving the right problems for our customers.
  • You’re a team player who is established in their skillset and able to rationalize design decisions to stakeholders and leaders.
  • You enjoy coaching and mentoring more junior team members.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Report to the Manager, Marketing
  • Work within the Digital Design team, led by the Digital Design Leader.
  • Take abstract ideas and turn them into useful, elegant, and best-in-class user experiences.
  • Solve complex problems in a highly creative, user-centric way through an iterative process of experimentation and attention to detail
  • Understand business metrics and the ability to translate company goals and objectives to create enterprise-level digital products that support broad, unstructured goals or nonlinear workflows of a variety of user types in specialized domains
  • Create an amazing user experience, using UX best practices across a wide range of devices.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to understand business problems and provide design solutions that will work at scale.
  • Design high quality multi-page funnels, application design, online systems, digital campaigns, and digital assets.
  • Work with user insights from our internal marketing and optimization teams.
  • Use both quantitative and qualitative research to gain insights into customer behaviour.
  • Plan and conduct a variety of user testing methods, such as usability tests, card sorting exercises, user surveys, and interviews
  • Follow UX best practices, usability heuristics, and AMA brand guidelines.

 

WHAT YOU'VE DONE

  • You will have a university degree or post-secondary diploma in a related field such as UX Design, Digital Media, Graphic Design or Visual Communication.
  • 5+ years of digital design experience developing enterprise websites and minimum 2 years in a role as an intermediate or equivalent designer position
  • 3+ years of UX design experience with strong knowledge of user behaviour, testing and UX best practices
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Inbound Marketing, Content Marketing, PPC, Email campaigns and HTML/CSS is an asset
  • Strong portfolio showcasing knowledge of UX and visual design principles and techniques
  • Experience creating wireframes, user flows, visual designs, and mobile/desktop prototypes with clear documentation.
  • Must be proficient in prototyping tools such as Figma, XD, as well as Adobe Creative Suite
  • Ability to work effectively under deadlines and juggle several large projects simultaneously
  • Strong knowledge of technical (backend) constraints and implementation
  • Strong communication and proficient presentation skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work in and foster a collaborative team environment
  • Proven integrity and ethics

  • You’re comfortable and willing to incorporate your own business, or already have.

 

AS A CONTRACTOR WE OFFER YOU:

  • Compensation for your performed services and your time.
  • Bonus pay incentive program.  
  • Flexibility for your work/life balance and earning potential.
  • Excellent support from AMA with our brilliant and up to date industry knowledge.

 

Please note: applicants without a portfolio of work are unlikely to be considered for this position.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Marketing Manager - Enterprise (Remote)
description:
At Emburse our mission is to help make our users’ lives -- and their businesses – better. We are dramatically transforming how organizations manage corporate expenses and invoices. We humanize work by automating manual tasks and saving users’ time, so they can focus on what matters most -- their family, community, or more rewarding work. We help CFO's give their employees a simple and amazing experience while ensuring compliance and reducing costs. Our solutions are tailored for companies from start-ups to enterprises. We have more than 16,000 clients and 9 million users globally.

Emburse has offices across North America, including Los Angeles, Montreal, Portland (ME), San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto, as well as locations in the UK, Germany, Spain, Australia and the Netherlands.

Our core values - Sincerity, Empathy, Empowerment, Individuality, and Teamwork - reflect who we are as a company. They are central to the decisions we make and the interactions we have with our teams, customers, and partners. As a people-focused company, we are seeking candidates who align with our values.

Emburse is a proud recipient of a 2020 Tech Cares Award from TrustRadius and a 2020 IDC SaaS CSAT Award for Travel and Expense. These awards celebrate companies that have gone above and beyond to provide their communities, clients, and front-line workers with support during the COVID-19 pandemic. We are a people-first company, and this award is a testament to our mission to humanize work.

Follow us to stay updated on news and job openings!

Reporting to the senior director of demand generation, the Enterprise marketing manager will be responsible for building integrated marketing campaigns that drive pipeline for the sales team, including, but not limited to, CPL programs, email nurture, content syndication, etc,. You will be focused on driving high-quality account engagement through the marketing/sales funnel that results in bookings and revenue. We are looking for someone results-driven, creative, and data-driven. You will partner with sales, BDRs, and across other marketing functions (events, digital, brand, etc.) to ensure that our resources are maximized and we are supporting to drive new business at every touchpoint. You will regularly participate in regular team meetings and brainstorms and provide meaningful, actionable data to leadership.

What You'll Do:

  • Help develop a comprehensive marketing plan to drive net new prospects to our solutions 
  • Manage marketing programs throughout the funnel to drive TOFU, MOFU, and BOFU pipeline and velocity
  • Communicate internally to the business on progress and results, and support project management to execute pipeline growth initiatives
  • Improve foundational metrics and make data-driven decisions to optimize programs and audience journeys, communicating relevant insights to the team
  • Partner with the BDR team to ensure quality lead delivery and proper follow-up. Build a consistent feedback loop and continuously improve and optimize lead hand-off processes
  • Manage agency and contractor relationships, expectations, and budgets
  • #LI-REMOTE
    #LI-LH1

What We're Looking For:

  • Required: Bachelor’s Degree
  • Preferred: Marketing or Business Degree
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience
  • Ability to manage budgets and analyze reporting
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, editing and proofreading skills
  • Proficiency Google Docs/Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) 
  • Organizational and planning skills
  • Experience with Marketing Automation systems, preferably Marketo
  • Proficiency in Salesforce
  • Experience with Google Analytics
Emburse provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Emburse complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location where the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

title: Business Development Manager - Movesnap, RBC Ventures (Quebec - Remote)
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Business Development Manager - Movesnap, RBC Ventures (Quebec - Remote)

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission.

What is the opportunity?

RBC Ventures is a wholly owned subsidiary of Royal Bank of Canada. We offer the culture and pace of a startup, backed by the power and resources of a trusted global brand. At MoveSnap, a Home RBC Venture, we’re on a mission to take the stress out of moving for all Canadians. Each year, 4.5 million Canadians move and we want to help all of them with our platform.

We are looking for a talented, Business Development Manager who wants to grow with the MoveSnap team. In this role you will have the opportunity to make significant decisions that contribute to our next phase of growth. You will work across the entire Client and Partner lifecycle from identifying key User (Client) needs to developing 3rd Party Vendor relationships and executing on offers for the platform.

What will you do?

  • Develop and deliver a vendor pipeline within Quebec with a focus on driving Client engagement and value throughout the moving space.
  • Craft and execute on win-win-win offer solutions for Clients, Vendors and MoveSnap.
  • Contract development and negotiations with 3rd party vendors.
  • Complete detailed industry research to ensure Vendors can deliver their services in a way that aligns to our MoveSnap values and culture.
  • Foster deep Vendor relationships with a focus on bolstering retention and Client engagement.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Fluent in French and English
  • 3+ years of sales experience.
  • Comfort in developing and reviewing contracts.
  • Strong negotiation skills.
  • Great communication skills. (written and oral)
  • Be a self-starter, proficient in sourcing and closing your own Clients.
  • Proven ability to develop and manage a sales pipeline.
  • Demonstrate a natural ability to translate Client (user) needs into actionable vendor sales.

Nice to Have:

  • Be a collaborative and creative team player.
  • You enjoy developing business cases and pricing in a clear and concise manner, enabling maximum productivity and value for both Vendors and Clients.
  • You have a self-motivated attitude with the ability to adapt quickly when priorities change, rolling up your sleeves to take on whatever needs to be done for the team.
  • You think, learn and act fast, with comfort in ambiguity and are able to develop ideas into sales.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interact with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization
  • Hybrid work environment with remote and in-office (when possible) work mixture

VSSALES

RBC Ventures

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d'emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d'entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu'ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d'adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l'exige

Job Summary

Prévoir les besoins du marché, puis concevoir et exécuter des programmes pour l’équipe territoriale de vente, les distributeurs et les clients pour optimiser leurs intérêts et l’efficacité du processus de vente. S’appuyer sur son expérience et un ensemble éprouvé de pratiques, de connaissances et d’aptitudes pour réaliser différentes affectations.

Address:

MONTRÉAL, Quebec, Canada

City:

CAN-QC-MONTRÉAL

Canada

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Job Type:

Regular

Posted Date:

2022-04-21-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-06-30-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

title: Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
Job Category:

Marketing and Communications

Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!

The Opportunity

Altus Group now have an opportunity for a Marketing Specialist to join our global Marketing team, you will ideally be based out of Toronto or Houston, though as this is a remote/ hybrid working role there is some flexibility here.

Our Marketing team has recently undertaken a change in their approach to supporting the business, they have moved form a business unit lead approach working as generalists to working as one large global team of specialists, each playing to their strengths and working in their area of expertise. This is where the opportunity for our new Marketing Specialist has arisen as we’ve identified a need for further support within our North American team.

Given our approach to playing to our teams strengths this role would be an excellent opportunity to move from a general marketing role to one focused within demand generation or events marketing and finding your own niche within this area.

What will our new Marketing Specialist do?

Be responsible for live & virtual event coordination – Promoting events across multiple channels and ensuring relevant audience attendance, coordinating internal stakeholders’ contribution to events, coordinating across marketing to deliver necessary assets and content, ensuring audiences receive a seamless experience at Altus hosted events as well as in their interaction with Altus at sponsored 3rd party events.

Email creation – Working with colleagues to finalize copy, design, and layout. Building relevant, targeted distribution lists, effectively testing approaches, and analyzing results to optimize approach

Website & digital advertising – tailoring marketing content and assets to ensure they are in the correct format and relevant for audiences, liaising with 3rd party publishers / associations to ensure advertising and content syndication tactics deliver impact.

Measurement & lead management – monitoring the performance of tactics in salesforce via reports and dashboards. Reporting impact to marketing managers and monitoring the flow of marketing generated leads to the sales team and ensuring they are being effectively followed up.

Experience and skills required:

  • Degree in Marketing/ Business Administration or similar
  • B2B marketing experience
  • Technologically savvy and analytically minded, ideally with experience in Salesforce & Pardot/Hubspot or similar platforms
  • Strong organisation, prioritization and time management skills
  • Confident and collaborative approach to tasks
  • Attention to detail
  • Commercially minded

Come realize your potential at Altus Group!

Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

title: User Experience Researcher - USA/Canada (Remote)
description:
Our workplace includes remote and in-office roles. By applying to this position, you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:


In-office location(s): Toronto, ON, Canada; Mountain View, CA, US

Remote location(s): Canada; United States


About us

VerticalScope (TSE: FORA) operates one of the 10 largest social media networks in the US. Our platform includes over 1,000 websites and 100 million monthly visitors. We operate at the intersection of community, content, and commerce, and believe in the power of enthusiasts to inform and inspire.


The role

As the first dedicated User Experience Researcher on the Design team, you will help your team of designers, product managers, and engineers better understand our users and their needs. You will focus on the question, “How do we better understand our users and their needs and motivations?” and iterate based on user feedback. The scope of your work will range from broad, exploratory research to inform product and company direction, to more focused studies.


You will coordinate, design, and conduct qualitative and quantitative studies, and share your findings with the wider company, so that everyone has a common understanding of who our users are and the problems we’re trying to solve. To do this well, you’ll need to have experience with interviews, moderated usability tests, and surveys.  It helps to also be familiar with other methodologies. If you’re comfortable with quantitative data – you can analyze info in Google Analytics or similar tools – even better!


User research is often misunderstood, so it’s important that you are able to hold your own with skeptics and patiently educate them on its benefits. On the flip side, your work won’t end in just a written report or a nice drawing – your recommendations will impact over 100 million people. Your primary focus will be user research, but we’re a fairly flat team that values learning, so if you’re interested in learning about or participating in other areas of design, there will be opportunities to do so.


If you don’t have experience with some of the aforementioned responsibilities, your willingness to learn – and ability to do so quickly – will be a huge asset. The team moves at a fast but manageable pace and will experiment often, so if you enjoy a less-structured environment that encourages you to explore, learn, and push your limits (in a good way), you will have fun. 


Minimum qualifications


  • Experience launching and growing successful consumer products
  • You can take a vague problem statement such as "Redesign the X experience" and know what to do with it


Preferred qualifications


  • 3+ years of user research experience, working directly with software engineers, designers, and marketers
  • Experience with rapid prototyping and experimentation
  • Interest in forums and online communities
  • Able to travel between Canada and the US periodically


Why work with us?


We are one of the 10 largest social media networks in the US (currently behind Snapchat, Discord, and Nextdoor), with over 1,000 communities that reach over 100 million monthly visitors. Because community is at the heart of what we do, joining our team means recognizing that people and relationships are key to great products.


Our team values impact through healthy work and healthy relationships – we try to live our values vs. just aspiring to them. We ask for a lot, but we give a lot in return: We pay well and our benefits are amazing. You can find this job anywhere, but it’s the intangibles that make the experience worthwhile. So reach out and get to know us – we’d love to get to know you.



NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as negotiated and ad hoc projects to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.


VerticalScope is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, colour, race, citizenship, ethnic origin, place of origin, creed, disability, family or marital status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation or any other protected ground or social area according to Human Rights laws in Canada.


If you require disability-related accommodation during the application, recruitment, and interview process, please let us know and we will work with you to make all possible adjustments to suit your needs.


Though we are only able to respond to applicants that are being considered for an actively open position, we sincerely thank all applicants who are interested in working with us and are glad to hear from you.



Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Product Designer (Remote)
description:
About Us

Snapcommerce is a high-growth company that sits at the intersection of mobile commerce and fintech. Our flagship product, Snaptravel allows millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging. We are currently in the scale-up phase of the company with plans to grow from ~150 employees to ~300+ employees as fast as possible while maintaining the competitive advantages and culture of being a startup.

With a high-performing team of world-class leaders, Snapcommerce thrives on tackling complex problems within AI, E-commerce, and Conversational Design to push the boundaries of the value we can add to our users’ lives!

At Snapcommerce, we pride ourselves on the performance-driven environment we’ve created for our team to prosper and excel. Our values are rooted in making data driven-decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the company. Check out this article from our CEO, Hussein on Snapcommerce's Core Values to learn more!

About the Role:

Are you tired of iterating on the same old product?
Do you feel the insights you present don’t matter?
Are you third in line for projects and promotions?
Do you wish you could tear it all down and start again from the beginning?

At Snapcommerce, that is exactly what we are doing. After revolutionizing online travel and shopping we are embarking on a new venture and building a new design and research team. You’ll work with experienced design and research leaders to define your own role, and be a key collaborator from the beginning on new products and new processes.

Some of the things we’ll be working on in 2022:

  • Launching a brand new product that changes that everything for our company and our customers
  • A complete overhaul of our core app
  • Establishing our design system
  • Introducing brand new research practices including a prototyping lab

Key Responsibilities:

  • Understanding of Figma
  • Experience working with engineering teams
  • Understanding of the product design process
  • Experience with user research
  • Experience with design systems
  • Experience with documentation
  • Comfortable with ambiguity (previous start-up experience, working with new product)
  • Comfortable working with various stakeholders (engineers, PMs, other designers, managers, execs)
  • Collaboration with other designers
  • Owning a product, vertical or feature set from a design perspective
  • Understanding of user research and product design process
  • Experience with design tools and documentation (figma, miro, confluence, etc)
  • Experience working collaboratively with engineering teams
  • Highly agile and comfortable with ambiguity

Perks & Benefits:

  • We are a Remote-first company, we offer flexible working hours with complete work-from-home freedom and a guilt-free unlimited vacation policy
  • Enjoy employee rewards, and travel discounts using SnapTravel
  • Competitive salaries, equity options, full benefits from day one, wellness budgets, and paid development - we’ve got you covered!
  • UberEats credits, meal budgets, special treats, and team lunches. When in the office, enjoy daily snack services and unlimited coffee, tea, and other drinks
  • Supporting continued growth with Learning & Development, Diversity & Inclusion events, TED talk Tuesdays, and Lunch & Learn opportunities
  • A comprehensive performance evaluation framework with performance reviews twice a year
  • We welcome new additions with a generous EI top-up, parental leave, additional vacation, and a flexible return-to-work plan
  • Game nights, Happy Hours, internal hackathons, team building games, workouts, and more
We Believe in Equal Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: GROWTH MARKETING MANAGER (WORLDWIDE) - Work From Home
description:
PersistIQ currently has the position of Growth Marketing Manager and we’re excited to tell you about it !


PersistIQ is a sales automation tool that makes it easy for sales people to quickly follow up with prospects and close more deals.  Originally based out of San Matteo, California, PersistIQ is a subsidiary of Wishpond Technologies, a provider of marketing-focused online business solutions.  Wishpond’s vision is to become the leading provider of digital market solutions that empower entrepreneurs to achieve success online.  The Company and its subsidiaries offer an “all-in-one” sales and marketing suite that provides companies with marketing, promotion, lead generation and sales conversion capabilities from one integrated platform.

 

OVERVIEW


We are searching for a Growth Marketing Manager to join our team on a full-time basis.  This is a fully remote position and the successful individual could be based anywhere in the world. You will work with an amazing remote team helping to grow PersistIQ. As the Growth Marketing Manager you will plan, execute, and analyze digital marketing campaigns and optimizations across the funnel. Your goal is to develop the channels and strategies to increase signups, sales leads, and revenue.


RESPONSIBILITIES             

 

  • Being the owner of PersistIQ’s inbound marketing 
  • Run marketing campaigns and other growth initiatives end-to-end: you will design experiments, develop campaign strategy, and drive execution of the campaign through to completion
  • Digital Ads Campaigns (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Retargeting, etc.)
  • SEO and organic traffic growth
  • Content marketing
  • Website & Funnel Optimization
  • Affiliate Marketing Channels
  • Setting up and managing analytics tracking in tools like Woopra, Google Analytics, and Segment
  • Proactively looking for opportunities to increase signups, sales leads, and revenue
  • Prepare and present recommendations, reports, and findings from experimental data all the way up to the executive level.
  • Other duties as assigned

 

QUALIFICATIONS

 

  • 3+ years of work experience in digital marketing
  • A love of data and can analyze a marketing funnel; you can identify and size different growth opportunities and the various ways to meet them
  • The ability to think strategically and develop comprehensive, data-driven marketing plans
  • Entrepreneurial mindset
  • Willing to participate in ongoing education and training for the role
  • A degree or diploma the contributes to the organization is considered an asset
  • Experience in sales is considered an asset
  • Capacity to manage complex projects seamlessly
  • Must be detail oriented, creative and have a passion for helping clients achieve their goals
  • Self-motivated with the ability to establish and maintain solid relationships through a client-first mentality 
  • As part of a diverse team, ability to work both independently and collaboratively
  • Must be technical, analytical, results-driven and have the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
  • Organized, great time management and have solid writing, phone, and general communication skills
  • Fluent in English (spoken and written). Knowledge of a second language is considered an asset
  • Willing to participate in ongoing education and training for the role

 

This role is expected to work regular business hours based on PST/PDT time zones.


Due to the nature of this role, we may verify backgrounds including conducting employment reference, criminal record and credit checks

 

GREAT REASONS TO APPLY FOR THIS ROLE

 

  • Fully remote position allowing you to work from your home anywhere in the world
  • Exciting and dynamic environment with a great leadership team 
  • Comprehensive training program and regular performance reviews to facilitate your success
  • Competitive compensation based on experience and proven abilities
  • Great referral programs with incentives and bonuses
  • Unbelievable product discounts when you use our products for your own business
  • A global workforce of multi-cultural and talented colleagues 
  • A close-knit operation with amazing growth opportunities for your personal development
  • A high growth SaaS technology company publicly traded on the TSX Venture Exchange
  • Corporate headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
  • Access to our education credits program and so much more !


ABOUT US

 

Founded in 2009, Wishpond is a rapidly growing technology company providing digital marketing solutions targeted at small businesses.  The cloud-based platform includes landing pages, social promotions, website pop-ups, online forms, and lead activity tracking. Wishpond has a dedicated team of professional project managers, designers, copywriters, and developers who provide marketing services tailored to our individual clients.

 

Wishpond serves over 3,000 customers in various industries and sizes, from startups to large fortune 500 companies. Wishpond has a rapidly growing global headcount and continues to hire dedicated and qualified employees and contractors who have what it takes to scale a successful software company.


To learn more about Wishpond Technologies, please visit our website, or follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube


  • Website: www.wishpond.com
  • Facebook:  wishpond
  • Instagram: @wishpondofficial
  • Twitter: wishpond
  • Youtube: thewishpond
  • LinkedIn : wishpond


 

APPLICATION PROCESS

 

If you are interested in applying for this exciting opportunity, please provide an updated resume in English (PDF or Word formats only), quoting “Growth Marketing Manager” in your cover letter

 

Wishpond Technologies is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture that does not discriminate on the basis of disability, status or any other basis protected under legislation

 

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position however due to the volume of applications we receive, we are unable to respond to phone, email, in person or agency inquiries

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Company Description

Assent is the supply chain sustainability management solution for the world’s most responsible, sustainability-focused complex manufacturers. The #1 business risk for complex manufacturers is hidden. Most supply chains were never built with sustainability in mind, and most manufacturers do not have deep visibility into their supply chain risks while outsourcing the majority of their production. Shaped by regulatory experts, customers and suppliers, Assent is the foundation manufacturers need for cross-enterprise sustainability. At Assent, your work will help bring transparency, sustainability, and fairness to the global community. 

We’re one of the fastest-growing technology companies - from $5 million to $50 million ARR in under five years! As the global leader in supply chain data management, we provide transparency into the supply chains of some of the world's largest and most successful companies, including 75 percent of Fortune 500 companies. In our most recent funding round, we raised $350 Million USD in funding led by Vista Equity Partners. This funding will allow us to continue to scale with purpose, and add exceptional talent to our already remarkable team. 


Job Description

As a critical member of Assent's Product Design Team, you will be part of our collective quest to re-envision how we help our customers and end-users curate and manage their supply chain data. The goal: Create a product that people will love, trust, and ultimately promote!

You will seamlessly blend your in-depth use of design thinking strategies with business needs. Working alongside fellow designers, product managers, QA specialists, engineers, and clients, you'll have the opportunity to help shape our product in a rapidly growing and competitive industry. 

You will promote and drive the design process from start to finish, leveraging the appropriate activities and insights with the right projects to deliver engaging, accessible, and beautifully designed experiences. 

Key Requirements and Responsibilities 

  • Energize the product design team with your expertise and passion, and foster collaboration within and across a diverse group of cross-functional stakeholders
  • Drive and lead research initiatives to acquire deep user understanding, validate design directions, evaluate usability, and make data/insight-driven decisions
  • Advocate intensely for our end-users and instinctively frame their needs and challenges in ways that help build a shared understanding across teams, and drive measurable outcomes
  • Communicate that shared understanding through compelling narratives like customer-journeys, scenario maps, wireframes, prototypes, personas, and user stories
  • Conceptualize, design and deliver intuitive and compelling solutions that support customer needs and business objectives
  • Collaborate with product management, engineering, and other cross-functional contributors, and be a key contributor to the product information architecture and design to accelerate greatness for our end-users
  • Inspire design innovation by continuously researching and sharing design best practices on a team that values bold ideas and attention to detail
  • Elevate and lead our design thinking practices through collaborative and thought-provoking activities and discussions with multi-disciplinary teams
  • Maintain, manage, and contribute to our design system, processes and team resource

Qualifications

  • At least 8 years of experience working in a UX discipline and tackling large scale products and applications
  • A Bachelor's Degree in Design (or related field) or equivalent professional experience
  • A portfolio of work that exposes an outstanding breadth and quality of work
  • A demonstrated ability and expertise in UI design and research methodologies
  • Obsessive attention to detail and design fundamentals that leverage interaction design principles
  • Impeccable oral and written communication skills in English - you communicate clearly, and with tact
  • Knowledge of UI development languages and tools would be considered an asset
  • Deep technical background or the ability to quickly understand and articulate interactions in a technical environment
  • Effective at influencing and convincing various stakeholders, and are highly motivated to effect change;
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to conceptualize complex systems

Additional Information

At Assent, we are uniquely positioned to make meaningful, impactful changes in the world around us. If you believe in doing work that matters, we want you to join our team.

Life at Assent

  • Wellness: We believe that you and your family’s well being is important. As a result, we offer vacation time that increases with tenure, comprehensive benefits packages (details vary by country), life leave days and more.

  • Financial Benefits: It’s not all about the money – well, it’s a little about the money. We understand that financial health is important and we offer a competitive base salary, a corporate bonus program, retirement savings options and more.

  • Life at Assent: There is purpose beyond your work. We provide our team members with volunteer days, flexible work options and opportunities to get involved in corporate giving initiatives.

  • Lifelong Learning: At Assent, curiosity is not only valued but encouraged. You will receive professional development days that are available to you the day you start.

  • Work The Way That Works for You: Your work and life should be balanced in a way that is purposeful for you. We offer flexible working environments for our team. Choose a space that meets your unique needs.

Work the way that works for you. Your work and life should be balanced in a way that is purposeful for you. At Assent, we offer flexible working environments for our team. Choose a space that meets your unique needs. 

At Assent, we are committed to growing and sustaining an environment where our team members feel included, valued, and heard. Our diversity and equal opportunity practices are guided and championed by our Diversity and Inclusion Working Group and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs).

Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion includes recruiting and retaining team members from diverse backgrounds and experiences, and fostering a culture of belonging where all team members are included, treated with dignity and respect, promoted on their merits, and placed in positions to contribute to business success.

If you require assistance or accommodation throughout any part of the interview and selection process, please contact talent@assentcompliance.com and we will be happy to help.  

 


Videos To Watch

  • https://youtu.be/ueYa47qRqwQ

title: Market Manager, Southern Alberta
description:
Our bottom line is different.

There’s something special about working at ATB, and it’s been recognized on every top employer list that matters. Maybe it’s our exceptional culture where your total wellness is supported through market-leading benefits and you’re free to bring your whole self to work. Maybe it’s our commitment to a growth mindset and our unrelenting thirst for making it possible for fellow Albertans—even the ones who aren’t our clients.


Whatever it is, you won’t find a more genuine, driven and knowledgeable group of humans anywhere. We foster a culture of purpose, performance and possibilities. We engage with intense curiosity, and bring our whole selves to work, every day. We know it starts with people like you, so take a chance and start with us.Job Number: REQ


Job Number: REQ3840

Location: Alberta South Market (Medicine Hat / Lethbridge; travel across southern Alberta will be required) #LI-Remote

Apply by: May 8, 2022

Paygrade: O-PFS

Leader Name: Justin Friesen, AVP AB South & Calgary


As ATB’s next Market Manager, you will lead a team of Branch Managers in our AB South market. Your role will be to bring out the very best in your team by:

  • Setting a clear direction by translating corporate strategy into successful business plans with the leaders you support
  • Clarifying expectations by helping your leaders understand the connection between their branch’s and the market’s success, through identifying and developing the right skills and behaviors so you and our teams thrive
  • Attracting, hiring and retaining the right people in the right roles
  • Coaching, providing feedback and measuring performance
  • Abundantly recognizing and celebrating results and successes
  • Knowing your business and creating value through collaboration with partners and stakeholders internally and in the community

Requirements

  • The agility to adapt by having a clear understanding of business drivers and levers and how to utilize them to make changes to your business plan
  • A demonstrated ability to be a catalyst who inspires new thinking, fresh momentum and focused action in other leaders
  • A talent for synthesizing and sifting through the noise to identify key trends and changes that are affecting your business
  • 10+ years of experience in progressively more senior leadership roles within retail banking
  • Knowledge of branch operations and human resource management principles


So, have we piqued your interest?

We love diversity of thought, so even if your skills and experience don’t check off every box, we’d love for you to consider putting your name in the running.

And...as this is a key leadership role we are curious to know a bit more about your leadership experience. Please provide a one pager on how you would describe your leadership style.

*** NOTE: Add your one pager to the cover letter area. If you decide to share a link with us, please make sure it is publicly visible content so that we can view it.

And...go!


At ATB, we know that as you develop in your career, you gain many transferable skills. If you believe your experience and qualities are a match for this position, please consider applying.

Benefits

Be great. Be you. Believe.

We are dedicated to building a workforce reflective of the diversity within our communities and creating an environment where every team member has what they need to reach their potential. We encourage candidates from all equity-seeking groups to apply.

What happens next?

Thank you for applying online. If you are shortlisted for this opportunity, you will hear from us after the posting close date regarding next steps. We might ask you to participate in a digital interview or phone interview. If you require any accommodations, please let us know.

ATB Financial team members are required to disclose their COVID vaccination status and provide proof of vaccination or complete COVID rapid testing as a condition of employment to help support client and team member safety. We thank all candidates in advance for their understanding.

Stay in touch!

ATB is excited to know you’re interested in a career with us! Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to get the inside scoop on what our team is up to.

title: Event Marketing Manager (Remote)
description:
Top Hat is looking for an Event Marketing Manager to lead and own our in-person and digital event strategy. This is an opportunity to own the ideation, creation and execution of conferences, webinars, fireside chats, keynote speaking engagements and more to drive Top Hat’s mission of empowering educators to engage students and unleash their potential. 

If you’re looking to join a company poised for significant growth over the next few years, right on the heels of raising $130M USD to fuel our expansion, where you’ll have an immediate impact on the business and team, this may be the perfect role for you!

*We are open to candidates based across Canada in this role. Please include a short cover letter with your application, outlining why you feel you’d be a great fit.

You Will:

  • Lead Top Hat’s overall external in-person and digital event strategy and execution
  • Identify and create key events, drive event attendance and maintain pre/post-event communications & reporting
  • Work cross-functionally with our revenue, customer success and product teams to organize prospect, customer and partner events
  • Be responsible for keeping track of our overall event objectives and impact; lead generation, customer advocacy, product launches, budgeting, and more
  • Help negotiate and execute contracts for large and small-scale events
  • Analyze, track, and report on event ROI (leads, revenue, and customer metrics)
  • Work with our in-house design team to ensure event look-and-feel accurately represents the Top Hat brand

About You:

  • Proven experience carrying out event marketing efforts, including event planning, attendance, and reporting
  • Exceptional logistic, project and budget management skills, with the capacity to manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Experience managing a wide range of events, from large-scale conferences to executive round tables to monthly high-impact webinars
  • Experience with digital, event management, CRM and analytics software (e.g. Zoom, Asana, Aventri, Salesforce, Google Analytics or similar tools)
  • Able to collaborate with and influence multiple levels of stakeholders (from specialists to vendors to C-level executives)


Ten reasons people choose to join the Top Hat team:

*A noble mission that creates meaningful, fulfilling work
*A team that cares deeply for customers and for each other
*Professional learning and development for all role levels
*The latest and greatest technology to do your job
*Competitive benefits and health/lifestyle spending accounts
*We’re currently embracing an engaging, remote-first culture and work experience
*A management team focused on performance, growth, engagement and connection
*Our winning strategy and market potential
*Employee-led, exec sponsored employee resource groups committed to Diversity and Inclusion
*Passionate customers that believe in us—and what we do

title: Business Development Manager, Canada Remote
description:
OFX is continuing to hire with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. We welcome conversations around flexible working arrangements for this role. Please indicate in the application questions what working arrangements would be your preference. This role can be located in Toronto or remotely in Canada. 

 

Hi. Nice to meet you. OFX grew from the idea that there had to be a better, fairer way to move money around the world. That was 20 years ago, and we’re still driven by the same mission today. We believe real help from real people counts, and that’s why we offer our clients the best of both worlds –an easy-to-use digital platform, combined with 24/7 phone access to our Currency Experts (we call them OFXperts). Foreign exchange is in our DNA. We help clients navigate the complexity of FX, making it simple and easy to understand.

 

OFX’s North American Region is a focus for growth, building on the base of North American customers that already use OFX to move money securely and easily. We are currently 80+ strong across North America. We are hiring a Business Development Manager who will be an integral part of the Corporate Dealing team. You will play an important part expanding revenue streams by qualifying and acquiring new leads across the Mid-Size Business Segment. This person would focus on solution-based sales, to educate prospective clients on OFX's service and products. You will collaborate with other members of the sales team to successfully secure prospective clients and build business relationships. 

 

Hear how a customer saves time and money monthly using OFX to pay overseas suppliers

 

Hear from our Corporate Dealers talking markets on the OFX Currency Couch.


What we offer


OFX attracts top talent from all over the globe with over 50 nationalities represented amongst our employees. To thrive here, you'll be a self-starter with a penchant for getting stuff done.


  • We offer four full weeks of vacation a year, no questions asked, and we encourage you to use them! Most importantly, we offer the right candidate an opportunity to join our very unique and exciting business that’s shaping the future of International Money Transfers.
  • An excellent place to kick start your career! Whilst being an established and respected International Money Transfer business, we offer a startup vibe, funky office and a great culture that stems from our Australian roots.
  • Birthday leave, career leave, volunteer days... We want to make sure you have the right balance in your life.
  • Stay motivated by knowing your work matters amongst a collaborative, creative and innovative team. We truly believe we're better together
  • Bring your big ideas. We're here to listen. Whether you're an old hand or just starting out, we value your insights and contributions, because pushing boundaries is a core value here
  • Feel welcome. We believe personal diversity drives future-focused innovation. We're looking for outliers, game-changers and bridge-builders, but don't just take our word for it, apply now, and come check it out for yourself


What you'll be doing

  • Intelligently research, identify and track new leads and corporate opportunities.
  • Present and explain OFX's value proposition, products and services to partner with prospective clients.
  • Collaborate with OFX's broader Operations team to stay updated with new and existing compliance and legal regulations, product advancements and distribution channels.
  • Actively contribute and consult on longer-term strategic sales direction.
  • Attend industry functions, such as association events and conferences; provide feedback and information on market and creative trends.
  • Meet and exceed KPI targets daily, weekly, monthly.
  • Manage data for new and prospective clients in Salesforce, tracking and recording activity.

 

What you'll bring

 

  • 3 years in a sales role.  “A hunger to create new business and achieve targets.”
  • University and/or college graduate, preferably Finance or Business
  • Salesforce experience (desirable)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Ability to handle pressure, meet deadlines and prioritize tasks accordingly
  • Driven and self-motivated, with a desire to meet and achieve goals
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Fast-learner, collaborative, and keen to contribute to the team success

 

 

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Product Designer
description:
All About Us

Seated is a mobile app that rewards consumers for dining out, ordering pickup or getting delivery from the best local restaurants. Seated is the first dynamic pricing platform for restaurantswe help fill their seats while providing members incredible rewards to top brands and unique experiences. 

Here at Seated, we strongly believe that restaurants are a vital part of our community. Through best-of-breed technology, our mission is to help ensure their continued success as they provide amazing meals and one-of-a-kind experiences. We currently drive demand to over 1,000 restaurant partners across 5 US markets, helping to grow both their dine-in and online order sales. For each meal enjoyed, our members earn rewards to top brands like Uber, Sephora, Target, Amazon & CB2, building a loyal member community to support our local restaurant partners.

Were a team of entrepreneurs, small business lovers, restaurant enthusiasts, hackers, developers and functional experts all passionate about using technology to push the restaurant world to a new frontier. Backed by Insight, Craft, Rho, Greycroft and Glade Brook were expanding quickly and looking for talented and ambitious people to embark on the journey with us. If you have the curiosity & passion to drive our mission together, we would love to hear from you. We have an office in NYC but we are open to this role being remote.

What youll do

  • Break down complex problems and explore ways to delight users with tools that solve needs efficiently and effectively.
  • Execute pixel-perfect design, while understanding how to overcome imperfections in order to meet time-sensitive deadlines.
  • Use qualitative and quantitative data to build products that effectively serve our users.
  • Define and refine components for Seateds design system when new patterns are necessary, and be able to communicate ideas when they are not.

What youll bring

  • Excellent portfolio demonstrating your passion for simple, intuitive, and beautiful designand the decisions or UX/UI choices you made to achieve outcomes.
  • Command over the fundamental pillars of graphic designtypography, color theory, grids and layout, formal geometry, etc.
  • Understanding of interaction design and information architecture, and experience developing wireframes and testing prototypes.
  • Expert skill in Sketch/Figma and the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator).
  • Strong communication and presentation skills that enable you to clearly convey and defend design decisions to stakeholders.
  • 2+ years experience designing web or mobile applications.
  • Degree in Design, Human-computer interaction, or equivalent work experience.
  • An understanding of HTML / CSS
  • Skills in motion a bonus (After Effects)

At Seated we welcome passionate people from all backgrounds, helping us make dining experiences more accessible & rewarding. If you have the curiosity & passion to drive our mission together, we would love to hear from you.

title: UX Research Lead | Canada - Fully Remote
description:
Location: Toronto,Ontario,Canada

About FFW

For over 20 years, FFW has provided significant digital experiences to the world’s largest brands many within the Fortune 50 in finance, power, media, healthcare, and pharmaceuticals. FFW is a team of more than 400 people across 11 countries and growing fast. Not only do we work with large organizations, but we have a diverse portfolio across various verticals working on a variety of mission-critical digital solutions. Learn more at https://ffwagency.com/about-ffw.

 

About the Position

FFW is looking for an experienced UX Research Lead to join our Experience Design (XD) Team and support project teams with research techniques and clearly articulate business benefits, rationale, and intended use of research findings. The Research Lead understands the process for executing research and how FFW can continuously improve its delivery. You will collaborate with the team and other strategic partners on managing project tasks and proper budgeting of research activities. You will provide research support and expertise to ensure research achieves objectives within given timeframes and budgets.

You will support research resources and drive the collection of inputs into the research analysis process. Part of your focus will be to mature and grow the agency’s growing library of research “best practices” examples related to the agency’s disciplines.

Strong candidates will demonstrate a rigorous, mixed-methods approach to cognitive human factors methods and have experience shipping digital experiences. We value UX researchers with expertise in standard generative and evaluative research methods and have a history of taking a creative approach to answering new questions about humans’ interaction and experience with technology. You will work with multidisciplinary digital teams to push the boundaries of what is possible in the DXP space. Ultimately, your expertise and ingenuity in research must do more than just contribute to knowledge – you must also be skilled at driving measurable positive impact on platforms and the user experience.

Research Leads are part of the Experience Design team to execute projects and enforce the infrastructure needed to do research at scale—spanning everything from participant recruiting, vendor and tools management, learning development, onboarding, workshop facilitation, and other programs.

 

You Will…

  • Champion UX Research across the disciplines of the organization

  • Mentor more junior researchers to increase their knowledge and experience

  • Organize the processes for onboarding and training for new researchers

  • Adapt to changing needs of the company for support in UX Research efforts

  • Support other teams in efforts like pitching and estimating projects

  • Design & conduct research for digital projects

  • Operationalize research findings into actionable, measurable UX goals and ensure accountability across the development lifecycle

  • Drive impact through a range of qualitative/quantitative research approaches and tools

  • Effectively communicate findings and work with team to develop recommendations

 

You Have...

  • Relevant higher education degree or 7+ years of relevant applied UX Research experience

  • Experience in an agency setting

  • English fluency

  • Experience leading teams or with mentorship and training

  • A broad experience using qualitative and quantitative research methods, including usability testing, in-depth interviews, heuristic evaluations, competitor reviews, surveys, card sorting, information architecture, task analysis, etc.

  • Excellent communication skills, ability to communicate ideas visually, verbally, and in writing

  • Ability to analyze analytics

  • Good knowledge of online research techniques

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Internet environments

  • Ability to prioritize time well and juggle multiple projects effectively

  • Ability to communicate coherently and sensitively with clients, vendors, and staff members

  • Excellent consensus-building skills

  • Intuitive and analytical approach to problem-solving

 

Nice to Haves

  • Experience with web content management systems, like Drupal

 

Does this sound like you? Send your resume over. We’d love to chat. NOTE: Please include a link to your portfolio or relevant project descriptions with your application.

Apply to this job

title: Manager, Marketing Operations (Remote Contract)
description:
Fullscript helps people get better. It's at the core of everything we do. As the leading platform for prescribing integrative health products, our work positively impacts millions of lives everyday. Our purpose extends well beyond our platform. As a health company, we are committed to the wellbeing of our team members. We are building an organization where people thrive, grow, and have a high impact through their work. 

By joining us, you stand with our purpose. You are an independent thinker, who likes to leave things better than you found them. You do things not because they are easy but because they are right. Ready to make an impact?

Reporting directly to the Vice President, Corporate Communications, the Marketing Operations Manager is a critical connector between the Marketing and Corporate Communications (MarComm) teams. In this role, you’ll work across these functions managing the planning, budgeting, staffing, project production, and reporting for both. 

As the Manager, Marketing Operations, you’ll work closely with Sales, Merchandising, Business Development, Data & Insights, Product, Talent & Culture, and other departments to plan, execute and measure large cross-functional campaigns. You know how to plan and activate strategic plans while proactively shifting priorities to keep critical business goals moving forward.  

Your previous experience and interpersonal skills have made you successful in managing relationships and delivering results that enable growth, lead generation, and customer engagement. 

**Please note this role is a 12 month Term/Mat Leave coverage

What you'll do:

  • Work with the MarComm leadership team to manage strategic quarterly and annual planning cycles for Corporate Communications and Marketing functions 
  • Manage budget forecasting and reporting and be the key point of contact for all budget requests
  • Orchestrate the MarComm calendar to build a holistic view of all campaigns and the people, budget, tooling, and timelines required by each project 
  • Oversee large cross-functional campaigns and initiatives including go-to-market plans, production cycles, budgeting, status updates, and reporting
  • Manage the scope and prioritization of data projects to ensure the MarComm team has the insights, dashboards, and lists needed to run campaigns
  • Develop and manage reporting strategy, including audits on dashboards and a revamped reporting process and template for monthly, quarterly, and annual results
  • Manage benchmarking, goal setting, and results reporting for key initiatives and campaigns  
  • Lead special projects, working closely with internal and external stakeholders
  • Organize and chair weekly team meetings, setting agenda items and gathering updates

What you bring to the table:

  • 8+ years of marketing experience including a deep understanding of strategy development, management, and performance reporting
  • Experience leading cross-functional projects, including project management and decision-making skills
  • Ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously, while shifting priorities quickly and proactively to keep the most critical projects moving forward
  • Exceptional collaboration skills with experience leading projects involving several functions or departments
  • Experience managing, coaching, and leading a direct report or indirectly managing the work of team members
  • Extremely organized and detail-oriented with high a degree of accuracy
  • Data-driven mindset with a focus on quality and optimization

What we can offer you:

  • Ability to work Wherever You Work Well*
  • Half (Flex) Day Fridays 
  • Flexible benefits package (medical, dental, vision) including health spending account
  • Discount on Fullscript catalog of products for family & friends
  • Company-wide learning initiatives and events
  • Employee Wellness Programs (including no meeting Wednesday) 
*Our Wherever You Work Well philosophy means Fullscript teammates get to pick their own office — whether that’s in-office, at home, or a bit of both.

Fullscript is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to work with talented people, period. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or ethnic origin, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or civil status, political affiliation, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the jurisdictions in which we operate.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please send an email to accessibility@fullscript.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Our team handles both personal information and personal health information, which means candidates that receive and accept employment offers must undergo a background check. 

Want to learn more? Check us out at www.fullscript.com/careers, find us on social media, or check out our culture guide.
